5678.NAME: Build a Monument
5678.DESCRIPTION: Regardless of which monument you choose to build, each of the constructed stages gives nice rewards. It's not important to complete tasks; it's important to build one of the structures. Note that materials can be collected in several ways. By completing tasks, you will gain more raw materials and need to engage less in item exchange. By completing fewer tasks, you will need to be more active on the island. By working diligently, some line tasks may prove unnecessary.

5679.NAME: The Skillful Weaver
5679.DESCRIPTION: It resembles a moth greatly, yet this insect is not to be harmed. The insect feeds on plants and in its free time spins beautiful garments. You might have already seen some of these artworks.

568.NAME: Gyckott knows! I
568.DESCRIPTION: Myckott has sent his brother Gyckott who can arrange a meeting with the senior council about the final part of the island. You only have to fulfill a few tasks.

5680.NAME: Who Owns the Wheat?
5680.DESCRIPTION: A small mishap. The insect wove the large cornfield into dresses and suits. Not a single stalk was left for the horse to nibble, nor a leaf for the spider to weave.

5681.NAME: Straw Chewing I of II
5681.DESCRIPTION: The night insect has harvested all the crops, leaving the animals unable to feed. Come to the rescue and feed the hungry friends.

5682.NAME: Straw Repair I of II
5682.DESCRIPTION: If the animals are fed, then there's no need to worry that the misfortune will strike again. Slowly begin the repair work.

5683.NAME: Straw Chewing II of II
5683.DESCRIPTION: The flying insect could talk for hours about knitting. About which weaves breathe better and which tear less often.

5684.NAME: Straw Repair II of II
5684.DESCRIPTION: The animals have completely lost interest in straw structures. Repair all the other damaged objects.

5685.NAME: Insect's Wishes
5685.DESCRIPTION: The insect gazes at the accumulated pile of pearls. They rustle and foam like the ocean, inviting you to put aside work and relax.

5686.NAME: Away on Holiday!
5686.DESCRIPTION: The pile of pearls at the foot of the colossus topples over and rolls in all directions. The insect has already woven the meadow, time to rest.

5687.NAME: Little Hare
5687.DESCRIPTION: While searching for spring greens, a gray hare nibbled on your lilac berries, look, there it is trying to escape, the purple spotted menace.

5688.NAME: Willow Giant?
5688.DESCRIPTION: The snow has melted and the willows grow, and grow, and grow, and grow. When the willow's shadow could accommodate even six pools, you start to have suspicions.

5689.NAME: Easter Ants
5689.DESCRIPTION: Ants roll eggs to the right, roll eggs to the left. There's no point in rolling, the ants abandon the rolling games.

569.NAME: Gyckott knows! II
569.DESCRIPTION: Fulfill these Gyckott's tasks, and he will arrange a meeting with the senior council about the final part of the island.

5690.NAME: Hares in Hiding
5690.DESCRIPTION: You manage to plant hares in the furrows. Snap! And they have already tripled.

5691.NAME: NOT USED
5691.DESCRIPTION: The hare is in a playful mood. When the hare, like a white carrot, is pulled from the ground, it runs to spin the rattle carousel.

5692.NAME: Eggs Under the Bed
5692.DESCRIPTION: When eggs start peeking out from all the cracks and corners, the ants begin to worry about their usefulness and practical application.

5693.NAME: Ant Inventory I
5693.DESCRIPTION: Roll here, roll there. To keep track of supplies, the ants start noting down where and what items are being delivered.

5694.NAME: Ant Inventory II
5694.DESCRIPTION: Remember, spinning carousels is not the only way to obtain building materials. The ants encourage you to continue building.

5695.NAME: Eggs Under the Bed
5695.DESCRIPTION: Ears are peeking out from the ground, you pull, and of course, it's a hare again with an egg basket in its paws. "Have you finished building yet?"

5696.NAME: Easter Whistle
5696.DESCRIPTION: Can you whistle like a real hare? The ants smirk and demonstrate, with one blow all the hares jump out of the ground.

5697.NAME: NOT USED
5697.DESCRIPTION: The hare wants to spin other carousels too, but unfortunately, the flag of emptiness flutters at the end of the line.

5698.NAME: NOT USED
5698.DESCRIPTION: Dizzy from the carousel, the little hare quickly buries itself back in the ground. The ants grumble that there's no one to build the decorations.

5699.NAME: Spring Willows
5699.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14  spring willows and the promised reward. If you complete six Willow tasks and master the Oceania underground, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

57.NAME: Craft nails
57.DESCRIPTION: Learn the new workshop features by crafting nails

570.NAME: Gyckott knows! III
570.DESCRIPTION: Fulfill these Gyckott's tasks, and he will arrange a meeting with the senior council about the final part of the island.

5700.NAME: Spring Willows
5700.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14  spring willows and the promised reward. If you complete six Willow tasks and master the Oceania underground, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5701.NAME: Spring Willows
5701.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14  spring willows and the promised reward. If you complete six Willow tasks and master the Oceania underground, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5702.NAME: Spring Willows
5702.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14  spring willows and the promised reward. If you complete six Willow tasks and master the Oceania underground, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5703.NAME: Spring Willows
5703.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14  spring willows and the promised reward. If you complete six Willow tasks and master the Oceania underground, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5704.NAME: Spring Willows
5704.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14  spring willows and the promised reward. If you complete six Willow tasks and master the Oceania underground, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5705.NAME: Golden Hens
5705.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14 golden hens and the promised reward. If you complete six Hen tasks and know how to raise crocodiles, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5706.NAME: Golden Hens
5706.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14 golden hens and the promised reward. If you complete six Hen tasks and know how to raise crocodiles, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5707.NAME: Golden Hens
5707.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14 golden hens and the promised reward. If you complete six Hen tasks and know how to raise crocodiles, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5708.NAME: Golden Hens
5708.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14 golden hens and the promised reward. If you complete six Hen tasks and know how to raise crocodiles, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5709.NAME: Golden Hens
5709.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14 golden hens and the promised reward. If you complete six Hen tasks and know how to raise crocodiles, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

571.NAME: Gyckott knows! IV
571.DESCRIPTION: Fulfill these Gyckott's tasks and you will be allowed to meet the senior council.

5710.NAME: Golden Hens
5710.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 14 golden hens and the promised reward. If you complete six Hen tasks and know how to raise crocodiles, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5711.NAME: Baskets
5711.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 8 baskets and the promised reward. If you complete six Basket tasks and know how to make souvenirs, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5712.NAME: Baskets
5712.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 8 baskets and the promised reward. If you complete six Basket tasks and know how to make souvenirs, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5713.NAME: Baskets
5713.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 8 baskets and the promised reward. If you complete six Basket tasks and know how to make souvenirs, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5714.NAME: Baskets
5714.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 8 baskets and the promised reward. If you complete six Basket tasks and know how to make souvenirs, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5715.NAME: Baskets
5715.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 8 baskets and the promised reward. If you complete six Basket tasks and know how to make souvenirs, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5716.NAME: Baskets
5716.DESCRIPTION: By completing this task, you will receive 8 baskets and the promised reward. If you complete six Basket tasks and know how to make souvenirs, you will receive a particularly difficult additional task.

5717.NAME: Iron Willows
5717.DESCRIPTION: We do not recommend completing this task for the sake of promotional prize items. You will not receive more Willows than in other tasks, but if you want to obtain this specific item, then just keep planting.

5718.NAME: Iron Hens
5718.DESCRIPTION: We do not recommend completing this task for the sake of promotional prize items. You will not receive more Hens than in other tasks, but if you want to obtain this specific item, then just keep planting.

5719.NAME: Iron Baskets
5719.DESCRIPTION: We do not recommend completing this task for the sake of promotional prize items. You will not receive more Baskets than in other tasks, but if you want to obtain this specific item, then just keep planting.

572.NAME: Traveller
572.DESCRIPTION: Now you can travel to other islands. Click on the raft to open a map of the islands.

5723.NAME: Little Ones on Mother's Day
5723.DESCRIPTION: The otter mother slowly swims along the stream holding her baby in a heartfelt embrace. The sun warms, and there is peace in the heart.

5724.NAME: The Otters Swam Away
5724.DESCRIPTION: While you were feeding the little ones, the otter mother swam away with the current. Curiosity urges you to follow.

5725.NAME: Pamper the Kiwi
5725.DESCRIPTION: Meanwhile, the little kiwi bird sighs sadly. The bird wants to play, but the kite has flown away.

5726.NAME: Kite Tails
5726.DESCRIPTION: In spring, the whole wide farm family takes care of their little ones, you should help them too. Look, the lost paper kite tails were found in the grass!

5727.NAME: Feed the Anteaters
5727.DESCRIPTION: After playing with the trains, the Kiwi happily expresses gratitude and runs off to have lunch.

5728.NAME: Sheep Task A
5728.DESCRIPTION: Hurry to prepare the cold soup, what kind of spring celebration would it be without it. After lunch, you can take a nap.

5729.NAME: Sheep Task B
5729.DESCRIPTION: Everyone must do their household chores, even when living on a jungle island. While doing chores, you can also hum lullabies. (thus you will gain dream sheaps)

573.NAME: Explore the new island
573.DESCRIPTION: You can enter the cave by fulfilling the ancient key daily tasks or buying a key for rubies at the shop.

5730.NAME: Sheep Task C
5730.DESCRIPTION: Anyone can learn to fish and teach fishing. The main thing is to prepare properly.

5731.NAME: Nap in the Park
5731.DESCRIPTION: After lunch, a few more families come to enjoy the fresh air.

5732.NAME: Wreaths
5732.DESCRIPTION: More than one toy has sunk in the stream. The otter mother can fish out these toys, so prepare wreaths.

5733.NAME: Lullaby Hush-a-bye
5733.DESCRIPTION: Slowly the little ones fall asleep, soon the mothers will also have a moment to rest. Only a few details remain.

5735.NAME: In Search of Flavors
5735.DESCRIPTION: Today, for dessert, you decided to have pancakes with jam. Opening the pantry, no flavor speaks to you; you crave something new and original.

5736.NAME: Market Path
5736.DESCRIPTION: Your goal was to reach the artisan island, hoping to trade berry jam for peach or apricot preserves.

5737.NAME: Chicory Traders
5737.DESCRIPTION: The island is a stone's throw away from the popular trading route. Pirates have decided to collect taxes.

5738.NAME: Pea Traders
5738.DESCRIPTION: These are not some unknown pirates. The island is currently run by the well-known Pirate Bane from Oceania.

5739.NAME: Sweet Potato Traders
5739.DESCRIPTION: No, no, no taxes will be demanded from you. You are a good friend to the pirates, you can keep the produce you've already managed to grow.

574.NAME: Cleaner of the island
574.DESCRIPTION: This island has been visited by many travelers. They may have left something behind.

5740.NAME: Trader Almazo
5740.DESCRIPTION: Convinced that everything can be turned into money, Pirate Almazo was the one who encouraged accepting barrels of seeds as payment.

5741.NAME: Rhubarb Compote
5741.DESCRIPTION: You harvested the crop, and Almazo skillfully handles the care and trade of the produce.

5742.NAME: Wagers
5742.DESCRIPTION: Everything is fine until Bane starts counting jars of sorrel, while Almazo only dedicates time to rhubarb.

5743.NAME: Filling the Warehouses
5743.DESCRIPTION: It would be fair to start with empty warehouses, but Almazo started earlier. To win, the warehouses must be filled.

5744.NAME: Three Pirates Compete
5744.DESCRIPTION: The pirates have fallen into a serious gambling frenzy. All three are diligently trading seeds, giving away chicory, peas, and sweet potatoes.

5745.NAME: Work Safety
5745.DESCRIPTION: At no point did the pirates think about what they were storing in the wooden building. Sooner or later, an accident was bound to happen.

5746.NAME: Durable Warehouse
5746.DESCRIPTION: The new warehouse must be built from quartz and marble; no acid will affect those stones.

5747.NAME: Draw
5747.DESCRIPTION: It's no longer possible to determine who was right in the end. But hey, chasing jelly around was a lot of fun.

5748.NAME: Don't Leave in the Sun
5748.DESCRIPTION: There's not enough space for the sown produce. The first quartz warehouse will be shared, each subsequent one - individual.

5749.NAME: Shining stones
5749.DESCRIPTION: Poinsettia maze? Sorry, the road is closed. Want to try another maze? Look for the shining stone island.

575.NAME: Sissy's beauty courses
575.DESCRIPTION: The winner of Miss Oceania, Sissy, needs your help with organizing beauty courses for the locals. Get her a few things and receive a good reward.

5752.NAME: The beginning of summer
5752.DESCRIPTION: Hello! In Oceania, it is summer all year round, but in different parts of the globe this is not the case.

576.NAME: Sissy's beauty courses II
576.DESCRIPTION: Sissy will teach the local women to prepare a special facial mask. Submit the following things

5761.NAME: In search of taste
5761.DESCRIPTION: Food is also seasonal in different countries. What interesting things could we find?

5762.NAME: Soup I
5762.DESCRIPTION: Meet - Cold Soup. This specific dish can be found in many countries. But in two of them...

5763.NAME: Tables I
5763.DESCRIPTION: For the third year in a row, the Lithuanian capital Vilnius hosts a cold soup festival.

5764.NAME: Soup II
5764.DESCRIPTION: ...two of them believe that only their version is the BEST! They are Latvia and Lithuania...

5765.NAME: Soup III
5765.DESCRIPTION: ...Cold soup recipes prepared in Lithuania often include boiled potatoes...

5766.NAME: Tables II
5766.DESCRIPTION: There is no such festival in Latvia yet, so we are visiting Lithuania to eat their soup.

5767.NAME: Soup IV
5767.DESCRIPTION: ...In Latvia, sliced ​​boiled or soft sausage is often added to Cold soup...

5768.NAME: Tables III
5768.DESCRIPTION: It wouldn't surprise anyone if the Latvian capital, Riga, also had such a festival soon.

5769.NAME: Soup V
5769.DESCRIPTION: We'll be scoundrels and let you in on a secret - THERE IS NO CORRECT RECIPE FOR COLD SOUP!

577.NAME: Repairing the ancient wall
577.DESCRIPTION: The gigantic ancient wall covers up the final part of the island. If you repair it, you will be able to sell or move it.

5770.NAME: Enjoy your meal!
5770.DESCRIPTION: You can always learn something new about the recipes and customs of hundreds of different lands.

5771.NAME: 100% RUBY SALE!
5771.DESCRIPTION: This is a reminder that there is currently a 1=2 promotion, meaning that when you purchase any ruby pack, you receive twice as much.

5772.NAME: Race Cleanup
5772.DESCRIPTION: The workshop will definitely be used in the race. This task will help clean it up.

5773.NAME: Three Directions
5773.DESCRIPTION: The eggs are hard-boiled, time to go for Gold, Silver, or Bronze if ALL race tasks are completed.

5774.NAME: Raise the Flag
5774.DESCRIPTION: After completing this quest, you will receive the Finish Line quest, which will be the final task in this race.

5775.NAME: Bronze I
5775.DESCRIPTION: Quack, quack, ducklings! Don't rush, BUT don't forget. This judge is very important.

5776.NAME: Bronze II of IV
5776.DESCRIPTION: After the `Raise the Flag` task, you will need 60 adult roosters simultaneously at the Race Crossroads, within the Finish Line quest.

5777.NAME: Bronze III
5777.DESCRIPTION: Don't forget to spend pennants to raise flags. The fancier the pole, the better the rewards it gives.

5778.NAME: Silver I
5778.DESCRIPTION: Hey, few people read these texts! Try to feed 96 chickens on this island before starting anything else.

5779.NAME: Silver II of III
5779.DESCRIPTION: After the `Raise the Flag` task, you will need to move Bonfire V or VI at the Race Crossroads, within the Finish Line quest.

578.NAME: Mine renovator
578.DESCRIPTION: You have found a new mine, tucked away in a corner.

5780.NAME: Silver III
5780.DESCRIPTION: Don't forget to spend pennants to raise flags. The fancier the pole, the better the rewards it gives.

5781.NAME: Gold I
5781.DESCRIPTION: After treating the judge with a drink, you will not only be able to walk past her but also place her in the shade.

5782.NAME: Gold II of III
5782.DESCRIPTION: After the `Raise the Flag` task, you will need to make 1 clay pot at the Race Crossroads, within the Finish Line quest.

5783.NAME: Gold III
5783.DESCRIPTION: Don't forget to spend pennants to raise flags. The fancier the pole, the better the rewards it gives.

5784.NAME: Finish Line
5784.DESCRIPTION: Upon completing this goal, your finish time will be recorded.

5786.NAME: Bronze IV
5786.DESCRIPTION: Strangely, there are four goals in the Bronze difficulty tasks. In which direction was the judge looking?

579.NAME: Governor's palace
579.DESCRIPTION: Build a dwelling worthy of a governor.

5794.NAME: Catch the Gardener
5794.DESCRIPTION: Snip, snip, snip. Someone is diligently trimming your backyard bushes.

5795.NAME: Out of the Water
5795.DESCRIPTION: Something pink, hard, and very dirty is pulled out of the ground. You decide to rinse off this oddity.

58.NAME: Upgrade fireplace
58.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade fireplace by using the new materials

580.NAME: Explosion
580.DESCRIPTION: It is time to blow up the big pile of rocks.

5803.NAME: Puzzle 12-J
5803.DESCRIPTION: The pinching one had received all the instructions but understood nothing. Help prepare the experiment.

5804.NAME: Puzzle 13-i
5804.DESCRIPTION: The pinching one had received all the instructions but understood nothing. Help prepare the experiment.

5805.NAME: Puzzle 14-H
5805.DESCRIPTION: The pinching one had received all the instructions but understood nothing. Help prepare the experiment.

5806.NAME: Puzzle 15-g
5806.DESCRIPTION: The pinching one had received all the instructions but understood nothing. Help prepare the experiment.

5807.NAME: Puzzle 16-F
5807.DESCRIPTION: The pinching one had received all the instructions but understood nothing. Help prepare the experiment.

5808.NAME: Puzzle 17-e
5808.DESCRIPTION: The pinching one had received all the instructions but understood nothing. Help prepare the experiment.

5809.NAME: Puzzle 18-D
5809.DESCRIPTION: The pinching one had received all the instructions but understood nothing. Help prepare the experiment.

581.NAME: Return home
581.DESCRIPTION: Learn to return to your island from Pinnachi island by using the raft.

5810.NAME: Crazy Uncle
5810.DESCRIPTION: The raft is still halfway, on the island an electric flash flares up before you, then an explosion. Nothing is visible in the cloud of dust.

5811.NAME: Help the Uncle
5811.DESCRIPTION: The pinching assistant won't manage on its own, you'll have to help train this strange underground creature.

5812.NAME: Clear Language
5812.DESCRIPTION: The uncle's assistant will prepare materials for the experiments, meanwhile, you could prepare the island.

5813.NAME: Start the Experiment
5813.DESCRIPTION: The uncle pulls the wires. The sheep generate static electricity, from the shock the sloths feel tingles.

5816.NAME: Grilling Festival
5816.DESCRIPTION: A neighbor is once again grilling shashlik over the fire, and the aroma is mouthwatering.

5817.NAME: Hearty Recipe
5817.DESCRIPTION: Eating together is more fun, but each neighbor has their own eating style. Let's grill a variety.

5818.NAME: Start Grilling
5818.DESCRIPTION: The plan is to grill both meat and vegetables, salads, fruits... oh no, it's burnt!

5819.NAME: Start Polishing
5819.DESCRIPTION: While the mushrooms and vegetables are grilling, you can start arranging the furniture.

582.NAME: Build a castle with a decorative block
582.DESCRIPTION: The castle has to be built from decorative blocks.

5820.NAME: Cheese!
5820.DESCRIPTION: Guests love cheese. You know two ways to obtain this yellow delicacy. Of course, the cheese will also be grilled.

5821.NAME: Clay Oven
5821.DESCRIPTION: We've handled the vegetables, now it's time to grill meat. Let's start with something simple, namely sausages.

5822.NAME: Stoking the Oven
5822.DESCRIPTION: There is room for grilled vegetables on the cocktail tables. Now that meat dishes are available, you can set the long tables.

5823.NAME: Side Dishes for Meat
5823.DESCRIPTION: When guests start eating flowers from the vases, you realize the vegetable amount was insufficient.

5824.NAME: Last Guests
5824.DESCRIPTION: Don't extinguish the coals, the grilling continues. Lured by the aroma, both nearby and distant neighbors have arrived.

5825.NAME: Unpacking
5825.DESCRIPTION: Of course, the neighbors haven't come empty-handed. Giant boxes are placed on the island.

5826.NAME: Picnic with Vulpijs
5826.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs decided to go on a picnic and invites you to join. Vulpijs wants to visit a remote but beautiful place.

5827.NAME: Visit Vulpijs
5827.DESCRIPTION: From Vulpijs Island, it's not far to the picnic spot. Vulpijs himself also promises that the hike won't be long.

5828.NAME: Design Island
5828.DESCRIPTION: Looking at the monuments, you express regret that you didn't manage to finish both. "Both? You can build at least three beautiful structures here."

5829.NAME: Vulpijs' Greenhouse
5829.DESCRIPTION: Pictures of the third monument have not been published in any magazine. To see the finished version of this design, the monument will need to be completed.

583.NAME: Upgrade the castle with gate mechanism
583.DESCRIPTION: A real castle needs a gate

5830.NAME: Grill Items I of III
5830.DESCRIPTION: Some of these materials will only be available after completing several tasks.

5831.NAME: Grill Items II of III
5831.DESCRIPTION: These side quests do not take into account that the event cycle includes planting and feeding tasks.

5832.NAME: Grill Items III of III
5832.DESCRIPTION: To complete this cycle, slightly larger quantities of resources will be needed than indicated in the side quests.

5833.NAME: Cricket game
5833.DESCRIPTION: In your free summer time, you go to Paprick to pass the time with a game of cricket.

5834.NAME: Isabella in the mountains
5834.DESCRIPTION: During school time, Isabella teaches chemistry to the little oceanics. In summer, Isabella lives in the mountains and dries interesting herbs.

5835.NAME: Little jungle
5835.DESCRIPTION: The cockatoos called their fellow species for help, together they will fly over the entire area in search of another path.

5836.NAME: Bird news
5836.DESCRIPTION: Bad news, to get up, you will need to cross the terrible ice plain. After these words, the little house's door opens.

5837.NAME: Taming the winds
5837.DESCRIPTION: Isabella promises to capture all the winds. The witch will be able to enjoy the roses and not worry.

5838.NAME: Ice forest
5838.DESCRIPTION: An unnaturally cold region, no wonder no one uses this path. Even in a thick coat, you will freeze stiff.

5839.NAME: Map directions
5839.DESCRIPTION: From above, it's hard to understand exactly where the gaps in the mountains are, but the well-trodden animal paths indicate that a way can be found.

584.NAME: Build a castle IV
584.DESCRIPTION: There will be a staircase leading to the tower

5840.NAME: Edge of the gorge
5840.DESCRIPTION: A tree has fallen across the gorge. Like a tube, the little animals move back and forth. The tree certainly won't hold your weight.

5841.NAME: Love whirlwind
5841.DESCRIPTION: The witch's broom is currently undergoing technical maintenance for straightening the bristles, flying will need to be done in another way.

5842.NAME: Almost home
5842.DESCRIPTION: This side is already familiar to Isabella, she is near the little house, where special mountain herbs were collected.

5843.NAME: Summer cottage
5843.DESCRIPTION: Isabella doesn't intend to fly with kites every time she needs milk. Time to light up the laboratory.

5844.NAME: Bruno's visit
5844.DESCRIPTION: Of course, Isabella wants to blast the rock into pieces, but blasting without thought is not allowed. Bruno Blaster has come to visit.

5845.NAME: Finally blasting?
5845.DESCRIPTION: Isabella didn't like waiting at all, but what to do, the correct procedure is intended for the safety of all oceanics.

5846.NAME: Small gratitude
5846.DESCRIPTION: A big thank you to everyone who helped me get home and clear the landslide.

5847.NAME: Material Search
5847.DESCRIPTION: Of the three monuments, Vulpijam likes the greenhouse the most. The pink friend starts to wonder how to procure materials.

5848.NAME: Work and Rest
5848.DESCRIPTION: From time to time, Vulpijam invites you to sit down and rest, and maybe eat a sandwich.

5849.NAME: Baobab Planting
5849.DESCRIPTION: Once the baskets are woven, there's still quite a bit of bark left. Some branches can be placed in a vase, the rest will be used for mulch.

585.NAME: Watchtower staircase
585.DESCRIPTION: The watchtower needs a solid staircase. Turrick has promised to build it in exchange for some things for his new sea garden.

5850.NAME: ONE MONUMENT!
5850.DESCRIPTION: There are enough materials for ONLY ONE MONUMENT! Choose which one to build and stick to this choice.

5851.NAME: Peacock Pruning
5851.DESCRIPTION: By completing these tasks, you will obtain flower pots for the greenhouse. Vulpijam places each pruned branch in a different vase.

5852.NAME: Cats That Don't Bite
5852.DESCRIPTION: The birds are very fond of cat decorations. Repair the decorations and you will receive seedlings. You will get birds by feeding the island's birds.

5853.NAME: Lichen Propagation
5853.DESCRIPTION: Clear the island paths and carefully select the larger lichens. A variety will be needed in the greenhouse.

5854.NAME: Stone Plants
5854.DESCRIPTION: Some plants grow only on limestone. For this task, you can earn 31 lilac branches.

5855.NAME: Coordinate with Vulpijam
5855.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijam is better at growing, you at building. For this task, you can earn 3 greenhouse glass panes.

5856.NAME: The Big Potting
5856.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijam has gathered a pile of flower pots and plans to fill them. In this task, you can earn 49 potted plants.

5857.NAME: Complete Cleanup
5857.DESCRIPTION: The greenhouse is partially filled. Vulpijam invites you to sit down and discuss the next tasks.

5858.NAME: Plants from Afar
5858.DESCRIPTION: The greenhouse is intended for many different exotic plants. Vulpijam still lacks Heliconia and Amaryllis.

5859.NAME: Watering
5859.DESCRIPTION: Work on the greenhouse continues. Don't forget to water the already planted plants.

586.NAME: Watchtower staircase II
586.DESCRIPTION: The watchtower needs a solid staircase. Turrick has promised to build it in exchange for some things for his new sea garden.

5860.NAME: Monument Construction
5860.DESCRIPTION: From time to time, Vulpijam will invite you to rest and eat a sandwich. Work until the next break.

5861.NAME: Monument Construction 2
5861.DESCRIPTION: After sitting under the palm tree, it's time to return to construction. Vulpijam reminds you that there will be another sandwich break later.

5862.NAME: Monument Construction 3
5862.DESCRIPTION: After the break, you find some candies in your pocket. Vulpijam knows how to cheer you up. Let's continue building.

5863.NAME: Build the Monument
5863.DESCRIPTION: Thank you for helping Vulpijam, but don't forget to lend a hand in monument construction. If tasks run out, build!

5864.NAME: Let's Start Working
5864.DESCRIPTION: During the tea break, several ideas and plant combinations were reviewed.

5866.NAME: Rhubarb snacks
5866.DESCRIPTION: You can dip a rhubarb stalk in sugar and munch it just like that. For a big rhubarb harvest, you’ll need cook’s recipes.

5867.NAME: Learning rhubarb
5867.DESCRIPTION: Rhubarb feels summery. Frequent rain showers don’t feel summery, so let’s move elsewhere.

5868.NAME: Rhubarb preserves
5868.DESCRIPTION: Putting rhubarb into jars will make them soft and tender later. In Oceania, this marinade restores the strength to bustle about.

5869.NAME: Cake idea
5869.DESCRIPTION: Finely chopped rhubarb, flour, this and that. At the last moment, you decide to try honey as an addition.

587.NAME: Castle gate mechanism
587.DESCRIPTION: The big, heavy castle gate needs a mechanism that would open it. Ask the engineer for some help.

5870.NAME: Ideas for a drink
5870.DESCRIPTION: From rhubarb you could make a summery tasty cocktail. Watermelon is undeniably summery.

5871.NAME: Pickled rhubarb
5871.DESCRIPTION: To complete this task, you must first complete the base task 'Rhubarb snacks'.

5872.NAME: Rhubarb cake
5872.DESCRIPTION: To complete this task, you must first complete the base task 'Rhubarb snacks'.

5873.NAME: Rhubarb drink
5873.DESCRIPTION: To complete this task, you must first complete the base task 'Rhubarb snacks'.

5874.NAME: Ingredients for compote
5874.DESCRIPTION: By preserving repeatedly, you managed to find the right proportion of spices and rhubarb.

5875.NAME: Ingredients for cake
5875.DESCRIPTION: Experiments with cakes and muffins greatly reduced the flour stock, but the recipe turned out perfect.

5876.NAME: Ingredients for drinks
5876.DESCRIPTION: Very simple, very quick recipe. It’s impossible to go wrong. Get more ingredients and enjoy again.

5877.NAME: Rhubarb in the kitchen
5877.DESCRIPTION: Rhubarb recipes are now available. It’s time to think about the best use for this vegetable.

5878.NAME: Autumn Tradition
5878.DESCRIPTION: While laughing at the well, a travel ticket is fished out, with a note attached containing directions.

5879.NAME: Beet in the Olympiad
5879.DESCRIPTION: In this discipline, the Oceanians compete to see who can grow the largest deep-water beet harvest.

588.NAME: Bundle of keys for the castle
588.DESCRIPTION: Helen Lancaster is ready to give a key for each task you fulfill. You will need a bundle of keys for your castle.

5880.NAME: Spotlight in the Olympiad
5880.DESCRIPTION: This discipline will consume your wood and coconut supplies.

5881.NAME: Eucalyptus in the Olympiad
5881.DESCRIPTION: This discipline will require huge reserves of splinters. Players will compete in harpoon carving.

5882.NAME: Betta Fish in the Olympiad
5882.DESCRIPTION: To compete in feeding Betta fish, the player will have to part with a large number of pitaya and pandanus fruits.

5883.NAME: Jelly in the Olympiad
5883.DESCRIPTION: In this discipline, players compete to see who has the largest poison reserves in Oceania. Yellow jungle plots can be dug up.

5884.NAME: Llamas in the Olympiad
5884.DESCRIPTION: This discipline is meant for llama keepers. Compete to see who is the greatest llama friend. Yellow jungle plots can be dug up.

5885.NAME: Paths in the Olympiad
5885.DESCRIPTION: This discipline will train your hands in bamboo weaving. Let’s see who can weave bamboo paths the best. Yellow jungle plots can be dug up.

5886.NAME: Mansion in the Olympiad
5886.DESCRIPTION: Competitions for the best carpenter’s skills. Asian mansions can be bought, moved, and sold. Yellow jungle plots can be dug up.

5887.NAME: Blisters in the Olympiad
5887.DESCRIPTION: In this discipline, the Oceanians compete to see who can best cultivate Sea blister plots.

5888.NAME: Fountain in the Olympiad
5888.DESCRIPTION: Water-spitting lizards eat lemons. In this discipline, players will try to feed the largest number of lemons.

5889.NAME: Chameleons in the Olympiad
5889.DESCRIPTION: This discipline will show who is best at building limestone decorations.

589.NAME: Bundle of keys for the castle II
589.DESCRIPTION: Helen Lancaster is ready to give a key for each task you fulfill. You will need a bundle of keys for your castle.

5890.NAME: Snails in the Olympiad
5890.DESCRIPTION: Snails continue to gnaw on cabbages even underwater. This discipline will determine who has the largest sea cabbage reserves.

5891.NAME: The Planned Flight
5891.DESCRIPTION: The birds are planning to leave, the animals grow sad. What to do? The time is coming when bird songs will no longer be heard.

5892.NAME: Foxes and Magpies
5892.DESCRIPTION: The magpie brings a record, which it quite accidentally `borrowed` from the foxes. In the foxes’ stash, one can find all sorts of trinkets.

5893.NAME: Terrible Noise
5893.DESCRIPTION: Bats and snails emerge from underground, angry about the dreadful noise. If you want to party, do it somewhere it won’t disturb others!

5894.NAME: Farewell Party
5894.DESCRIPTION: The birds will soon be leaving, so this might be a farewell party. The foxes have another idea in mind, but it is not spoken of.

5895.NAME: Fatigue
5895.DESCRIPTION: After the ninth dance the head feels light, but the legs are heavy as lead. The next two dances will have to be skipped.

5896.NAME: Couriers
5896.DESCRIPTION: There are many guests, and the stock of paper cups is quickly shrinking. The foxes are planning a trip to the store.

5897.NAME: Foxes’ Intentions 1 of 3
5897.DESCRIPTION: While everyone is partying, the foxes begin to organize their grand plan. What are the foxes up to?

5898.NAME: Foxes’ Intentions 2 of 3
5898.DESCRIPTION: Are the foxes planning a photo shoot? But the invitation to pose was extended only to certain animals.

5899.NAME: Foxes’ Intentions 3 of 3
5899.DESCRIPTION: The foxes intend to record the migratory birds’ songs, so that the animals staying at home can enjoy the birds’ voices even in winter.

59.NAME: Upgrade waterhole
59.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade waterhole, using the new materials

590.NAME: Explore and clear the island
590.DESCRIPTION: Clear the new part of the island.

5900.NAME: Unusual Dance
5900.DESCRIPTION: The birds truly love to sing, the recording session is a success, and there are even tears in the listeners’ eyes.

5901.NAME: The Night is Still Long
5901.DESCRIPTION: Enough sitting. The song recordings can be listened to in winter. Tonight the birds’ legs will grow tired, not their wings.

5902.NAME: Shaman Disco
5902.DESCRIPTION:
The mandarin ducks are offered a tour to Shaman Island. The offer is valid only for a full-sized choir.
To buy a disco ball, you need to complete the Fox Disco special quest line.

5903.NAME: Bat Disco
5903.DESCRIPTION:
A special offer is made to the coastal birds. The flight path is suggested to be redirected to an underground cave.
To buy a disco ball, you need to complete the Fox Disco special quest line.

5907.NAME: Autumn Olympiad 2025
5907.DESCRIPTION: Each small side task in a discipline will give you 1 box of joy, while the large side task will give you 2 boxes of joy.

591.NAME: New resources
591.DESCRIPTION: Use the gem mine to obtain new resources

5911.NAME: Place the Wells
5911.DESCRIPTION: When visiting the Festival Island, check the EVENT section and you’ll see three wells. Place all three wells.

5912.NAME: Kittens’ riddles
5912.DESCRIPTION: Something purple appears and disappears under the local fir tree. Something orange peeks out from under the bushes.

5913.NAME: Night visit
5913.DESCRIPTION: By sunset, these kittens have gathered all the forest goods on your island. The kittens sit on the raft and go to look for forest treasures on another island.

5914.NAME: Work in the dark
5914.DESCRIPTION: The night is dark. The berry kittens see perfectly in the dark. During the night, no one disturbs the kittens as they bustle in the forest.

5915.NAME: Marigold Riddle I
5915.DESCRIPTION: At night, the kittens will trim one marigold bush. You’ll find a note with the tasks in the basket the next morning.

5916.NAME: Marigold Riddle II
5916.DESCRIPTION: You’ll find the answers to this riddle on the morning of October 12. The answers won’t disappear; you’ll still see the task list even on later dates.

5917.NAME: Marigold Riddle III
5917.DESCRIPTION: The kittens plan to trim all 12 marigold bushes. Each morning you’ll find a new basket and a new note.

5918.NAME: Marigold Riddle IV
5918.DESCRIPTION: The kittens are surprised you managed to do everything. There’s no need to complete all kitten tasks in one day.

5919.NAME: Marigold Riddle V
5919.DESCRIPTION: Under today’s task note, the kittens have also added a date: October 15. The fifth riddle means the 15th date.

592.NAME: Buyer of golden chains
592.DESCRIPTION: You will need golden chains to make beautiful jewelry

5920.NAME: Marigold Riddle VI
5920.DESCRIPTION: While trimming another bush, a sleepy sand kitten chooses from the marigolds.

5921.NAME: Marigold Riddle VII
5921.DESCRIPTION: The sand kitten won’t take part in the night’s harvest; it curls up under the fir tree and keeps napping.

5922.NAME: Marigold Riddle VIII
5922.DESCRIPTION: The berry kittens have enough of your help. Their relative from the sandy plain can sleep undisturbed.

5923.NAME: Marigold Riddle IX
5923.DESCRIPTION: The note again emphasizes that there’s no need to overdo it. Below is the list of tasks for Sunday.

5924.NAME: Marigold Riddle X
5924.DESCRIPTION: While the berry kittens bustle about, the sand kitten is gradually covered by pink leaves. The kitten doesn’t complain. It’s warm.

5925.NAME: Marigold Riddle XI
5925.DESCRIPTION: The kittens note that just two more tasks remain, and all the autumn forest treasures will be gathered. This is the penultimate task.

5926.NAME: Marigold Riddle XII
5926.DESCRIPTION: It’s October 22. The kittens’ note invites you to finish all delayed tasks. The sand kitten has disappeared and can’t be found.

5927.NAME: Kitten in the basket
5927.DESCRIPTION: The sand kitten lies in the berry basket and is ready to leave. When dividing the forest treasures, the kittens have assigned this basket to you.

593.NAME: Pieces of iron and copper
593.DESCRIPTION: There are new iron and copper recipes in the workshop section MATERIALS.

5930.NAME: Olympiad `25 Correction
5930.DESCRIPTION:
Hey, greetings to everyone who completed the Autumn Olympiad 2025 additional task.
The reward for completing this task differs from the one we promised to players.
The reward has been earned, and we won’t take it away — if you find the Tree of Wealth more appealing than the fish, that’s fine. However, if you wanted to receive exactly the Autumn Fish Trio, you can exchange the reward you received.
Both rewards are quite similar — each gives 2 energy every 18 hours.

5931.NAME: Maya’s Inheritance
5931.DESCRIPTION: Your acquaintance Maya recently inherited an old house. Some help with decorating for halloween would be appreciated.

5932.NAME: Skeletons in the Garden
5932.DESCRIPTION: Maya remembers that in her childhood the garden was decorated with plastic skeletons. Help find those old decorations.

5933.NAME: Busy in the Garden
5933.DESCRIPTION: Maya remembers that in her childhood the garden was decorated with plastic skeletons. Help find those old decorations.

5934.NAME: Busy in the Kitchen
5934.DESCRIPTION: Maia could use some help carving pumpkins. After a while, Maya enters the kitchen and asks you to brew tea from the herbs.

5935.NAME: Crooked Pumpkins
5935.DESCRIPTION: The pumpkin faces turned out mediocre. Maya suggests using a mirror to make the expressions more natural.

5936.NAME: Hunting
5936.DESCRIPTION: While you were busy in the garden, Maya brought down the old mirror from the attic. It will be useful for your carving.

5937.NAME: Green Carving
5937.DESCRIPTION: While practicing in front of the mirror, this time you noticed movement. Turning around, you see Maya holding knives.

5938.NAME: Tension
5938.DESCRIPTION: Maia enters the garden. You ask her to hold the candles, but due to an awkward grip, Maya drops them on the ground.

5939.NAME: Another Tea?
5939.DESCRIPTION: Maia takes the shards outside. After a while, Maya returns and asks you to make another cup of tea.

594.NAME: Gemstone necklaces
594.DESCRIPTION: Now you can make necklaces in the workshop section OTHER. You can also sell the from your bag.

5940.NAME: Tea in the Garden
5940.DESCRIPTION: Maya had rinsed her wound in the spring—you notice a drop of blood next to it. How did the finger heal so fast?

5941.NAME: Inconsistency
5941.DESCRIPTION: Maya isn’t allergic to silver? You were strictly told not to use a silver spoon when making tea.

5942.NAME: Cold Cellar
5942.DESCRIPTION: The house is a place where candles go out if you walk across these boards. And there’s a chill in the air. This house has no cellar.

5943.NAME: Angry Spirit
5943.DESCRIPTION: You hear an angry sigh behind you. Turning around, you see a person who looks like Maya.

5944.NAME: Old Superstition
5944.DESCRIPTION: Only when you threaten to stir the urn’s contents with a silver spoon does the ghost yield, and Maya wakes up.

5945.NAME: Maia Was Frightened
5945.DESCRIPTION: Even the ghost was scared of these creatures. The ghost reminds you—use silver items!

5946.NAME: House Guardian
5946.DESCRIPTION: Long ago, the little spirit diligently guarded the house, but when it was abandoned, of the boredom spirit fell into a  deep sleep.

5947.NAME: Gaining Personality
5947.DESCRIPTION: If the little spirit had a stronger personality, it could break free and leave this house.

5948.NAME: Breaking Free
5948.DESCRIPTION: The little spirit settles into the urn. From now on, it will be the flowerpot spirit. The spirit is ready to travel.

5949.NAME: Festival Haunting
5949.DESCRIPTION: Is it really time to go? The little ghost wants to haunt the garden one last time, and then we can leave.

595.NAME: Bone beads II
595.DESCRIPTION: Open the third section of your bag and find bone beads. Sell them!

5950.NAME: The Guide Has Returned
5950.DESCRIPTION: The guide got lost in the second maze. This time, the guide will definitely note every bunny found.

5952.NAME: Gel in Hair
5952.DESCRIPTION: Three hours spent in front of the mirror, clothes are clean, hair looks like from a fashion magazine cover. Meanwhile, the kittens have licked all the hair gel from their fur, and now they look fluffy again.

5953.NAME: Weavers’ Island
5953.DESCRIPTION: All year you’ve been embroidering a tablecloth with folk patterns. Now it’s time to put your handiwork to use.

5954.NAME: Cleanup 1 of 3
5954.DESCRIPTION: You arrive on the island in a festive mood, but all around is silence, thickets, and the smell of paint.

5955.NAME: Cleanup 2 of 3
5955.DESCRIPTION: The weavers came out, greeted you, and returned to work. The spinners, while greeting, didn’t even lift their eyes and kept working.

5956.NAME: Cleanup 3 of 3
5956.DESCRIPTION: No decorations have been placed on the island yet. While waiting, you can help so that later the decorations don’t get caught in branches.

5957.NAME: Thread Spinners
5957.DESCRIPTION: Like the saying about the shoemaker who walks barefoot. The weavers have been making folk patterns for others all year.

5958.NAME: Festive Decorations
5958.DESCRIPTION: The island’s craftsmen have tried to weave festive ribbons for everyone, but the island itself remains boringly empty.

5959.NAME: Ties for Raccoons
5959.DESCRIPTION: The spinners, weavers, and other animals have fabric rolls in every corner, but no suits for themselves.

596.NAME: Plan of the castle
596.DESCRIPTION: In order to build a castle, you need a plan. You need an architect. Send him a letter. Paprick will help you.

5960.NAME: Restless Eyes
5960.DESCRIPTION: The Raccoons fidget and can’t stay still. They know how to work, but not how to rest. Put the Raccoons to work, decorate the island.

5961.NAME: Tuxedos for Kangaroos
5961.DESCRIPTION: Some animals didn’t get the hint and keep working. You’ll have to drag the spinners away from work by their tails.

5962.NAME: Festive Embroidery
5962.DESCRIPTION: The Kangaroos have timely embroidered festive tapestries. Of course, right now these fabrics are buried under piles of clothes.

5963.NAME: Island Weavers
5963.DESCRIPTION: Spinning and weaving are different processes. The weavers’ looms keep clattering, find weaving experts.

5964.NAME: Work Camels
5964.DESCRIPTION: Ah, when you said workhorses, did you mean we should help the Camels?

5965.NAME: Llamas are Late
5965.DESCRIPTION: The Llamas finished work along with the Raccoons, but they still can’t decide on an outfit.

5966.NAME: Raccoons and Kangaroos
5966.DESCRIPTION: While you were chatting with the Llamas, the Kangaroos and Raccoons continued decorating the island with tapestries and other décor.

5967.NAME: Last Caravan
5967.DESCRIPTION: After helping the Camels get dressed, the unpacked boxes remained right in the middle of the island.

5968.NAME: Festive Day
5968.DESCRIPTION: The island finally looks festive, and most of the animals are ready for the celebration.

5969.NAME: Thread Variants
5969.DESCRIPTION: It seems the craftsmen will never finish their work. You can complete this task leisurely. Active help is needed in other tasks.

597.NAME: Plan of the castle II
597.DESCRIPTION: Architect has sent you a reply via Paprick. Gather the following things and you will get the plan for the castle.

5970.NAME: Weave the Flag
5970.DESCRIPTION: In the workshop lies a special festive flag, collectively woven and embroidered. Each animal has added its paw in free time to help the shared work progress.

598.NAME: Bundle of keys for the castle III
598.DESCRIPTION: Helen Lancaster is ready to give a key for each task you fulfill. You will need a bundle of keys for your castle.

599.NAME: Bundle of keys for the castle IV
599.DESCRIPTION: As a reward for fulfilling the tasks, Helen has given you lots of keys.

6.NAME: Earn trust
6.DESCRIPTION: Earn the trust of natives, so they would allow you to settle on the big island.

60.NAME: Upgrade your shelter
60.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade your simple shelter into a plank hut

600.NAME: Blocks for building the castle
600.DESCRIPTION: The castle needs to be built from special decorative stone blocks. To get the recipe, fulfill the demands of the local potter.

601.NAME: Blocks for building the castle III
601.DESCRIPTION: The local potter has revealed the recipe for making decorative blocks.

602.NAME: Blocks for building the castle II
602.DESCRIPTION: Continue fulfilling the potter's tasks to get the recipe for decorative blocks.

603.NAME: Tiles for the castle roof
603.DESCRIPTION: The castle will have a tile roof. Gycott has promised to give you the recipe. He will organise a gourmand night on your island. Help by doing the following tasks.

604.NAME: Tiles for the castle roof II

605.NAME: Tiles for the castle roof III
605.DESCRIPTION: - You have done well. The gourmand night was a success. - said Gycott and handed you the roof tile recipe

606.NAME: Tycott's truffle seeds
606.DESCRIPTION: Tycott tells you that he once was in a castle and ate a royal meal out of truffles. He even got some seeds. You definitely want to get some!

607.NAME: Tycott's truffle seeds II
607.DESCRIPTION: Continue fulfilling Tycott's tasks to get truffle seeds.

608.NAME: Tycott's truffle seeds III
608.DESCRIPTION: Continue fulfilling Tycott's tasks to get truffle seeds.

609.NAME: Truffles
609.DESCRIPTION: Turns out that Tycott had only two truffle seeds. He gave them to you.

610.NAME: Castle floor
610.DESCRIPTION: Every castle needs a parquet floor. Tycott has promised to deliver it if you get the following things.

611.NAME: Upgrade the castle with truffles
611.DESCRIPTION: According to an old saying, you need to build some truffles into the castle walls - then they will never be destroyed.

612.NAME: Upgrade the castle with tiles
612.DESCRIPTION: The castle roof will look amazing if you use tiles

613.NAME: Upgrade the castle with a new floor
613.DESCRIPTION: Improve the castle with the new flooring, made by Turrick

614.NAME: Antelopes II
614.DESCRIPTION: Yuyu has offered to sell you a couple of baby antelopes so that you can try to raise them.

615.NAME: Antelopes
615.DESCRIPTION: Your island is visited by antelope breeder Yuyu. He likes your island. Give him some things and you will be able to buy antelopes in the shop.

616.NAME: Binoculars for the castle
616.DESCRIPTION: Yuyu is ready to invest in the building of your castle by giving you binoculars for its towers. Of course, he wants something in exchange.

617.NAME: Upgrade the castle with binoculars
617.DESCRIPTION: You need binoculars for the castle towers.

618.NAME: Paprick's troubles
618.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is in trouble again. Help him and you will receive a special paint pot for the castle walls.

619.NAME: Paprick's troubles II
619.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is in trouble again. Help him and you will receive a special paint pot for the castle walls.

62.NAME: Longer plank path
62.DESCRIPTION: Beautify your island with a longer plank path

620.NAME: Upgrade the castle with the paint pot
620.DESCRIPTION: You need a sustainable, yet royally beautiful paint for the castle walls.

621.NAME: Castle chandelier
621.DESCRIPTION: Every castle needs a big and beautiful chandelier. Sissy has promised to decorate it.

622.NAME: Approving the castle plan
622.DESCRIPTION: The local council of elders wants to see the plan and approve the building of your castle.

623.NAME: Help friends wih resources
623.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends in clay and stone mines

624.NAME: Castle chandelier II
624.DESCRIPTION: Continue fulfilling Sissy's tasks and you will get a beautifully decorated chandelier.

625.NAME: Castle chandelier III
625.DESCRIPTION: Continue fulfilling Sissy's tasks and you will get a beautifully decorated chandelier.

626.NAME: Jeweller's order
626.DESCRIPTION: The local jeweller is preparing a jewel exhibition. Obtain gems to receive reputation and a special bush

627.NAME: Jeweller
627.DESCRIPTION: Your island is visited by a jeweller. Fulfill his tasks and you will receive a generous reward.

628.NAME: A royal meal
628.DESCRIPTION: A new food recipe is available in the workshop. Try it out.

629.NAME: Help a friend in need
629.DESCRIPTION: As Paprick once said - be a good friend for others, and they will be good friends for you!

630.NAME: Sissy's party
630.DESCRIPTION: Sissy has asked you to give her some exotic fruit for her exotic swimsuit party.

65.NAME: New plank shed
65.DESCRIPTION: Build a new plank shed. Previously placed plank sheds do not count

661.NAME: Upgrade the castle with chandelier
661.DESCRIPTION: The great hall can be illuminated by a big, embellished chandelier

662.NAME: Obtaining roof frame
662.DESCRIPTION: You need a frame for the castle roof. Fulfill these tasks and you will get the first part of the frame

663.NAME: Obtaining roof frame II
663.DESCRIPTION: You need a frame for the castle roof. Fulfill these tasks and you will get the second part of the frame

1.DESCRIPTION: Find a way to get away from the small island.

10041.DESCRIPTION: In general, diamonds are distinctly small. It's not advisable to lose them, just as it wouldn't be good to lose needles.

10103.DESCRIPTION: The cockatoo visited the foxes, visits the foxes and asked in which direction the cockatoo went. Sell foxes.

10104.NAME: Through the onion field
10104.DESCRIPTION: The foxes point to the onion field, straight across and to the left. Harvest onion fields.

10105.NAME: Marks on the island
10105.DESCRIPTION: Stick stakes in the ground to clearly see where the bird has gone. Make nails in the workshop.

10106.NAME: Kneading sculpture mass
10106.DESCRIPTION: Nice keepsakes keep the best memories, but the bird doesn't remember you yet. Make wax bees.

10107.NAME: Blocks for the house
10107.DESCRIPTION: Maybe a stable and durable house would be useful for the bird? I doubt it, birdhouses are made from boards. Make blocks.

10108.NAME: Shiny coins
10108.DESCRIPTION: Everything that shines well in sunny weather shines in the eyes of magpies, but the cockatoo is not a magpie. Visit the Pinaki Treasure Cave.

10109.NAME: Guaranteed by Ducks
10109.DESCRIPTION: If you do not believe in the benevolence of foxes, ask the ducks, they will confirm the foxes' hospitality and good intentions. Feed the ducks.

1011.NAME: Plank paths
1011.DESCRIPTION: Make 3 plank paths to please Paprick

10110.NAME: Ketchup in the mustache
10110.DESCRIPTION: Foxes have a red nose because pasta is best eaten with ketchup. Harvest tomato fields.

10111.NAME: Rearrange supplies
10111.DESCRIPTION: Move materials in storage, maybe you will find something that Kakadu might like. Make bricks.

10112.NAME: Thinking thoughts
10112.DESCRIPTION: When you lack inspiration, you can sit down and think. Build houses for thinking thoughts.

10113.NAME: Get pure iron
10113.DESCRIPTION: You were so happy when you got your first metal fork on a foreign island. I doubt that Kakadu will be able to appreciate it.

10114.NAME: Wool blanket
10114.DESCRIPTION: Get the cloth to warm the black bird. Linen fabric will also work.

10115.NAME: Goat forests
10115.DESCRIPTION: Horns do not prevent the goat from moving forward, do you want to know how the goat manages it? Stubbornness is the basis of everything. Feed the goats.

10116.NAME: Harvest the beans
10116.DESCRIPTION: Cutting creepers with machetes is a typical choice, but you have a tractor! Harvest the string bean crop.

10117.NAME: Antelope postmen
10117.DESCRIPTION: Send a message with antelopes, sell them. Antelopes run fast, hopefully the food won't get cold.

10118.NAME: Root hedgehogs
10118.DESCRIPTION: Spotting hedgehogs wandering in the thicket, it would be polite to say hello. Feeds hedgehogs.

10119.NAME: Build paths
10119.DESCRIPTION: Stone blocks and bricks were rejected, Kakadu doesn't need those things. Create stone or clay paths.

1012.NAME: Water
1012.DESCRIPTION: Give Paprick some water, so that he would not run out of drinks at the party.

10120.NAME: Grain birds
10120.DESCRIPTION: You can hit your head against a nearby tree, hedgehogs remind you, most birds like grain that way. Harvest the wheat.

10121.NAME: Angry bird
10121.DESCRIPTION: The cockatoo is still angry, small, painless stones are thrown in your direction. Get the shards.

10122.NAME: Other meat
10122.DESCRIPTION: Offer a cockatoo fish to explain what a fish is, draw it in the sand. Build fish trophies.

10123.NAME: Porridge for birds
10123.DESCRIPTION: Do you remember the stew that the chicken liked so much? If you don't remember, feed the chickens and try recalling.

10124.NAME: A jungle mess
10124.DESCRIPTION: Arguing with the black beauty can take a long time, build any type of modern storage to shelter from the rain.

10125.NAME: Pumpkin bowling
10125.DESCRIPTION: Look at the birds' legs, as you can see, birds have no football talent. Pick and roll pumpkins while playing bowling.

10126.NAME: Repairing storage
10126.DESCRIPTION: There was no rain, so the nails dried up. Get the little copper pieces for a little more sturdy nails.

10127.NAME: Flax fields
10127.DESCRIPTION: Who needs decorations when you can see the beautiful flax fields from above. That's right, harvest time, flax must be cut.

10128.NAME: Shiny trees
10128.DESCRIPTION: Shiny coins were also rejected. Cockatoos like trees with iridescent fruit, build jewel trees.

10129.NAME: Get puffball mushrooms
10129.DESCRIPTION: You can't make foamy desert from tomatoes, Cockatoo wanted to eat deliciously. Get puffball from friends or Paprick.

1013.NAME: Stools
1013.DESCRIPTION: Paprick needs to borrow some stools for his party. Make 3 plank stools.

10130.NAME: Offer wine
10130.DESCRIPTION: Dew does not last long in this tropical climate, roll out a keg of your best wine from the cellar. Build these barrels.

10131.NAME: Harvest the carrots
10131.DESCRIPTION: Birds don't give up fruit, but you only manage to find a wild carrot in the forest. Harvest the harvest.

10132.NAME: Chewing water
10132.DESCRIPTION: Meal somewhere between the two previous categories, doesn't Cockatoo want some delicious jellyfish? Get the jellyfish.

10133.NAME: Building a cheese workshop
10133.DESCRIPTION: After the storage disaster, your choice leaned towards screws. Get these cheese factory assembly pieces.

10134.NAME: A vegetarian wallaby
10134.DESCRIPTION: Cockatoos don't like carrots too much, but you can't overlook the good will and cooking of wallabies. Feed the wallabies.

10135.NAME: Water cooling
10135.DESCRIPTION: Phew, blue cheese is real poison! Fish fountains are being built to cool the new building.

10136.NAME: Newspapers
10136.DESCRIPTION: There is no internet in the jungle, the cockatoo was reading the local press. Help remove the papers, submit the parchment.

10137.NAME: Potatoes for the miracle bird
10137.DESCRIPTION: The staple food will be boiled potatoes, harvest this crop.

10138.NAME: Game meat for guest
10138.DESCRIPTION: The vegetarian bird does not have livestock to process into sausages. Invite the dogs to help with hunting, feed the dogs.

10139.NAME: Cactus juice
10139.DESCRIPTION: The camel treated the bird with cactus flowers, but they made the bird dizzy. Clean up Toby Island.

1014.NAME: Beans
1014.DESCRIPTION: Give Paprick some beans to prepare for the party.

10140.NAME: Pickled cucumbers
10140.DESCRIPTION: During the winter, when fruit was harder to come by, cockatoo's food consisted of pickled cucumbers in pots. Make clay pots.

10141.NAME: Feeding the elephants
10141.DESCRIPTION: The cockatoos are sitting in the trees, invite the elephants to raise their snouts and comb through the upper layers of the air.

10142.NAME: Thirst
10142.DESCRIPTION: The last bird cannot hide forever, the trees have fruit but no water. Make some troughts.

10143.NAME: Little paws
10143.DESCRIPTION: The meerkats picked up all the fallen feathers, redundant but still nice. Sell meerkats.

10144.NAME: Joyride
10144.DESCRIPTION: As the birds roll, they run into a tree, which is ground under the wheels. Forgot to untie the machetes? Drive a tractor.

10145.NAME: All cockatoos
10145.DESCRIPTION: The bird ran away hungry, to feed all the birds you will need cheese. Fill the bellies of the birds after completing the tasks.

10146.NAME: Tractor machetes
10146.DESCRIPTION: Tie the machete to the tractor and let it go to the circle. Clear the field for lunch. Forge the yellow machetes.

10147.NAME: Lunch benches
10147.DESCRIPTION: It is convenient for a cockatoo to sit right there in a palm tree, a relative can sit on a bench. Build iron benches.

10148.NAME: Delicious feathers
10148.DESCRIPTION: Wonderbird loves beetles so much! Sometimes it also eats ants in a sloth's feather. Feed the sloths.

10149.NAME: White feathers
10149.DESCRIPTION: Among the feathers found, some were white. Wonderbird was also stressed. Get eagle feathers.

1015.NAME: Planks
1015.DESCRIPTION: Submit 3 planks - Paprick needs another table for gifts

10150.NAME: A sweet treat
10150.DESCRIPTION: The miracle bird arrived with a watermelon under its wing. No (delicious) horror cakes this time. Harvest watermelons.

10151.NAME: Straw eaters
10151.DESCRIPTION: Cockatoo rides on antelopes, Wonderbird chooses horses. Sell horses.

10152.NAME: Gaze up
10152.DESCRIPTION: Hang curtains, pretty curtains will distract from the sandy ground. Presents the silk.

10153.NAME: Chickens in tears
10153.DESCRIPTION: Hot pepper was the wrong choice. The poor chickens are being fried from the inside out. Harvest the fields of chili.

10154.NAME: Rare neighbors
10154.DESCRIPTION: The island is home to animals that are otherwise only seen underground. Feed the bats here, or in the underground cave.

10155.NAME: Berries on cake
10155.DESCRIPTION: The miracle bird will not be in debt, the bag of beetles is exchanged for a basket of bush berries. Harvest lemons or purple berries.

10156.NAME: Caught fish
10156.DESCRIPTION: What to do with the angelfish, sharks and jellyfish caught the day before? Put in aquariums, build small aquariums.

10157.NAME: Comfortable sitting
10157.DESCRIPTION: A hand does not rise to show the Wonderbird a place on a hard bench. Prepare the hanging seats.

10158.NAME: Fish for guest
10158.DESCRIPTION: If the game does not taste good, there will be a serving of shrimp in reserve. Fish in Lobsters or in the depths of Hammerheads.

10159.NAME: Eggplant palms
10159.DESCRIPTION: Eggplants are brought to the table, they are meant for you. The birds weren't sure what you would like, so go dig in the eggplant fields. Harvest the eggplants.

1016.NAME: Berries and mushrooms
1016.DESCRIPTION: Gather some berries or mushrooms, Paprick is very fond of them.

10160.NAME: Harvest aromas
10160.DESCRIPTION: A special treat! Those who can't make it will be late! Let's see if the trick worked, pick fragrant strawberries.

10161.NAME: Friend of bear cubs
10161.DESCRIPTION: The pups regularly play with the bird, treat them with honey, and ask about the cockatoo.

10162.NAME: Dried feathers
10162.DESCRIPTION: Wash and hang recovered feathers, build clotheslines.

10163.NAME: Second attempt
10163.DESCRIPTION: Chickens do not want to repeat the porridge experiment. Feed the ostriches and work on the recipe.

1017.NAME: Strawberries
1017.DESCRIPTION: Give Paprick some strawberries - he loves them.

1018.NAME: Harvest
1018.DESCRIPTION: Harvest 10 fields of any kind to honour the deities of rain, so that it would not rain on the day of Paprick's party.

1019.NAME: Paths
1019.DESCRIPTION: Buy and place some sand paths on your island - Paprick likes them.

102.NAME: Place 2 more plank sheds
102.DESCRIPTION: Buy and place two more plank sheds

1020.NAME: Ropes
1020.DESCRIPTION: Make some ropes, just in case.

1021.NAME: Congratulate Paprick
1021.DESCRIPTION: Visit Paprick and shake his hand (click on Paprick when on his island)

1022.NAME: Longest path
1022.DESCRIPTION: Place several sand paths on the map, so that there would be 40 sand paths on the island at the same time.

1023.NAME: Tree cutting
1023.DESCRIPTION: Any decent carpenter ought to know how to cut trees. Show Turrick how it's done by cutting 15 fully grown trees.

1024.NAME: Making planks
1024.DESCRIPTION: Show Turrick how to make planks. Make 30 planks

1025.NAME: Carpenter's nails
1025.DESCRIPTION: A real carpenter needs nails. Make and give Turrick 25 nails.

1026.NAME: Carpenter's screws
1026.DESCRIPTION: No carpenter can work without some screws. Show Turrick how to make them by producing screws 3 times

1027.NAME: Carpenter's stools
1027.DESCRIPTION: Every carpenter has to know how to make a simple stool. Show Turrick how it's done by making 10 stools of any kind.

10276.NAME: Palm tree
10276.DESCRIPTION: The ship was built from palm tree, crush the salvaged ship parts. Chop any type of palm.

1028.NAME: Carpenter's tables
1028.DESCRIPTION: A real carpenter can make a table. Show Turrick how you do it by making 10 tables of any kind.

1029.NAME: Reputation for the contest
1029.DESCRIPTION: Earn some reputation, so that the senior council would make you a member of Miss Oceania jury.

103.NAME: Complete 2 more plank sheds
103.DESCRIPTION: Complete 2 more plank sheds of any kind. Previously completed sheds are not taken into account

1030.NAME: Stage for the contest
1030.DESCRIPTION: What's a contest without a stage? Submit planks

1031.NAME: Curtain for stage
1031.DESCRIPTION: A beautiful curtain needs to be sewn for the stage. Submit 10 pieces of cloth

1032.NAME: Tables for the jury
1032.DESCRIPTION: The jury needs some tables. Make and sell 5 clay tables

1033.NAME: Stools for the jury
1033.DESCRIPTION: The judges need comfortable seats. Make and sell 10 painted stools

10331.NAME: Qualification
10331.DESCRIPTION: Don't rely on the rain, it's better to take your water bottle with you. Get a collection vase.

10332.NAME: Bronze Discipline I
10332.DESCRIPTION: There are 5 wells placed on the island, some are visible, others are hidden. Exhaust the wells.

10333.NAME: Bronze Discipline II
10333.DESCRIPTION: You must sell the big dogs. This time, tree cutting will be in the bronze questline, but a little later.

10334.NAME: Bronze Discipline III
10334.DESCRIPTION: Time to empty the piggy bank. Sow tomatoes in furrows, but do it by buying seeds from the store.

10335.NAME: Bronze Discipline IV
10335.DESCRIPTION:
Cut down fully grown tall palms.
Did you read the text on the sweet tree?

10336.NAME: Bronze Discipline V
10336.DESCRIPTION: Did you stock up on bones before selling the dogs? Make bone beads in the workshop.

10337.NAME: Bronze Discipline VI
10337.DESCRIPTION: Feed you hissing snakes. If you intend to use fodder, then one hisser  snake will be enough, if not, you will have to look for free places.

10338.NAME: Bronze Discipline VII
10338.DESCRIPTION: Of all the butterflies in the collection, only one cannot be found when reaping crops. Get giant speckled butterfly.

10339.NAME: Bronze Discipline VIII
10339.DESCRIPTION: Sow 60 fields of wheat. Giant speckled butterfly cannot be obtained in any Oceania packs.

1034.NAME: Flowers for the stage
1034.DESCRIPTION: The stage needs to be decorated with pretty flowers. Buy and sell yellow or red small flowers

10340.NAME: Bronze Discipline IX
10340.DESCRIPTION: Feed adult hedgehogs. You can see the time allocated for the competition by moving the cursor on the special barrel.

10341.NAME: Silver Discipline I
10341.DESCRIPTION: Peacocks are hidden somewhere on the island, find, feed and sell them. If you choose to sell your peacocks, it's your own fault.

10342.NAME: Silver Discipline II
10342.DESCRIPTION: You will need a lot, a lot, a LOT of boards and bones in this trophy race. Build gazebos.

10343.NAME: Silver Discipline III
10343.DESCRIPTION: Spend gold doubloons in any way you like. You will need to cut jungle later, but only the blue-purple kind.

10344.NAME: Silver Discipline IV
10344.DESCRIPTION: This mill is slightly different from the Atafu mill. Use a mill and grind flour.

10345.NAME: Silver Discipline V
10345.DESCRIPTION: Both pools on the island were almost complete. Keep 9 completed pools made of boards on the island at the same time.

10346.NAME: Silver Discipline VI
10346.DESCRIPTION: Sell your adult foxes. The time required for cultivation is almost the same as for the mill.

10347.NAME: Silver Discipline VII
10347.DESCRIPTION: The store has a specially prepared jungle of blue flowers. Cut down only the blue flower jungle, the others will not count.

10348.NAME: Silver Discipline VIII
10348.DESCRIPTION: Do you still remember how to get clay masses? Hand in 30 such rolled up clay balls.

10349.NAME: Silver Discipline IX
10349.DESCRIPTION: It is difficult to grow strawberries in Oceania, there are few berries, they spoil quickly, but how delicious! Harvest strawberry beds.

1035.NAME: Microphone for the contest
1035.DESCRIPTION: The participants need a microphone, otherwise the audience will not be able to her them speak.

10350.NAME: Golden Discipline I
10350.DESCRIPTION: We recommend that you choose this task as the highest priority. Make cuts in the lava blocks.

10351.NAME: Golden Discipline II
10351.DESCRIPTION: Get flax stalks. You will be able to move the huge stone ridge only after it is fully built.

10352.NAME: Golden Discipline III
10352.DESCRIPTION: Conducts construction of guest houses. This time, the winners of the cup will be those who read the texts (also about Peacocks).

10353.NAME: Golden Discipline IV
10353.DESCRIPTION: Make iron from large iron ore. There are two ways to go wrong in this work, be careful!

10354.NAME: Golden Discipline V
10354.DESCRIPTION: Have 170 christmas flower pots at the same time. Lack of space is a problem in every Cup competition.

10355.NAME: Golden Discipline VI
10355.DESCRIPTION: If you leave the island, you will definitely forget. Feed fully grown meerkats.

10356.NAME: Golden Discipline VII
10356.DESCRIPTION: A normal hive takes 20 hours to recover all 5 actions. Use bee hives. Will you wait or build?

10357.NAME: Golden Discipline VIII
10357.DESCRIPTION: When picking lava, you got coal, while flax will be useful for cloth. Make torches in the workshop.

10358.NAME: Golden Discipline IX
10358.DESCRIPTION: In the Shrubs section of the store, you will find special Ligo holiday bushes. Pick the grass, cut those bushes.

10359.NAME: Eggs for biscuit
10359.DESCRIPTION: If you fulfill Biscuit's personal requests, the butterfly will travel to your island. Get the eggs.

1036.NAME: Contest poster
1036.DESCRIPTION: Buy and give 4 parchments to the council. They need to make posters for the competition.

10360.NAME: Filling for biscuit
10360.DESCRIPTION: You will get 25 watermelon seeds from the previous task, 25 from the next task. Reap watermelon fields.

10361.NAME: Sweetness for a biscuit
10361.DESCRIPTION: Eggs, honey, watermelon and flour are Biscuit's classic holiday recipe. Cut down giant trees that hide honey.

10362.NAME: Race reminder
10362.DESCRIPTION: Completing one discipline completely will earn you one snow globe. Collect all three snow globes.

1037.NAME: Candy for the finalists
1037.DESCRIPTION: Buy and submit 50 candy as a gift to all finalists.

1038.NAME: Birdhouse
1038.DESCRIPTION: Turrick's favourite bird is the blackbird. Make and sell 15 birdhouses.

1039.NAME: Metal bars for Turrick
1039.DESCRIPTION: Turrick is building a barn. He has run out of metal bars. Give him 2 metal bars

104.NAME: The new flowers
104.DESCRIPTION: Buy and place 1 of the new flower decorations

1041.NAME: Chili for Turrick
1041.DESCRIPTION: Submit 50 units of chili - Turrick is making a huge cauldron of soup.

1044.NAME: Feed small animals
1044.DESCRIPTION: Feed grown-up meerkats, hens, roosters, rabbits, cats, ducks and toucans

1045.NAME: Reward
1045.DESCRIPTION: Tussy will host the contest and wants a reward of 3 bronze doubloons.

1046.NAME: Gazebo for the winner
1046.DESCRIPTION: The winner of Miss Oceania will receive a gazebo. Make and sell it to the council.

1047.NAME: Beads for the local girls
1047.DESCRIPTION: The most beautiful girls will be given pretty beads. Submit 12 bone beads

1048.NAME: Feed medium sized animals
1048.DESCRIPTION: Feed grown-up sheep, foxes, pigs, dogs and turtles

1049.NAME: Feed big animals
1049.DESCRIPTION: Feed grown-up cows, ostriches, goats, bears, antelopes and sloths

105.NAME: Place 7 new flowers
105.DESCRIPTION: Buy and place 7 more new flowers to create a pretty garden. Previously placed flowers are not taken into account

1050.NAME: Dig up the field
1050.DESCRIPTION: The locals believe that digging up the field on Easter will grant a good harvest. Dig up 25 fields

1051.NAME: Eggs with salt
1051.DESCRIPTION: The locals believe that one has to eat many eggs with salt on Easter and then one will be strong and healthy. Buy and submit salt

1052.NAME: Finish the swing
1052.DESCRIPTION: In your bag you will find a half-finished swing. Place it on the map and finish it.

1053.NAME: Swing III
1053.DESCRIPTION: In your bag you will find a half-finished third swing. Place it on the map and finish it.

1054.NAME: Swing II
1054.DESCRIPTION: In your bag you will find a half-finished second swing. Place it on the map and finish it.

1055.NAME: Colours for the eggs
1055.DESCRIPTION: A local saying: Eat many painted eggs and you will have a colourful year. Submit 4 pots of colour

1056.NAME: Easter harvest
1056.DESCRIPTION: On Easter one has to help one's friends. Help your friends to harvest their fields.

1057.NAME: Easter wine
1057.DESCRIPTION: On Easter, one has to make wine, so that one would get along with friends and neighbours for the rest of the year. Make 3 bottles of wine

1058.NAME: Look!
1058.DESCRIPTION: On Easter morning one has to look through a woolen cloth to see one's fortune. Submit 4 woolen cloths

1059.NAME: Flowers in pots
1059.DESCRIPTION: On Easter one has to plant pretty flowers - then sheep will give lots of wool. Make some flowers in clay pots

106.NAME: Get 5 eggs from hen
106.DESCRIPTION: Each time you feed a grown up hen, there's a chance that it will lay an egg. Get 5 eggs

1060.NAME: Chili for the cheeks
1060.DESCRIPTION: On Easter, the local girls have to eat at least 15 pieces of chili, so that their cheeks would be a pretty pink for the rest of the year. Harvest 15 chili fields

1061.NAME: Feed cows
1061.DESCRIPTION: Tycott likes cows. Feed cows or calves 20 times

1062.NAME: Out of screws
1062.DESCRIPTION: Tycott is in need of 10 screws. Give them to him

1063.NAME: Barrels for Tycott
1063.DESCRIPTION: Make and give Tycott some barrels. He wants to take part in rolling barrels down the hill.

1064.NAME: Food for Tycott
1064.DESCRIPTION: After rolling the barrels, Tycott will be very hungry. Get him 100 food units

1065.NAME: Corn for Tycott
1065.DESCRIPTION: Give Tycott 25 units of corn, he likes them very much.

1067.NAME: Sheep for Gycott
1067.DESCRIPTION: Sell Gycott 10 grown-up sheep. He wants to practice his shearing skills.

1068.NAME: Furrows for Mycott
1068.DESCRIPTION: Mycott is a true child of nature. Dig up 70 fields

1069.NAME: Palm-trees for Mycott
1069.DESCRIPTION: Plant 25 palm-trees of any kind that can be turned into wood. They will increase the air quality on your island.

107.NAME: Get 30 eggs
107.DESCRIPTION: Get 30 eggs from a hen and the natives will gladly buy them

1070.NAME: Fields of wheat
1070.DESCRIPTION: Mycott wants you to plant some wheat.

1071.NAME: Bean stew
1071.DESCRIPTION: Mycott thinks that bean stew is the best food there is. Make him some bean stew

1072.NAME: A colourful day
1072.DESCRIPTION: Make colour pots 4 times to make Mycott's day more colourful.

1073.NAME: Stone gardens for Mycott
1073.DESCRIPTION: Make some stone gardens for Mycott. The more flowers, the better.

1074.NAME: Wine for Mycott
1074.DESCRIPTION: Give Mycott 3 bottles of wine to make his day more joyful.

1075.NAME: Gaining reputation
1075.DESCRIPTION: Gain some reputation, and Mycott will give you the information.

1077.NAME: Pumpkin harvest
1077.DESCRIPTION: Show Gycott how to harvest pumpkins. Gather the pumpkins

1078.NAME: Water for Gycott
1078.DESCRIPTION: Gycott drinks lots of water. Give him 25 water units

1079.NAME: Paths for Gycott
1079.DESCRIPTION: Make and sell 8 stone paths, so that Gycott can put them in his yard.

10796.NAME: Haunting Festival
10796.DESCRIPTION: Papuans decided to decorate the basement of Festival Island. First, go to Festival Island.

10797.NAME: Haunted huts
10797.DESCRIPTION: The haunting starts right at the entrance. Decorate the first and third pavilions in a spooky mood.

10798.NAME: Ghost House
10798.DESCRIPTION: Turn the basement entrance into a real haunted house. Imrove look, then right click and select USE.

10799.NAME: Hell flames
10799.DESCRIPTION: Everyone who enters the house first lights their lamp using a torch in the corner of the room. Get hellfire.

108.NAME: Get 3 units of wool from sheep
108.DESCRIPTION: Each time you feed a grown-up sheep, there's a chance that it will give you wool. Get 3 units of wool

1080.NAME: Latrines
1080.DESCRIPTION: Build 3 latrines for Tycott. He admires their design.

10800.NAME: Turn on the light
10800.DESCRIPTION: Choose the most important torches and light them. Keep at least seven torches burning with blood flames.

10801.NAME: A hole in the ground
10801.DESCRIPTION: There is nowhere to hide in the room for Papuan actors dressed as mummies. Open the hatch.

10802.NAME: Building lamps
10802.DESCRIPTION: Papuans are hard at work on the spooky decorations. Take the freshly painted ghost lamps.

10803.NAME: Connect the lights
10803.DESCRIPTION: Please bring the lamps inside and hang them in totems. The lamps are intended for decorating the side corridor.

10804.NAME: Black ghosts
10804.DESCRIPTION: Little bats participate in the scare. Please take lunch to the black bats, feed them.

10805.NAME: Mechanical skeletons
10805.DESCRIPTION: Do not fear, skeletons are moved by strings from ceiling. Go dance with skeletons

10806.NAME: Bad idea
10806.DESCRIPTION: The stringed brooms tangle once again. Use spiders to untwist brooms and replace them with wax witches.

10807.NAME: Move spiders
10807.DESCRIPTION: While there are no guests, the spiders rest by sitting in the roses. Get spiders from roses without cobwebs.

10808.NAME: A hole in the pits
10808.DESCRIPTION: Unfortunately, the lava leaked out under the floorboards. Ask the goblins to sweep up and retrieve the ghostly liquid.

10809.NAME: Fill the holes
10809.DESCRIPTION: Chemists added a little fat for a better shine. Use ghost oil and fill the holes.

1081.NAME: Meerkats for the granddaughter
1081.DESCRIPTION: Buy and sell baby meerkats to Gycott. It will be a gift for his granddaughter.

10810.NAME: Volcano light
10810.DESCRIPTION: You will need more lava to decorate the house. Drain the pits and move the artificial lava elsewhere.

10811.NAME: Green dragons
10811.DESCRIPTION: The dragon's paws were placed at the kiwi. Turn the remaining bones into spooky seahorses.

10812.NAME: Dangerous toys
10812.DESCRIPTION: Walking armor is too heavy, cobwebs break. Remove the armor and place the painted sheets in these places.

10813.NAME: Lizard performance
10813.DESCRIPTION: Lizards practice landing. Have 9 lizards at the same time. If a lizard is missing, wait for tomorrow, the tree will return.

10814.NAME: Sugary bones
10814.DESCRIPTION: Papuans intend to fill their hands with candies, which will be a surprise for the little ones. Try it, pick the scary hands.

10815.NAME: Teddy bears
10815.DESCRIPTION: If someone happens to be completely confused, then persuade them to pet the funny bears. Feed the koalas.

10816.NAME: Peel off the skin
10816.DESCRIPTION: They are not monster eggs. Peel off the skin and arrange these green decorations. Work around kiwi fruit.

10817.NAME: Jumping goblins
10817.DESCRIPTION: There were goblins hiding in the bushes. Try scaring with goblins. Keep 50 goblins in the grass on the field at the same time.

10818.NAME: Friendly ghosts
10818.DESCRIPTION: Heading out towards the exit, the bats wave with their glowsticks. Have 18 white bats at the same time.

10819.NAME: Dark bat game
