10819.DESCRIPTION: Before going out, everyone who was brave enough to make it to the end will be able to try the bat attraction. Try it.

1082.NAME: Candy for the granddaughter
1082.DESCRIPTION: Give Gycott some candy. He will give them to his granddaughter.

10820.NAME: Lizards of tomorrow
10820.DESCRIPTION: Feed the chameleons. Remember, they will climb the tree again tomorrow, if you run out of these lizards, wait for tomorrow.

10821.NAME: Flaming decor
10821.DESCRIPTION: Scoop the shiny lava out of the pit and let the griffons shine. Decorate the griffons.

10822.NAME: Watering kiwi
10822.DESCRIPTION: Skinless kiwi monsters dry quickly, feed these monsters.

10823.NAME: Eye shadows
10823.DESCRIPTION: The break is over. Help the bats apply a layer of makeup. Hold 6 dark bat bushes at the same time.

10824.NAME: Hang the spiders
10824.DESCRIPTION: Reach out and help the spiders get back to work. Submit the spiders.

10825.NAME: Lava puddles
10825.DESCRIPTION: The goblins did not manage to collect all the spilled lava. Collect artificial lava in buckets, submit it.

10826.NAME: Renewal of the eruption
10826.DESCRIPTION: It will take a significant amount of artificial lava to move the volcano. Make the volcano glow.

10827.NAME: The secret visitor
10827.DESCRIPTION: Mischievous Anastasia is hiding in the pumpkin field, find her. When found, pet it.

10828.NAME: Horse spirits
10828.DESCRIPTION: Don't forget to wipe off the dust and wax from the haunted ghosts from time to time. Feed the seahorses.

10829.NAME: More light
10829.DESCRIPTION: Bring light to the haunted house, put bloody flames in all torches.

1083.NAME: Berries for Gycott's wife
1083.DESCRIPTION: Give Gycott some forest berries. His wife is very fond of them.

10830.NAME: Visible monsters
10830.DESCRIPTION: Jumping out of the bushes was too scary. Have all goblins at the same time. Ask the goblins to sit in a visible place.

10831.NAME: A lamp for courage
10831.DESCRIPTION: Encourage the children to go to the haunted house, give the most fearful children glowing pumpkins.

10832.NAME: The shiny floor
10832.DESCRIPTION: Wipe up all the oil while feeding the goblin. Keep 13 lava pools on the field at the same time.

10833.NAME: Lava lizards
10833.DESCRIPTION: Remember that lizards fall from trees. Hold 8 lizards at the same time and smear them with artificial lava.

10834.NAME: Dim the light
10834.DESCRIPTION: A proper haunted house should be gloomy. Anastasia took out the glowsticks from the totems. Submit them.

10835.NAME: Charging
10835.DESCRIPTION: Don't forget to water the kiwi monsters from time to time.

10836.NAME: Horse dance
10836.DESCRIPTION: The spiders were bored, so they tied strings to the seahorses. Feed the seahorses.

10837.NAME: Compromise
10837.DESCRIPTION: You want more light, Anastasia wants less. UPGRADES ghostly stones and lamp totems with right click.

1084.NAME: Tomatoes for Gycott
1084.DESCRIPTION: Give Gycott 30 tomatoes - he is going to make tomato soup for his family.

1085.NAME: Cave on treasure island
1085.DESCRIPTION: Visit the cave on the treasure island

1086.NAME: Path
1086.DESCRIPTION: Clear out a path to the cave by searching the clusters, and enter the cave.

1087.NAME: Finding doubloons
1087.DESCRIPTION: Unlock the treasure cave with the ancient key and search for doubloons.

1088.NAME: Abandoned bags
1088.DESCRIPTION: Search the island for abandoned traveller's bags

1089.NAME: Strawberry lip balm
1089.DESCRIPTION: Did you know that one can make a wonderful lip balm out of strawberries? Give strawberries to the beauty course participants

109.NAME: Get 20 units of wool
109.DESCRIPTION: Get 20 units of wool from sheep and the natives will gladly buy them

1090.NAME: Coal for eye-liners
1090.DESCRIPTION: Coal can be used to make eye-liners. Give coal to the beauty course participants

1091.NAME: Blueberry mask
1091.DESCRIPTION: In order to make the facial mask, some blueberries are needed. They will nourish and soften the skin. Submit 15 blueberries

1092.NAME: Milk for the mask
1092.DESCRIPTION: Milk is one of the ingredients for the facial mask. It will moisturise the skin. Submit some milk

10927.NAME: Finish building well
10927.DESCRIPTION: When you finish this task here are some goodies to keep you going.

10928.NAME: Finish your last task
10928.DESCRIPTION: Thank you for keeping up with us. When you will reach 160 reputation goal for badge you will get few rewards to keep going.

10929.NAME: Finish your last task
10929.DESCRIPTION: Here are some extra rewards. PS. Please rate us with some 5 stars, if you do like our game. :)

1093.NAME: Grapes for the mask
1093.DESCRIPTION: Grapes are one of the ingredients for the facial mask. They will make the skin glowing. Submit grapes

1095.NAME: Repair the mine
1095.DESCRIPTION: Repair the newly discovered gem mine

1097.NAME: Blow up the pile of rocks
1097.DESCRIPTION: Everything is prepared for the explosion. Click on the pile of rocks and see what happens.

1098.NAME: Use the raft
1098.DESCRIPTION: Find the raft on the shore of the island to open the map. Then, select your home island as your destination.

10986.NAME: Entry fee
10986.DESCRIPTION: During these winter tasks, we have decided to scare you with short stories in which you should be able to feel a dose of dark humor.

10987.NAME: Guests have arrived
10987.DESCRIPTION: Feed the guests as needed. Stories are told better with full bellies. Serve 100 food.

1099.NAME: Finish  the 1st stage of the castle
1099.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the first stage of the castle.

11.NAME: Complete workshop
11.DESCRIPTION: Find the needed resources in the bushes and scattered stones, and complete building the workshop.

110.NAME: Get 1 unit of milk from cows
110.DESCRIPTION: Each time you feed grown-up cow, there's a chance it will give you milk

1100.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1100.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the castle with some decorative blocks.

1101.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1101.DESCRIPTION: Finish building this stage of the castle

1102.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1102.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the castle with the gate mechanism

1103.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1103.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 3rd stage of the castle

1104.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1104.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the castle with the stairs

1105.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1105.DESCRIPTION: Finish the 4th stage of the castle

1106.NAME: Sea stars for Turrick
1106.DESCRIPTION: Buy and sell any kind of sea stars to Turrick.

1107.NAME: Paths for Turrick
1107.DESCRIPTION: Build and sell plank paths to Turrick.

1108.NAME: Barrels for Turrick
1108.DESCRIPTION: Make and sell barrels to Turrick.

1109.NAME: Wooden signs for Turrick
1109.DESCRIPTION: The sea garden will need some signs. Build and sell wooden signs to Turrick.

111.NAME: Get 10 milk bottles
111.DESCRIPTION: Get 10 milk bottles from cows or coconuts and the natives will gladly buy them

1110.NAME: Steering wheels for Turrick
1110.DESCRIPTION: Buy and sell ship wheels to Turrick. They will fit in his new garden.

1111.NAME: Tomatoes for Turrick
1111.DESCRIPTION: Harvest some tomato fields. Turrick needs ingredients for tomato soup.

1112.NAME: Beans for Turrick
1112.DESCRIPTION: The engineer wants to treat himself to some beans. Give him 100 beans

1113.NAME: Wine for Jarno
1113.DESCRIPTION: Jarno's grandfather wants you to give him 5 bottles of wine

11135.NAME: Food for Penguin I
11135.DESCRIPTION: The penguin will need additional food. Sell 3 Twig sheds for food.

11136.NAME: Food for Penguin II
11136.DESCRIPTION: Also bring some litter for the new animal. Sell 6 Hay stacks.

1114.NAME: Pigs for the engineer's herd
1114.DESCRIPTION: Sell 40 grown-up pigs to the engineer. He wants to add them to his herd.

1115.NAME: Totem masks
1115.DESCRIPTION: Build and sell totem masks to Helen. She believes that they scare away undesired guests.

1116.NAME: Coal for Helen
1116.DESCRIPTION: Helen and her friends have learned to make Sissy's black eye-liners. They need some coal. Submit coal

1117.NAME: Hens for Helen
1117.DESCRIPTION: Sell hens. They will live in Helen's famous bird garden.

1118.NAME: Ropes for Helen
1118.DESCRIPTION: Give Helen a sufficient amount of ropes

112.NAME: Plank supply order
112.DESCRIPTION: Craft 20 planks for the natives. By doing this, you will lose 20 planks and receive a reward

1120.NAME: Fix the mine
1120.DESCRIPTION: Fix the newly discovered gem mine

1121.NAME: Cut the jungle
1121.DESCRIPTION: Cut 10 jungle fields and create more space for yourself.

11211.NAME: New Year's festival
11211.DESCRIPTION: So that the neighbors don't knock on the radiators, go to the Festival Island and make as much noise as you can!

11212.NAME: Observant Tiliki
11212.DESCRIPTION: Is there a party going on here? Tiliki came uninvited. Buy, breed and sell Tilikis on Festival island.

11213.NAME: New Year's Fortress
11213.DESCRIPTION: Tiliki is always welcome even without an invitation, but there are others... Buy ice castle foundations to prevent the gathering.

11214.NAME: Playing around
11214.DESCRIPTION: Have fun blowing soap bubbles while you wait for your guests. Wait for bubbles and catch them.

11215.NAME: Guests and gifts
11215.DESCRIPTION: The guests did not come empty-handed, they came with decorations. Get any components of New Year's collection.

11216.NAME: The glow
11216.DESCRIPTION: Exchange New Year's items for glitter, you will need that to decorate the castle. Take a look at the collections.

11217.NAME: Build a fortress
11217.DESCRIPTION: Together, during the party, build the greatest ice structure ever.

11218.NAME: Dancing away
11218.DESCRIPTION: Move your red legs! Keep 10 red bugs on the island at the same time. Take a look at the store.

11219.NAME: Musical taste
11219.DESCRIPTION: Provide some music for dancing. Keep 10 singing boxes on the island at the same time.

1122.NAME: Searching for prickles
1122.DESCRIPTION: Clear out the last part of the island from thorny bushes.

11220.NAME: Disco ball
11220.DESCRIPTION: Spin the bright star and provide light effects. Keep 10 elegant starfish on the island at the same time.

1123.NAME: Pieces of iron
1123.DESCRIPTION: Get some pieces of iron in the gem mine

1124.NAME: Pieces of copper
1124.DESCRIPTION: Get some pieces of copper in the gem mine

1125.NAME: Buy golden chains
1125.DESCRIPTION: Buy golden chains in the shop section SPECIAL

1126.NAME: Gems
1126.DESCRIPTION: Obtain some gems from the gem mine

1127.NAME: Iron out of pieces
1127.DESCRIPTION: Make iron out of the pieces of iron

1128.NAME: Copper out of pieces
1128.DESCRIPTION: Make copper out of the pieces of copper

113.NAME: Straw bundle order
113.DESCRIPTION: Craft 5 straw bundles for the natives

1132.NAME: Sell beads
1132.DESCRIPTION: Make bone beads and sell bone beads from bag.

1133.NAME: Candy for Helen
1133.DESCRIPTION: Give Helen some candy. She has a sweet tooth.

1134.NAME: Necklace for Helen
1134.DESCRIPTION: Helen has found out that you make pretty necklaces. Craft  a jasper necklace for her.

1135.NAME: Paper for the letter
1135.DESCRIPTION: Buy and give parchment to Paprick. He will write a long and exhaustive letter to the architect.

1136.NAME: Coal for the letter
1136.DESCRIPTION: Give Paprick some coal so that he can write the letter.

1137.NAME: Paint for the drawing of the castle
1137.DESCRIPTION: Paprick has gotten so carried away that he's asking for some paint. He will draw his dream castle in hope that the architect can design it.

1138.NAME: Clay delivery
1138.DESCRIPTION: Send the architect some clay. He will try to build a reproduction of the clay colossus.

1139.NAME: Milk delivery
1139.DESCRIPTION: Send the architect some milk. His wife makes wonderful cheese.

114.NAME: Bone bead order
114.DESCRIPTION: Craft 3 bone beads for the natives

1140.NAME: Shell delivery
1140.DESCRIPTION: Send the architect some shells as a reward for the plan.

1141.NAME: Sheds for Helen
1141.DESCRIPTION: Build 3 modern sheds of any kind for Helen

1142.NAME: Fence for Helen
1142.DESCRIPTION: Build and sell 10 painted fences to Helen. She likes them and wants to decorate her park with them.

1143.NAME: Prezels for the party
1143.DESCRIPTION: Make and give Helen 4 pretzels for her annual pretzel party.

11431.NAME: Boiled clues
11431.DESCRIPTION: While traveling with raft you come upon a boiled fish trail. Follow it to Festival island.

11432.NAME: Upgrade mermaid
11432.DESCRIPTION: Festival island looks fine. Talk to mermaid and UPGRADE her. Perhaps she knows more.

11433.NAME: Visit steam island
11433.DESCRIPTION: According to mermaid, there was a loud bang last night on another island. Travel togeather by using the rocket.

11434.NAME: Collect fishes
11434.DESCRIPTION: Shore water so hot, that fish jump out.  Walk around and pick up the poor things.

11435.NAME: Boil the fish
11435.DESCRIPTION: Sad, but fish can't be saved, but there is a chance for plants. Boil your collected fishes.

11436.NAME: Sizzeled plants
11436.DESCRIPTION: Enough moisture, but excessive heat. Feed the poor plants with brew you just made.

11437.NAME: Boiled ocean
11437.DESCRIPTION: Sea watwer is not drinkable. Try a spoonful, tastes like soup. Collect fishes.

11438.NAME: Be practical
11438.DESCRIPTION: Put 90 fishes in the cauldron. Make some nurishment for harmed plants.

11439.NAME: Heal plants
11439.DESCRIPTION: Use the nurishment to revive this island. Yellow jungle is not walkable. Look for rose paths.

1144.NAME: Make a bundle of keys
1144.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop section SPECIAL and make a bundle of keys

11440.NAME: Sprouts
11440.DESCRIPTION: From yellow flowers you gain special branches. The berries still hold bird songs inside them. Get these branches.

11441.NAME: Twig symphony
11441.DESCRIPTION: Pluck off the berries and soon you have a small orchestra. Collect more singing branches.

11442.NAME: Use laboratory
11442.DESCRIPTION: Put the song berry jam on  pancake, it turned into vinyl birdsong discs. Use the lab.

11443.NAME: Collect branches
11443.DESCRIPTION: The stumps are hot and very soft, you don't even need an ax here, a kitchen knife will suffice. Carve olive tree trunks.

11444.NAME: Olive braids
11444.DESCRIPTION: Melting metal plates will take time that you don't have. The resulting branches are used to weave bark fragments.

11445.NAME: Repair the basement
11445.DESCRIPTION: To stop the flood, you will need both bark patches and a plug. The wave threw plug into wine fountain.

11446.NAME: Use fountain
11446.DESCRIPTION: Remember, the fountain only gives you one bottle of wine per day, and you will need several if you want to complete all the quests on the island.

11447.NAME: Rubber tree sap
11447.DESCRIPTION: Aha! When you sniff the stems, it tastes like tea with a hint of eucalyptus. Extract sap from rubber tree stumps.

11448.NAME: The jolly island
11448.DESCRIPTION: Music will not be able to melt the ice, but there is someone who can. Play records of bird trills using a gramophone.

11449.NAME: Build an aquarium
11449.DESCRIPTION: The hot water is no longer running, the fish are finally at peace. Build an aquarium for survivor.

1145.NAME: Help friends to obtain clay
1145.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends to obtain clay from the clay pit

11450.NAME: Fix the vase
11450.DESCRIPTION: Finaly the vase is pressurized. Clean it and UPGRADE it.

11451.NAME: Vitalizing water
11451.DESCRIPTION: The heat has dissolved the minerals deep in the earth. Someone will definitely like this water. Get the special water.

11452.NAME: Hot blooded
11452.DESCRIPTION: Encouraged by the smell of tea and the heat, the Vulkan god has arrived on the island. Perhaps the guest will be able to solve the problem of frost.

11453.NAME: Melting icicles
11453.DESCRIPTION: The special coals from the depths of the volcano are stronger than the Squid the shaman spells. Thaw icicles.

11454.NAME: Revive the flowers
11454.DESCRIPTION: Uses vitalizing water to revive flowers encased in ice. Allowing the island to bloom again.

11455.NAME: Revive the tree
11455.DESCRIPTION: Press UPGRADE and revive the burnt tree. Hopefully there is still life to be found under the charred crust.

11456.NAME: Heals the tree
11456.DESCRIPTION: After cleaning the soot, the tree looks in good condition. Keep moving to make the tree bloom.

11457.NAME: Bird songs
11457.DESCRIPTION: Introduce the tree-dwelling bird to pancakes made with melody jam. You can also reuse the gramophone. Use up music discs.

11458.NAME: 225 Roses
11458.DESCRIPTION: If you can revive 225 red roses, you will receive a decoration created by the Volcano-God.

11459.NAME: 375 roses
11459.DESCRIPTION: Head in roses, you forgot about your guest. Meanwhile  Volcano-God made another sign.

1146.NAME: Help friends to obtain stone
1146.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends to obtain stones from the stone pit

11460.NAME: Wine for a volcano
11460.DESCRIPTION: The Volcano-God has prepared several gifts for you, do you have something to give to the  Volcano-God ? Serve the wine.

11463.NAME: Delicious bait
11463.DESCRIPTION: Tempt a heat lover with a delicious meal. Put on the table special delicacies that can be obtained on this island, this guest will appreciate them.

1147.NAME: Make decorative blocks
1147.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop section MATERIALS and make decorative blocks

1148.NAME: Water for the potter
1148.DESCRIPTION: The potter needs a great amount of water in his work. Submit water

1149.NAME: Wood for a new potter's wheel
1149.DESCRIPTION: Give the potter some wood. He wants to make new potter's wheels.

115.NAME: Onion supplies
115.DESCRIPTION: Grow 40 black onions for the natives

1150.NAME: For Paprick's gourmand night
1150.DESCRIPTION: Harvest chili fields for spicy food lovers

1151.NAME: Melons for the gourmand night
1151.DESCRIPTION: Harvest a sufficient amount of melon fields for all guests who love sweets.

1152.NAME: Wheat for the gourmand night
1152.DESCRIPTION: Harvest wheat fields. Bread will be baked for the gourmand night.

1153.NAME: Onions for the gourmand night
1153.DESCRIPTION: Harvest onions for those who love onion soup.

1154.NAME: Truffles for the gourmand night
1154.DESCRIPTION: No gourmand night can be successful without a royal delicacy. Harvest truffle fields

11547.NAME: Remove thorn bushes
11547.DESCRIPTION: Just as thorns harm your hand so do flames. In spirit of flames remove thorn bushes.

11548.NAME: Craft spicy soup
11548.DESCRIPTION: The boiling usually starts from the inside. Craft Spicy soup.

11549.NAME: Build troughs
11549.DESCRIPTION: To offset the chill, let your animals drink hot tea from troughs. Build troughs.

1155.NAME: Wine barrels for the gourmand night
1155.DESCRIPTION: Make and sell wine barrels. The gourmands will want something to drink.

11550.NAME: Feed foxes
11550.DESCRIPTION: These cunning animals know where to get flint rocks to start fire. Feed foxes.

11551.NAME: Give necklaces
11551.DESCRIPTION: Hand in bone bead necklaces for the burning heart ritual. If it works, it will be cheap price to pay.

11552.NAME: Sell fields
11552.DESCRIPTION: By looking for flint rock you dug up a lot of plots. Sell dug up fields before you bury yourself completely.

11553.NAME: Many rabbits
11553.DESCRIPTION: You will need many participants for the ritual. Simultaneously have 150 rabbits. Not by batches, but all at once.

11554.NAME: Sell fences
11554.DESCRIPTION: Sell 16 long plank fences or toilets. You will need to repurpose these planks for the grand fire.

11555.NAME: Collect forest goods
11555.DESCRIPTION: A ritual will include a feast. Collect forest berries or mushrooms, so you can hand them out to participants.

11556.NAME: Removing swamp
11556.DESCRIPTION: To get to the core of this problem you will need to dig deep. Remove swamp tiles.

11557.NAME: Build pits
11557.DESCRIPTION: Dig even deeper. Finish building all clay pits. All four pits are scattered across this map.

11558.NAME: Sell piglets
11558.DESCRIPTION: Piglets remind you: "You can move some objects even without walking up to them." Sell smarty pansy piglets.

11559.NAME: Harvest pumpkins
11559.DESCRIPTION: Deep, deep under volcano you plant pumpkins, so that their vines can crack the rock. Harvest pumpkins.

1156.NAME: Making tiles
1156.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop section MATERIALS and make tiles 4 times

11560.NAME: Give paint buckets
11560.DESCRIPTION: Don't do this at home. Some paints are flammable. Fill the  cracks with paint. Hand in Paint buckets.

11561.NAME: Feed cats
11561.DESCRIPTION: You will need a guide so deep down, someone that sees in dark better than you. Feed fully grown cats.

11562.NAME: Use well
11562.DESCRIPTION: Someone has dug a well at the top corner of the map. Find the well and use it. You can also use mysterious cave.

11563.NAME: Repurpose ships
11563.DESCRIPTION: You will need shelter from cold. Convert the shipwrecks to foreign houses and visit them.

11564.NAME: Swing your axe
11564.DESCRIPTION: For a good kindle you will need special kind of wood. Chop  any trees on the island. Keep in mind, jungle is not wood.

11565.NAME: Chop jungle
11565.DESCRIPTION: You will need a bundle of jungle leaves. Chop any jungle tile.

11566.NAME: Sell trees
11566.DESCRIPTION: Sell Mango, Pitaya or Pandanus trees. Trim the leaves of rare trees.

11567.NAME: Go fishing
11567.DESCRIPTION: You will also need lots of electric eels. Use any fishing spots on the island.

11568.NAME: Have 4 ponds
11568.DESCRIPTION: Have 4 finished ponds at the same time to store the eels for later usage. Remember you can move buildings around.

11569.NAME: Collect grapes
11569.DESCRIPTION: Collect grape clusters. Remember to take into account yield of a single tile. Amounts can be confusing.

1157.NAME: Screws for Tycott
1157.DESCRIPTION: Tycott needs some screws. Make and give him some screws

11570.NAME: Sell elephants
11570.DESCRIPTION: The prepared leaf packages will make your elephants grow larger than usual. Sell fully grown elephants.

11571.NAME: Feed sheep
11571.DESCRIPTION: Surround the volcano with warmest animals you have and press from all sides. Feed fully grown sheep.

11572.NAME: Give flowers
11572.DESCRIPTION: You will need to place some desert flowers atop the mountain. Hand in cactus flowers.

11573.NAME: Build wax figurines
11573.DESCRIPTION: Once the animals squeeze out some lava, you will need to feed wax to the mountain. Build wax figurines.

11574.NAME: Pelican's message
11574.DESCRIPTION: Palko the pelican brings you news. Meet him at Festival island, go there.

11575.NAME: Fast travel
11575.DESCRIPTION: All preparations are done! The rocket is prepared, you can find it inside the shop. Quickly place the rocket.

11576.NAME: Volcanic emergency
11576.DESCRIPTION: The Pelican fly's ahead. Don't dally, climb into the rocket and follow him. Select USE on the rocket.

11577.NAME: First mountain
11577.DESCRIPTION: Finish any of three quest lines and jump-start any volcano. Do it and you will earn reputation.

11578.NAME: Second mountain
11578.DESCRIPTION: For igniting two mountains you will gain Palko the pelican as a reward, plus some more reputation.

11579.NAME: Third mountain
11579.DESCRIPTION: Only if you do all quests can you light up all three volcanos. This task will net you even more reputation.

1158.NAME: Weird wood cutting
1158.DESCRIPTION: Tycott says that you cut tress in a weird fashion. Teach him your method by cutting any fully grown trees.

1159.NAME: Tycott doesn't understand
1159.DESCRIPTION: Why don't snowdrops bloom all year long? - Tycott sighed. Buy and give Tycott snowdrops (by selling them)

1160.NAME: Five chains
1160.DESCRIPTION: Tycott needs five golden chains for his outfit. Buy and give them to Tycott

1161.NAME: Not enough furrows
1161.DESCRIPTION: Tycott thinks that you don't have enough furrows. Dig a sufficient amount of furrows

1162.NAME: A warm cloak
1162.DESCRIPTION: Tycott is often cold. Even when it's hot. Give him some fabric so that his wife can sew a warm cloak.

1163.NAME: Ants for the terrarium
1163.DESCRIPTION: Tycott will make an ant terrarium. Give him ants (you can also get them from grown-up sloths)

1164.NAME: A key for Tycott
1164.DESCRIPTION: Give Tycott an ancient key. He wants to try and find a golden doublon.

1165.NAME: Lawn for the picnic
1165.DESCRIPTION: Buy and sell lawn to Tycott. He wants to organise a picnic.

1170.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1170.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the castle by submitting truffles

1171.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1171.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 5th stage of the castle

1173.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1173.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 6th stage of the castle

1174.NAME: Ore for the potter
1174.DESCRIPTION: Obtain iron or copper ore in the metal mine

11748.NAME: Boil the eggs
11748.DESCRIPTION: Eggs of ostriches, magpies and crabs are buried. Boil your breakfast eggs before the bunny has time to bury them too.

11749.NAME: Feed the hedgehogs
11749.DESCRIPTION: The wild egg must have been decorated with mushrooms and wild berries. Feed hedgehogs and their babies.

1175.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1175.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the castle by submitting the new floor

11750.NAME: Feed the kiwi birds
11750.DESCRIPTION: Kiwi birds are very diligent in examining Easter eggs. Find the hidden kiwi birds, feed them and ask about their appearance.

11751.NAME: Larch branches
11751.DESCRIPTION: Juniper, pine and fir. Forest eggs are woven from conifer branches. Cut the prickly thorn bushes.

11752.NAME: Greenhouse bird
11752.DESCRIPTION: This bird is used to the heat, but the air is gradually becoming stuffy. Feed and release the trapped bird.

11753.NAME: The giant peacock
11753.DESCRIPTION: It is not clear how such a large bird could fit into such a small egg. Fresh air stimulates the appetite. Feed the cloaking phoenix.

11754.NAME: Feed the phoenix
11754.DESCRIPTION: The luxurious bird, well fed, bursts into flames. A chick appears in his place. Feed the baby phoenix.

11755.NAME: Overboiled egg
11755.DESCRIPTION: Be careful with shovel, if you break the boiling egg while digging, there will be an eruption. Find the dangerous eggs.

11756.NAME: Pearl eruption
11756.DESCRIPTION: Egg is ruined. The underworld spits out the ingredients of the egg. Pick up hot shards.

11757.NAME: Resinous stones
11757.DESCRIPTION: The bubbling has subsided, hard but gummy stones are left. Break and grind resinous stones.

11758.NAME: A tangle of threads
11758.DESCRIPTION: Summon the best weaver in Oceania. Feed the spider Poko and untangle the tangles of the web.

11759.NAME: Wool threads
11759.DESCRIPTION: The fabric egg is knitted in layers. The bottom layer has a stiff wool fabric. Feed the lambs and sheep, get ready for the weaving.

1176.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1176.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 7th stage of the castle

11760.NAME: Fine frame
11760.DESCRIPTION: Poko likes to work with familiar materials. Dig furrows and cut the hardy and flexible camel's thorns.

11761.NAME: Yellow sprouts
11761.DESCRIPTION: An old dead baobab stump was found. It will take a lot of sprouts to revive it. Pick yellow tropical palms.

11762.NAME: Green sprouts
11762.DESCRIPTION: The stem will be grafted with fast-growing branches of palms. Buy from the store, plant and harvest green tropical palm trees.

11763.NAME: Purple sprouts
11763.DESCRIPTION: The youthful power of the palms will be able to breathe the life into the baobab. Shop, plant and harvest purple tropical palms.

11764.NAME: Egg shards
11764.DESCRIPTION: Damaged areas can be patched with dyed egg shards. Feed the chickens so that the rabbits have enough to paint.

11765.NAME: Easter painters
11765.DESCRIPTION: Bunnies know which colors and brushes are right. Find where bunnies have buried themselves. Find the funny bunnies.

11766.NAME: Swings
11766.DESCRIPTION: Before getting down to tinting the egg shards, the bunny wants to fix the swing. Help the bunny with this holiday chore.

11767.NAME: Moss and lichens
11767.DESCRIPTION: To create a forest egg, you will need a piece of green forest plants. Make lichen balls in the workshop.

11768.NAME: Buy a rose bush
11768.DESCRIPTION: The bunny has chosen the white rose bush as a base for the forest egg. Buy a rose bush and plant it in the furrow.

11769.NAME: Cutting roses
11769.DESCRIPTION: Watering white roses with colored water can produce roses of any color. Cut the bush and create a forest egg.

1177.NAME: Baby antelopes
1177.DESCRIPTION: Buy 4 baby antelopes in the shop

11770.NAME: Glass incubator
11770.DESCRIPTION: Find the masked Phoenix in the shop and place the other imprisoned bird on your board if you haven't already.

11771.NAME: The hatching of the phoenix
11771.DESCRIPTION: Help hatch glass eggs, feed trapped birds several times.

11772.NAME: Baby care
11772.DESCRIPTION: A few feeds and the phoenix bursts into flames again. This bird lives trough eternal spring. Feed the little phoenix chicks.

11773.NAME: Pearl mosaic
11773.DESCRIPTION: Fragments glued to dry are spread all around the grass. Find a pearl mosaic in the store and place it on island.

11774.NAME: Build a pearl egg
11774.DESCRIPTION: The resinous pieces form an amber-like layer after hardening. Restore the pearl egg, build it.

11775.NAME: The earth is bubbling
11775.DESCRIPTION: Ground starts to shrivel underfoot, how many eggs did the bunny bury? Find the new eruptions and collect the resinous parts.

11776.NAME: Fabric egg
11776.DESCRIPTION: The weaving is in full swing until the spider runs out of straw. Prepare some fresh straw bales.

11777.NAME: Fabric miracle
11777.DESCRIPTION: The stock of prepared braids resembles a huge pillow. Buy a fabric miracle from the store and place it.

11778.NAME: Fabric Faberge
11778.DESCRIPTION: The flattened fabric mock-up is gradually stretched upwards to obtain a pleasant oval shape. Build fabric Faberge.

11779.NAME: Place the roots
11779.DESCRIPTION: Lift wisely, heavy. Find baobab roots in the store and place them on the island.

1178.NAME: Feed the antelopes
1178.DESCRIPTION: With Yuyu's help, practice feeding antelopes.

11780.NAME: Improve roots
11780.DESCRIPTION: Ring the first spring alarm clock, graft the first branches on the huge stump. Click UPGRADE on the baobab roots.

11781.NAME: Working with a chisel
11781.DESCRIPTION: Graft one side, then the other, forming an oval tree in the process of growth. Carve a luxurious wooden egg from baobab.

11782.NAME: Place the egg
11782.DESCRIPTION: Almost all parts for repair are painted. Find a metal egg in the store and place it on the island.

11783.NAME: Bunnies at swing
11783.DESCRIPTION: The bunny is fascinated by swinging the chickens, feed the bunnies and remind them about the painting jobs.

11784.NAME: Build an egg
11784.DESCRIPTION: The bunny will hold the shells, you will paint and glue. As a result, decorations have some bunny paw prints. Restore the metal egg.

11785.NAME: Visit the island
11785.DESCRIPTION: The bunny doesn't remember where he buried the eggs, he dug through the whole island, but nothing. Go help the bunny, travel.

11786.NAME: Difficult to move
11786.DESCRIPTION: Move the bunny decoration to a freer patch of land. Make sure the patch is big enough to land successfully.

11787.NAME: Jump like a bunny
11787.DESCRIPTION: Visit the island a few more times. For example, move the totem to the raft, or to the mill, and press USE on the bunny.

11788.NAME: Egg ingredients
11788.DESCRIPTION: Bunny won't have a headache over painted eggs, the chickens will lay more of them. Complete Faberge Egg Preparation tasks.

11789.NAME: Treasure eggs
11789.DESCRIPTION: The bunny had hidden richly decorated treasure eggs. Build new Faberge eggs for the bunny, complete all Faberge tasks.

1179.NAME: Feeding foxes
1179.DESCRIPTION: Yuyu is interesting in feeding foxes. Feed grown-up and baby foxes.

11790.NAME: An accidental find
11790.DESCRIPTION: The golden hen can be found in all sorts of places. Find some golden chickens.

11791.NAME: Easter chickens
11791.DESCRIPTION: When you find golden chickens, exchange them in the store of the event island for Easter ones and get the benefits they give.

118.NAME: Brown goats
118.DESCRIPTION: Grow and sell 20 brown goats, and you will get the ironwood shaft for the shovel

1180.NAME: Glass for Yuyu
1180.DESCRIPTION: Buy and give him glass. He wants to investigate this see-through material.

1181.NAME: Obtaining eggs
1181.DESCRIPTION: Yuyu wants to see how you get eggs. Show him by feeding hens or ostriches.

1182.NAME: Machetes for Yuyu
1182.DESCRIPTION: Give Yuyu some machetes. He will explore the jungle to find out if there are any antelopes.

1183.NAME: Weathercocks for Yuyu
1183.DESCRIPTION: Make and sell weathercocks to Yuyu

1184.NAME: Clay pots for Yuyu
1184.DESCRIPTION: Give Yuyu clay pots. They will come in handy in watering antelopes.

1185.NAME: Look from afar
1185.DESCRIPTION: Look at castle from Paprick's island.

1186.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1186.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 8th stage of the castle.

1187.NAME: Strawberry harvest
1187.DESCRIPTION: Paprick's ice box has broken down. It contained the whole strawberry harvest from last year. Help him get it back by harvesting strawberries on his island.

1188.NAME: Flowers for Paprick
1188.DESCRIPTION: The hot sun has burned down all Paprick's flowers. Buy and sell him orange flowers

11888.NAME: Wake up the beasts
11888.DESCRIPTION: Not only the bears and rabbits have fallen asleep, but also the sheep and the dogs who counted them. Feed any beasts.

11889.NAME: Lava eruption
11889.DESCRIPTION: Red rocks have buried local paths. Eliminate hot ore piles.

1189.NAME: Mangers for Paprick
1189.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is sad because all his mangers are old and cracked, and all water is pouring out. Make and sell him some new mangers

11890.NAME: Stumbling along
11890.DESCRIPTION: It is possible to recover some blocks from the ore, which were used in the construction of this island. Fixes some broken paths.

11891.NAME: The Boiling Watchdog
11891.DESCRIPTION: This guardian of the island is not afraid of heat. A lava dog sits in one of the pitch pits and warms up. Find some watchdogs.

11892.NAME: Save the fire
11892.DESCRIPTION: The magic stones still emit heat. Try to make something useful out of them. Start construction of the furnace.

11893.NAME: Build a furnace
11893.DESCRIPTION: The stones obtained from the hot ore hold together well, so the furnaces are built directly from them. Complete the construction of the furnace.

11894.NAME: Hardening of stones
11894.DESCRIPTION: When the furnace is ready, you can start hardening the stones. Uses the furnace to turn magical stones into durable picks.

11895.NAME: Shaking the snow
11895.DESCRIPTION: So high in the treetops, the heat from the ground cannot reach the snow. Shake snow from palm trees.

11896.NAME: Refrigerator
11896.DESCRIPTION: Stores all snow for later use. Find the snow storage cave and start filling it with snow.

11897.NAME: Ice mine
11897.DESCRIPTION: Finish filling the snow warehouse. You will be able to freeze ice cubes in the ready-made ice mines.

11898.NAME: Release the flowers
11898.DESCRIPTION: Smash the golden vases, let the flowers hit the ground and re-sprout their roots.

11899.NAME: Adjust the climate
11899.DESCRIPTION: Use snow from the tops of trees or a pond, so that the flowers understand - now it is early spring. Comb the lawn.

119.NAME: Eggs for the festival
119.DESCRIPTION: Get 30 eggs for the festival (from hens or ostriches)

1190.NAME: Paprick's wood supply
1190.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is almost out of wood. Help him obtain some by cutting trees

11900.NAME: Snowdrops
11900.DESCRIPTION: However, the frozen flowers want to go back into the vases. Pluck the snowdrops.

11901.NAME: Get the torches
11901.DESCRIPTION: Some places on the island are darker than others. You can get torches from hellhounds or in pitch pits where these dogs tend to swim.

11902.NAME: The pink guards
11902.DESCRIPTION: Talk to the cats to get the keys. You will get mould by building paths, you will get ore by using mines.

11903.NAME: Closed home
11903.DESCRIPTION: Use up the keys. Don't be afraid to unlock the tunnels, they will also come in handy in future quests on the island.

11904.NAME: Black blocks
11904.DESCRIPTION: Use pickaxes to carve some tunnels into the black lava blocks.

11905.NAME: Keep carving
11905.DESCRIPTION: Use pickaxes to carve more tunnels. This island is densely populated.

11906.NAME: Lava piercing
11906.DESCRIPTION: One tunnel for each migrated beast. Continue transforming the black lava blocks.

11907.NAME: Flower braids
11907.DESCRIPTION: Make durable braids from tangled spring flowers. Improves gray vases.

11908.NAME: Succulent flowering
11908.DESCRIPTION: Succulent leaves will be needed for gardening. You will get leaves from both improved vases and pixies. Get seedlings.

11909.NAME: Caraway blossoms
11909.DESCRIPTION: The wrong season! Change the plants, cut the caraway and replace them with the delicate spring flowers.

1191.NAME: Beads for Paprick's grandmother
1191.DESCRIPTION: Paprick's grandmother will have a birthday soon and he doesn't know what to give her. Make and sell some beads from your backpack.

11910.NAME: Get the chomper  moving
11910.DESCRIPTION: Informs mar migration. Catch sand herbivores and collect 10 coins which you can later throw into the fountain.

11911.NAME: Improve the pond
11911.DESCRIPTION: It will take a miracle to get the island ready in time. The chomper has an idea, thus pond needs an UPGRADE.

11912.NAME: Fishing for a miracle
11912.DESCRIPTION: After upgrading, throw coins into the heated lake. A herbivore's best hope is to catch a goldfish and get a wish.

11913.NAME: Icy waters
11913.DESCRIPTION: Miracles will not be enough, so drain the warm water and return the pond to its chilly nature. Select UPGRADE the pond.

11914.NAME: Icy patterns
11914.DESCRIPTION: Used pond for ink extraction. Accumulate a large amount of icy ink before you start creating patterns on the walls of the tunnel.

11915.NAME: Design sketches
11915.DESCRIPTION: Sketch the interior using the workshop. There will be a flower pot in the corner, a cup on the windowsill. The walls may need to be painted.

11916.NAME: Lions' habitats
11916.DESCRIPTION: The widest caves will house lions. Put the lions in the tunnels. Also, take a look in the workshop.

11917.NAME: Birds' habitats
11917.DESCRIPTION: Porous stones are not acoustic. Find the loudest tunnels for birds. Place the birds in the tunnels.

11918.NAME: Lizard habitats
11918.DESCRIPTION: A flat roof allows you to warm your back in the heat of the sun. Place the heat-loving lizards in the caves.

11919.NAME: Friendly living
11919.DESCRIPTION: Don't worry, lions won't eat their neighbors. Tunnel lions prefer to eat ice cream. Accommodate all the lions.

1192.NAME: Pizzas for Paprick
1192.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is going to have a pizza party, but he doesn't know how to make them. Make some pizzas

11920.NAME: Eagle Eye
11920.DESCRIPTION: There will be enough space for everyone. Scan the island with an eagle eye. The number of caves is sufficient. Find places to house all the birds.

11921.NAME: Lizards are warming up
11921.DESCRIPTION: Ten minutes after arrival, the lizards go basking on the roof of the lodge to enjoying the sun. Create habitats for lizards.

11922.NAME: Weed flowers
11922.DESCRIPTION: Small patches of snowflakes spoil the overall view. Completely uproots snowdrops and creates a beautiful lawn.

11923.NAME: Cultivate a garden
11923.DESCRIPTION: The island is already decorated with clusters of Caraway. Change all the flowers to soft spring flowers.

11924.NAME: Stones for the interior
11924.DESCRIPTION: Paths? It also looks good, if you don't want it, don't fix it. Better make some more magic stones in the workshop.

11925.NAME: Hard work
11925.DESCRIPTION: The animals admire hard work, thus, if you work hard enough, you will earn 5 chocolate bars.

11926.NAME: 10 more chocolates
11926.DESCRIPTION: Even strangers could judge you. But does it really matters?  Keep up the good work.

11927.NAME: Complimenting effort
11927.DESCRIPTION: By passing the final test you will earn another batch of chocolate bars. 15 piecies of sweets, to be precise.

11928.NAME: Papīra pārbaude
11928.DESCRIPTION: When you were building the castle, Helena was doing the paperwork. Pools were not part of the plan. Sell modern pools.

11929.NAME: Supervision
11929.DESCRIPTION: Who else, if not Dimond ladies, will check whether the chutes are running and the animals are being fed? Feed adult pigs.

1193.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1193.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the castle by submitting the special paint

11930.NAME: Count and plan
11930.DESCRIPTION: Who else, if not Dimond lady, will point out number of furrows needed. Harvest carrots.

11931.NAME: Sending hives
11931.DESCRIPTION: It is important to maintain a good relationship. Sweet honey hives will be a good gift for girlfriends. Sell your hives.

11932.NAME: Lazy fur coats
11932.DESCRIPTION: Bears loiter around the hives, but the coat you get afterwards is worth the patience. Feed the big bears.

11933.NAME: Flax reserves
11933.DESCRIPTION: Diamond lady does not rely on fate. If the wool runs out, she will mow the flax fields. Harvest flax.

11934.NAME: Enjoy the doubloons
11934.DESCRIPTION: What good is wealth if you can't enjoy it? Harvest pitaya, pandanus or mango trees.

11935.NAME: Cleans up after others
11935.DESCRIPTION: After construction, there is always excess sand. Use sand, build and sell sand gardens.

11936.NAME: Salty wine
11936.DESCRIPTION: Show ingenuity, give an order to put tomato soup on the table the next day, after the wine festival. Harvest the tomatoes.

11937.NAME: Diamond fox
11937.DESCRIPTION: Foxes occasionally bring a useful trinket, but they never bring diamonds. Feed adult foxes.

11938.NAME: Diamond signs
11938.DESCRIPTION: One small diamond is worth more than ten wooden signs. Lots of wooden signs for sale.

11939.NAME: Diamond grain
11939.DESCRIPTION: Neither moss nor grain grows on diamonds. Diamonds are not found under crops. Harvest the wheat fields.

1194.NAME: Finish improving the castle
1194.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 9th stage of the castle

11940.NAME: Diamond rest
11940.DESCRIPTION: People who have a lot of diamonds rest more often. I guess diamonds are soothing. Build regular hammocks.

11941.NAME: Diamond antelopes
11941.DESCRIPTION: Antelopes don't have fingers to wear diamond rings on. Sell your antelopes.

11942.NAME: Diamond lemons
11942.DESCRIPTION: Acids cannot eat glass, marble, or diamond. Harvest the sour lemon bushes.

11943.NAME: Diamond bats
11943.DESCRIPTION: Diamond wives also glow in the dark and underground. Feeds on small and large bats.

11944.NAME: Diamond glass
11944.DESCRIPTION: Real diamonds shine brighter than any glass beads. Use up the glass.

11945.NAME: Diamond hedgehogs
11945.DESCRIPTION: Diamonds cannot be scratched by a fingernail or a hedgehog's needle. Feeds adult hedgehogs.

1196.NAME: Submitting the castle plan
1196.DESCRIPTION: Submit the castle plan to the local council

11961.NAME: Chicks, bros
11961.DESCRIPTION: Don't try to do complicated things, mommy will worry. Feed the little chicks and roosters.

11962.NAME: Kids, lambs
11962.DESCRIPTION: Simple sandwiches with slices of sausage or cheese will suffice. Feed lambs or small goats.

11963.NAME: Calves, foals, antelopes
11963.DESCRIPTION: Don't forget to clean up after yourself. Put the products in the refrigerator, dishes in sink. Feed calves, foals, antelopes.

11964.NAME: Soothe toddlers
11964.DESCRIPTION: On this holiday, of course, we also welcome new mothers with babies. Sooth toddlers, feed pea pods and strollers.

11965.NAME: Anteater pups
11965.DESCRIPTION: Diligent! The little anteater offers to carry his mother's parasol. Feed the family of anteaters.

11966.NAME: Hatch owls
11966.DESCRIPTION: Help warm up those baby owls who are late. Put a scarf on the owl brother or sister and hatch the owl eggs.

11967.NAME: Fix the fence
11967.DESCRIPTION: Do not allow babies to go astray, limit the movement of the little ones by fencing off the territory. Build fences.

11968.NAME: Sit down and relax
11968.DESCRIPTION: Create benches so that there is somewhere to sit while the child runs around and catches butterflies.

11969.NAME: Park tables
11969.DESCRIPTION: Repair mahogany coffee tables. Later you will be able to unpack the buns and lemonade you brought with you.

1197.NAME: Cocktail tables for the potters wife
1197.DESCRIPTION: The potter's wife needs some new cocktail tables for her kitchen. Buy and sell them

11970.NAME: Old palm trees
11970.DESCRIPTION: You won't stop a child from climbing a tree. Cut down the weakest of the three-sided palm trees so that mom doesn't worry.

11971.NAME: Eliminates thorns
11971.DESCRIPTION: No such place where a baby cannot crawl. Pick and remove clumps of thorns. Don't waste mummy bandages.

11972.NAME: The lost doll
11972.DESCRIPTION: It is easy to lose a shovel or a toy car in the long grass. Make things neat. Uproot clumps of reeds.

11973.NAME: Family walk
11973.DESCRIPTION: Find the most beautiful flowering tree or bush, and take a picture with your mother next to it. Travel to the island of mothers.

11974.NAME: Restores joy
11974.DESCRIPTION: The children are happy about the entertainment, the mother has peace of mind. Start all the merry-go-rounds.

1199.NAME: Sell stone walls
1199.DESCRIPTION: Build and sell stone walls to Sissy.

12.NAME: Craft shovel
12.DESCRIPTION: Search the island for necessary resources and craft a shovel in the workshop. This can be done same way as with the stone axe.

120.NAME: Wheat for the festival
120.DESCRIPTION: Get 60 wheat for the festival (the wheat will be taken out of your backpack)

1200.NAME: Pumpkin diet
1200.DESCRIPTION: Submit pumpkins. Sissy wants to go on a pumpkin diet.

1201.NAME: Clothes-lines for Sissy
1201.DESCRIPTION: Make a couple of clothes-lines for Sissy so that she can dry all her pretty dresses.

1202.NAME: Flax harvest
1202.DESCRIPTION: Grow and harvest flax. Sissy wants to sew new linen dresses.

1203.NAME: Wires for the chandelier
1203.DESCRIPTION: Give Sissy some metal wires for making the chandelier

1204.NAME: Harvesting coconuts
1204.DESCRIPTION: Sissy wants you to show her how to get coconuts. Harvest them

1205.NAME: Truffles for Sissy
1205.DESCRIPTION: Give Sissy some truffles. She will prepare a royal meal.

1206.NAME: Linen fabric
1206.DESCRIPTION: Make fabric out of flax stems. It's necessary for the decorations of the chandelier.

12083.NAME: Buggy festival
12083.DESCRIPTION: Flying beetles were carrying field flowers and they were heading for Festival island. Follow them!

12084.NAME: Launching yourself
12084.DESCRIPTION: A giant sling would not be controllable. A rocket would be a better option. Buy one rocket in the shop.

12085.NAME: A fake firefly
12085.DESCRIPTION: Seeing the flaming exhaust, the bugs have labeled you as a bug as well. Select the USE option on the rocket.

12086.NAME: Hungry buzzers
12086.DESCRIPTION: Bugs are busy knitting new wreaths, but they are SO hungry. Feed the bugs and gain some wreaths.

12087.NAME: Stumpy blockers
12087.DESCRIPTION: Decorate stumps with wreaths and the beatles will drag the stump away. Try spending some wreaths and making a path.

12088.NAME: Shriveled paths
12088.DESCRIPTION: It is easy to fall down on this mountain top. Water the brown leaf paths to sprout green buds to grapple for safe crossing.

12089.NAME: Flower fields
12089.DESCRIPTION: On such a warm and sunny day you can roll around in flower fields all day. Go into the fields and pick some flowers.

12090.NAME: Shiny rocks
12090.DESCRIPTION: Some beatles have already found shiny rocks and have adorned themselves. Try getting a few gems by chopping Treasure stone.

12091.NAME: Honey stitch
12091.DESCRIPTION: The hives here are so old, that sticky honey holds them from falling apart. Patch up the moss worn beehives.

12092.NAME: Mountain lake
12092.DESCRIPTION: Not many fishes in the mountain waters, though you could try catching some water vegetables. Try fishing!

12093.NAME: A passing caravan
12093.DESCRIPTION: These parts have a mountain trail that is used by some caravans. Try talking to caravans, and pet their camels.

12094.NAME: Water source
12094.DESCRIPTION: Either dig your own watering hole (shop) or use the mountain well. Either way, dip your bucket in the well 20 times.

12095.NAME: Crack putty
12095.DESCRIPTION: Some gaps in stone trip your feet from time to time. Collect some clay from clay pit to fill the cracks.

12096.NAME: Low branches
12096.DESCRIPTION: It is not necessary to cut down the entire tree, but you hit your head on low branches too often. Chop trees.

12097.NAME: Picnic place
12097.DESCRIPTION: Pick the place with the best view, then clear some bushes, so you can lay down a blanket.

12098.NAME: Fern blossoms
12098.DESCRIPTION: Turnip is so hungry that anything and everything looks delicious. Pluck some fern flowers

12099.NAME: Mountain berries
12099.DESCRIPTION: Pick some berries for Turnip. Yes, pandanus trees, blueberries or camel thorns, just get something for Turnip.

121.NAME: Milk for the festival
121.DESCRIPTION: Get 20 bottles of milk for the festival (the milk will be taken out of your backpack)

1210.NAME: Submit ropes
1210.DESCRIPTION: Give the jeweler a rope. He will need it for making bone beads.

12100.NAME: Spiced pumpkins
12100.DESCRIPTION: By restoring shriveled pumpkins, you can eat them immediately. Harvest some pumpkins.

12101.NAME: Mushroom greeting
12101.DESCRIPTION: The guests from the forest brought you a basket of mushrooms and berries. Gather some of these snacks.

12102.NAME: Animal omnibus
12102.DESCRIPTION: Dogs and sloths, sheep and ostriches, all took the same caravan and arrived at the same time. Feed these animals.

12103.NAME: Steep climbers
12103.DESCRIPTION: Grown pigs motivated themselves by climbing backwards, always looking down into the chasm. Feed grown pigs.

12104.NAME: Waterfront
12104.DESCRIPTION: Most of the guests wish to settle with ease of access to swimming spots. Build a plank, or clay pool.

12105.NAME: Bonfire supplies
12105.DESCRIPTION: Guests have split up in multiple groups, each wishing for its own bonfire. Build multiple plank storages.

12106.NAME: Sleeping quarters
12106.DESCRIPTION: Guests of course are animals, and they love to sleep in hay bales. Build some hay stacks.

12107.NAME: Onion flavoring
12107.DESCRIPTION: You can avoid putting meat on the skewers, but you can not avoid roasting onions. Harvest onion fields.

12108.NAME: Fried carrots
12108.DESCRIPTION: How do you correctly skewer carrots? Do you pierce them from the thick end or the thin one? Harvest carrots.

12109.NAME: Vegetable buns
12109.DESCRIPTION: To grill beans, peas and other grain you will need dough, so harvest some wheat fields.

1211.NAME: Grapes for the jeweler
1211.DESCRIPTION: Give the jeweler some grapes. He will make some wine.

12110.NAME: Cherry tree
12110.DESCRIPTION: The Turnip means you well, but the bug has a point. Enough work, sit back and relax. Buy some Sakura trees.

1212.NAME: Gathering berries and mushrooms
1212.DESCRIPTION: Gather berries and mushrooms for the jeweller

1214.NAME: Help friends with the bonfire
1214.DESCRIPTION: Help friends get coal from the bonfire

1216.NAME: Exotic fruit
1216.DESCRIPTION: Help friends harvest bananas, Pandanustree or Pitaya tree fruit

1218.NAME: Corn - level 1
1218.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn on your friend's islands

1219.NAME: Corn - level 2
1219.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn on your friend's islands

122.NAME: Yeast for the festival
122.DESCRIPTION: Buy 100 yeast in the shop for the natives (the yeast will be taken out of your backpack)

1220.NAME: Corn - level 3
1220.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn on your friend's islands

1221.NAME: Chili - level 1
1221.DESCRIPTION: Harvest chili on your friend's islands

1222.NAME: Chili - level 2
1222.DESCRIPTION: Harvest chili on your friend's islands

12224.NAME: A loud thud
12224.DESCRIPTION: Lucky you, landing into rhododendrons. Plant the broken branches, spend clay pots.

12225.NAME: Visit the island
12225.DESCRIPTION: Visit an island as long as a parrot's unfinished errands. Travel.

12226.NAME: Polish the farm
12226.DESCRIPTION: One day will not be enough to get things in order. Complete any parrot riddle task.

12227.NAME: A moment to rest
12227.DESCRIPTION: Motivation - surfboards can be made in the workshop only after the work is done. You will get sparkles by solving riddles.

12228.NAME: Dig up the bike
12228.DESCRIPTION: However, the best waves can be found at the other end of the island. Dig up the bike to shorten the way there.

12229.NAME: Dig into the paprika
12229.DESCRIPTION: For each of these tasks you will receive a surfboard. One board is buried in paprika. Harvest this crop.

1223.NAME: Chili - level 3
1223.DESCRIPTION: Harvest chili on your friend's islands

12230.NAME: Lazy boards
12230.DESCRIPTION: Even sloths have found surfboards. If you want some, you will have to feed the sloths.

12231.NAME: Washed wheat
12231.DESCRIPTION: The wheat sacks hit the rocks first and dissolved. Recover and harvest wheat.

12232.NAME: The sleepy helmsman
12232.DESCRIPTION: The waves lulled the bears into sleep and there was no one left to steer the boat. Sell your bears.

12233.NAME: On stilts
12233.DESCRIPTION: Build gazebos for some recovery and rest after a crash. You can't get summer joys from gazebos.

12234.NAME: Ride the waves
12234.DESCRIPTION: Allowing the parrot to ride the waves purely in the name of exploration. Master all the big waves.

12235.NAME: Marsh ducks
12235.DESCRIPTION: Such a climate, such ducks. Note that the purple duck is not native. Feed any ducks.

12236.NAME: Water up to the ears
12236.DESCRIPTION: Only the palm trees, neither the wind nor the waves seem to be harmed, at least at this strength. Harvest coconut palms.

12237.NAME: Picking rocks
12237.DESCRIPTION: No matter how many times you cut the pile of stones, in the morning the waves will have replenished the stock. Harvest it once.

12238.NAME: Melon buoys
12238.DESCRIPTION: Harvest melons. They don't care about tides, their hollow bellies keep them afloat, and their strings act as an anchor.

12239.NAME: Feed the pigs
12239.DESCRIPTION: Pigs don't have toes to grip the ground with when the waves come. Heavy pigs do not swim. Feed adult pigs.

1224.NAME: Flux - level 1
1224.DESCRIPTION: Harvest flux on your friend's islands

12240.NAME: Fix the road
12240.DESCRIPTION: Build some clay paths to walk above the swamp. Collection items cannot be obtained in this process.

12241.NAME: Roots of success
12241.DESCRIPTION: Collectables can be found twice as often when harvesting harvest fields. Harvest the carrots.

12242.NAME: Someone stands out
12242.DESCRIPTION: Different collectibles can be found on the left and right sides of the island. Feed the sheep.

12243.NAME: Clear the swamp
12243.DESCRIPTION: You can walk across this swamp, but be careful. No matter how much earth you pour into this depression, the swamp will return.

12244.NAME: Collector of trinkets
12244.DESCRIPTION: Keep 10 foxes at the same time. Pay attention to what little things each action gives, this knowledge can later be useful.

12245.NAME: Summer cacti
12245.DESCRIPTION: To make swamping a little easier, keep 4 reanimated cacti at the same time.

12246.NAME: Peach warehouses
12246.DESCRIPTION: The parrot has set priorities. First of all, peaches should be stored in a safe place. Build food storage.

12247.NAME: Picking potatoes
12247.DESCRIPTION: Potatoes were thrown out of storage to make way for peaches. Harvest the potato crop.

12248.NAME: Stamping elephants
12248.DESCRIPTION: Elephants can eat warehouses surplus. So go, sell some elephants.

12249.NAME: Use windmills
12249.DESCRIPTION: Delayed work can be done more easily with the help of technology. Use restored mills.

1225.NAME: Flux - level 1
1225.DESCRIPTION: Harvest flux on your friend's islands

12250.NAME: Sell your chikens
12250.DESCRIPTION: The beasts on the island can be moved and sold after the first feeding. Store-bought beasts don't have this problem.

12251.NAME: Endurance of eggplant
12251.DESCRIPTION: Note that all plants on this island have longer than normal rot times. Harvest the eggplants.

12252.NAME: Work without benefit
12252.DESCRIPTION: You brought the benches from home, they won't give you any collection items. Build painted stools so you can sit down.

12253.NAME: Meerkat posture
12253.DESCRIPTION: When you get up on your hind legs, you can see what things will be available in the next area. Sell adult meerkats.

12254.NAME: The Impatient Harvest
12254.DESCRIPTION: Due to the favorable climate, many of the island's plants grow faster here. Harvest the corn fields.

12255.NAME: Set up camp
12255.DESCRIPTION: Sometimes you can't choose. Prepare several tents for a long stay. Hold 4 yellow tents at the same time.

12256.NAME: Antelope in tents?
12256.DESCRIPTION: Only completed tents can be moved, but antelopes can be moved in other ways. Sell antelopes.

12257.NAME: A type of bean
12257.DESCRIPTION: In Oceania, beans are divided into regular, coffee, and jelly beans. Harvest the beans.

12258.NAME: A work horse
12258.DESCRIPTION: Full carts, send the horses away to the mill. Sell grwon horses.

12259.NAME: Pluck the thorns
12259.DESCRIPTION: The thorns on this island just get in the way. You can't find any summer fjoy in them for the collection. Remove thorns or thistles.

1226.NAME: Flux - level 1
1226.DESCRIPTION: Harvest flux on your friend's islands

12260.NAME: Roll
12260.DESCRIPTION: At least pumpkins are easy to find and harvest. Cut the stem, and roll away. Harvest pumpkins.

12261.NAME: Sitting on a tomato
12261.DESCRIPTION: Each of these quests will yield a surfboard instead of collection pieces. Harvest the tomatoes.

12262.NAME: On a palm leaf
12262.DESCRIPTION: The parrot is light, it can break waves even on a palm leaf. Make cuts in the basic palms.

12263.NAME: Sell dogs
12263.DESCRIPTION: Keeping the dog on a leash, you can also slide on the sand with the leaf. Sell dogs.

12264.NAME: Careful, hole!
12264.DESCRIPTION: Almost fell. Add stairs so you can get out. Moves a completed clay pit, or any clay pit II.

12265.NAME: A row of parrots
12265.DESCRIPTION: The parrot lost all interest in the island. Try to get him back to work with strawberries.

12266.NAME: Looping like a bunny
12266.DESCRIPTION: Jump into the water, ride a wave, and repeat, like a rabbit in a wheel. Feed rabbits and hares.

12267.NAME: Knock
12267.DESCRIPTION: Complete the task, then knock on the nearest stump and put the parrot to work. Wake up any parrot.

12268.NAME: Get the collection
12268.DESCRIPTION: Work for a while, rest for a while. You will need surfboards for recreation. Exchange the collection - get a board.

12269.NAME: Away in the waters
12269.DESCRIPTION: You can't go out and enjoy the ocean waves until all the work is done. Send all the parrots to swim.

1227.NAME: Strawberries - level 1
1227.DESCRIPTION: Harvest strawberries on your friend's islands

12270.NAME: The typical plant
12270.DESCRIPTION: When you see this plant, the first thought that comes to mind is Oceania. Shorten this adult plant 33 times.

12271.NAME: The plant in question
12271.DESCRIPTION: This plant reminds you of moonless night. Harvest 20 such tiles.

12272.NAME: The talking plant
12272.DESCRIPTION: And this is the time when the plant can fall on your head. Sell ​​this plant 33 times.

12273.NAME: An inedible plant
12273.DESCRIPTION: There are not many plants that cannot be turned into food. Harvest this crop 16 times.

12274.NAME: Wheel
12274.DESCRIPTION: Perform actions to obtain a collectible cartwheel. Strange wheels can be made from things that do not roll.

12275.NAME: The fastest bird
12275.DESCRIPTION: This bird can run faster than the fastest horse. Feed these birds 33 times.

12276.NAME: The fragile plant
12276.DESCRIPTION: Both garden and forest versions of this plant are popular. Collect 33 such tiles.

12277.NAME: Using the tool
12277.DESCRIPTION: The avatar regularly wields an axe, machete, pickaxe, or shovel. Brandish another tool.

12278.NAME: Do not eat
12278.DESCRIPTION: This thing should not be consumed, you will definitely drop dead. Get this resource 7 times.

1228.NAME: Strawberries - level 2
1228.DESCRIPTION: Harvest strawberries on your friend's islands

12283.NAME: Simple math
12283.DESCRIPTION: You will need 32 hours to grow these animals into adults. Sell 8 fully grown animals.

12284.NAME: No chill
12284.DESCRIPTION: The name of this plant is exact oposite of its nature. Harvest 17 such fields.

12285.NAME: Walls and roof
12285.DESCRIPTION: More often orange with red, sometimes white with purple, in special cases turquoise and green. Use 33 times.

1229.NAME: Strawberries - level 3
1229.DESCRIPTION: Harvest strawberries on your friend's islands

12293.NAME: Specimen
12293.DESCRIPTION: At the same time, have 17 such birds, which are only useful when sold. That do not form a separate bird species.

12294.NAME: Salad plant
12294.DESCRIPTION: You don't make stews and sauces from this vegetable, it is only good for salads. Harvest 17 squares.

12295.NAME: A pile of boards
12295.DESCRIPTION: You will need 10 boards to build this humble but very useful building. Build this building three times.

123.NAME: Plant 30 new trees
123.DESCRIPTION: Dig fields and plant in them 30 new trees from the shop

1230.NAME: Melons - level 1
1230.DESCRIPTION: Harvest melons on your friend's islands

12303.NAME: Combing animal
12303.DESCRIPTION: Again, your clothes are covered with yellow-orange animal fur. Sell 11 adult animals.

12304.NAME: Teeth and fossils
12304.DESCRIPTION: Friends tend to look for lion's teeth here. Use 16 times.

12305.NAME: Food in a box
12305.DESCRIPTION: Harvest an incredibly large crop field 4 times. This crop is the parrot's favorite meal.

12306.NAME: Roof on walls
12306.DESCRIPTION: Brown-red and white-purple, this time this object must be built. Complete construction 6 times.

12307.NAME: Owners of horns
12307.DESCRIPTION: Of course, no one has measured, but this beast may have the longest horns in Oceania. Sell 22 longest horns.

12308.NAME: A misunderstanding
12308.DESCRIPTION: The previous exercise mentioned beasts... but who bothers to read. Harvest 17 longhorn Plants.

12309.NAME: Investment
12309.DESCRIPTION: This item can be upgraded by spending 5 rubies multiple times. Move this object multiple times.

1231.NAME: Melons - level 2
1231.DESCRIPTION: Harvest melons on your friend's islands

12310.NAME: No backbone
12310.DESCRIPTION: Twice you get a thing that has no other use than to be sold. This item is worth 600 shells.

12311.NAME: Liquid
12311.DESCRIPTION: Spend 32 times the thing that helps you save energy in household work.

12313.NAME: Came from the forest
12313.DESCRIPTION: These nocturnal animals cannot fly. Feed these animals and their babies.

12314.NAME: Hobby
12314.DESCRIPTION: A peach parrot is trying to catch this object in its free time. Use it 33 times.

12315.NAME: Knitting pillows
12315.DESCRIPTION: On Parrot Island, these animals give pillows, while visiting friends they give llama wool. Feed 33 times.

12316.NAME: Arrows
12316.DESCRIPTION: Finish making the metal birds. No, these are not peacock statues. Build them 9 times.

12317.NAME: For big eyes
12317.DESCRIPTION: At least five days are required to raise this beast on the home island. Sell 6 such beasts.

12318.NAME: Small stomach
12318.DESCRIPTION: These adults need to be fed more often than adult chickens. Performs 10 feedings.

12319.NAME: Fish beast
12319.DESCRIPTION: Only one beast on Parrot Island gives flying fish. Feed this beast 32 times on any island.

1232.NAME: Melons - level 3
1232.DESCRIPTION: Harvest melons on your friend's islands

12320.NAME: Repetition
12320.DESCRIPTION: A few days ago you had the task of sowing this plant. Now harvest 32 such harvest fields.

12321.NAME: Far spectrum
12321.DESCRIPTION: Darker then grapes, the color of this plant is at the far end of spectrum. Harvest 16 times.

12323.NAME: Scythe
12323.DESCRIPTION: This decoration is obtained when one bundle of straw is tied to 8 pieces of firewood with a rope. Build 16 times.

12324.NAME: 18 x ??
12324.DESCRIPTION: Sow 18 vegetables in such a way that 252 shells are spent in the process.

12325.NAME: Nine recipes
12325.DESCRIPTION: Which dish of these vegetables gives exactly 13 food. Get these vegetables for 9 such servings.

12326.NAME: Incredibly cheap
12326.DESCRIPTION: This decor is built from bricks, however it only gives 2 shells when sold. Build 9 times.

12327.NAME: Second on the right
12327.DESCRIPTION: The flower pot on Parrot Island is given by only one beast. Feed adult such beasts 21 times.

12328.NAME: Mentioned in the text
12328.DESCRIPTION: This crop cannot be found on Paprick's Island except for a male specimen. Harvest 18 harvest fields.

12329.NAME: Night Bird
12329.DESCRIPTION: The same riddle about the hedgehog, only in flying form. Feed 33 times.

12330.NAME: Shiny things
12330.DESCRIPTION: Use the workshop three times to spend 10 energy each time.

12331.NAME: Diary?
12331.DESCRIPTION: 18 times harvest the plants that were trampled by the bears on Parrot Island.

12334.NAME: First year
12334.DESCRIPTION: This goal is simple - have at least one reputation point. Its been a year, you should be famous among natives.

12335.NAME: Lend a hand
12335.DESCRIPTION: The more, the merrier. Help any friend, or help Paprick, and let them join in on this celebration.

12336.NAME: Back to basics
12336.DESCRIPTION: Prove that you still remember those times when you just started farming. Harvest 35 radish fields.

12337.NAME: Party hat
12337.DESCRIPTION: To get into the mood, change your outfit, or at least put on the party hat from the friend quest.

12360.NAME: Water sources
12360.DESCRIPTION: Get water. Check any water sources. Make sure that the jellyfish was only in the well.

12361.NAME: Festival Jellyfish
12361.DESCRIPTION: Medusa dances unusually energetically, so visit the well-known dance island - Festival Island.

12362.NAME: Millstones
12362.DESCRIPTION: Moves millstones. The resulting well power is temporary. Use the power potion you got when you drew water.

12363.NAME: Power fishing
12363.DESCRIPTION: Fish on any island and get the power of the jellyfish that has flown here.

12364.NAME: Draw from the well
12364.DESCRIPTION: Use the wells and draw the power of the jellyfish. Each of these tasks will give you the power to dedicate millstones.

12365.NAME: Catching the cloud
12365.DESCRIPTION: Catch hurricanes. After feeding the red bugs, they resume twirling the twisters and syphoning the rainwater of power.

12366.NAME: Round pyramids
12366.DESCRIPTION: Stack the millstones in a pile and make the pits into storage for the resin. You can gain stones on the island.

12367.NAME: Resin storage
12367.DESCRIPTION: Make sure the resin is cool and fresh. Use pyramid shaped storages to produce resin vases.

12368.NAME: Jellyfish lighthouse
12368.DESCRIPTION: Try to attract a new cloud by placing the scented resin on the roof of the lighthouse. Build a lighthouse from millstones.

12369.NAME: Watermelon for jellyfish
12369.DESCRIPTION: The jellyfish sips the resin and deftly disappears into the coral. Harvest watermelons, to offer to jellyfishes.

12370.NAME: Varieties of carrots
12370.DESCRIPTION: Eating carrots every day, wallabies can choose the best carrots by smell alone. Feed the wallabies.

12371.NAME: Resin soup
12371.DESCRIPTION: Save the resin and try to dilute it. If watermelon and carrots don't work, try other garden produce. Build barrels.

12372.NAME: Search the well
12372.DESCRIPTION: I guess you shouldn't have released the found jellyfish into the ocean. Try to find more by drawing from well again.

12373.NAME: Cloud spinning
12373.DESCRIPTION: Hurry up and take the fans in your hands to get the benefits of the cloud faster. Cut in more whirlwinds.

12374.NAME: Electrolytes
12374.DESCRIPTION: Drinking ocean water is dangerous, but this time it increases your power. Continue fishing on any island.

12375.NAME: Radish nectar
12375.DESCRIPTION: Silently observes whether the jellyfish will come to sip the nectar. Harvest the radish crop, it blocks the view.

12376.NAME: Push ashore
12376.DESCRIPTION: Feed the ducklings and ducklings, pull the birds out of the water so that the jellyfish can leave the Ocean unhindered.

12377.NAME: Look at the buildings
12377.DESCRIPTION: Build 3 shell storages from clay or stone. Make sure that the jellyfish is not hiding in these buildings.

12378.NAME: Boiling nectar
12378.DESCRIPTION: You will get nectar containers from pyramid-shaped buildings. Upgrade all Pavilions so you can start casting coins.

12379.NAME: Cookies for jellyfish
12379.DESCRIPTION: Sweet tree resin is used to make coins, or cookies for jellyfish. Turn nectar into coins using the pavilion.

12380.NAME: Dig under a rock
12380.DESCRIPTION: You will need amber coins. Buy and plant stones from store, then dig the stone up.

12381.NAME: Farm cats
12381.DESCRIPTION: The rain turned the mice into cat sizes. Feed a large flock of cats and kittens to counter the hoard of mice.

12382.NAME: A giant catch
12382.DESCRIPTION: While fishing, You pulled up giant fish, one after another. Build fish trophies, capture those achievements.

12383.NAME: Carrots for wallabies
12383.DESCRIPTION: Wallabies gave you their best carrots. Harvest fresh carrots, keep the wallabies from starving.

12384.NAME: Wolf dogs
12384.DESCRIPTION: Even an old barn owl has turned into a wolf after the rain. Sell 12 big dogs.

12385.NAME: Fatigue
12385.DESCRIPTION: Dandelions had to be weeded with an axe. Build hammocks, take a nap, recover strength.

12386.NAME: Overgrowth in wheat
12386.DESCRIPTION: When you wake up, everything is dark. You are lost in field of thick wheat. Mow your way with scythe. Harvest the wheat crop.

12387.NAME: Chicory flavor
12387.DESCRIPTION: Adds a bitter coffee flavor to amber cookies and nectar. Harvest the chicory crop.

12388.NAME: Tropical flavor
12388.DESCRIPTION: Pineapple will help you mix up the bouquet of tropical fruits. Build pineapple swimming rings.

12389.NAME: Soft greens
12389.DESCRIPTION: Maybe jellyfish like a milder taste? Feed the little lizards and write down which flavors they like best.

12390.NAME: Acacia braids
12390.DESCRIPTION: Acacia branches are flexible and have a specific smell. Plant acacia trees and cut them down.

12391.NAME: Green cups
12391.DESCRIPTION: Flycatchers cannot hold jellyfish. Pour nectar into giant flycatcher cups, harvest flycatchers.

12392.NAME: Cocktail glass
12392.DESCRIPTION: If you want coconut halves with small umbrellas, feed the cockatoos and ask them to lend you such treys.

12393.NAME: Jellyfish whispering
12393.DESCRIPTION: Jellyfish are still hiding in the coral. Use sweet words, lure and tame the jumping jellyfish.

124.NAME: Chop down 20 grow-up trees
124.DESCRIPTION: Chop down 20 grown-up trees. If you have none, plant them from the shop and wait for them to grow

12480.NAME: Catching a star
12480.DESCRIPTION: The stars flattened the chrysanthemums so dear to you. Give away plant revivers.

12481.NAME: A star sails
12481.DESCRIPTION: It looks pretty, but take off the star stuck to the sail and go to the Starry Island.

12482.NAME: Wandering cancer
12482.DESCRIPTION: The starfish forced the island's cancers to move to the coastal breakwater. Feed the cancers.

12483.NAME: Looking for a way
12483.DESCRIPTION: Cancers with strong pincers can break their way to the middle of the island. Use pincers on stars after feeding.

12484.NAME: Hat owners
12484.DESCRIPTION: Move starfish using pincers. Find some SPECIAL frogs with hats on their heads.

12485.NAME: Borrow hats
12485.DESCRIPTION: Feed the hat frogs and get the very capacious magic cylinders. They will still be useful to you.

12486.NAME: Tickling jelly
12486.DESCRIPTION: The gluttonous jelly devoured the supplies you brought with you. Do other tasks when you get feathers then tickle jelly.

12487.NAME: Pick up the stacks
12487.DESCRIPTION: Stacks of seashells washed in by the tide are TRAVERSABLE. Throw these shells into the magic hats.

12488.NAME: Deliver packages
12488.DESCRIPTION: Filling cylinders to the brim will give you bundles. Deliver these packages to the merchant. Used cabin.

12489.NAME: Buy camels
12489.DESCRIPTION: Hats will have to be returned. Use the obtained juicy branches and buy caravan camels to transport the shells.

12490.NAME: The long caravan
12490.DESCRIPTION: A longer caravan will be difficult to manage, hopefully 40 camels will be enough for all the packs. Buy camels.

12491.NAME: Frog combing
12491.DESCRIPTION: Cancers know at least 40 frogs who like to wear hats. You will have to find out where each frog is hiding.

12492.NAME: Don't stumble
12492.DESCRIPTION: Read the stacks and you won't have to trip over the shells. Fill 40 hats with these treasures.

12493.NAME: A small meal
12493.DESCRIPTION: You can only move around the island with the pincers you get from feeding cancers. Feed some cancers.

12494.NAME: Great feeding
12494.DESCRIPTION: Each of these tasks will give you extra pincers as a reward, which will help you progress. Keep feeding.

12495.NAME: Cancer meal
12495.DESCRIPTION: Stroll of cancers  tickles the jelly. Each of these tasks will give you a feather to tickle the jelly. Keep feeding cancers.

12496.NAME: Oxen or elephants
12496.DESCRIPTION: Some camels are assigned to help cancers. Raise heifers and cows, or elephants to carry the burden of camels.

12497.NAME: Relatives of the camel
12497.DESCRIPTION: When camels are missing, relatives of camels can be taken as helpers. Feed ostriches, antelopes, horses or zebras.

12498.NAME: Drag on the water
12498.DESCRIPTION: And in general, the land road is not the only option. Catch fish to move crates on water.

12499.NAME: Cancer trails
12499.DESCRIPTION: Already in the first five minutes, the convoy stops again. Obstacle ahead. Feed even more cancers.

125.NAME: Craft 40 planks
125.DESCRIPTION: Craft 40 planks for the natives (the planks will be taken out of your backpack)

12500.NAME: Nibble the grass
12500.DESCRIPTION: Cancers waddle across the bottom of the grass, camels can't. Feed the lambs, sheep or goats, cut the grass on the camel paths.

12501.NAME: Roll the lawn
12501.DESCRIPTION: Take the edge and start rolling the lawn into a roller. Build straw bales. Better black soil than grass up to the chin.

12502.NAME: Continue tickling the jelly
12502.DESCRIPTION: Feathers pinned to hats are the cause of all magic. Tickle the jelly with the feathers, soon the jelly  will fade.

12503.NAME: Saddle the camels
12503.DESCRIPTION: Every time the jelly is tickled with magic, it spits out a pair of swallowed saddles. IMPROVE camels with this saddle.

12504.NAME: Earn a pack
12504.DESCRIPTION: The merchant diggs out a package. Investing makes the caravan move faster. Create 180 grass trails.

12505.NAME: Food on the tide
12505.DESCRIPTION: Builds food caches from branches or boards to supply the camels with new shipments of food.

12506.NAME: Dig up the shells
12506.DESCRIPTION: What cannot be loaded onto a camel must be stored. Build clay, stone or modern shell storage.

12507.NAME: Water on a journey
12507.DESCRIPTION: Waves wash into the spring, the water is no longer drinkable, it's good that the water was provided in advance. Build barrels.

12508.NAME: Saddle all the camels
12508.DESCRIPTION: When the road is cleared, several more camels join the caravan. Count 48 saddled camels.

12509.NAME: Last help
12509.DESCRIPTION: When the jelly was driven away, the cancers recovered the evacuated stocks. Help the Cancers split the harvest pyramid.

12511.NAME: Motivate movement
12511.DESCRIPTION: Too many stars washed in from the sea. Give away thorny branches, motivate movement.

12512.NAME: Chicken bones
12512.DESCRIPTION: After a delicious chicken meal, leftover bones can be turned into good luck charms. Submit bone beads.

12513.NAME: Radish ghosts
12513.DESCRIPTION: To prevent the next wave from coming, it is necessary to cover the coast with radishes. Give away radishes.

12514.NAME: Milk purification
12514.DESCRIPTION: Give milk to the priest. Before starting any work, wash your hands in milk, then the work will definitely succeed.

126.NAME: Gather 5 clay
126.DESCRIPTION: Give 5 clay for the natives. You can get clay by digging fields

1265.NAME: Upgrade castle
1265.DESCRIPTION: Improve the castle by submitting the chandelier

1266.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1266.DESCRIPTION: Finish building 10th stage of the castle

1267.NAME: Feed chickens
1267.DESCRIPTION: Feed grown-up chickens on your island

1268.NAME: Using the well
1268.DESCRIPTION: Obtain water from the well on your island

127.NAME: Remove 5 swamp fields
127.DESCRIPTION: Remove at least 5 swamp fields, using your new iron shovel, to get to the other side of the swamp

1271.NAME: Building sheds
1271.DESCRIPTION: Make and build any type of modern sheds

12716.NAME: The broken skeleton
12716.DESCRIPTION: A rib is missing from the skeleton from the science room. Get some bones to repair the mannequin.

12717.NAME: Pie for lunch
12717.DESCRIPTION: The handcraft class suddenly showed interest in the pumpkin pie recipe. Write the recipe. Make pumpkin pies.

12718.NAME: Floods of sweat
12718.DESCRIPTION: The theater class asked to make wax candles. You are thirsty from hot work. Drink well water, use a well.

12719.NAME: Botany class
12719.DESCRIPTION: You'll have to go to the Dark Garden to find the not-so-poisonous ivy branches. Travel!

1272.NAME: Fans for Mycott's wife
1272.DESCRIPTION: Sell peacock-feather fans to Mycott, so that his wife can cool herself

12720.NAME: Engraving of a well
12720.DESCRIPTION: Still thirsty, luckily there is a well on this island too. Have a drink.

12721.NAME: Silent steps
12721.DESCRIPTION: It is impossible to outrun the goblins. Quietly sneak up and catch them then.

12722.NAME: Lamp catchers
12722.DESCRIPTION: You didn't catch goblins for fun. Only goblins will be able to catch the flying pumpkin lights. Try it!

12723.NAME: A sense of security
12723.DESCRIPTION: The awakened guest cannot sleep in the terrible darkness. Give the hand a bright lamp so that the guest is not afraid to fall asleep.

12724.NAME: Collecting termites
12724.DESCRIPTION: Chop burnt and wormy trees, then pick up the fallen worms on the ground.

12725.NAME: Fatten the worms
12725.DESCRIPTION: Treat your worms with candies that have fallen on the ground. The obtained wormy candies will be useful to you later.

12726.NAME: Howling bushes
12726.DESCRIPTION: Scary sounds and shadows howling in the dark? Place the lamps so it will be safer. Silence the howling bushes.

12727.NAME: Pursuing bites
12727.DESCRIPTION: You dodged a thorn, but you still scratched yourself. Guilty flowers! Take away flower fangs, since they are dangerous

12728.NAME: The gray earth
12728.DESCRIPTION: Pick purple sticks, thorn bushes, or burning thistles, as well as roses. Smooth out the sharpness.

12729.NAME: Soften the ground
12729.DESCRIPTION: Pumpkins are grown on the gray earth. Any unpicked tree needles will get caught in the round vegetables.

1273.NAME: Feeding sheep
1273.DESCRIPTION: Feed sheep or lambs on any island

12730.NAME: Sooth the onions
