12730.DESCRIPTION: To eradicate all the heresies with which the earth is saturated, try to grow onions. Fix stubborn onions.

12731.NAME: Sooth the carrots
12731.DESCRIPTION: If you can't make the earth whiter, maybe make it oranger? Fix stubborn carrots.

12732.NAME: Sooth the flax
12732.DESCRIPTION: When you manage to stick flax seeds into the black earth, then half the work will be done. Fix stubborn flax.

12733.NAME: Pumpkin ghools
12733.DESCRIPTION: Find pumpkin monsters in the shop and place them on patches of softened ground.

12734.NAME: Collect curses
12734.DESCRIPTION: By eating evil vegetables, pumpkin maggots are able to gather evil energies into tangible pieces. Feed the monsters.

12735.NAME: Good spirit
12735.DESCRIPTION: The powerfully friendly spirit of ghosts can transform any negative energy into friendly emotions. Feed.

12736.NAME: Onion beetles
12736.DESCRIPTION: When harvesting onions, you will find chocolate beetles with a delicious onion filling. Harvest this crop.

12737.NAME: Carrot beetles
12737.DESCRIPTION: The worm candy has turned into stuffed beetles in the carrot field. Harvest carrots and collect beetles.

12738.NAME: Flax beetles
12738.DESCRIPTION: Beetles stuffed with linen mittens. There are quite a few hands on the island that long for a glove. Harvest flax.

12739.NAME: Cursed goat
12739.DESCRIPTION: Soon I'll get out of this hairy skin. Help me!!!

1274.NAME: Ignition oil
1274.DESCRIPTION: Obtain ignition oil on your island

12740.NAME: Extra pumpkins
12740.DESCRIPTION: In order for pumpkin gnats to continue to catch curses floating in the air, they will need additional food. Sow pumpkins.

12741.NAME: Stocks of Curses
12741.DESCRIPTION: Goblins will throw all your cursed packets in some far away well. Hand in enough globlins for the task.

12742.NAME: Knock on the coffin
12742.DESCRIPTION: Peace reigns again in the dark garden. Knock on the coffin and hold 13 hands at the same time.

12743.NAME: Overfed maggots
12743.DESCRIPTION: Hang the worms back in the trees. Make sure that there is no burnt tree on the island.

12744.NAME: Removing all teeth
12744.DESCRIPTION: Remember, the fanged flowers must be defeated before dawn, when they will return. Eliminates all fanged flowers.

12745.NAME: Lost in the grove
12745.DESCRIPTION: Cut all the birch branches, but be careful, the work must be done in one day. Count 21 small birch trees.

12746.NAME: Regenerate the forest
12746.DESCRIPTION: In silence and peace, the spiders can weave their webs again. Plant purple trees.

12747.NAME: Butterflies in a pumpkin
12747.DESCRIPTION: Let the pumpkins fly! Help the butterflies take flight. Count 20 pumpkins in flight.

12748.NAME: Shrub candies
12748.DESCRIPTION: Scares scarecrows. Use the candy star on the ground to summon the scary pumpkins in the bushes.

1276.NAME: Feeding meerkats
1276.DESCRIPTION: Feed small or grown-up meerkats on your island

1277.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1277.DESCRIPTION: Improve the castle by submitting castle roof frame

1278.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1278.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 11th stage of the castle

1279.NAME: Make the frame
1279.DESCRIPTION: Make the frame in the workshop

128.NAME: Remove the rest of the swamp
128.DESCRIPTION: Remove the rest of the swamp to get more space for buildings and animals

1280.NAME: Make the mold for the bell
1280.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop section UNIQUE and make the mold for the bell

1287.NAME: Make a bell
1287.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop section UNIQUE and make the castle bell out of the mold, iron ore and copper ore

1288.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1288.DESCRIPTION: Improve the castle by submitting the bell

1289.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1289.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 12th stage of the castle

129.NAME: Craft iron shovel
129.DESCRIPTION: Craft iron shovel from the components, so that you can dig the swamp and gain new territories

1293.NAME: Thorns for Tussy
1293.DESCRIPTION: Plant and trim thorns on your island. Tussy needs some nails

1294.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1294.DESCRIPTION: Improve the castle by submitting the carpet

1295.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1295.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 13th stage of the castle

12957.NAME: Get dressed
12957.DESCRIPTION: After all these years, I haven't been able to find a pair of shoes. Dress warmer, change your look in the clothing section.

12958.NAME: Duck grain
12958.DESCRIPTION: Grow rice, wheat, corn or beans. Take a grain mix with you so you don't run out of feed.

12959.NAME: Party bus
12959.DESCRIPTION: Grabbing at the roots of the fir trees, you manage to reach the icebergs roof terrace. Eikite į Žiemos salą.

12960.NAME: Spruce branches
12960.DESCRIPTION: Island miracle! Spruce trees fall with one touch and grow back after a few hours. Christmas tree collection.

12961.NAME: Spruce decorations
12961.DESCRIPTION: The festive trees diligently collect miracles all year round. Christmas tree balls grow here like apples. Remove the balls.

12962.NAME: Spruce bushes
12962.DESCRIPTION: Decorate small clusters of Christmas trees with baubles. These trees will be sent to the Papuans. Cut down the decorated trees.

12963.NAME: Plant Christmas trees
12963.DESCRIPTION: Look in the tree or shrub section of the store and you will find freshly cut spruce branches.

12964.NAME: Decorate Christmas trees
12964.DESCRIPTION: To avoid having to walk twice, stock the cut Christmas trees. Cut the decorated Christmas trees.

12965.NAME: Trees for the Papuans
12965.DESCRIPTION: Give Papuan Ajo Christmas trees. Ajo will deliver and distribute them to others.

12966.NAME: Christmas trees for Orion
12966.DESCRIPTION: Orion is falling like a star from the sky. Help Orion collect enough Christmas trees for the distant lands of the sky.

12967.NAME: Another guest
12967.DESCRIPTION: It will be more interesting. You will soon see who the next Christmas tree is for. Give Christmas trees as gifts.

12968.NAME: Next guest
12968.DESCRIPTION: All Christmas tree bundles will be distributed fairly. This guest will take trees to the shore of the continent.

12969.NAME: Green bug
12969.DESCRIPTION: The insect waited patiently for its turn. Do you have any more Christmas trees? Can I have them, please?

12970.NAME: Giant hands
12970.DESCRIPTION: Can you guess who lives next door to Anastasia? The guest, placing a fir tree bouquet under his arm, says, "Thank you."

12971.NAME: Celebrities
12971.DESCRIPTION: A Christmas tree for Master Bruno and Princess Tara, as well as other celebrities. Give Christmas trees.

12972.NAME: Feeding reindeer
12972.DESCRIPTION: Feed and befriend the reindeer. They will definitely be able to help you later.

12973.NAME: Clap the horseshoes
12973.DESCRIPTION: The moment a deer's horseshoe rings a bell, you are overcome with a warm and cozy feeling. Use deer's horseshoes to ring the bells.

12974.NAME: Ice cracker
12974.DESCRIPTION: The sound of a bell breaks  forever frozen ice. Break the ice crystals into smaller but usable pieces.

12975.NAME: Special candle
12975.DESCRIPTION: If you get the candle ingredients from the forest gnome, you will receive an eternally burning Advent candle. Talk to the forest gnomes.

12976.NAME: Frozen hands
12976.DESCRIPTION: When sending mittens and tools to his nephew, the candle maker also includes candles. Talk to the elf workshop.

12977.NAME: Infinite light
12977.DESCRIPTION: Allows the elf workshop to work. Once the magic lantern is complete, hang it on the end of a pole. Complete any lantern pole.

12978.NAME: Elf tools
12978.DESCRIPTION: Some tools break, others freeze to the table. Do some gardening and you will get extra elven tools.

12979.NAME: Elfų žvėrys
12979.DESCRIPTION: Help take care of the elven animals by completing beast quests. You will receive mittens for your hard work.

1298.NAME: Lilies for the park
1298.DESCRIPTION: Place Royal lilies on your island (all of them must be there)

12980.NAME: Fix the lights
12980.DESCRIPTION: Collect materials and repair all the lights in time. You will get mittens and tools after completing other tasks.

12981.NAME: Pet the kittens
12981.DESCRIPTION: You don't need gloves to pet kittens. Someone forgot a pair of gloves here. Feed 60 cats.

12982.NAME: Pet the puppies
12982.DESCRIPTION: The sled dogs are trained. On command, they can fetch forgotten mittens. They feed puppies and dogs.

12983.NAME: Pet the fishes
12983.DESCRIPTION: The fish have cute knitted hats, and the fish don't need gloves. Feed the fish and you'll get extra mittens.

12984.NAME: Thanks to the goats
12984.DESCRIPTION: At the mention of gloves, a goat hits a tree with its horns, causing both snow and a pair of gloves to fall. Feed the goats.

12985.NAME: Knitted gloves
12985.DESCRIPTION: If you can't find your lost gloves, you can knit a new pair. Feed sheep, lambs, heifers, or cows.

12986.NAME: Medium size
12986.DESCRIPTION: The dwarf gloves fall off the meerkats' paws, but the elephants can't put them on. Feed the meerkats or elephants.

12987.NAME: Radish hammers
12987.DESCRIPTION: A pile of frozen radishes can replace a hammer. Dwarves can use anything. Harvest radish fields.

12988.NAME: Tomato pods
12988.DESCRIPTION: The little hammer needs a stem, and tomatoes have long stems. Harvest the tomatoes.

12989.NAME: Paint rollers
12989.DESCRIPTION: Fish scale patterns can be created by coloring with corn cobs. Harvest corn fields.

1299.NAME: Make flower beds for the castle
1299.DESCRIPTION: The castle park needs some flower hedges and rose beds

12990.NAME: Hollow eggplants
12990.DESCRIPTION: Dwarfs lack a toolbox, so get some eggplants to stick icicles into.

12991.NAME: Puffball combination
12991.DESCRIPTION: Pepper-filled puffballs are great hot air blowers. Plant from the store and harvest your winter pepper crop.

12992.NAME: Winter strawberries
12992.DESCRIPTION: Remember that all three special plants must be planted from the store. Collect strawberries.

12993.NAME: Christmas trees for fun
12993.DESCRIPTION: Giving Christmas trees brought as much joy as the process of decorating them. Keep 12 decorated small Christmas trees on the island.

12994.NAME: Breaking the ice
12994.DESCRIPTION: When you dig in the snow, bunnies come out. Ring the bell and dig under the slippery ice paths. UPGRADE.

12995.NAME: Sweets lover
12995.DESCRIPTION: All the other guests are already on the island. Once you've fed the new guests, you can fully dedicate yourself to the celebration.

13.NAME: Dig 4 fields
13.DESCRIPTION: Dig 4 fields, using the shovel. Click on the shovel (instrument panel) and then on a free spot where you want to make the field.

130.NAME: Give 12 tomatoes
130.DESCRIPTION: Grow and submit 12 tomatoes. In return you will get shells.

1300.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1300.DESCRIPTION: Improve the castle by submitting the decoration

1301.NAME: Finish upgrading the castle
1301.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 14th stage of the castle

1302.NAME: Upgrade the castle
1302.DESCRIPTION: Improve the castle by submitting the bundle of keys

1303.NAME: Get wool
1303.DESCRIPTION: Sometimes you can get wool by feeding a grown-up sheep. Get 1 unit of wool

1304.NAME: Activate sawmill
1304.DESCRIPTION: Activate the sawmill for 2 days. Tussy needs some timber

13048.NAME: Visit the island
13048.DESCRIPTION: You can reach Poinsettia Island by raft. The island is located north of the main island.

13049.NAME: Pet the martens
13049.DESCRIPTION: Pet the martens and get a chance to explore the labyrinth. Paths need looking glass, walls consume food.

1305.NAME: Chili for Tussy
1305.DESCRIPTION: Submit chili to Tussy, she will make a pizza

13050.NAME: Find the bunny
13050.DESCRIPTION: The rabbits in the maze will give you various useful trinkets. Find 3 of the 101 rabbits hiding in this maze.

13069.NAME: ==Qualification==
13069.DESCRIPTION: Whoever digs a hole for someone else will have to sell the dug furrows. It is possible to reach the island faster with a tractor.

13070.NAME: Bronze I from XII
13070.DESCRIPTION: Feed fully grown chickens. One rooster hides behind a baobab, but feeding the rooster will not count in this quest.

13071.NAME: Bronze II from XII
13071.DESCRIPTION: Think about moving. Have new Broad palms on your island at the same time.

13072.NAME: Bronze III of XII
13072.DESCRIPTION: Sell plank stools. Watch out for snowmen, if you use up hurycanes, you will have to postpone repairing the bridges.

13073.NAME: Bronze IV of XII
13073.DESCRIPTION: Sell adult hedgehogs. Wild mushrooms and berries can also be obtained from the seasonal packet - mushroom basket.

13074.NAME: Bronze V of XII
13074.DESCRIPTION: Plant thorn fields. It is very likely that half of these thorns will be useful to you in the next task.

13075.NAME: Bronze VI of XII
13075.DESCRIPTION: Sow tomatoes. By holding down the CTRL button on the keyboard, you can use the mouse wheel to move the hard-to-reach fields closer.

13076.NAME: Bronze VII of XII
13076.DESCRIPTION: Move the rooster. This task is easier to do if you clear a slightly larger patch of land for it.

13077.NAME: Bronze VIII of XII
13077.DESCRIPTION: Harvest pumpkins. Hover over the snowman to see what reward it offers.

13078.NAME: Bronze IX of XII
13078.DESCRIPTION: Build plank toilets. Silver and bronze snowmen are hidden under some ice crystals. Crystals can be upgraded.

13079.NAME: Bronze X from XII
13079.DESCRIPTION: Sell ​​any items from the bag. This exercise has at least two correct answers.

13080.NAME: Bronze XI of XII
13080.DESCRIPTION: Harvest any type of crop that sometimes produces green maggots.

13081.NAME: Bronza XII no XII
13081.DESCRIPTION: If you are looking for things to sell in a bag, then look to see if they are already somewhere in the bag. Get thorn branches any way you like.

13082.NAME: Silver I of XII
13082.DESCRIPTION: Sell adult bears. No quests will require pigs or dogs.

13083.NAME: Silver II of XII
13083.DESCRIPTION: Read all task texts carefully. Keep 194 wax figures on island at the same time.

13084.NAME: Silver III of XII
13084.DESCRIPTION: Prepare wild berry jam. We have carefully counted the free fields. Some of the blanks are harder to spot.

13085.NAME: Silver IV of XII
13085.DESCRIPTION: Make flower garlands. In the cup competition, large stockpiles of materials are always relevant.

13086.NAME: Silver V of XII
13086.DESCRIPTION: Feed the sloths and their babies. Feeding adult sloths gives much more experience.

13087.NAME: Silver VI of XII
13087.DESCRIPTION: Harvest the fields of red chilli. It rarely happens, but if you don't know where to spend energy, boards and nails will always come in handy.

13088.NAME: Silver VII of XII
13088.DESCRIPTION: Feed baby zebras. These animals do not eat reeds, but you already knew that.

13089.NAME: Silver VIII of XII
13089.DESCRIPTION: Place marble fountains. Rarely used, sometimes forgotten, this fountain displays your doubloon savings.

1309.NAME: Make a fishing-rod
1309.DESCRIPTION: Get all the necessary components and make a fishing-rod in the workshop section UNIQUE.

13090.NAME: Silver IX of XII
13090.DESCRIPTION: Make cuts in rubber trees. If you want to grow large rubber trees, remember that they grow 24 hours longer than tall palms.

13091.NAME: Silver X of XII
13091.DESCRIPTION: Keep 5 completed playgrounds on the field at the same time. There are exactly five squares on the island where these decorations can be placed.

13092.NAME: Silver XI of XII
13092.DESCRIPTION: Feed small or adult snakes. The special snake food recipe is available in the workshop when it is almost finished.

13093.NAME: Silver XII of XII
13093.DESCRIPTION: Plant grape seedlings from bag. If you want, you can leave this crop unharvested.

13094.NAME: Gold I of XII
13094.DESCRIPTION: Cut jungle or reeds. Note that you can also travel home using a tent. Getting stuck on this island is impossible.

13095.NAME: Gold II of XII
13095.DESCRIPTION: Makes cuts in volcanic rocks. Red hot rocks will also work for this task.

13096.NAME: Gold III of XII
13096.DESCRIPTION: Remove spiky leaves or thick and drooping creepers. Note that the flower pots can be moved after they are fixed.

13097.NAME: Gold IV of XII
13097.DESCRIPTION: Use Fire oil pumps. Rarely, but it also happens that you want to operate the sawmill, but the oil has run out.

13098.NAME: Gold V of XII
13098.DESCRIPTION: Build aquariums. If you are short of fish, remember, the smokehouse bonus improves all types of fishing.

13099.NAME: Gold VI of XII
13099.DESCRIPTION: Feed any type of fox. Hope you don't forget to cut down the broad palms, because it will be much more difficult to do later.

131.NAME: Start upgrading workshop
131.DESCRIPTION: Choose UPGRADE button on the workshop to start upgrading it

1310.NAME: Bait
1310.DESCRIPTION: You need a lobworm for the first fishing spot. Find it when digging furrows or buy it in the shop

13100.NAME: Gold VII of XII
13100.DESCRIPTION: Harvest the potato crop. Potato pancakes are one way to get a koala doll.

13101.NAME: Gold VIII of XII
13101.DESCRIPTION: Harvest lemon bushes. Unlike blueberry bushes, these bushes have always been walkable.

13102.NAME: Gold IX of XII
13102.DESCRIPTION: Complete the shell vaults. Stalagmites and oyster mushrooms have tripled the number of permitted activities on this island.

13103.NAME: Gold X of XII
13103.DESCRIPTION: Feed the kittens. Confusingly, however, this number is conveniently divisible by three.

13104.NAME: Gold XI of XII
13104.DESCRIPTION: Build sandstone figurines. If you're running low on supplies, it might be worth checking out the store.

13106.NAME: Stadium Island
13106.DESCRIPTION: All tasks of the cup competition will take place in a specially prepared stadium. Get on the raft and go there.

13107.NAME: Repair bridges
13107.DESCRIPTION: Pythons do not want to swim in icy water. Repair all bridges.

13108.NAME: Plant cacti
13108.DESCRIPTION: The pythons were so engrossed in the competition that the cacti withered. Repair the cactus flower pots on the island.

1311.NAME: Corn bait
1311.DESCRIPTION: Submit corn for the fisherman. It can be used as bait

13110.NAME: Fight for the cup
13110.DESCRIPTION: Your goal is to get all three competition snowglobes the fastest. Complete all gold, silver and bronze quests.

13111.NAME: Blessing of the Pythons
13111.DESCRIPTION: A strong wind can blow you off the bridge. Move the python and ask it for the Huricane talisman.

13112.NAME: Repair bridges
13112.DESCRIPTION: Embed the huricaine plaque in the foundations of the bridge, then the wind will not be dangerous for you. Repair one bridge.

13113.NAME: Silver break
13113.DESCRIPTION: Prepare some bottles of milk, please. In this way, you will clean the workshop for the next competition tasks.

13114.NAME: Promote Movement
13114.DESCRIPTION: Break this vicious cycle, enough dancing, it's time to move on. Sell adult hens.

13115.NAME: Divide into pairs
13115.DESCRIPTION: We offer a warm welcome to the birds on Festival Island. Divide the birds into pairs. Sell your adult roosters.

13116.NAME: Pink Cafe
13116.DESCRIPTION: Large flower pots and curtains. Visit Festival Island, where you can decorate cozy rooms.

13117.NAME: Romantic poems
13117.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the yellow pavilion. If you are not good at creating attractive lines, this pavilion will definitely come in handy.

13118.NAME: Looking for inspiration
13118.DESCRIPTION: Get hearts by using the pavilion, helping friends, or by finding silver and gold chests on Pinaki Island.

13119.NAME: Perfume Pavilion
13119.DESCRIPTION: You will need a separate space for mixing essential oils and water. Opens a striped pavilion.

1312.NAME: Make a fishing line
1312.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop section UNIQUE and make a fishing line

13120.NAME: Pleasant feelings
13120.DESCRIPTION: You don't see with your eyes, you feel with your heart. Work in the striped pavilion and spread pleasant feelings.

13121.NAME: Dig up bushes
13121.DESCRIPTION: Arrange a single cluster of bushes. Pleasant, like soft velvet. Twilight does not necessarily have to be bright, other sensations will create coziness.

13122.NAME: Master beaker
13122.DESCRIPTION: The dark pavilion is for sugar casting. Open this pavilion.

13123.NAME: Provide bait
13123.DESCRIPTION: Food and weather are two topics that can be discussed in any situation. Bring some romantic snacks.

13124.NAME: Clear the tables
13124.DESCRIPTION: After dusting, place snacks on the table. Polish any cocktail tables.

13125.NAME: Summon the spirit
13125.DESCRIPTION: Open a shop on the main island and summon the spirit of Valentine. If you upgrade three more tables, you will earn more poems.

13126.NAME: Return to caffee
13126.DESCRIPTION: There is still so much to do, you can see it for yourself on Festival isle.

13127.NAME: Finish renovation
13127.DESCRIPTION: Each fully set table will give you a poem. This way you can earn even more spirits, if you choose to do so.

13128.NAME: Ear Plugs
13128.DESCRIPTION: The songs sound pleasant, sirens are just a myth. Better not to risk it, get wool for your ear canals.

13129.NAME: Better to See Once
13129.DESCRIPTION: The skies are clear, visibility is good. Sailing to the island will be a breeze. Head to the Golden Coral Island.

13130.NAME: Chop Nut Trees
13130.DESCRIPTION: There are a few nut trees on the island. Don't waste the collected items; nuts and moss will be useful later.

13131.NAME: Remove Corals
13131.DESCRIPTION: They look nice, but you'll quickly find yourself without pants when the sharp corals tear your belt. Cut the corals.

13132.NAME: Underwater Mushrooms
13132.DESCRIPTION: Deep-sea mycelium grows in the dark. Eradicate the mushrooms before nightfall; it will be much harder later.

13133.NAME: Adella's Ideas
13133.DESCRIPTION: Cross tulips with purple stems. Such flowers will last longer. Plant tulips from the store. Collect 20 crossed flowers.

13134.NAME: Saffron Flowers
13134.DESCRIPTION: Saffron is a crocus flower. The stamens in the middle of the flower are used as a spice. Harvest the saffron flower crop.

13135.NAME: Flax Flowers
13135.DESCRIPTION: Sow and harvest flax seeds. First blue, then golden, just like this island. Yes, it's Adella's whim, this task has no practical benefit.

13136.NAME: Preserving Ideas
13136.DESCRIPTION: If fragrant flowers were filled into wine bottles, maybe it would help? Obtain wine bottles.

13137.NAME: Messenger
13137.DESCRIPTION: Delfina wants to deliver its ideas to Charlotte. Feed the goats and carve a path through the golden corals.

13138.NAME: Damaged Fish
13138.DESCRIPTION: Removing the algae layer reveals fish entangled in the green mass. Release the cats on the island, sell them.

13139.NAME: Honey Component
13139.DESCRIPTION: Build beehives. You will need a LOT of sweeteners.

13140.NAME: Ant Source
13140.DESCRIPTION: Ant acid has interesting chemical properties. Feed the bears or sloths.

13141.NAME: Chop Palms
13141.DESCRIPTION: No great boards will come from nut trees. Chop palms so you can build barrels later.

13142.NAME: Saffron Wine
13142.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop and make some saffron wine bottles.

13143.NAME: Saffron Stamens
13143.DESCRIPTION: Charlotte insists that saffron should be watered with fresh water. The salty ocean waves only harm these flowers.

13144.NAME: Saffron Barrels
13144.DESCRIPTION: These barrels Charlotte will keep for herself, fill the barrels with saffron wine.

13145.NAME: Berry Mushrooms
13145.DESCRIPTION: Harvest the mushrooms. These mushrooms grow right above underwater eruptions and contain coal.

13146.NAME: Bud Wine
13146.DESCRIPTION: The plants growing in the water are rich in water. The valuable part is the flowers. Make several bottles of bud wine in the workshop.

13147.NAME: Bud Barrels
13147.DESCRIPTION: Adella would gladly take home fragrant bud barrels. Find the right barrels and fill them.

13148.NAME: Algae in Bottles
13148.DESCRIPTION: Keep in mind, this is not preservation. This means the algae must not be boiled. Make Golden algae wine in the workshop.

13149.NAME: Flower Experts
13149.DESCRIPTION: The cross between lilies and tulips looks like ordinary tulips, only the buds are different. Plant and harvest these flowers.

1315.NAME: Bone for the fishhook
1315.DESCRIPTION: Get a well-shaped bone for making the fishhook. You can find it by digging furrows or searching through bushes.

13150.NAME: Golden Barrels
13150.DESCRIPTION: Delfina leisurely enjoys the island's scents. She wouldn't mind some Gold wine barrels, yes. Build barrels.

13151.NAME: Strengthen Roots
13151.DESCRIPTION: It's good that the island is sinking, the main thing is that it doesn't fall apart during the sinking. Plant green saffron from the bag.

13152.NAME: Saffron Tendrils
13152.DESCRIPTION: Building barrels will yield even more green saffron tendrils. Obtain special wine bottles in the workshop.

13153.NAME: Save the Bees
13153.DESCRIPTION: There's still a long way to disaster, the water is only up to the ankles. Evacuate the bees in time using beehives.

13154.NAME: Island Compaction
13154.DESCRIPTION: To prevent the island from falling apart, plant carrots. As the carrots expand, the island's foundation will be compacted.

13155.NAME: Chasing Umbrellas
13155.DESCRIPTION: Eliminate the pests trying to drown this island. Release the floating birds, feed the ducks.

13156.NAME: Strengthen the Island
13156.DESCRIPTION: You will get green flowers by completing other tasks. Plant more green saffron, ensure the island doesn't fall apart.

13157.NAME: Row with Paws
13157.DESCRIPTION: Put the bears to work, feed them. With wide paws, the island quickly gains speed, but who will steer the island?

13158.NAME: Steering Keel
13158.DESCRIPTION: Line up branch tables on the shore and turn them in one direction. A large raft needs a large keel. Build branch tables.

13159.NAME: Next Planting
13159.DESCRIPTION: Each strengthening of the island reduces the arable area on the island. Plant green saffron.

1316.NAME: Make a fishhook
1316.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop section UNIQUE and make a fishhook out of bone

13160.NAME: Wine Gift
13160.DESCRIPTION: Farewells must be celebrated. Sell wine bottles filled with the scents of this island from the bag.

13161.NAME: Sink the Island
13161.DESCRIPTION: Load the storage sheds with stones and watch the island go down with a bubble. Build!

13162.NAME: Last Ropes
13162.DESCRIPTION: Under the weight of the storage sheds, the island bends slightly. Plant the last saffron. Count all the green flowers.

13163.NAME: Bouquet for Home
13163.DESCRIPTION: As the island sinks, the first harvest from the green saffron begins to come in. Take machetes and cut some of these flowers as a memento.

13164.NAME: Hand in wool
13164.DESCRIPTION: These tasks hardly require any real effort. Get Nadine some wool.

13165.NAME: Hand in nails
13165.DESCRIPTION: To make the work go faster, you will need needles and pins. At Nadine's request, provide nails.

13172.NAME: Catalog
13172.DESCRIPTION: A design magazine has fallen into Papuan's hands. If you want to take a look, make 80 cuts in rubber trees.

13173.NAME: Travel and Explore
13173.DESCRIPTION: After finishing flipping through the magazine, you return it, sit on a raft, and head to where the photos were taken.

13174.NAME: Visit the Construction Island
13174.DESCRIPTION: Not all props were dismantled. Press USE on the new building, visit the alley.

13175.NAME: Feed the Turtles
13175.DESCRIPTION: The turtles were background actors. Maybe it's worth talking? Feed the turtles.

13176.NAME: Feed the Hedgehogs
13176.DESCRIPTION: The hedgehogs earned extra by building decorations. At least someone has seen the catalog furniture. Feed the hedgehogs.

13177.NAME: Turn Over Stones
13177.DESCRIPTION: First, you need to catch some shiny insects. See those stones? Try to lure the insects with peas.

13178.NAME: Shear chrysanths
13178.DESCRIPTION: Insects will only shine if they feel at home. Wrap the insects in chrysanths flowers, use these bushes.

13179.NAME: Check the Pyramids
13179.DESCRIPTION: With bright lanterns, we can go underground. Remember this cycle sequence, it will be useful for you. Descend underground.

1318.NAME: Finding a rod
1318.DESCRIPTION: Cut 3 trees of any kind to find a solid branch that can be used as a fishing rod.

13180.NAME: Pick Berries
13180.DESCRIPTION: Pick berries, and at the same time, get lichen. You will get additional cups by giving lichen to totems.

13181.NAME: Use Totems
13181.DESCRIPTION: These spirits will help plan. Use the volcano spirit totems, give them lichen so the wind doesn't whistle through the totem cracks.

13182.NAME: Use Tropical Palms
13182.DESCRIPTION: Use tusks to shear the pink bananas from the tropical palms. Remember, palms give red bananas.

13183.NAME: Shear Bushes, Not Trees
13183.DESCRIPTION: Consensus. Before we start the work, we need to establish order. Remove jungles, pointy-leaf plants, thorns, or store thorns.

13184.NAME: Feed the Elephants
13184.DESCRIPTION: By feeding the animals, you will get plans on how to civilize the area. You will need many such ideas.

13185.NAME: Buy and Grow Wheat
13185.DESCRIPTION: If you make a mistake, you'll have to wait until the wheat rots, so plant and harvest EXACTLY 27 wheat plots.

13186.NAME: Return to the Alley
13186.DESCRIPTION: Armed with ideas, furniture, and tools - you are determined to fix the models. Press USE on the New Building.

13187.NAME: Build the Eastern Manor
13187.DESCRIPTION: With the help of the Volcano god and volcano spirits, the idea is set. Start work on arranging the manor.

13188.NAME: Carve the Baobab Tower
13188.DESCRIPTION: Under Gonzo's supervision, a simple settlement is created from the large stump. There is still room to expand. Fix the stump.

13189.NAME: Cut Trees
13189.DESCRIPTION: Cut any trees. Choosing this task will emphasize agriculture and tree cutting.

13190.NAME: Get Sparks
13190.DESCRIPTION: This time, you will get peas from tree cutting. From peas to insects, then chrysanths, and finish the cycle in the mines.

13191.NAME: Choose the Baobab Line
13191.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop and make a choice. Be careful! Making one recipe will irreversibly LOSE the OTHER recipe.

13192.NAME: Cut Stones to Get Parts
13192.DESCRIPTION: Get volcanic rocks. Choosing this task will emphasize animal feeding and stone cutting.

13193.NAME: Get Asian Manor Parts
13193.DESCRIPTION: You will get furniture from berries and animals. Of course, you will also need pink bananas and lichen from totems.

13194.NAME: Choose the Manor Line
13194.DESCRIPTION: Open the workshop and make a choice. Be careful! Making one recipe will irreversibly LOSE the OTHER recipe.

13196.NAME: Store Firewood
13196.DESCRIPTION: Store the chopped trees in wood storage, build them. There's so much firewood that a branch storage won't suffice this time.

13197.NAME: Craftsmen Feeding
13197.DESCRIPTION: The craftsmen attracted by Gonzo are used to spicy foods. Harvest chili and get special materials.

13198.NAME: Clear the Clearing
13198.DESCRIPTION: Free up more space for the craftsmen. Cut jungles, fallen leaves, or store thorns.

13199.NAME: Harvest Strawberries
13199.DESCRIPTION: The craftsmen work at a brisk pace. Harvest the strawberry crop and get additional materials for construction.

132.NAME: Complete the workshop
132.DESCRIPTION: Build and complete the 3rd level workshop to unlock clay era formulas

13200.NAME: Fish for Sea Cabbage
13200.DESCRIPTION: Gonzo informs you that the sea cabbage, which the craftsmen carve so diligently, has run out. Fish for sea cabbage.

13201.NAME: Cut Trees
13201.DESCRIPTION: The wood from the local island is accustomed to the local climate, so cut trees right on this island.

13202.NAME: Harvest Flax
13202.DESCRIPTION: The tower will need curtains, bedspreads, and other fabrics. Harvest the flax fields.

13203.NAME: Feed Zebras
13203.DESCRIPTION: Help Gonzo with feeding the zebras. Meanwhile, Gonzo will find more sparks.

13204.NAME: Build Gazebos
13204.DESCRIPTION: From here on, it's all in your hands, the craftsmen have finished their work. Let the craftsmen rest, build gazebos.

13205.NAME: Excess Materials
13205.DESCRIPTION: You won't need the territory plans. Convert the plans into useful beams. Use the recipe.

13206.NAME: Saw Recipe
13206.DESCRIPTION: Prepare saws in the workshop for sawing the baobab tower. To get the components, you'll have to bustle around the island.

13207.NAME: Build the Tower
13207.DESCRIPTION: A long journey ahead, complete one-third of the tower to gain additional reputation.

13208.NAME: Feed the Ostriches
13208.DESCRIPTION: The volcanic totem spirits see and hear everything. This is a good time to sell the ostriches. Feed these birds.

13209.NAME: Use Mines
13209.DESCRIPTION: Rare stones are a good trading material. Use the claypit, stone mine, or gem mines.

13210.NAME: Stone Construction
13210.DESCRIPTION: The spirits don't have sore feet, but you could use paths. Restore the ancient paths, or honor the totems by building sandstone figurines.

13211.NAME: Feed the Meerkats
13211.DESCRIPTION: In fact, the spirits continue to order things from the catalog. Feed the meerkats to cover the costs.

13212.NAME: Harvest Tomatoes
13212.DESCRIPTION: The spirits acquire everything in large quantities, baskets of tomatoes will be needed. Harvest this crop.

13213.NAME: Get Volcanic Rock
13213.DESCRIPTION: The spirits are engrossed in trading, who will help the Volcano god? Get volcanic rocks.

13214.NAME: Sell Adult Ducks
13214.DESCRIPTION: Barter with the catalog authors. Provide duck down. Sell adult ducks.

13215.NAME: Feed the Foxes
13215.DESCRIPTION: Aren't the totem spirits of a particularly red origin, they are very friendly with foxes. Sell the foxes.

13216.NAME: Use Beehives
13216.DESCRIPTION: This is the last contract, the totems have run out of buyers. Use beehives to get honey.

13217.NAME: Excess Materials
13217.DESCRIPTION: You already have a plan where to hang the lanterns. Use the excess material recipe.

13218.NAME: Beams in the Workshop
13218.DESCRIPTION: Prepare beams in the workshop for strengthening the manor. To get materials, you'll have to bustle around the island.

13219.NAME: Build the Manor
13219.DESCRIPTION: A long journey ahead, complete one-third of the manor to gain additional reputation.

1322.NAME: Let's fish!
1322.DESCRIPTION: Try out the fishing spot on the small peninsula

13220.NAME: How to Get Plans
13220.DESCRIPTION: Feed the animals, then harvest the fruit palms, and feed the animals again. From totems to berries and back. This way, you'll get blueprints.

13221.NAME: How to Get Savannah Rhythms I
13221.DESCRIPTION: Plant EXACTLY as many crop plots as you have sparks. Spend the obtained peas on insect stones.

13222.NAME: How to Get Savannah Rhythms II
13222.DESCRIPTION: Insects can be spent on marigolds. The obtained lanterns can be used in the mines. Explore the workshop, bustle wisely.

13223.NAME: Build the Monument
13223.DESCRIPTION: To complete the entire monument requires a huge amount of work. Each level gives rewards. Evaluate your strengths.

13226.NAME: April first ?
13226.DESCRIPTION: Let me hold 100 of your rubies.

13227.DESCRIPTION: But if I ask to hold 200 rubies, will you let me hold them?

13228.NAME: lirpA 1
13228.DESCRIPTION: Will you really trust me to hold 300 rubies? Strange, but if that's what you want, just hand them over.

1323.NAME: Go to Toby's island
1323.DESCRIPTION: Use the raft to go to Toby's island

13230.NAME: April 001
13230.DESCRIPTION: Spend, but do not sell striped angelfish.

13232.NAME: April 0001
13232.DESCRIPTION: Murmuring, murmuring, 20 murmuring, pig! Go and figure it out!

13233.NAME: April 00001
13233.DESCRIPTION: Do you know what things the volcano god eats? Spend these things 120 times.

13234.NAME: April 10000
13234.DESCRIPTION: Sow seeds in the furrows that you will get from another task. If you don't want to wait, you can try to guess.

13235.NAME: April 101
13235.DESCRIPTION: Find the food recipe in the workshop section, according to the number of dots in the first line. Prepare this food.

13236.NAME: April 111
13236.DESCRIPTION: Count the dots in the second line. Count the animals in the shop, find this number and feed them the same number of times.

13237.NAME: April 31
13237.DESCRIPTION: The number of dots in the third line is the order number in the decor section. Finish building this decor the same number of times.

13239.NAME: Build the Monument
13239.DESCRIPTION: To complete the entire monument requires a huge amount of work. Each level gives rewards. Evaluate your strengths.

1324.NAME: Talk to Toby
1324.DESCRIPTION: Go to Toby and click on him. He will tell you something

13240.NAME: Greenery
13240.DESCRIPTION: Prepare straw bales, the insect will surely be pleased with fresh greenery.

13241.NAME: Horse Mischief
13241.DESCRIPTION: If the foal has nothing to eat, it will eat hay. Head to Festival Island and check out the gnawed hay.

13242.NAME: Knock on the Stump
13242.DESCRIPTION: Peace, just peace! It can all be fixed. Press UPGRADE on the stump.

13243.NAME: Feed the Spiders
13243.DESCRIPTION: The spider - weaver will transform into an insect - spinner after intensive feeding. You can obtain wool from the flyer.

13244.NAME: Feed the Koalas
13244.DESCRIPTION: The baby koalas satisfied their hunger by chewing on the woven fence. Feed the koalas to prevent the problem from recurring.

13245.NAME: Feed the Foals
13245.DESCRIPTION: Don't gnaw the branch you're sitting on, but the foals were SO hungry. Feed the horses and foals.

13246.NAME: Build Fences
13246.DESCRIPTION: The posts won't need to be dug anew, so half the work is already done. Repair some sections of the fence.

13247.NAME: Build Bales
13247.DESCRIPTION: The straw reserves were also eaten, mainly in the form of bales. Repair the straw bales.

13248.NAME: Build Cottages
13248.DESCRIPTION: Repair two of the damaged straw cottages. Currently, they are held together by promises of goodwill.

13249.NAME: Transform the Spiders
13249.DESCRIPTION: When you fully supply all the spiders with weaving materials, the flying weaver will come to their aid.

1325.NAME: Reviving desert plants
1325.DESCRIPTION: Revive couple of red flower cactus by watering them.

13250.NAME: Grow the Koalas
13250.DESCRIPTION: Adult koalas are better at controlling their appetite. Complete the feeding of all koalas. Grow all the koalas.

13251.NAME: Horse Maturity
13251.DESCRIPTION: Grow all the foals into horses.

13252.NAME: Build All Fences
13252.DESCRIPTION: Finish repairing all sections of the fence. This task will count even if these works were done prematurely.

13253.NAME: Restore Bales
13253.DESCRIPTION: Fresh bales will not only look nice but also smell like freshly cut grass.

13254.NAME: Repair Cottages
13254.DESCRIPTION: The winged spinner has several workshops on the island, but they have been stingy with shelters.

13255.NAME: Build Colossi
13255.DESCRIPTION: The insect doesn't know how to relax. Pearls serve as a reminder, when too many are collected, it's time for a vacation. Repair the colossi.

13256.NAME: Use Weaver Workshops
13256.DESCRIPTION: With more paws, you can operate multiple spindles simultaneously. Use the weaver workshop.

13257.NAME: Feed the Flyers
13257.DESCRIPTION: The warm season is approaching, the spinner is making shirts and shortening its wool. Feed the diligent spinner.

13258.NAME: Time for Cats!
13258.DESCRIPTION: One of the Soft Moths has moved in with your cats. Feed the cats and kittens.

13259.NAME: Time for a Nap!
13259.DESCRIPTION: Having acquired several hammocks, it proudly announces that its name is Fred. Sell the hammocks.

1326.NAME: Bananas
1326.DESCRIPTION: The camel loves eating bananas. Submit bananas

13260.NAME: Time for Snacks!
13260.DESCRIPTION: And, without unnecessary manners, devours several radishes from your patch. It will stay here. Harvest the radish crop.

13261.NAME: Dye Saving
13261.DESCRIPTION: Harvest the blueberry bushes, or at least what's left of them, otherwise you'll have to dye the eggs with onion skins.

13262.NAME: In the Shadow of Willows
13262.DESCRIPTION: The sun climbs higher but the shadow doesn't get shorter. Get on the raft and find out what's casting this huge shadow.

13263.NAME: Shake the Willows
13263.DESCRIPTION: You shake the willow tree, and eggs and other round things fall like apples, burying themselves in the ground. Not even a shell is left to pick up.

13264.NAME: Dig and Search
13264.DESCRIPTION: You can only dig in the green area. Create fields, watch if the falling eggs can hide like potatoes.

13265.NAME: Swinging Ant
13265.DESCRIPTION: Ants don't like swinging, they can catch the wind in other ways. Perform actions with 18 ants.

13266.NAME: Dance in Circles
13266.DESCRIPTION: Ants replace swinging with carousel spinning. It sounds spring-like. Use shell carousels.

13267.NAME: Capture Joy
13267.DESCRIPTION: There are several started decorations on the island. Capture the joy of spring by performing one building action.

13268.NAME: Plant the bunnies
13268.DESCRIPTION: As soon as the big willow touches the ground, it turns into bunnies. Plant bunny scuts from the store.

13269.NAME: Chip in the Air
13269.DESCRIPTION: A bunny is not a mole, you can try to catch it. Hunt the bunnies that try to escape.

1327.NAME: Coconuts
1327.DESCRIPTION: Coconuts are an essential part of the camel's meal. Submit coconuts

13270.NAME: Work for the bunny
13270.DESCRIPTION: Emerging from the ground, you see a bunny, with an egg in each paw. The bunny says these eggs need to be hidden. Submit the spring bunnies.

13271.NAME: Willow Carousel
13271.DESCRIPTION: Note, there are three different carousels, each requiring different materials. Try the bottom carousel.

13272.NAME: Keep Spinning
13272.DESCRIPTION: The bunny goes in circles and the hanging eggs rattle in the carousel. With each turn, willows fall. Spin the willow carousel.

13273.NAME: Collect Willows
13273.DESCRIPTION: When the actions end, the bunny starts spinning this rattle again, the carousel will never end. Get more willows.

13274.NAME: Restore the Totem
13274.DESCRIPTION: Currently, the totem looks more like a gnawed path. Build a tower from eggs, repair the started totem.

13275.NAME: Restore the Basket
13275.DESCRIPTION: With diligent hands and work, everything can be achieved. Create egg baskets from bird nests.

13276.NAME: Restore the Pedestal
13276.DESCRIPTION: Ants are puzzled about where to place the eggs. Arrange the eggs in a bowl and place them on the pedestal, repair the pedestals.

13277.NAME: Get Eggs A
13277.DESCRIPTION: More colors are more fun. Catch bunnnies from the bunny egg fields. You'll need a lot more of these eggs.

13278.NAME: Get Eggs B
13278.DESCRIPTION: The ants note where each egg was obtained, but they encourage getting more. Dig in the blue egg fields.

13279.NAME: Count the  bunnies
13279.DESCRIPTION: In general, the ants think  bunnies created chaos. Count how many times you managed to catch the cheerful little bunny.

1328.NAME: Corn
1328.DESCRIPTION: The camel would definitely like some corn. Submit corn

13280.NAME: Basket Dance
13280.DESCRIPTION: The bunny keeps spinning and the carousels rattle. Ants count how many rounds the bunny has made with the carousels. Get baskets.

13281.NAME: Chicken Dance
13281.DESCRIPTION: The faster the carousel spins, the more eggs rattle. And suddenly a golden chicken falls out. Help the ants count these chickens.

13282.NAME: Willow Dance
13282.DESCRIPTION: Ants suspect that the willows are thrown by the bunnies, not the carousel. Whatever the case, the count must be recorded.

13283.NAME: Restore the Totems
13283.DESCRIPTION: There are two totems on the island, for the bunnies to rest easy, you'll have to repair both.

13284.NAME: Restore the Pedestals
13284.DESCRIPTION: Ants have prepared ten bases for pedestals. Complete all ten.

13285.NAME: Restore the Baskets
13285.DESCRIPTION: Five beautiful baskets, just asking to be filled with eggs. Repair all the egg baskets.

13286.NAME: Easter bunny
13286.DESCRIPTION: Simultaneously keep 52 fully grown rabbits on the island.

13287.NAME: Green scut
13287.DESCRIPTION: Plant several green scuts from the store. Depending on the mood, the bunny may dig up eggs of other colors.

13288.NAME: Egg Rattles
13288.DESCRIPTION: If you tie two different eggs at the ends of a string, you'll get golden chickens, spin the next carousel.

13289.NAME: Basket Carousel
13289.DESCRIPTION: To build island decorations, all kinds of things will be needed. After pulling the bunny scuts, spin the basket carousel.

1329.NAME: Make a saddle
1329.DESCRIPTION: Make a saddle for the camel in the workshop section UNIQUE

13290.NAME: Higher is Better
13290.DESCRIPTION: Unable to agree on the best height, the ants continue to build upwards. Complete one Easter totem.

13291.NAME: Some Baskets
13291.DESCRIPTION: Continue filling the started baskets. Each small decoration brings the holidays closer.

13292.NAME: More Bowls
13292.DESCRIPTION: Ants promise to paint the pedestals. Place marble plates on the pedestals and decorate them with willows. Build the pedestals.

13293.NAME: Shards
13293.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for shards and spring willows.

13294.NAME: Ancient Keys
13294.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for ancient keys and spring willows.

13295.NAME: Bananas
13295.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for bananas and spring willows.

13296.NAME: Blueberries
13296.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for blueberries and spring willows.

13297.NAME: Grapes
13297.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for grapes and spring willows.

13298.NAME: Solid Stone
13298.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for solid stones and spring willows.

13299.NAME: Tendrils
13299.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for tendrils and golden chickens.

133.NAME: Craft first 4 bricks
133.DESCRIPTION: Craft your first clay bricks. You can follow their progress in the new TIMED CRAFTING section

1330.NAME: Putting on the saddle
1330.DESCRIPTION: Adorn the camel with the saddle

13300.NAME: Milk
13300.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for milk and golden chickens.

13301.NAME: Obsidian Shards
13301.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for obsidian shards and golden chickens.

13302.NAME: Forest Mushrooms
13302.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for forest mushrooms and golden chickens.

13303.NAME: Coal
13303.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for coal and golden chickens.

13304.NAME: Salmon
13304.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for salmon and golden chickens.

13305.NAME: Thorny Branches
13305.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for thorny branches and baskets.

13306.NAME: Wool
13306.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for wool and baskets.

13307.NAME: Bones
13307.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for bones and baskets.

13308.NAME: Forest Berries
13308.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for forest berries and baskets.

13309.NAME: Royal Purple
13309.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for royal purples and baskets.

13310.NAME: Ants
13310.DESCRIPTION: Exchange 300 cheerful bunnies for ants and baskets.

13311.NAME: Blue pickaxes
13311.DESCRIPTION: Achieve great things and submit 3000 cheerful rabbits, then you can receive an additional reward - 275 blue pickaxes.

13312.NAME: Reptile Food
13312.DESCRIPTION: Achieve great things and submit 3000 cheerful rabbits, then you can receive an additional reward - 150 reptile food.

13314.NAME: Palm Souvenir
13314.DESCRIPTION: Achieve great things and submit 3000 cheerful rabbits, then you can receive an additional reward - 20 palm souvenirs.

13321.NAME: Babies at home
13321.DESCRIPTION: You don't have time to watch this touching scene because the babies at home are hungry. Feed the puppies or kittens.

13322.NAME: Downstream
13322.DESCRIPTION: In warm weather, you can drift downstream. Lie back and let the current take you to the baby island. Travel.

13323.NAME: Wreath for mom
13323.DESCRIPTION: Pick sunflowers and weave a beautiful wreath for the otter mom.

13324.NAME: Sleeping child
13324.DESCRIPTION: The baby is sleeping, so the otter mom gives you a locomotive as a thank you for the wreath. Get locomotives.

13325.NAME: Kite tail
13325.DESCRIPTION: Only the tail of the kite remains in the air. That's okay, these strings can be used to weave more wreaths. Pick sunflowers.

13326.NAME: Choo, choo, choo.
13326.DESCRIPTION: If you lost the locomotive, ask the otter mom to get more locomotives. Spend locomotives playing with the kiwi.

13327.NAME: Kiwi, come for lunch!
13327.DESCRIPTION: The kiwi happily rolls the wagons, but it's lunchtime. Wash your hands in the well or the sea-cabbage bank.

13328.NAME: Feed the ducklings
13328.DESCRIPTION: The ducklings are energetically running around the corner of the garden. Feed the ducklings 40 times.

13329.NAME: Feed the lambs
13329.DESCRIPTION: The lamb babies are carefully nibbling around the paper kite. Feed the lambs 40 times. Other baby tasks will also provide string for the wreath.

13330.NAME: Feed the calves
13330.DESCRIPTION: The calves have lost their fears and are little rascals. But you have to love them all. Feed the calves 40 times. Look, a string!

13331.NAME: Get the lambs
13331.DESCRIPTION: Meanwhile, the anteater mom arrives on the island. The fresh air of the island will help lull the baby to sleep. Complete the dream sheep tasks.

13332.NAME: Lullaby, lullaby
13332.DESCRIPTION: With patience, song after song, the little anteater is lulled to sleep. Feed the anteater family.

13333.NAME: Playful cubs
13333.DESCRIPTION: Some anteater cubs find locomotives and completely forget about sleep. Lull almost all the little anteaters.

13334.NAME: Harvest radishes
13334.DESCRIPTION: The radishes have just come in and are very fresh. Shall we put them in the cold soup? Harvest 180 radishes.

13335.NAME: SALT!
13335.DESCRIPTION: Something is missing in the cold soup - SALT! How can you do without it? Sell salt from the bag 280 times.

13336.NAME: Feed the piglets
13336.DESCRIPTION: The naughty piglets have gotten into the front room and devoured the entire pot of soup. Feed the piglets 90 times.

13337.NAME: Corn
13337.DESCRIPTION: Plant and grow corn fields. They are the foundation. Harvest 90 corn fields.

13338.NAME: Corn pies
13338.DESCRIPTION: Harvest, dry, clean, and head to the kitchen. Make corn pies 40 times.

13339.NAME: Buy machetes
13339.DESCRIPTION: With the food produced, you can go to the store and buy machetes 12 times. Jungle - beware!

1334.NAME: Fabric
1334.DESCRIPTION: You need fabric to make the blanket. Submit linen or wool fabric

13340.NAME: Arthropod collection
13340.DESCRIPTION: To go fishing, you will need to get bait. Exchange the arthropod collection 3 times.

13341.NAME: Smokehouse bonus
13341.DESCRIPTION: Of course, let's activate the smokehouse. You can also do this with neighbors. Activate the smokehouse bonus.

13342.NAME: Get mussels
13342.DESCRIPTION: Then, together with your little friend, go fishing for mussels. Get 90 mussels.

13343.NAME: Earn wreaths
13343.DESCRIPTION: To express gratitude to the otter mom, get some flower wreaths by completing the wreath task.

13344.NAME: Spend the wreath
13344.DESCRIPTION: The otter mom lines up the once lost rattles on the shore. The found toys will help to fall asleep. Feed the otter moms.

13345.NAME: Buy prams
13345.DESCRIPTION: Lull with a toy, then look for prams in the store. Place the baby prams on the island.

13346.NAME: Sweet pea bouquet
13346.DESCRIPTION: While bustling at home, strings are not needed. Weave a sweet pea wreath. Plant beans from the bag in the furrows.

13347.NAME: Store flowers
13347.DESCRIPTION: Pretty flowers can be found in the store. This would be an atypical wreath. Break the piggy bank, sell the shell storage.

13348.NAME: Moss flowers
13348.DESCRIPTION: The small moss flowers form a small but beautiful wreath. Feed the hedgehogs to get these wreaths.

13349.NAME: Straw silence
13349.DESCRIPTION: Build haystacks to muffle noise. If a child cries, it can wake up other napping babies.

1335.NAME: Colour
1335.DESCRIPTION: You need to paint the fabric in vivid colours. Submit paint

13350.NAME: Build prams
13350.DESCRIPTION: Make sure the prams are warm and the sun doesn't shine in the face. If needed, fix the prams. Build and finish the prams.

13351.NAME: Put toddlers to sleep
13351.DESCRIPTION: Take the toddlers out of the prams. Gently rock them and head towards the cradle. Sing to the pea children.

13353.NAME: Market Swap
13353.DESCRIPTION: Make jam or mushroom preserves. You might be able to trade one jam for another at the local market.

13354.NAME: Pirate Trap
13354.DESCRIPTION: The raft is sailing along a well-known trade waterway. Halfway through, pirates force you to dock at a remote island's shore. Travel.

13355.NAME: Chicory Traders
13355.DESCRIPTION: Traders paid the pirates with seeds. Find the barrels of chicory and empty them.

13356.NAME: Don't Expect Taxes
13356.DESCRIPTION: You can't give away the jam; you'll need it yourself. Sow and harvest wheat fields, maybe that'll be enough.

13357.NAME: Chicory Taxes
13357.DESCRIPTION: Sow chicory, you'll get seeds from barrels and tasks. You can't know if wheat alone will suffice this time.

13358.NAME: Pea Traders
13358.DESCRIPTION: Bane complains that in spring, the villagers spent all their money on seeds. Empty the barrels of peas.

13359.NAME: Beans for Bane
13359.DESCRIPTION: Bane is not a farmer, and he won't be able to eat such a quantity of peas and beans. Harvest the bean crop.

1336.NAME: Beads
1336.DESCRIPTION: The fabric needs some nice decorations. Submit bone beads

13360.NAME: Pea Taxes
13360.DESCRIPTION: Sow peas, you'll get seeds from barrels and tasks. Better underground than rotten. Bane entrusts you with sowing peas.

13361.NAME: Barrels with Sweet Potatoes
13361.DESCRIPTION: Empty the barrels with sweet potatoes. Pirates are tired of eating the same turnip every single day.

13362.NAME: Corn Bread
13362.DESCRIPTION: Bane is deathly tired of sweet potatoes, so the pirate has sown corn. Help harvest this crop.

13363.NAME: Sow Sweet Potatoes
13363.DESCRIPTION: Where has Emett gone? He surely knows how to grow crops. Sow sweet potatoes, you'll get seeds from barrels and tasks.

13364.NAME: Almazo Trades
13364.DESCRIPTION: Sow chicory only from the store. Confident of success, Almazo bought additional chicory seeds.

13365.NAME: Sow Rhubarb
13365.DESCRIPTION: Traders promised to trade all grown chicory for rhubarb. Sow rhubarb from the store.

13366.NAME: Harvest Rhubarb
13366.DESCRIPTION: Almazo likes rhubarb, but the cunning traders only gave seeds. Grow rhubarb and harvest the rhubarb crop.

13367.NAME: Almazo's Warehouse
13367.DESCRIPTION: This building was built to store riches, but Almazo thinks rhubarb is a good gain. Place rhubarb in the warehouse.

13368.NAME: Bane on a Pea
13368.DESCRIPTION: Bane hates peas, but Almazo has bought more seeds. Eliminate this plague. Sow peas from the store.

13369.NAME: Sorrel Harvest
13369.DESCRIPTION: Almazo promised Bane sorrel, that's the only reason Bane tolerated the peas. Harvest the sorrel crop. You'll find seeds in the store.

1337.NAME: Make lemonade
1337.DESCRIPTION: Make cactus lemonade in the workshop section FOOD

13370.NAME: Almazo's Rhubarb
13370.DESCRIPTION: A dispute arises, but none of these pirates understand agriculture. Help Almazo harvest rhubarb.

13371.NAME: Sorrel
13371.DESCRIPTION: Bane claims he can manage better. You'll need to help even the score. Harvest sorrel.

13372.NAME: Harvest Wheat
13372.DESCRIPTION: Emett is unbothered and calmly harvests wheat. Emett had already started sowing the seeds given by traders in advance.

13373.NAME: Zucchini Warehouse
13373.DESCRIPTION: Even without expecting any bets, Emett was already growing zucchini. Grow a few more zucchinis and fill the warehouse.

13374.NAME: Sorrel Warehouse
13374.DESCRIPTION: Fill Bane's warehouse with sorrel acid. If you didn't know, this acid is used in chocolate making and is quite valuable.

13375.NAME: Almazo Harvests
13375.DESCRIPTION: Sow and harvest rhubarb. "Hey, Almazo! Don't even think about buying them!", we're all competing in GROWING here.

13376.NAME: Emett Grows Zucchini
13376.DESCRIPTION: Emett no longer hides his zucchinis, he sows vast fields. Harvest the zucchini crop.

13377.NAME: Bane Sows More
13377.DESCRIPTION: Bane counts and sows even more sorrel. Help Bane harvest the sorrel crop.

13378.NAME: Almazo's Warehouse
13378.DESCRIPTION: With this count, Almazo still gets ahead of Bane, but does so discreetly. Use Almazo's warehouse.

13379.NAME: Acid
13379.DESCRIPTION: In the name of competition, wooden structures were filled to the brim with sour acid products. Upgrade the warehouses.

1338.NAME: Gudgeon catcher
1338.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of gudgeons. You don't need to collect them to complete the task

13380.NAME: Chase Away Jellies
13380.DESCRIPTION: The warehouses melted, and the compote came to life. Chase away the jellies by pelting them with leftover vegetables.

13381.NAME: Forgotten Harvest
13381.DESCRIPTION: Ruckus! Pirates are having fun chasing jelly all the way to the ocean. Harvest any remaining crops.

13382.NAME: Buy the Foundations
13382.DESCRIPTION: Glass is the best insulator for acidiciy, but upon seeing the price, Almazo nearly turned gray. Buy a pile of stones.

13383.NAME: Joint Storage
13383.DESCRIPTION: With the existing 'taxes', pirates can afford to buy warehouses one at a time. Finish building the quartz foundations.

13384.NAME: Joint Dinner
13384.DESCRIPTION: Tired and happy, the pirates will eat any vegetables right now. Submit sweet potatoes for dinner preparation.

13385.NAME: Collective Sorrel
13385.DESCRIPTION: Emett treats the other pirates with his zucchinis and encourages Almazo to help Bane harvest sorrel. Reap this crop.

13386.NAME: Collective Rhubarb
13386.DESCRIPTION: Later, Bane offers to help Almazo with his rhubarb. Collectively harvest the rhubarb fields.

13387.NAME: Collective Zucchini
13387.DESCRIPTION: There's no rush with zucchinis, they're much more resilient. Help Emett harvest zucchinis.

13388.NAME: Build for Bane
13388.DESCRIPTION: The massive reserves are divided into three fair parts. Build one quartz warehouse, this warehouse will be used by Bane.

13389.NAME: Build for Almazo
13389.DESCRIPTION: Almazo signs up for the second completed warehouse. The order doesn't matter, the stock volumes will be the same for everyone.

1339.NAME: Pearl hunter
1339.DESCRIPTION: Sometimes you can find pearls in mussels. Find and sell them.

13390.NAME: Build for Emett
13390.DESCRIPTION: Emett enjoys diversity, he doesn't mind waiting. Build the third quartz storage and fill it with vegetables.

13391.NAME: Towards the light
13391.DESCRIPTION: This island is not difficult to find. This island shines like a lighthouse. Arm yourself with sunglasses and travel!

13392.NAME: Gladiolus greenhouse
13392.DESCRIPTION: Gather gladioli. There is a road here, there is no road there. The gladioli will be useful for marking the way.

13393.NAME: Few bunnies
13393.DESCRIPTION: This time the bunnies are hiding in rock crevices instead of flower stumps. Find and greet three bunnies.

13396.NAME: Grow some radishes
13396.DESCRIPTION: In some of them, spring is ending and summer is just beginning. Harvest 20 radish fields.

134.NAME: Craft your first clay pot
134.DESCRIPTION: Go to OTHER section in the workshop and craft a clay pot. You can follow its progress in the new TIMED CRAFTING section

1340.NAME: Boot catcher
1340.DESCRIPTION: Pull out an old boot from the ocean and open it in your bag. Sometimes you can find something valuable. Open several boots.

1341.NAME: Exotic fisherman
1341.DESCRIPTION: Catch the rare angelfish several times and sell it from your bag.

13413.NAME: Go to Soup Island
13413.DESCRIPTION: Head to the distant island of Zupas, where people from Lithuania and Latvia have come to celebrate an interesting holiday.

13414.NAME: Fill the first bowl
13414.DESCRIPTION: The main ingredient of this Cold Soup is kefir. Let's pour it in. Build the first Big Bowl.

13415.NAME: What is kefir?
13415.DESCRIPTION: Kefir is made from milk. Let's call it the fermentation process that results in kefir. Hand in 30 bottles of milk.

13416.NAME: Get kefir
13416.DESCRIPTION: Today, the drinks stand only serves kefir, and most of it ends up in the soup. Collect 10 kefir.

13417.NAME: Set festive tables
13417.DESCRIPTION: Set up some festive tables. We will serve the most traditional type of soup on them. Build Soup Table II.

13418.NAME: Great popularity
13418.DESCRIPTION: There will be so many guests this year that for safety reasons, you should bring your own stool. Sell 15 wooden stools.

13419.NAME: Make cold soup
13419.DESCRIPTION: Chef, please make me some cold soup! Cook few portions of this soup in your workshop.

1342.NAME: Shark catcher
1342.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of sharks. You don't need to collect them to complete the task

13420.NAME: Fill the second bowl
13420.DESCRIPTION: Pickled beets are the base of this soup and they color the kefir PINK. Finish the second Large Bowl.

13421.NAME: Cucumbers
13421.DESCRIPTION: Cucumber might be the next most commonly used ingredient. But we don't have cucumbers. Grow 20 fields of Black Onions.

13422.NAME: TICKETS!
13422.DESCRIPTION: Hey! This person has not purchased a festival ticket. Please do so immediately. Submit 1000 seashells.

13423.NAME: Fill the third bowl
13423.DESCRIPTION: Almost everyone who knows the real recipe adds dill and onions. Fill the third Large Bowl.

13424.NAME: Spicy?
13424.DESCRIPTION: Only a few people add anything spicy to their Cold Soup, but some eaters don't mind. They add 35 chillis.

13425.NAME: Bread
13425.DESCRIPTION: Many eaters have bread on the side. Bake 15 fresh loaves of bread in the workshop.

13426.NAME: Festive tables
13426.DESCRIPTION: Serve 3 Soup Table I. In these, we will give preference to Lithuania's favorite recipes with potatoes.

13427.NAME: Bring the potatoes.
13427.DESCRIPTION: A large bag holds up to 50 kilograms of potatoes. Harvest 50 potato fields.

13428.NAME: Prepare Cold Soup
13428.DESCRIPTION: Cook few portions of Cold soup with potatoes in your workshop.

13429.NAME: Fill the fourth bowl
13429.DESCRIPTION: No one will be able to agree on the next ingredients. They are often seasonal vegetables. Fill the fourth bowl.

1343.NAME: Sea-cabbage catcher
1343.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of sea cabbages. You don't need to collect them to complete the task

13430.NAME: Add meat
13430.DESCRIPTION: But meat lovers were not shy about adding both cooked and dried sausage. Feed piglets 45 times.

13431.NAME: Get a sausage
13431.DESCRIPTION: Table sausage for 20 servings of soup for 49.99. Trade for shells.

13432.NAME: Set the tables
13432.DESCRIPTION: Set the last three tables - Soup Table III, so that the holiday is celebrated at full capacity.

13433.NAME: Wrong order
13433.DESCRIPTION: Someone had mixed up the order - we will not put wax in the Cold Soup. Selling 50 beeswax from a bag.

13434.NAME: Prepare Cold Soup
13434.DESCRIPTION: Prepare cold soup with sausage 20 times.

13435.NAME: Fill the fifth bowl
13435.DESCRIPTION: Finish the last of the Big Bowls. Trust me, they will all be dry soon.

13436.NAME: Share the soup
13436.DESCRIPTION: Take the soup to your friends and their animals to try. Feed your friends' animals 50 times.

13437.NAME: Thank the cook
13437.DESCRIPTION: Say thank you to the chef with a refreshing, almost pink drink. Serve 5 bottles of wine.

13438.NAME: Visiting Soup Island again
13438.DESCRIPTION: Turn on full screen on your device and enjoy this bright pink island. (return to this island)

13439.NAME: Grow 20 radishes
13439.DESCRIPTION: Go home and grow 20 more radishes. Tomorrow will be another day and you will have to make another Cold Soup.

1344.NAME: Visit Paprick
1344.DESCRIPTION: Go to Paprick's island and talk to him by clicking on him. He will tell you what he has found

13440.NAME: ONLY 3 DAYS!
13440.DESCRIPTION: This task is not completable and will disappear at the end of the promotion. *The first purchase bonus is not doubled.

13441.NAME: Boil Eggs
13441.DESCRIPTION: Boil the eggs. Meanwhile, you can brew yourself some tea, coffee, or prepare sandwiches for later.

13442.NAME: Race Crossroads
13442.DESCRIPTION: Hop on the raft and set off. On the map, the races are still marked with a cup icon.

13443.NAME: Strangely Refreshing
13443.DESCRIPTION: It's not the right season for eggnog, kvass is trending now. Ask Paprick to mix a kvass-based cocktail.

13444.NAME: Grumpy Judge
13444.DESCRIPTION: The invited judge is overheated in the sun, you won't get past until you treat her to a drink. Try it!

13445.NAME: Raise the Bronze Flag
13445.DESCRIPTION: You will receive materials for raising the flag by completing Bronze I, II, III, and IV goals. Raise the flag in the bronze area.

13446.NAME: Raise the Silver Flag
13446.DESCRIPTION: You will receive materials for raising the flag by completing Silver I, II, and III goals. Raise the flag in the silver area.

13447.NAME: Raise the Gold Flag
13447.DESCRIPTION: You will receive materials for raising the flag by completing Gold I, II, and III goals. Raise the flag in the gold area.

13448.NAME: Bronze Discipline I
13448.DESCRIPTION: Feed adult pigs. Remember, unlike fields, animals can be moved to inaccessible places.

13449.NAME: Bronze Discipline II
13449.DESCRIPTION: Prepare barrels. Consider the order in which you will solve problems, some tasks require larger areas.

1345.NAME: Revive aloes
1345.DESCRIPTION: Revive a couple of aloes by watering the generously

13450.NAME: Bronze Discipline III
13450.DESCRIPTION: Harvest wheat or coconut crops. Easily obtainable items are not worth keeping on the race map.

13451.NAME: Bronze Discipline IV
13451.DESCRIPTION: Simultaneously raise 102 rabbits. In bronze level tasks, fabric will not be needed. Think about it!

13452.NAME: Bronze Discipline V
13452.DESCRIPTION: Sell bone beads. Plant trees and bushes carefully, don't block your path.

13453.NAME: Bronze Discipline VI
13453.DESCRIPTION: Simultaneously grow 56 thorn fields. Each thorn bush not yet harvested counts towards this task.

13454.NAME: Bronze Discipline IX
13454.DESCRIPTION: Feed unusual foxes and fox cubs. For race needs, even players with little progress will have access to foxes.

13455.NAME: Bronze Discipline VII
13455.DESCRIPTION: On the island, each field is carefully counted. Simultaneously place 11 plank sheds for shells.

13456.NAME: Bronze Discipline VIII
13456.DESCRIPTION: Repair simple wells. Evaluate which of the available seven wells you want to restore.

13457.NAME: Silver Discipline I
13457.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn fields. Keep in mind that the coastline is not walkable, only cut those bushes and trees that are in the way.

13458.NAME: Silver Discipline II
13458.DESCRIPTION: Repair broken aeroplanes. Repaired aeroplanes can be moved, but they cannot be sold.

13459.NAME: Silver Discipline III
13459.DESCRIPTION: Sell adult dogs. When counting a large number of fields, sometimes it's easier to count the energy spent.

1346.NAME: Revive camel-thorns
1346.DESCRIPTION: Revive a couple of camel-thorns by watering the generously

13460.NAME: Silver Discipline IV
13460.DESCRIPTION: Simultaneously keep 6 grand sand castles on the island. The first task in the queue is not always the first to be completed. Plan!

13461.NAME: Silver Discipline V
13461.DESCRIPTION: Plant strawberry crops. You may have noticed, there is a dream catcher on the island. This way you can return to the crossroads.

13462.NAME: Silver Discipline VI
13462.DESCRIPTION: Simultaneously raise 20 cows. There were quite a few heifers on this island, hopefully, you didn't sell them?

13463.NAME: Silver Discipline VII
13463.DESCRIPTION: Prepare sugar from horned melons in the workshop. For race needs, this recipe is available to all players.

13464.NAME: Silver Discipline VIII
13464.DESCRIPTION: Use beehives. This task can be completed quickly or wisely, regardless of the choice, the result remains the same.

13465.NAME: Silver Discipline IX
13465.DESCRIPTION: Use the ancient windmill. To use the windmill, of course, it must first be repaired.

13466.NAME: Gold Discipline I
13466.DESCRIPTION: Finish building unfinished hot tubs. Note, oak leaf paths are walkable, they don't need to be repaired.

13467.NAME: Gold Discipline II
13467.DESCRIPTION: Simultaneously raise 70 adult ducks. No task will require bear cubs, or adult bears.

13468.NAME: Gold Discipline III
13468.DESCRIPTION: Sell 200 fields. Be careful not to sell ducks during the duckling feeding process. Hurry slowly and with thought.

13469.NAME: Gold Discipline IV
13469.DESCRIPTION: Build large aquariums, both options will do. Few remember, these aquariums show fish stocks in the bag.

1347.NAME: Blue guppy catcher
1347.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of blue guppies. You don't have to collect them to finish the task.

13470.NAME: Gold Discipline V
13470.DESCRIPTION: Prepare diamond necklaces. Remember, this task is active only on the Gold Totem Island!

13471.NAME: Gold Discipline VI
13471.DESCRIPTION: Harvest watermelon crops. Snakes and truffle pigs will not be needed in this race.

13472.NAME: Gold Discipline VII
13472.DESCRIPTION: Finish building 24 gemstone lanterns. Race lanterns are available to all race participants.

13473.NAME: Gold Discipline VIII
13473.DESCRIPTION: Submit clay mass. Limestone mines can also be accessed without cutting down purple stalagmites.

13474.NAME: Gold Discipline IX
13474.DESCRIPTION: Feed 210 baby bats or adult bats.

13475.NAME: Finish Discipline I
13475.DESCRIPTION: Simultaneously raise 60 adult roosters! Meadow grasses can be moved, filled vases cannot be moved.

13476.NAME: Finish Discipline II
13476.DESCRIPTION: Move a Bonfire V or VI. If the level is lower, then continue building.

13477.NAME: Finish Discipline III
13477.DESCRIPTION: Prepare one clay pot in the workshop. Or just take it out if you read the tasks carefully.

13479.NAME: Bronze Discipline X
13479.DESCRIPTION: Feed the duck queen. Reminder, the duck queen cannot be accelerated. This animal eats once every 12 hours.

1348.NAME: Royal crab catcher
1348.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of royal crabs. You don't have to collect them to finish the task.

13487.NAME: Attract the Gardener
13487.DESCRIPTION: Build flower boxes. One by one. Closer, closer, snap! The diligent gardener is pulled from the ground.

13488.NAME: Ouch!
13488.DESCRIPTION: A mud ball pinches you and swims away. Catch the fugitive, jump on the raft, and chase it to Uncle's Island.

1349.NAME: Sea shell catcher
1349.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of sea shells. You don't have to collect them to finish the task.

13496.NAME: Puzzle 12-J
13496.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with adult koalas.

13497.NAME: Puzzle 12-J
13497.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with seed packs.

13498.NAME: Puzzle 12-J
13498.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with onions.

13499.NAME: Puzzle 13-i
13499.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with kittens.

135.NAME: Learn to craft things in a queue
135.DESCRIPTION: Craft 12 clay bricks in a row by clicking 4 times on CRAFT button

1350.NAME: Ocean salmon catcher
1350.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of ocean salmons. You don't have to collect them to finish the task.

13500.NAME: Puzzle 13-i
13500.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with broad palms.

13501.NAME: Puzzle 13-i
13501.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with any kind of sloths.

13502.NAME: Puzzle 14-H
13502.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with lambs.

13503.NAME: Puzzle 14-H
13503.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with thorns.

13504.NAME: Puzzle 14-H
13504.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with hay stacks.

13505.NAME: Puzzle 15-g
13505.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with adult brown goats.

13506.NAME: Puzzle 15-g
13506.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with fishing spots.

13507.NAME: Puzzle 15-g
13507.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with beach chairs.

13508.NAME: Puzzle 16-F
13508.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with adult hens.

13509.NAME: Puzzle 16-F
13509.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with wood storage.

1351.NAME: Boot catcher
1351.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of boots. You don't have to collect them to finish the task.

13510.NAME: Puzzle 16-F
13510.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with corn.

13511.NAME: Puzzle 17-e
13511.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with adult pigs.

13512.NAME: Puzzle 17-e
13512.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with red-flower cacti.

13513.NAME: Puzzle 17-e
13513.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with pumpkins.

13514.NAME: Puzzle 18-D
13514.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with adult platypuses.

13515.NAME: Puzzle 18-D
13515.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with wax candles.

13516.NAME: Puzzle 18-D
13516.DESCRIPTION: Figure out what to do with wild berries or forest mushrooms.

13517.NAME: Imprecise Docking
13517.DESCRIPTION: Sloths won't tell you anything, but Uncle might. To get closer, move the cottage, then return to the island.

13518.NAME: Nudge Uncle
13518.DESCRIPTION: Uncle has several ideas. Find out what they are. Uncle is trying to train his assistant, not very successfully so far.

13519.NAME: Any of the Seven
13519.DESCRIPTION: Uncle's new assistant struggles to understand Uncle's ideas. Try to explain this idea, talk to any of Uncle's assistants.

1352.NAME: Jellyfish catcher
1352.DESCRIPTION: Catch a lot of jellyfish. You don't have to collect them to finish the task.

13520.NAME: Full Plan
13520.DESCRIPTION: Check all of Uncle's ideas, spend ideas. You will receive new ideas every day from Uncle, as well as by completing puzzle goals.

13521.NAME: 21 Trainings
13521.DESCRIPTION: Uncle's assistant doesn't understand and misunderstands. Help the clawed one, complete all puzzle tasks.

13522.NAME: Shearing
13522.DESCRIPTION: By completing tasks and talking to Uncle, you will receive bush shears. Trim the bushes and clear space.

13523.NAME: Risk of Burning
13523.DESCRIPTION: Sell the existing unfinished decorations. None of these decorations will be needed. Do not sell the sloths for now.

13524.NAME: Grounding
13524.DESCRIPTION: Ensure good grounding, dig and harvest carrots. Grounding wires can be tied to the carrots.

13525.NAME: Soft Sands
13525.DESCRIPTION: Cover the corner of the island with sand paths. At the same time, place a large area with sand paths on the island.

13526.NAME: Full Power!
13526.DESCRIPTION: UPGRADE Uncle, then quickly turn off the electricity. Talk to Uncle after upgrading.

13529.NAME: Grilling Festival
13529.DESCRIPTION: The house is a mess, luckily the Festival Island was cleaned up in time. Head to the Festival Island.

1353.NAME: Radish salad
1353.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of radish salad in the workshop

13530.NAME: Two Types of Wasabi
13530.DESCRIPTION: Harvest wasabi bushes and greenhouses. Some bushes will regenerate over time, just in case you need more cabbage.

13531.NAME: Catch Fish in Bloom
13531.DESCRIPTION: There are some fish in bloom on the island. Additional fish can be found in the store. Feed the fish in a fragrant flower.

13532.NAME: Use Vases
13532.DESCRIPTION: Marinate shashlik, brew drinks. Use vases and you'll get both.

13533.NAME: Light the Coals
13533.DESCRIPTION: First, light the metal grills, here corn will be roasted. Use the obtained coals to repair the square grills.

13534.NAME: Dried Mushrooms
13534.DESCRIPTION: Watermelon grills does not need much firewood, use them. Dried mushrooms can only be obtained here.

13535.NAME: Shear Sunflowers
13535.DESCRIPTION: Wild vegetables have multiplied on the island. Shear sunflowers, additional flowers can be found in the store.

13536.NAME: Round Tables
13536.DESCRIPTION: Clean up, repair two round tables. Missing items can be found right here on the island.

13537.NAME: Spicy Fields
13537.DESCRIPTION: Find in the store, sow and harvest 90 plots with this peculiar chilli. This crop yields wild vegetables and peaches.

13538.NAME: Harvest Jelly Beans
13538.DESCRIPTION: Harvest 90 plots with purple beans. This way you can get both beans and marinade buckets.

13539.NAME: Feed the Gliding Fish
13539.DESCRIPTION: Find in the store, feed the gliding and flying little fish.

1354.NAME: Smoked salmon
1354.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of smoked salmon in the workshop

13540.NAME: Repair Cheese Factories
13540.DESCRIPTION: Build cheese factories. Note, oil will be pressed during construction, only after completing the building will you get seal cheese.

13541.NAME: Continue Cleaning
13541.DESCRIPTION: While the flying little fish are tying cheese, you can wipe a few more tables.

13542.NAME: Repair Both Kilns
13542.DESCRIPTION: The grills are burning well, take some of the coals and transfer them to the kiln. Repair the kilns so you can roast sausages.

13543.NAME: Sausage in Dough
13543.DESCRIPTION: You already know where to find the ingredients on this island. Bake some sausages using the ovens.

13544.NAME: While Baking
13544.DESCRIPTION: While the sausages are baking, you can try fishing for crabs. Fish, if you're lucky, you might catch a moray.

13545.NAME: Set the Tables
13545.DESCRIPTION: The food is baking and grilled delicacies can be served on any table. Repair any tables or round tables.

13546.NAME: Heating the oven
13546.DESCRIPTION: Once the kiln is fired up and coals are multiplied, you can finally start heating the large stone ovens. Light all three ovens.

13547.NAME: Delicious Roasts
13547.DESCRIPTION: Of course, the main feast dish will be a juicy roasted roast. Use the ovens and get roasts.

13548.NAME: Use Up Drinks
13548.DESCRIPTION: Drinks are meant for guests. Choose which tables you'll place the glasses on this time. Repair 5 more tables.

13549.NAME: Quick Hand
13549.DESCRIPTION: Beans grow quickly, and you don't have to wait for fish flowers either. Obtain purple beans in any way.

1355.NAME: Spicy coconut soup
1355.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of Spicy coconut soup in the workshop

13550.NAME: Hearty Cheese
13550.DESCRIPTION: Rich cheese will create satiety until the next roast. Choose to build cheese factories or help the flying little fish.

13551.NAME: Fish is Not Meat
13551.DESCRIPTION: Guests really enjoyed the smoked moray rolls. Obtain morays by fishing or harvesting wasabi greenhouses.

13552.NAME: Bake and Grill
13552.DESCRIPTION: A few tables are still empty, so use the fruit grill, square grill, kiln, or oven.

13553.NAME: Finish Cleaning
13553.DESCRIPTION: Game and craft tables are also cleaned. Tablecloth over, you can sit down. Set all the tables on the island.

13554.NAME: Peaches for Dessert
13554.DESCRIPTION: Accumulate a good amount of peaches. Make sure you have at least 72 peaches in your bag before you start making desserts.

13555.NAME: Celebration in Dessert
13555.DESCRIPTION: The festive unpacking is accompanied by cocktails decorated with peaches. IMPROVE all three boxes.

13556.NAME: Submit Marinade
13556.DESCRIPTION: When the food settles, you'll want more. Submit buckets with marinade so the grilling never stops.

13557.NAME: Picnic Basket I
13557.DESCRIPTION: You'll need a blanket for the picnic, so you don't have to sit on the grass. Obtain 12 units of cloth.

13558.NAME: Picnic Basket II
