13558.DESCRIPTION: You'll need drinks for the picnic. Prepare Cactus Lemonade for Vulpijs. You'll find the recipe in the workshop.

13559.NAME: Picnic Basket III
13559.DESCRIPTION: You'll need food for the picnic. Choose to bake banana pie, pretzels, or potato pancakes. Prepare the food.

1356.NAME: Fish soup
1356.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of Fish soup in the workshop

13560.NAME: Visit Vulpijs
13560.DESCRIPTION: First, take a raft to Vulpijs, so you can continue on foot. Find Vulpijs Island on the map.

13561.NAME: Beach Trail
13561.DESCRIPTION: While walking on the beach, Vulpijs points to a post with arrows: "We turn here!". Find the signpost and choose USE.

13562.NAME: Familiar Island
13562.DESCRIPTION: Wait, you've been here before, you built a monument here. Vulpijs shrugs and invites you to start eating. Spend food.

13563.NAME: Beyond the Fence
13563.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs says the photographers have long gone, and the barrier is actually unnecessary. Press UPGRADE on the fence.

13564.NAME: Sand Fox
13564.DESCRIPTION: Maybe there's a sketch or drawing stuck somewhere? Ask the fox what structure was planned for this location.

13565.NAME: Stylish Pane
13565.DESCRIPTION: The fox digs up a glass pane. Try using it on the greenhouse frame.

13566.NAME: Material Search
13566.DESCRIPTION: The building will need more materials. Return to Vulpijs Island (using Forest Mystery).

13567.NAME: Remove the Tree
13567.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs slips past the withered tree, but you can't get through. UPGRADE this tree.

13568.NAME: Continue Building
13568.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs has entrusted the construction entirely to you. Work until the next break. Repair any monument.

13569.NAME: Purple Beans
13569.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Fish in a Fragrant Flower or from Jelly Beans.

1357.NAME: Cactus juice lemonade
1357.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of cactus lemonade in the workshop

13570.NAME: Gathered Vegetables
13570.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Spicy Fields or from Sunflowers.

13571.NAME: Seal Cheese
13571.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Cheese Factories or from Flying Little Fish.

13572.NAME: Collect Crabs
13572.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Flying Little Fish or from Fishing Spots.

13573.NAME: Collect Rye Drinks
13573.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Vases or from Fish in a Fragrant Flower.

13574.NAME: Collect Oils
13574.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Sunflowers or from Cheese Factories.

13575.NAME: Collect Peaches
13575.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Peach Greenhouses or from Spicy Fields.

13576.NAME: Collect Cabbages
13576.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Wasabi Greenhouses or from Peach Greenhouses.

13577.NAME: Collect Morays
13577.DESCRIPTION: You can obtain this product from Fishing Spots or from Wasabi Greenhouses.

13578.NAME: Remove Obstacle
13578.DESCRIPTION: Machete was left at home. Burn the path with the coals you brought. Remove the obstacle.

13579.NAME: News from Paprick
13579.DESCRIPTION: During the game, Paprick shares the latest rumors. Click on Paprick (Paprick island) to hear what he has to say.

1358.NAME: Pizza
1358.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of pizza in the workshop

13580.NAME: Landslide
13580.DESCRIPTION: While Isabella was in the store, a landslide occurred and the road up the mountain was blocked. Clear the debris.

13581.NAME: White cockatoos
13581.DESCRIPTION: Isabella doesn't know another way to move forward, but nearby cockatoos are pecking insects. Ask the birds to scout.

13582.NAME: Meeting place
13582.DESCRIPTION: The best viewpoint is the tall jungle palms. The cockatoos will look around and wait for the teacher in one of the palms.

13583.NAME: Gratitude to the birds
13583.DESCRIPTION: For the good deed, find berries in the forest. Berries so close to the ground are a rarity for cockatoos and also a delicacy.

13584.NAME: Bark for the map
13584.DESCRIPTION: A portable map will be needed. While the birds are flying, process (cut down) birches or tall palms and obtain birch bark.

13585.NAME: Suspicious little house
13585.DESCRIPTION: On the other side of the birch grove is a strange little house. Knock on the little house.

13586.NAME: Witch's roses
13586.DESCRIPTION: The cold wind spirits finished off the witch's roses. Isabella is a good gardener and promises to revive the roses.

13587.NAME: To make the wind harmless
13587.DESCRIPTION: The witch has an idea to make the evil winds harmless. A lot of fish will be needed. Go fishing.

13588.NAME: Fairy dust
13588.DESCRIPTION: The witch will need the help of fairies, go to the swamp and find the fairies in the broken heart bushes.

13589.NAME: Deceptive fire
13589.DESCRIPTION: The winds need to be confused. Sprinkle dust on the thorns, choose UPGRADE.

1359.NAME: Boiled eggs
1359.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of boiled eggs in the workshop

13590.NAME: Don't fear the fire
13590.DESCRIPTION: Collect these fires with bare hands. These flames lie, they look terrible but don't bite. Collect the burning bushes.

13591.NAME: Witch's cauldron
13591.DESCRIPTION: Throw the deceptive flame and fish into the witch's cauldron. Obtain the wind capturing spell.

13592.NAME: Catch the ice spirits
13592.DESCRIPTION: Use the witch's spells to capture the nasty spirits. Don't let even one escape, capture them all.

13593.NAME: Revive the forest
13593.DESCRIPTION: A captured spirit is captured cold. Use the elixir of vigor to awaken the icy trees.

13594.NAME: Revive the land
13594.DESCRIPTION: Use the elixir of vigor to break and remove the icy paths.

13595.NAME: Mountain path
13595.DESCRIPTION: Life reigns anew in the forest. Upgrade the ice wall, then completely remove this obstacle.

13596.NAME: Meerkats in the bushes
13596.DESCRIPTION: The air scouts did their job, time to turn to the little animals. Search the brown shrubbery.

13597.NAME: Ask for the way
13597.DESCRIPTION: Feed the hedgehogs and meerkats. Ask the little friends to find human-friendly passages between the rocks.

13598.NAME: Talk to the witch
13598.DESCRIPTION: The witch is currently feeding the goats, help the horned ones and during work ask for help. Feed the goats on Atafu island.

13599.NAME: Solution brewing
13599.DESCRIPTION: The witch sighs - there is only one option. UPGRADE the witch's cauldron, then use it.

136.NAME: Build clay oven
136.DESCRIPTION: Buy in the shop and build a clay oven. You will need clay bricks for it

1360.NAME: Shark roast
1360.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of shark roast in the workshop

13600.NAME: Strawberries for the elixir
13600.DESCRIPTION: Harvest additional strawberries on Atafu island, the special elixir will need a lot of sweet berries.

13601.NAME: Release the winds
13601.DESCRIPTION: The winds can help fly over the gorge, but the witch doesn't trust the winds. Use the love elixir, UPGRADE the captured winds.

13602.NAME: Feed the winds
13602.DESCRIPTION: For a good flight, a strong wind will be needed. Feed all the released wind spirits.

13603.NAME: Kite path
13603.DESCRIPTION: Use wind talismans in places where butterflies are flying. With a paper kite, you can cross the gorge. Catch the butterflies!

13604.NAME: Families, aloes
13604.DESCRIPTION: On the way home, pick useful herbs. Collect all the family clusters, if you find, also shear the aloes.

13605.NAME: Nuts and mushrooms
13605.DESCRIPTION: Other forest treasures can be turned into a potion. Of course, you need to know how to use it. Collect toadstools, if found, also collect nuts.

13606.NAME: Little carriers
13606.DESCRIPTION: Feed the hedgehogs and meerkats, you can bring more treasures home if you take the little burden carriers along.

13607.NAME: Empty the flasks
13607.DESCRIPTION: Acid will be needed. Purple-colored berry acid will be good enough. Empty the chemistry flasks.

13608.NAME: Magical flames
13608.DESCRIPTION: Reignite the thorns with fairy dust. Once the flames are lit, obtain more magical flames.

13609.NAME: Dangerous Chili
13609.DESCRIPTION: The brew needs an extra 10% sharpness. Harvest the chili crop anywhere on your island.

1361.NAME: Truffle julienne
1361.DESCRIPTION: Make 10 portions of truffle julienne in the workshop

13610.NAME: Pyrotechnician
13610.DESCRIPTION: It turns out he heard about the landslide and is rushing to help. Treat Bruno with pumpkin pie, bake it.

13611.NAME: Bruno's experience
13611.DESCRIPTION: Bruno suggests using long flax string fuses. Harvest flax seeds on any island.

13612.NAME: Flaming papers
13612.DESCRIPTION: Such tasks require the Papuan council's permission. Submit doubloons for paper approval.

13613.NAME: Finally blasting!
13613.DESCRIPTION: Bruno gives Isabella the honor of lighting the flax fuses. Submit torches.

13614.NAME: Blast the rock
13614.DESCRIPTION: Place the explosive near the rock, then quickly run away, and only then light the fuse. Blast the gray rock.

13615.NAME: Blast the rocks
13615.DESCRIPTION: The first clearing was successful! Let's continue blasting! Removing the yellow rocks will be a bit harder. Let's go!

13616.NAME: Garlic
13616.DESCRIPTION: If you give me four shells, you will receive rare plants that I found in the mountains.

13617.NAME: Tree Frames
13617.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs's paws won't reach the roof. Cut tall and broad palms for scaffolding.

13618.NAME: Stored Tools
13618.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs forgot which chest he put the hammer, screwdriver, and pliers in. Build pearl chests.

13619.NAME: Strawberry Baskets
13619.DESCRIPTION: After peeling bark and weaving baskets, the tools remained in the baobab clearing. Fill the strawberry baskets.

1362.NAME: Find out the way
1362.DESCRIPTION: Ask Paprick the way to the volcano island

13620.NAME: Picnic Tomatoes
13620.DESCRIPTION: Slice the tomatoes for the salad in advance, you can add the cream later. Harvest the tomato crop.

13621.NAME: Sandwich Making
13621.DESCRIPTION: Sip tea with Vulpijs and the crabs. Feed Vulpijs or the crabs. Additional Vulpijs can be found in the shop.

13622.NAME: Picnic Packs
13622.DESCRIPTION: Have a picnic in the small yellow flowers or in the shade of tropical palms. Obtain picnic packs by completing other tasks.

13623.NAME: Vases for Branches
13623.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs suggests making vases from bamboo. Quick and simple. Explore the bamboo containers on the island.

13624.NAME: Use Waterfalls
13624.DESCRIPTION: The bucket-sized bamboo turned out to be too large. Vulpijs threw bamboo bundles into the buckets. Make vases.

13625.NAME: Carve a Peacock
13625.DESCRIPTION: While trimming branches for the greenhouse, a beautiful shape begins to form. Carve a decorative peacock from the baobab.

13626.NAME: Special Glass
13626.DESCRIPTION: Buy the special glass in the SHOP PROMOTION section. Lilacs and sea plants in pots are planned for the greenhouse.

13627.NAME: Try Glazing
13627.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs places plants in the greenhouse and invites you to insert the newly acquired pane. Build the greenhouse.

13628.NAME: Renaissance Greenhouse
13628.DESCRIPTION: Completing this monument will earn you an Eostre's tree branch, which can provide basic energy when planted. Buy glass.

13629.NAME: Second Peacock
13629.DESCRIPTION: Don't forget to exchange the acquired plants for construction materials. Carve the second peacock figure.

13630.NAME: Five Peacocks
13630.DESCRIPTION: While you carve the tree, Vulpijs walks around the baobab and places each fallen branch in a vase. Carve all the peacocks.

13631.NAME: Temporary Vases
13631.DESCRIPTION: When vases start to run out, Vulpijs puts flowers in aquariums. Build 10 aquariums, buy the missing ones.

13632.NAME: Yellow Cats
13632.DESCRIPTION: Repair both yellow cat decorations. Started cat decorations are located in the lower corner of the island.

13633.NAME: Black Cats
13633.DESCRIPTION: Repair all black cat decorations. Started cat decorations are located in the lower corner of the island.

13634.NAME: Gray Cats
13634.DESCRIPTION: Repair both gray cat decorations. Started cat decorations are located in the lower corner of the island.

13635.NAME: Submit Lichens
13635.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs would prefer to plant lichens. If you bring a pile of lichens, Vulpijs will give you lilac branches.

13636.NAME: Submit Lichens
13636.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs will need flower pots for the lichens, so by submitting lichens, you'll receive other plant pots.

13637.NAME: Submit Lichens
13637.DESCRIPTION: The small paws are more suited for weeding than building. If you bring lichens, Vulpijs will provide you with a glass pane.

13638.NAME: Build Stone Gardens
13638.DESCRIPTION: It's not recommended to move or sell the existing island decorations, you won't place them back. Repair the stone gardens.

13639.NAME: Build Gazebos
13639.DESCRIPTION: There aren't enough gazebos on the island for all the crabs and birds. Build gazebos, buying some of them in the shop.

1364.NAME: Water to drink
1364.DESCRIPTION: To survive on the volcano island, you will need a lot of water, as it is very hot there. Get water

13640.NAME: Decorative Pruning
13640.DESCRIPTION: Inspired by the baobab, Vulpijs asks you to decorate the local bush clusters. Upgrade all giant bushes.

13641.NAME: Next Meeting
13641.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs bakes cookies for the meeting. Feed the pale crabs and Vulpijs, and you'll receive picnic packs.

13642.NAME: Advisor
13642.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs invites the sand fox to share its opinion. Sell adult foxes and you'll receive picnic packs.

13643.NAME: Picnic in the Palms
13643.DESCRIPTION: Go for a picnic under the palm or in the small yellow flowers. Spend the packs this way.

13644.NAME: Plant Hyacinths
13644.DESCRIPTION: Plant all the hyacinths on Vulpijs Island. Fresh shoots can be replanted in the greenhouse.

13645.NAME: Potato Flowers
13645.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs likes the color of the flowers. Harvest a large potato field and select the most beautiful flowers for the greenhouse.

13646.NAME: Sand Gardens
13646.DESCRIPTION: Bonsai trees are difficult to transplant. Vulpijs encourages more attempts. Build sand gardens.

13647.NAME: Next Picnic
13647.DESCRIPTION: Feed Vulpijs, feed the crabs. Help the island friends fill the thermoses with tea.

13648.NAME: Beak Gardeners
13648.DESCRIPTION: Up high near the ceiling, where Vulpijs's paws can't reach, the plants will be planted by birds. Submit the birds.

13649.NAME: Last Picnic
13649.DESCRIPTION: Spend the picnic packs on rose buds or elsewhere. This was the last meeting over a cup of tea. Now, work.

1365.NAME: Food pack
1365.DESCRIPTION: Give the food pack to Paprick - he will check if there's enough food

13650.NAME: Carrots for Flowers
13650.DESCRIPTION: Grow carrots. Vulpijs will exchange these root vegetables for plant seedlings from distant lands.

13651.NAME: Plant Delivery
13651.DESCRIPTION: With an elephant caravan, the carrots will be delivered to distant lands. Feed the elephants.

13652.NAME: Vases for Travel
13652.DESCRIPTION: On the way back, the elephants will carry flower seedlings. To keep the seedlings longer, vases will be needed. Submit bamboo vases.

13653.NAME: Watering Brigade
13653.DESCRIPTION: Neither you nor Vulpijs have time to water the greenhouse. Simultaneously grow 99 adult meerkats.

13654.NAME: Well to Draw From
13654.DESCRIPTION: Build 6 Koi ponds. It will be easier for the meerkat brigade to draw water from the pond.

13655.NAME: Watered Corn
13655.DESCRIPTION: Every third meerkat gets lost in the cornfield. Harvest the corn to make it easier for the meerkats to move.

13656.NAME: Make Repairs
13656.DESCRIPTION: Start repairing the monument you have chosen. Vulpijs will help provide materials.

13657.NAME: Next Act
13657.DESCRIPTION: Eight actions separate you from the next rest break. Well, let's go!

13658.NAME: The Big Repair
13658.DESCRIPTION: Reminder! Repairing monuments does not consume energy. Repair the chosen type of monument.

13659.NAME: Finish Construction
13659.DESCRIPTION: Completely finish one of the monuments. If you have enough materials, you can try building another monument.

1366.NAME: Doubloons for exchange
1366.DESCRIPTION: You will need a proper bag for storing everything. Turrick's wife will give you  the bag, in exchange for doubloons. Submit bronze doubloons

13660.NAME: Baobab Tower
13660.DESCRIPTION: The reward for the Baobab Tower is the Stoneflower. It can be used to upgrade the Earth Mother. Make boards.

13661.NAME: Asian Manor
13661.DESCRIPTION: Completing this monument will earn you six cloves of garlic. Growing them will allow you to make garlic toasts. Make necklaces.

13662.NAME: Make a Choice
13662.DESCRIPTION: Vulpijs can only provide additional materials for one monument. In the workshop section OTHER, make your choice now!

13664.NAME: Desert recipe
13664.DESCRIPTION: Water, a few cactus flowers, and a little extra sharpness. Get water or cactus flowers on Ahe – the desert island.

13665.NAME: Maybe cake?
13665.DESCRIPTION: For rhubarb cake you’ll need flour and honey. Put on the beekeeper’s outfit and use any beehives.

13666.NAME: Cinnamon and other things
13666.DESCRIPTION: We’re making compote, into jars it goes, a pinch of spice, and the lid on top. Get spices packs.

13667.NAME: Summer festival
13667.DESCRIPTION: The minibus is parked in the sands of Festival Island. Go to Festival Island.

13668.NAME: Upgrade the minibus
13668.DESCRIPTION: The minibus doors are stuck. Press UPGRADE on the minibus, and you’ll get the chance to travel further.

13669.NAME: Summer inspiration
13669.DESCRIPTION: The route is planned, just sit at the wheel and start moving toward the sun. Press USE on the minibus.

13670.NAME: Spice mix
13670.DESCRIPTION: Harvest the harvest pyramid. For compote you’ll need spices, a ground vegetable mix sounds logical.

13671.NAME: Taste of flowers
13671.DESCRIPTION: It’s not worth disturbing Toby for a few cactus flowers. Trim the local cacti in pots.

13672.NAME: Pigs for spices
13672.DESCRIPTION: Feed piglets and pigs. The mask collection can be exchanged for spices packs. This time we’ll trade in a herd of pigs.

13673.NAME: Grain for flour
13673.DESCRIPTION: Empty the sacks. Slowly process them into flour. The handful of leftover ears is thrown into the furrow.

13674.NAME: Bees in the temple
13674.DESCRIPTION: Three beehives won’t produce the needed amount of honey. Let bees into the empty small temples.

13675.NAME: Flour materials
13675.DESCRIPTION: The ears sown in the furrows sprouted. To harvest 82 wheat plots, you’ll only need to sow 36 wheat furrows.

13676.NAME: Pick stalks
13676.DESCRIPTION: The ice is melting in the drink. It’s not the time to grow new rhubarb. Pull the rhubarb out of the cake.

13677.NAME: Watermelon gardeners
13677.DESCRIPTION: The frogs living on this island are engaged in watermelon breeding. Help the frogs with gardening.

13678.NAME: Watermelon harvest
13678.DESCRIPTION: You don’t have to plant anything, just harvest all the watermelon plots that the frogs planted.

13679.NAME: Extra cacti
13679.DESCRIPTION: Not all cacti on the windowsill bloom, so buy extra cacti in the shop and build them.

13680.NAME: Trim flowers
13680.DESCRIPTION: Trim the cacti, get flowers. Only a few cacti will be needed, so choose which pot you’ll trim.

13681.NAME: Grape masks
13681.DESCRIPTION: Harvest grapes. Just like pigs, grapes also give masks for the collection, and you’ll need lots of spices for the marinade.

13682.NAME: Bees in bushes
13682.DESCRIPTION: Bees have settled in the green bushes, so sometimes these bushes will give honey. Find ripe bushes and get honey.

13683.NAME: Small mills
13683.DESCRIPTION: Place and build millstones. At the windmill, a queue forms. You’ll need a hand-operated version.

13684.NAME: Mill grinders
13684.DESCRIPTION: On top of the millstones, make a sculpture that will do the work. Build the already built millstones.

13685.NAME: Small/Big frogs
13685.DESCRIPTION: Buy and feed 18 frogs, then help the frogs tend the watermelon harvest. Bustle around the frogs.

13686.NAME: On our own
13686.DESCRIPTION: Harvest the watermelon plots. It’s completely clear that 46 of the plots can’t be entrusted to the frogs.

13687.NAME: Multiply rhubarb
13687.DESCRIPTION: This time there’s no rush, the ice sits in the freezer. Sow and wait for the rhubarb harvest, then harvest the rhubarb plots.

13688.NAME: Pickled rhubarb
13688.DESCRIPTION: Pickled rhubarb is equal to gingerbread. These preserves help restore energy, make them.

13689.NAME: Rhubarb cake
13689.DESCRIPTION: The key to success is chopping rhubarb into small pieces. Make several rhubarb cakes.

1369.NAME: Wine to bring with you
1369.DESCRIPTION: Make a sufficient amount of wine bottles

13690.NAME: Rhubarb drink
13690.DESCRIPTION: A drink that doesn’t even really need water. True, the rhubarb pieces never dissolved. Make this drink.

13691.NAME: The tastiest snacks
13691.DESCRIPTION: Choose and make your favorite snacks from rhubarb. Any of the three recipes will do, the main thing is that you like the taste!

13692.NAME: Second Olympiad
13692.DESCRIPTION: With the arrival of autumn, the new Autumn Olympiad cycle begins. Head to Festival Island.

13693.NAME: Purchase a Well
13693.DESCRIPTION: In the shop, you will find different wells, each leading to a different competition venue. Place one well.

13694.NAME: Head First!
13694.DESCRIPTION: Just like the first time, to reach the competitions, you’ll have to dive into the well. Each well leads to a different place with different tasks.

13695.NAME: Beet Olympiad
13695.DESCRIPTION: Find beet plots and harvest them. From now on, plant beet seeds from the shop. Each beet harvest will advance this discipline.

13696.NAME: Rosé Wine
13696.DESCRIPTION: For 25 built wine barrels, your beet growing progress will be boosted by 500 units.

13697.NAME: Rosy Ducks
13697.DESCRIPTION: Feed 1000 ducks of any kind. Your beet growing progress will be boosted by 1000 units.

13698.NAME: Coconut Olympiad
13698.DESCRIPTION: Each fully repaired coconut spotlight will advance this task’s progress.

13699.NAME: White Reflectors
13699.DESCRIPTION: After feeding 500 adult sheep, your Olympiad coconut result will improve by 1000 points.

137.NAME: Upgrade plank well
137.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the plank well to a clay well

13700.NAME: Carrot Reflectors
13700.DESCRIPTION: Harvest 500 carrots and your Olympiad coconut result will improve by 2000 points.

13701.NAME: Harpoon Olympiad
13701.DESCRIPTION: Each strike into a eucalyptus will advance this discipline. You can find eucalyptus seedlings in the furrows.

13702.NAME: Sharpening Bushes
13702.DESCRIPTION: Cut grass, bushes, purple-stem clusters, or rooted seaweed. Completing this task will earn you 900 harpoons for the competition.

13703.NAME: Sharpening While Resting
13703.DESCRIPTION: Build hammocks. Completing this task will advance your harpoon carving progress by 1800 units.

13704.NAME: Betta Olympiad
13704.DESCRIPTION: This discipline will count every fed Betta fish.

13705.NAME: Bright Anemones
13705.DESCRIPTION: Anemones ripen like berry bushes. After harvesting these plants 500 times, you will find 1000 Betta fish to advance the discipline.

13706.NAME: Bright Corals
13706.DESCRIPTION: Build corals. Completing this task will advance this discipline by 2000 units. Corals can be found in the shop.

13707.NAME: Poisonous Olympiad
13707.DESCRIPTION: Each feeding of a jelly cube will advance this task’s progress. You can buy and sell cubes in the shop.

13708.NAME: Rare Benches
13708.DESCRIPTION: Completing this task will advance this discipline by 1000 units. Build iron benches.

13709.NAME: Rare Plants
13709.DESCRIPTION: Harvest competition flytraps or red and purple flytraps, and you will progress the discipline by 2000 units.

1371.NAME: Strawberries to bring with you
1371.DESCRIPTION: Harvest a sufficient amount of strawberries

13710.NAME: Olympiad Llamas
13710.DESCRIPTION: Each feeding of a llama or its baby on the Olympiad island will progress this discipline by one unit.

13711.NAME: Friendly Ore
13711.DESCRIPTION: Build existing and additional totem masks. Completing this task will increase the number of fed llamas by 1000.

13712.NAME: Friendly Miner
13712.DESCRIPTION: Chop cooled ore stones. After the first 333 strikes, the number of fed llamas will increase by 2000 units.

13713.NAME: Olympiad Bamboo
13713.DESCRIPTION: This discipline will be advanced by building bamboo paths and completing bamboo paths. Both actions will be counted.

13714.NAME: Koala Weavers
13714.DESCRIPTION: Feed the koalas living on the island. Completing this task will advance the squid discipline by 200 units.

13715.NAME: Onion Weavers
13715.DESCRIPTION: Harvest onion crops. After completing this task, the squid discipline will advance by 400 points.

13716.NAME: Building Olympiad
13716.DESCRIPTION: This is not about some furniture constructor. Build and complete Asian mansions to advance this discipline.

13717.NAME: Graceful Antelope
13717.DESCRIPTION: Feed the antelopes on the island, or buy other antelopes. Completing this task will earn you 1000 Olympiad tools.

13718.NAME: Graceful Potatoes
13718.DESCRIPTION: Harvest potato crops. For completing the task, you will receive 2000 Olympiad tools, thereby advancing this discipline.

13719.NAME: Sea Blister Olympiad
13719.DESCRIPTION: Grow Sea blisters in the furrows, each harvest will advance this task as well as the discipline overall.

13720.NAME: Rubbing Blisters
13720.DESCRIPTION: To earn 500 Sea blister progress, you need to build 250 clay brick paths. Building will surely rub blisters.

13721.NAME: Blister Eaters
13721.DESCRIPTION: To earn 1000 Sea blister progress, you need to feed 1000 deep-water catfish.

13722.NAME: Lizard Olympiad
13722.DESCRIPTION: Each fed lizard will advance this discipline’s progress.

13723.NAME: Lemon Frogs
13723.DESCRIPTION: Repair all frog fountains on this island, and the lizard feeding progress will be increased by 1000 units.

13724.NAME: Lemon Strikes
13724.DESCRIPTION: Make strikes in rubber trees. After the first 1000 such strikes, this discipline will progress by 2000 units.

13725.NAME: Limestone Olympiad
13725.DESCRIPTION: In the shop, you will find special chameleon decorations. This discipline will be advanced both by building and completing these decorations.

13726.NAME: Ringed Elephants
13726.DESCRIPTION: Feed elephants and their babies. Completing this task will advance the decoration building discipline by 1000 units.

13727.NAME: Ringed Stalagmites
13727.DESCRIPTION: For the first 1000 strikes in any stalagmite, this competition discipline will advance by 2000 units.

13728.NAME: Snail Olympiad
13728.DESCRIPTION: Feed snails. Each fed snail, or its baby, will improve this discipline’s result.

13729.NAME: Cabbage Fans
13729.DESCRIPTION: For completing all peacock fans, this discipline will rise by 1000 points.

1373.NAME: Blueberry juice to bring with you

13730.NAME: Sleeping in Cabbages
13730.DESCRIPTION: If you complete this task, the snail feeding discipline will advance by 2000 units.

13731.NAME: Rooster Throats
13731.DESCRIPTION: Hens like it, but other animals think rooster songs are just shouting. Feed big and small roosters.

13732.NAME: Duck Sounds
13732.DESCRIPTION: Ducks drum with their feet on the water and refuse live performance offers. Feed ducklings and ducks.

13733.NAME: Hollow Rumble
13733.DESCRIPTION: The ground vibrates all around. Ostriches with heads in the sand sing in chorus. The earth shakes, but no sound. Feed any ostriches.

13734.NAME: Play the Record
13734.DESCRIPTION: Sell any wood storage sheds until you find where the old gramophone has gone.

13735.NAME: Disco Music
13735.DESCRIPTION: To the cheerful music rhythms, hedgehogs roll out from under the bushes, spinning again and again and again. Feed hedgehogs and their babies.

13736.NAME: Dance with Friends
13736.DESCRIPTION: Visit friends and help them. Invite friends to jump along to the music. More fun together!

13737.NAME: Disco Island
13737.DESCRIPTION: Find a distant corner on the map and head to Disco Island.

13738.NAME: Sweep the Floor
13738.DESCRIPTION: Remove any thorns, bushes, or stones. Uproot trees, pick mushrooms. Throw away dead fish, or gather purple-flower clusters.

13739.NAME: Tamp the Ground
13739.DESCRIPTION: Feet sink into the soil. Harvest crops, or dig out a swamp. Tamp the ground, but remember, you are not allowed to dig a dance floor.

13740.NAME: Insulation
13740.DESCRIPTION: To make sure the noise really, really doesn’t disturb anyone, fluffy sheep are invited to the party. Feed lambs and sheep.

13741.NAME: Rooms
13741.DESCRIPTION: Stepping on a hedgehog is unpleasant for both you and the hedgehog. The island is divided into dance rooms. Feed hedgehogs and show them their designated grass.

13742.NAME: Glittering
13742.DESCRIPTION: Cats study how they could catch the flying shiny ball. With full bellies it’s harder to jump, feed cats and kittens.

13743.NAME: Sofas
13743.DESCRIPTION: Wooden benches don’t fit the disco design. Buy and build some comfy sofas.

13744.NAME: Hay Seating
13744.DESCRIPTION: Some animals still prefer sitting in straw. Build hay stacks.

13745.NAME: Bird Nests
13745.DESCRIPTION: Right now little birds are swinging on wires. For their comfort, build birdhouses or cloth poles.

13746.NAME: Pack Dogs
13746.DESCRIPTION: Foxes have convinced dogs to make a trip to the store. Sell dogs.

13747.NAME: Sweaty Goats
13747.DESCRIPTION: The goats are completely soaked from dancing, they’ll gladly accompany the dogs and cool off at the same time. Sell goats.

13748.NAME: Shopping List
13748.DESCRIPTION: Foxes list the remaining little things that would be useful for this party. Feed foxes and fox cubs.

13749.NAME: Back Row
13749.DESCRIPTION: Foxes ask cows to line up in one or two rows against the wall. Feed cows and calves.

1375.NAME: Canned mushrooms to bring with you
1375.DESCRIPTION: Make a sufficient amount of canned mushrooms

13750.NAME: Middle Row
13750.DESCRIPTION: When the cows are in place, foxes invite the sheep to stand in front of the cows. Feed adult sheep.

13751.NAME: Front Row
13751.DESCRIPTION: At the same time, keep 45 adult pigs on the island, who will form the first row in this performance.

13752.NAME: Stump Discs
13752.DESCRIPTION: Sell resource sheds. Inside are already neatly cut round wooden discs.

13753.NAME: Wax Lumps
13753.DESCRIPTION: Empty the beehives. Foxes plan to cover these wooden discs with a firm layer of wax.

13754.NAME: Little Mechanics
13754.DESCRIPTION: Meerkats follow instructions and dismantle one of the music boxes. Feed meerkats.

13755.NAME: Recording Box
13755.DESCRIPTION: Buy in the store and build the specially modified song box. This box can record music, not just play it.

13756.NAME: Sheet Music Books
13756.DESCRIPTION: Rabbits have long ears. Placed like this, the sheet music books are easier for all singers to see. Feed baby rabbits.

13757.NAME: Position the Birds
13757.DESCRIPTION: Finches land on cows, starlings use the sheep podiums. Feed the birds, coordinate their placement on the animals’ backs.

13758.NAME: Well Then…
13758.DESCRIPTION: The birds want to say something, but their voices are completely dried out. Build water troughs, help the birds.

13759.NAME: Joyful Farewell
13759.DESCRIPTION: Soon the birds will have to make their long autumn flight, but today, party! Foxes, music! Feed foxes.

1376.NAME: Food to bring with you
1376.DESCRIPTION: Submit any kind of food for the food pack

13760.NAME: Preparing for Night
13760.DESCRIPTION: Night hours won’t stop this party. Find palm trees with lights in the store and set them up to light the island.

13761.NAME: New Rhythms
13761.DESCRIPTION: Build a jukebox for each dance floor. For every taste there will be a tune you can move along to.

13762.NAME: Seated Guests
13762.DESCRIPTION: An invitation to all those whose cat won’t let them stand up. Take the cat under your arm and go dance! Feed kittens and cats.

13763.NAME: Mandarin Ducks
13763.DESCRIPTION: After completing this task you will be able to buy one disco ball on Shaman Manu’s island.

13764.NAME: Sea Shore Birds
13764.DESCRIPTION: Feed the sea shore birds and you will get the chance to buy one disco ball in the underground cave.

13768.NAME: Playful Fish
13768.DESCRIPTION: Earn 7 boxes of joy by completing any Autumn Olympiad disciplines and you will receive the unique Playful Fish decoration!

13769.NAME: Fish Triplets
13769.DESCRIPTION: When you collect 15 boxes of joy, you will receive another Playful Fish, as well as three Fish Triplets decorations.

1377.NAME: Cactus lemonade to bring with you

13773.NAME: Competition Well
13773.DESCRIPTION: Place the Plank Well on the Festival Island. This task can only be completed on the Festival Island.

13774.NAME: Clay Well
13774.DESCRIPTION: Place the Clay Well on the Festival Island. This task can only be completed on the Festival Island.

13775.NAME: Stone Well
13775.DESCRIPTION: Place the Stone Well on the Festival Island. This task can only be completed on the Festival Island.

13776.NAME: Get berries or mushrooms
13776.DESCRIPTION: Forest kittens crawl under branches looking for berries and mushrooms. Help the kittens and collect these forest treasures.

13777.NAME: Travel at night
13777.DESCRIPTION: The darkness of night won’t stop you. Get on the raft and follow the kittens. Go to the Night Kittens’ Island.

13778.NAME: Feed the kittens
13778.DESCRIPTION: In the first task of each riddle, an animal will be involved. This time, feed the berry kittens.

13779.NAME: Help with berries
13779.DESCRIPTION: The second task of each riddle focuses on plants. Help the kittens harvest strawberries.

1378.NAME: Salt to bring with you
1378.DESCRIPTION: Buy a sufficient amount of salt

13780.NAME: Proudflower growing
13780.DESCRIPTION: In the third task of each riddle, you’ll need to do other kinds of work. This time, the kittens invite you to acquire proudflowers.

13781.NAME: Marigold Riddle Ia
13781.DESCRIPTION: It’s not known what to do in this task. You’ll find the answers the next morning in the left corner of the island.

13782.NAME: Marigold Riddle Ib
13782.DESCRIPTION: All answers will appear on specific dates. Starting later won’t cause you to miss anything.

13783.NAME: Marigold Riddle Ic
13783.DESCRIPTION: Completing these goals won’t affect how quickly the answer baskets appear. One basket each morning.

13786.NAME: Marigold Riddle IIc
13786.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

13789.NAME: Marigold Riddle IIIc
13789.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

1379.NAME: Doublons for 3rd place winners
1379.DESCRIPTION: The 3rd place winners will receive bronze medals. Submit 10 bronze doublons

13792.NAME: Marigold Riddle IVc
13792.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

13795.NAME: Marigold Riddle Vc
13795.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

13798.NAME: Marigold Riddle VIc
13798.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

138.NAME: Gather blueberries to craft paint
138.DESCRIPTION: There are two blueberry bushes in the new territory. Find them and gather 4 berries

1380.NAME: Doublons for 2nd place winners
1380.DESCRIPTION: The 2nd place winners will receive silver medals. Submit 5 silver doublons

13801.NAME: Marigold Riddle VIIc
13801.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

13804.NAME: Marigold Riddle VIIIc
13804.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

13807.NAME: Marigold Riddle IXc
13807.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

1381.NAME: Doublons for 1st place winners
1381.DESCRIPTION: The 1st place winners will receive gold medals. Submit 2 golden doublons

13810.NAME: Marigold Riddle Xc
13810.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

13813.NAME: Marigold Riddle XIc
13813.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

13816.NAME: Marigold Riddle XIIc
13816.DESCRIPTION: ??? Task NOT involving plants or animals. ???

13817.NAME: Forest goods in jars
13817.DESCRIPTION: The final task. Help the kittens sort the treasures. Make wild berry jams or mushroom preserves.

1382.NAME: Lemonade for the banquet
1382.DESCRIPTION: Nothing can be more refreshing than a glass of cactus lemonade. Make cactus lemonade

13820.NAME: Olympiad `25 Correction
13820.DESCRIPTION: To obtain the Autumn Leaf Fish, sell ONE of the Hidden Wealth Mines. You will receive the correct decoration as a reward.

13821.NAME: Festival Neighbors
13821.DESCRIPTION: The house is located near the Festival Island. Hop on the raft and travel with Maija to the Festival Island.

13822.NAME: Old Lock
13822.DESCRIPTION: Unable to turn the key, Maya hands it to you. Choose UPGRADE to unlock the abandoned house.

13823.NAME: Go Inside
13823.DESCRIPTION: Choose USE and you’ll enter the building.

13824.NAME: Boxes in the Corner
13824.DESCRIPTION: To reach the ghost festival decorations, you’ll need to throw out the junk. Clear out the clutter.

13825.NAME: Unpack the Bones
13825.DESCRIPTION: Find all the plastic skeleton decorations. Dig through the old chests to find plastic skulls.

13826.NAME: Other Parts
13826.DESCRIPTION: Some bones were used in other celebrations, so they were tossed on top of the wardrobe. Use the dresser.

13827.NAME: Hanging Trees
13827.DESCRIPTION: The skeletons are old and barely hold together. Tie them up and hang the bones on the trees where bats are now hanging.

13828.NAME: Dancing Skeletons
13828.DESCRIPTION: By selecting the best bones, you can create a skeleton that can stand on its feet. Build the skeleton pedestal.

13829.NAME: Herb Gathering
13829.DESCRIPTION: Weed the local bushes on Festival Island until you find the needed herbs.

1383.NAME: Pretzels for the banquet
1383.DESCRIPTION: In order to make the banquet more festive, you should serve a wonderful pretzel. Make pretzels.

13830.NAME: Pumpkin Baskets
13830.DESCRIPTION: So you don’t have to walk around with a knife, fill all the pumpkin baskets with pumpkins before carving.

13831.NAME: Collect the Candles
13831.DESCRIPTION: Take candles from candle holders to iluminate pumpkins latter. Replenish candles by selecting UPGRADE on empty stands.

13832.NAME: Carve the Pumpkins
13832.DESCRIPTION: Wave the knife, create angry and happy faces. Carve the orange pumpkins, then UPGRADE them and carve the next ones.

13833.NAME: Pumpkins on the Lawn
13833.DESCRIPTION: Place the freshly carved pumpkins. On Festival Island, upgrade the pumpkins located next to the house.

13834.NAME: Light the Pumpkins
13834.DESCRIPTION: Use candles so the pumpkins start to glow. From time to time the pumpkins will go out, so the candles will need to be replaced.

13835.NAME: Water for Tea
13835.DESCRIPTION: Someone waves to you from the other side of the garden. Maia reminds you that tea needs water—scoop some from the spring.

13836.NAME: Mirror Practice
13836.DESCRIPTION: Turn the mirror right and left, practice your expressions. Use the mirror until you’ve gathered enough ideas for faces.

13837.NAME: Startled
13837.DESCRIPTION: You didn’t notice when Maia approached: “How’s the tea coming along?” Light the stove to heat the water.

13838.NAME: Tea Set
13838.DESCRIPTION: Search the cupboard and find the dishes for making tea.

13839.NAME: Sharpen the Knives
13839.DESCRIPTION: Pumpkin carving will go faster if you sharpen these knives. Use the axe baskets and sharpen the knives.

1384.NAME: Radish for the banquet
1384.DESCRIPTION: People say that the local sportsmen love radish. Harvest radish fields.

13840.NAME: Try the Knives
13840.DESCRIPTION: The tea is still steeping, keep carving pumpkins. Place the green pumpkins in the garden of Festival Island.

13841.NAME: Scary Pumpkins
13841.DESCRIPTION: Put candles in the green pumpkins. Not to brag, but the faces turned out great.

13842.NAME: Tension
13842.DESCRIPTION: Maia is visibly frightened and runs away. Maybe it’s time to serve tea to calm the nerves? Use the stove.

13843.NAME: Sit Down
13843.DESCRIPTION: Maybe while stirring tea you stood up too quickly—your head spins from the steam, and you drop the cup. Build sofas.

13844.NAME: Noise
13844.DESCRIPTION: Hearing the noise, Maya enters. While trying to pick up the shards, Maya cuts her hand. Search the cupboards and find bandages.

13845.NAME: Crooked Mirror
13845.DESCRIPTION: Maybe it’s the tea steam. As Maia leaves, you don’t see her reflection in the mirror. Examine the mirror, use it.

13846.NAME: Tea Herbs
13846.DESCRIPTION: Maia is already waiting for you in the garden and points out which herbs are needed. Collect the tea herbs again.

13847.NAME: Scoop from the Spring
13847.DESCRIPTION: While pointing to the herbs, the injured finger looked healed. Scoop water from the spring.

13848.NAME: Serve the Tea
13848.DESCRIPTION: Fulfilling the request, you prepared the tea. Find Maya in the garden. Build a dining table so you can sit and talk.

13849.NAME: Bandage
13849.DESCRIPTION: Maya’s finger is bandaged. Didn’t quite get it? Express your concerns. Feed the cats and kittens.

1385.NAME: Help Tycott
1385.DESCRIPTION: Tycott's wood-material shed is almost empty. Activate the 5-day bonus in sawmill three times

13850.NAME: Gloomy Tea
13850.DESCRIPTION: The tea is too hot to drink. Maya hadn’t asked for tea. Your story seems frightening. Remove the black onions.

13851.NAME: Present the Herbs
13851.DESCRIPTION: You show Maya the plant you used in the tea. This plant is very poisonous—that’s why you felt dizzy at first.

13852.NAME: Knives?
13852.DESCRIPTION: The knives really were dull—they needed sharpening. That was a useful request. Feed the hedgehogs and baby hedgehogs.

13853.NAME: Candles?
13853.DESCRIPTION: Hand in some candles. Maya has no problem holding them, not like the first time, when they went trough the hands.

13854.NAME: Break the Floor
13854.DESCRIPTION: With Maya’s permission, you decide to lift the floorboards. Some of the board paths can be UPGRADED. Find these paths.

13855.NAME: Bitter Truth
13855.DESCRIPTION: The sand under the floor is berry black. Plant and harvest radishes, then dig deeper.

13856.NAME: Creepy Discovery
13856.DESCRIPTION: The urn found underground is ancient, with roots wrapped around it. Plant the urn from the shop, then dig it up.

13857.NAME: Ghostly Roses
13857.DESCRIPTION: Maya faints. Thorns sprout from the ground and wrap around the lying body. Plant and harvest the ghostly roses.

13858.NAME: Lost Consciousness
13858.DESCRIPTION: If fear took away consciousness, maybe pleasant emotions will awaken Maya? Plant and harvest the pleasant strawberries.

13859.NAME: Rooster’s Cry
13859.DESCRIPTION: Feed small and large roosters. The birds’ voices make the ghost grimace, but Maya keeps sleeping.

1386.NAME: Help Mycott
1386.DESCRIPTION: Mycott has run out of shells. Activate the 5-day bonus in laboratory three times

13860.NAME: Mirror Rune
13860.DESCRIPTION: When the mirror in the attic was cleaned, rubbing the strange symbol summoned this ghost. Examine the mirror.

13861.NAME: Break the Mirror
13861.DESCRIPTION: In the corner of the mirror there really is a strangely drawn mark. Upgrade it and then smash this cursed mirror.

13862.NAME: Old Superstition
13862.DESCRIPTION: Breaking a mirror always brings bad luck. From the ground emerge horns and claws. Try to fight—place the monsters.

13863.NAME: Knives and Forks
13863.DESCRIPTION: Search the dressers, find all the knives and forks. Remember—only silver items!

13864.NAME: Banish the Monsters
13864.DESCRIPTION: Feeding the monsters from silver spoons turns them into vapor and they disappear. Banish (feed) the monsters.

13865.NAME: Truce
13865.DESCRIPTION: After true horrors, a truce is made with the house spirit. Offer an olive branch. Plant and cut down the olive tree.

13866.NAME: Loyal Guardians
13866.DESCRIPTION: Feed the dogs and puppies. The little spirit thought you were uninvited guests and was just trying to do its job.

13867.NAME: Spirit in a Pot
13867.DESCRIPTION: Spirit cannot cross the threshold, even if it crawls into the urn. Plant and harvest the urns.

13868.NAME: Not Spiritual
13868.DESCRIPTION: The little spirit is well-rooted—it lacks the strength to break free and leave this house. Harvest the well-rooted corn.

13869.NAME: Warming Word
13869.DESCRIPTION: The little spirit has no name—like a mirror, it had mirrored Maya. Use the stove to bake a new name for the spirit.

1387.NAME: Help Gycott
1387.DESCRIPTION: Gycott has only a couple of strawberries left after the banquet. Harvest strawberries on your island.

13870.NAME: Bright Moods
13870.DESCRIPTION: The autumn darkness can depress any spirit. Present candles to increase the light.

13871.NAME: Best Skills
13871.DESCRIPTION: The little spirit loves to hide and scare. A loud voice is the spirit’s skill. Sell adult roosters.

13872.NAME: Across the Threshold
13872.DESCRIPTION: The urn is carefully carried outside. The little spirit has never traveled farther than the home garden. Visit Festival Island.

13873.NAME: Replanting
13873.DESCRIPTION: The little spirit wants to hide in the poisonous herbs. Collect wild herbs so you can plant them in the urn.

13874.NAME: A Place to Sit
13874.DESCRIPTION: Make sure there are at least 4 dining tables on the island. Dining is more comfortable when sitting on soft furniture.

13875.NAME: 13 Pumpkins
13875.DESCRIPTION: Make sure there are 13 ghostly flying pumpkins on the island at the same time.

13876.NAME: Hide and Seek in the Roses
13876.DESCRIPTION: Grow 66 rose bushes at once. It will be hard for both you and others to guess from which bush the little ghost will jump out.

13877.NAME: Bunny Aloe Maze
13877.DESCRIPTION: When 101 bunnies nibble on the aloe at once, even short ears can find the way. Travel to the bunnies.

13878.NAME: Sharp-Eyed Squids
13878.DESCRIPTION: Flying fish glide over the island every day. Ask the squid for directions. Gain the pathfinding skill.

13879.NAME: A Few Bunnies
13879.DESCRIPTION: During winter, the bunnies sit under the aloes and nibble on fresh sprouts. Find and greet three bunnies.

1388.NAME: Planks to bring with you
1388.DESCRIPTION: Prepare some planks, in case you have to fix the raft

13881.NAME: Brush the Furs
13881.DESCRIPTION: The animals look scruffy again. Take the big comb and brush the animals’ fur. Feed any of your animals.

13882.NAME: Weavers’ Island
13882.DESCRIPTION: Weavers are the right people to appreciate such a tablecloth. Travel to Weavers’ Island.

13883.NAME: Chop Trees
13883.DESCRIPTION: No one came to greet you? While waiting for the island’s owners, clear some space. Chop the tall palms or baobabs.

13884.NAME: Trim Bushes
13884.DESCRIPTION: You have the tablecloth, now you need some flowers for the vase. Dig in the swamp or trim the yellow club-moss patches.

13885.NAME: Break Stones
13885.DESCRIPTION: By moving one of the looms, you’ll find a suitable stone to sit on and wait. Strike the island’s rocks.

13886.NAME: Keep Trimming
13886.DESCRIPTION: Alright, you can wait a little longer. Just like before, continue any cleanup tasks.

13887.NAME: Spot in the Meadow
13887.DESCRIPTION: If you place the tablecloth on the ground, it becomes a small picnic blanket. Clear more thickets, trees, or swamp.

13888.NAME: Really No One?
13888.DESCRIPTION: Climb the nearest tree. Have the island’s inhabitants gotten lost? No one has even offered tea. Keep busy.

13889.NAME: Bush Arches
13889.DESCRIPTION: No need to cut everything down. Straight lines will do. Level the bumps, continue cleaning up.

1389.NAME: Stone blocks to bring with you
1389.DESCRIPTION: Prepare some stone blocks, in case you need some shelter from the rain

13890.NAME: Gust of Wind
13890.DESCRIPTION: The wind has blown the tablecloth into the thickets. Keep clearing the island and retrieve the tablecloth.

13891.NAME: A Log to Sit On
13891.DESCRIPTION: It seems even whole trees are in the way here. Fell at least a few, they can be used for sitting. Finish the cleanup.

13892.NAME: Red Spools
13892.DESCRIPTION: Greet the thread spinners. Use the Rosy Spinners.

13893.NAME: Change the Dye
13893.DESCRIPTION: UPGRADE the Sunny Spinner. You arrived just in time for a shift change. By changing the dye bucket, the Sunny Spinner turns silver.

13894.NAME: Silver Threads
13894.DESCRIPTION: The weavers and spinners will be ready to talk after they finish winding the silver threads. Obtain Silver Spools.

13895.NAME: Wrapping Sticks
13895.DESCRIPTION: If you wrap a stick with thick, colorful threads, it could make a quick and neat decoration. Build green Budding Trees.

13896.NAME: Build Several Trees
13896.DESCRIPTION: After the first few trees, you realize they look good enough. Wrap a few more green palms with bright threads.

13897.NAME: Busy Year
13897.DESCRIPTION: Craftsmen don’t know rest. Their pile of Shells keeps growing. Build a few stone Shell storages.

13898.NAME: Pull Away from Work
13898.DESCRIPTION: Enough working! Time to get ready and put on festive clothes. Buy Raccoons in the shop.

13899.NAME: Upgrade Rosy Spinners
13899.DESCRIPTION:
Get the Raccoons’ attention.
Upgrade the Rosy Spinners, recolor the threads purple.

139.NAME: Craft paint
139.DESCRIPTION: Craft 3 paint buckets, using milk, eggs and blueberries. You will need paint for the new buildings

1390.NAME: 1st school task
1390.DESCRIPTION: Tussy had 100 beans. SHe planted 40 and lost 15. Plant as many bean fields as the amount of beans she had left

13900.NAME: Dress the Raccoons
13900.DESCRIPTION: Sew festive outfits for the Raccoons from threads. Have 9 neatly dressed Raccoons on the island at once.

13901.NAME: Feed the Fish
13901.DESCRIPTION: Watching fish is calming. Build aquariums or angelfish trophies.

13902.NAME: Ribbon Decorated
13902.DESCRIPTION: Give the Raccoons thread spools and have them wrap all the tropical trees in a festive look. Finish building.

13903.NAME: Work Horses
13903.DESCRIPTION: The saying that workhorses should be allowed to rest was taken too literally by the Raccoons. Feed the foals.

13904.NAME: Misty Spools
13904.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the Mossy Spinners, then obtain Misty Spools. Bleaching the green threads will make the Kangaroos stop working.

13905.NAME: Place the Kangaroos
13905.DESCRIPTION: Kangaroos can be bought in the shop, place them in a row to start trying on clothes.

13906.NAME: Tuxedos for Kangaroos
13906.DESCRIPTION: Have 9 Kangaroos in tuxedos on the island at once. The vests don’t need to be buttoned, as long as they look stylish.

13907.NAME: Angelfish Delight
13907.DESCRIPTION: The Kangaroos suggest not waiting. While they search for tapestries, obtain royally purple fish and angelfish.

13908.NAME: Place the Tapestries
13908.DESCRIPTION: While you were fishing, the Kangaroos found the buried tapestries. Buy several Started Tapestries in the shop.

13909.NAME: Finish the Embroidery
13909.DESCRIPTION: The Kangaroos had forgotten—the tapestries weren’t fully embroidered. Go help and finish these decorations.

1391.NAME: 2nd school task
1391.DESCRIPTION: Paprick has 24 flax ropes and 16 liana ropes. How many ropes does he have? Make the same amount of ropes

13910.NAME: Stop the Spiders
13910.DESCRIPTION: The Spiders are almost dressed up, but they keep working. Buy Spiders in the shop.

13911.NAME: Ongoing Work
13911.DESCRIPTION: Feed the Spiders until you get Spider - Weavers. The Spiders will stop working only when the job is done.

13912.NAME: Praise the Patterns
13912.DESCRIPTION: Study the freshly woven fabrics. Praise the fine patterns. Discuss embroidery methods, feed the Spider - Weavers.

13913.NAME: Attract the Camels
13913.DESCRIPTION: The Camels walk around with shiny boxes on their backs; to keep them calm, you’ll need bait. Build a few clay troughs.

13914.NAME: Greet the Camels
13914.DESCRIPTION: Buy Camels in the shop. While the Camels eat, remove the heavy loads from their backs.

13915.NAME: Raise the Camels
13915.DESCRIPTION: The Camels don’t have festive clothes. Use the fabrics made by the Spiders. Have 18 dressed-up Camels on the island at once.

13916.NAME: Turn on the Light
13916.DESCRIPTION: Turn on the light, upgrade the Night Spinner where the Llamas keep their clothes. There are plenty of outfits to choose from here.

13917.NAME: Place the Llamas
13917.DESCRIPTION: Buy Llamas in the shop. The Llamas change clothes behind the baobabs. Place five Llamas on the island who are still deciding.

13918.NAME: Distribute Parasols
13918.DESCRIPTION: Have 12 Llamas with parasols on the island at once. More than half of the Llamas are almost ready for the celebration.

13919.NAME: More Tapestries
13919.DESCRIPTION: All the found tapestries are unfinished. Lend a hand, embroider more tapestries.

1392.NAME: 3rd school task
1392.DESCRIPTION: Turrick harvested 45 tomatoes. He needs to harvest 130 in total. How many tomatoes does he have to harvest now? Feed rabbits as many times

13920.NAME: Silk Spinners
13920.DESCRIPTION: The Raccoons’ decorating efforts have also involved insects – spinners. Buy and feed the little bugs.

13921.NAME: Dress the Dancers
13921.DESCRIPTION: The Kangaroos and Raccoons have found dancer sculptures. Buy and dress the dancer decorations.

13922.NAME: Sell the Camels
13922.DESCRIPTION: The Camels can’t stand still and try to move the already stacked boxes. Sell the dressed-up Camels.

13923.NAME: Frozen Bees
13923.DESCRIPTION: Unpack or thaw the bees encased in ice blocks. Find the Honey Suitcases in the shop and build them.

13924.NAME: No Exceptions
13924.DESCRIPTION: A festive look for everyone, no exceptions. Use the Honey Suitcases, make sure even the bees tidy up.

13925.NAME: Raccoons in Parade
13925.DESCRIPTION: The animals are invited to join a singing festive parade. Sell the dressed-up Raccoons. Organize the parade.

13926.NAME: Kangaroos in Parade
13926.DESCRIPTION: In smaller groups, the animals start moving out. Sell the dressed-up Kangaroos. Coordinate the parade.

13927.NAME: Llamas in Parade
13927.DESCRIPTION: The Llamas are right—the parade will need a flag. Sell the dressed-up Llamas. Listen to their suggestions.

13928.NAME: Colorful Trees
13928.DESCRIPTION: Help the craftsmen obtain colorful threads, clear the vibrant flower trees. These trees will bloom again tomorrow morning.

13929.NAME: Build Spinners
13929.DESCRIPTION: You’d gladly lend a hand in spinning, but there’s not enough space in the spinners. Look in the shop and build any spinners.

1393.NAME: 4th school task
1393.DESCRIPTION: Make fish soup as many times as there are months in two years

13930.NAME: Flax Spinning
13930.DESCRIPTION: The craftsmen could make the island’s decorations right here, but they’ll need flax seeds for that. Harvest the flax fields.

13931.NAME: Flag in the Workshop
13931.DESCRIPTION: You take the flag but find a scarf on the mannequin that the animals have woven just for you. Make a Scarf in the workshop.

1394.NAME: 5th school task
1394.DESCRIPTION: Obtain milk as many times as 7 cows have feet

1395.NAME: 6th school task
1395.DESCRIPTION: Mycott dug 28 furrows on Monday. On Wednesday, he had 50 furrows. How many furrows did he dig on Tuesday? Plant as many three-branch palms

1396.NAME: 7th school task
1396.DESCRIPTION: Sissy has two dishes of strawberries. Each contains 20 berries. How many berries does she have? Help harvesting plants on friend's islands that many times

1397.NAME: 8th school task
1397.DESCRIPTION: Gycott is making wooden stools, each needs 4 nails. How many nails he needs to make 6 stools? Make that many nails

1398.NAME: 9th school task
1398.DESCRIPTION: How much does one lamb cost in shells? Make as many plank paths

1399.NAME: 10th school task
1399.DESCRIPTION: Cudsy wants to know, how much is one quarter of 100? Sell as many grown-up pigs

14.NAME: Plant 2 radish fields
14.DESCRIPTION: Gather shells so you can buy 2 radish in the shop. Then plant them in two fields.

140.NAME: Craft cloth
140.DESCRIPTION: Craft your first cloth. It can be crafted from wool and will be needed for the new buildings

1400.NAME: 11th school task
1400.DESCRIPTION: Toby asks: How many ml of cactus juice can you pour in a 200 ml glass? Buy as many units of sugar

1401.NAME: 12th school task
1401.DESCRIPTION: How much does branch food shed cost in shells? Harvest as many wheat fields on your island

1402.NAME: 13th school task
1402.DESCRIPTION: Make as many branch stools as there are cactuses, aloes and camel-thorns on desert island

1403.NAME: 14th school task
1403.DESCRIPTION: Obtain as much water from the well as there are furrows on Paprick's island

1404.NAME: 15th school task
1404.DESCRIPTION: How much do 2 bugs cost in the shop? Cut trees on friend's islands as many times

1405.NAME: Ropes to bring with you
1405.DESCRIPTION: Prepare some ropes - they always come in handy

1406.NAME: Gaining reputation
1406.DESCRIPTION: Gain enough reputation for travelling to the volcano island

1407.NAME: Go to the volcano island
1407.DESCRIPTION: Get on your raft and go to the volcano island

1408.NAME: Helpful rabbit grower
1408.DESCRIPTION: Feed grown-up or baby rabbits on your friend's islands

1409.NAME: Grow 20 rabbits
1409.DESCRIPTION: Grow and sell 20 rabbits to obtain extra experience and shells

141.NAME: Upgrade plank house
141.DESCRIPTION: Start upgrading the plank house by pressing UPGRADE on it

1413.NAME: Collect berries and mushrooms
1413.DESCRIPTION: Collect wild berries and mushrooms - they don't grow near the volcano

1416.NAME: Spend stone blocks
1416.DESCRIPTION: Spend stone blocks in any way you want

1417.NAME: Harvest friend's plantations
1417.DESCRIPTION: Harvest any plants on your friend's islands

1419.NAME: Make beads
1419.DESCRIPTION: Make some bone beads in the workshop

142.NAME: Complete clay house
142.DESCRIPTION: Complete building your clay house. It will increase your maximum energy

1425.NAME: Sell flowers
1425.DESCRIPTION: Sell red or yellow small flowers

1426.NAME: Obtain clay
1426.DESCRIPTION: Obtain clay in any way you want

1429.NAME: Obtain stone
1429.DESCRIPTION: Obtain a bunch of stones (use stone pit or chop stones with chisel)

1430.NAME: Chop trees on friend's islands
1430.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends with chopping trees

1432.NAME: Feed roosters
1432.DESCRIPTION: Feed small or grown-up roosters on your or friend's islands

1434.NAME: Talk to Paprick
1434.DESCRIPTION: Visit Paprick. I know that he has prepared an offering for me!

1435.NAME: Offer the bundle to the volcano god
1435.DESCRIPTION: Deliver the bundle to the volcano god (simply touch him)

1436.NAME: Give a doubloon to the volcano god

1437.NAME: Give some eggs to the volcano god

1438.NAME: Give some clay pots to the volcano god

1439.NAME: Give shards to the volcano god

1440.NAME: Give paint to the volcano god
1440.DESCRIPTION: Submit paint (it can be crafted in the workshop)

1441.NAME: Give grapes to the volcano god

1442.NAME: Give bricks to the volcano god

1443.NAME: Give some wool to the volcano god

1445.NAME: Activate the volcano
1445.DESCRIPTION: Donate flame elixir, explosive powder and volcano heart to the volcano (just touch it)

1451.NAME: Some firewood
1451.DESCRIPTION: Chop up and submit some wood and you'll receive several fertilizers as a gift

1452.NAME: Try out plant fertilizer
1452.DESCRIPTION: Click on a non-grown plant and use a fertilizer. Spend several fertilizers this way

1453.NAME: Shells for fodder
1453.DESCRIPTION: Submit some shells and receive several units of fodder as a gift

1454.NAME: Accelerate the growth of animals
1454.DESCRIPTION: Spend the obtained fodder by clicking on a baby animal and accelerating its growth

1455.NAME: Autumn cleaning
1455.DESCRIPTION: The locals believe that the best time for cleaning is autumn, not spring. Remove grass, thorns or thorny bushes on any of your islands (not your friends')

1456.NAME: Autumn winds
1456.DESCRIPTION: The weather is getting colder, and some thick blankets will be necessary. Submit wool

1457.NAME: Autumn reconstruction
1457.DESCRIPTION: Autumn is the very last moment for building some new sheds. Build a stick or plank shed of any kind.

1458.NAME: Flowers for bees
1458.DESCRIPTION: Bees enjoy places where colourful flowers are in bloom. Buy and place blue, white or orange flowers on your island

1459.NAME: Sweets for bees
1459.DESCRIPTION: Bees always appear if there are sweets. Make some tasty coconut porridge

1460.NAME: Aroma for bees
1460.DESCRIPTION: If something will smell sweetly on the island, the bees will arrive in a heartbeat. Plant pumpkins

1461.NAME: Fire-wood stock
1461.DESCRIPTION: Although it's always warm in Oceania, the locals always prepare some firewood. Chop trees on your island

1462.NAME: Jam stock
1462.DESCRIPTION: Autumn is the best time for making jam. Make berry jam.

1463.NAME: Chicken farm
1463.DESCRIPTION: Turns out, that the saying "Count your chickens in autumn" is popular with the locals. Feed chickens on your island

1469.NAME: Honey gatherer
1469.DESCRIPTION: Obtain honey from the beehive 60 times

147.NAME: Place 6 clay paths
147.DESCRIPTION: Buy and place 6 clay paths to make your island more beautiful

1470.NAME: Desert plants
1470.DESCRIPTION: Go to desert island and harvest camelthorns, aloe or cactuses

1471.NAME: Doubloons
1471.DESCRIPTION: Go to Pinaki island and visit the treasure cave 3 times

1472.NAME: Obtain lava chisels
1472.DESCRIPTION: Go to volcano island and obtain 15 lava chisels

1473.NAME: Autumn morning ritual
1473.DESCRIPTION: The locals celebrate autumn by forming a line and washing their faces early in the morning. Obtain water

1474.NAME: Lobworm hunter
1474.DESCRIPTION: In autumn, the locals organize a lobworm race. Submit lobworms

1475.NAME: Radishes for immunity
1475.DESCRIPTION: The locals know that there is no better medicine than radish. Make radish salad several times

1476.NAME: Milk for the autumn ball
1476.DESCRIPTION: Now that all works are done, it is time to rest. Get milk to serve at the ball

1477.NAME: Candy for the autumn ball
1477.DESCRIPTION: Now that all works are done, it is time to rest. Buy candy to hand out to the winners of party-games

1478.NAME: Goods for the autumn ball
1478.DESCRIPTION: Now that all works are done, it is time to rest. Harvest melons, blueberries, coconuts or bananas.

148.NAME: Sell at least 3 twig sheds
148.DESCRIPTION: It's time to free some space for new buildings. Sell 3 twig sheds (if you have sold them already, you'll have to build them anew)

1480.NAME: Food for Mycott's sheep
1480.DESCRIPTION: Mycott owns a large herd of sheep. Help him by submitting 40 units of food

1481.NAME: Fences for Mycott's sheep
1481.DESCRIPTION: An angry cow recently ruined Mycott's fence. Build and sell 10 plank fences

1482.NAME: Ropes for Mycott's sheep
1482.DESCRIPTION: You need ropes to make sure that the sheep do not wander off. Submit 15 ropes

1483.NAME: Sheep feeder
1483.DESCRIPTION: Show Mycott that you like sheep as much as he does. Feed lambs or sheep on your island.

1484.NAME: Sheep shearer
1484.DESCRIPTION: Mycott wants to cover the floor of his living-room with woolen rugs. Submit 6 units of wool

1485.NAME: Sheep friend
1485.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends - sheep keepers. Feed sheep or lambs on friends' islands.

1486.NAME: Beehives
1486.DESCRIPTION: It is time to build the first beehives. Buy and build 2 beehives

1487.NAME: Honey
1487.DESCRIPTION: The bees have taken residence in the beehives. Now try obtaining honey

1488.NAME: Honey cake
1488.DESCRIPTION: Honey can be used to make food. Go to the workshop and make honey cake several times

1489.NAME: Offerings
1489.DESCRIPTION: Get lava chisels from the volcano god 3 times

1490.NAME: Explore the bags
1490.DESCRIPTION: Explore the abandoned bags - you'll get good rewards and will unlock beautiful decorations in the shop!

1491.NAME: Chisel
1491.DESCRIPTION: Give the sample to the volcano god

1492.NAME: Neighbour harvest
1492.DESCRIPTION: Now that your work is done, go and help your neighbours to harvest plants!

1493.NAME: Neighbour animals
1493.DESCRIPTION: Now that your work is done, go and help your neighbours to feed their animals!

1494.NAME: Neighbour timber
1494.DESCRIPTION: Now that your work is done, go and help your neighbours to chop trees!

1495.NAME: Pumpkin gatherer
1495.DESCRIPTION: What's Halloween without a great stock of pumpkins? Harvest pumpkin fields

1496.NAME: Bead maker
1496.DESCRIPTION: The locals scare away nasty ghosts by rattling bone beads. Submit beads

1497.NAME: Candy buyer
1497.DESCRIPTION: You have to be ready to receive local children on your island. Buy some candy

1498.NAME: Stools for guests
1498.DESCRIPTION: Guests might be forced to stand in line at your door. Make stools

1499.NAME: Scary outfits
1499.DESCRIPTION: Everyone wants to sew special costumes for Halloween. Submit wool

15.NAME: Harvest 2 radish fields
15.DESCRIPTION: Gather 2 radish fields and you will get 6 radish which can be found in the backpack.

150.NAME: Place castle foundations
150.DESCRIPTION: Open the shop section BUILDINGS and place castle foundations on your island

1500.NAME: Maggots for the mischievous
1500.DESCRIPTION: If someone tries to cheat, you can scare them with maggots. Collect maggots

1501.NAME: Paprick
1501.DESCRIPTION: Find out what Paprick has heard about the mysterious ship.

1502.NAME: New outfit
1502.DESCRIPTION: Go to section PROFILE and change your outfit for Halloween.

1504.NAME: Halloween
1504.DESCRIPTION: Go to Paprick's island and talk to him.

1505.NAME: Honey
1505.DESCRIPTION: The locals are very fond of honey. Collect honey

1506.NAME: Corn pies
1506.DESCRIPTION: Corn pie is a special treat. Make corn pie several times.

1507.NAME: Sugar
1507.DESCRIPTION: If you're our of sweets, you can nibble a piece of sugar. Submit sugar

1508.NAME: Lianas for the basket
1508.DESCRIPTION: In order to make a good basket, you need lianas. Submit lianas

1509.NAME: Timber for the basket
1509.DESCRIPTION: You will need some timber for the basket. Chop trees on your islands

151.NAME: Build the new painted fence
151.DESCRIPTION: Buy and build 8 new painted fences

1510.NAME: Nails for the basket
1510.DESCRIPTION: In order to put the basket together, you'll need thorn nails. Make thorn nails

1511.NAME: Basket for Paprick
1511.DESCRIPTION: Go to Paprick's island and submit the sweets basket.

1512.NAME: Straw bundles for Gycott
1512.DESCRIPTION: Gycott wants to protect his house against wind. Submit straw bundles

1513.NAME: Rabbits for Gycott
1513.DESCRIPTION: Gycott's children adore rabbits. Sell grown-up rabbits

1514.NAME: Lobworm for Gycott
1514.DESCRIPTION: Gycott is a passionate fisherman. Submit lobworms

1515.NAME: Food for Gycott
1515.DESCRIPTION: Gycott's family eats a lot and quickly. Submit food

1516.NAME: Ropes for Gycott
1516.DESCRIPTION: Gycott wants to tie all his animals, so that they don't run away. Craft ropes.

1517.NAME: Shells for Gycott
1517.DESCRIPTION: Gycott wants to go to the local market. Submit shells

152.NAME: Build a clay pit
152.DESCRIPTION: Buy and build a clay pit. There you can gather clay regulary

1521.NAME: Hocus pocus
1521.DESCRIPTION: Say the spell and see what happens!

1522.NAME: Dodgy goblins
1522.DESCRIPTION: Continue catching goblins on your island!

1523.NAME: Tenacious goblins
1523.DESCRIPTION: Catch even more goblins - you can do it!

1524.NAME: Making friends
1524.DESCRIPTION: During Halloween, you have to visit surrounding islnads! Go to your friends and help them in any way.

1525.NAME: Fooling around
1525.DESCRIPTION: Fool your guests by turing your island upside down! Move objects 10 times

1526.NAME: Toby
1526.DESCRIPTION: Learn if Toby has information about the ship.

1527.NAME: Volcano god
1527.DESCRIPTION: Maybe Volcano god knows where the ship came from? You must ask him.

1528.NAME: Question Paprick
1528.DESCRIPTION: Visit Paprick and talk to him.

1529.NAME: Shell sheds
1529.DESCRIPTION: Paprick likes your see-through shell sheds. Make 5 modern sheds for shells.

153.NAME: First clay shed
153.DESCRIPTION: Buy and build your first clay shed

1530.NAME: Colourful gems
1530.DESCRIPTION: "What pretty stones!" Paprick gasped. Obtain jasper from the mine.

1531.NAME: Antelopes
1531.DESCRIPTION: Paprick adores antelopes. Sell grown-up antelopes.

1532.NAME: Durable chisels
1532.DESCRIPTION: Paprick needs better chisels. Submit lava chisels.

1779.DESCRIPTION: A traditional gift for high-born guests is royal shells. Submit 5 royal shells.

178.DESCRIPTION: Craft enough clay supports and masses and gather emeralds to craft the left leg of colossus

1780.NAME: A splendid lunch
1780.DESCRIPTION: The princess expects a great feast. Make truffle julienne 5 times.

1781.NAME: New acquaintance
1781.DESCRIPTION: Introduce the princess to Paprick. Visit his island.

1782.NAME: Gift
1782.DESCRIPTION: Give the dress to princess Tara as a farewell gift.

1785.NAME: Lute
1785.DESCRIPTION: Obtain the necessary parts and create a lute in the workshop section UNIQUE.

1786.NAME: Drums
1786.DESCRIPTION: Obtain the necessary parts and create drums in the workshop section UNIQUE.

1787.NAME: Flute
1787.DESCRIPTION: Obtain the necessary parts and create a flute in the workshop section UNIQUE.

1788.NAME: Sloths for Turrick
1788.DESCRIPTION: Turrick is very fond of sloths - probably because he himself is so diligent. Sell grown-up sloths.

1789.NAME: Glass for the hothouse
1789.DESCRIPTION: Turrick wants to build a spacious hothouse. Buy and submit glass.

179.NAME: Add the left leg of colossus
179.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the statue by adding the left leg of colossus

1790.NAME: Boiled eggs for a picnic
1790.DESCRIPTION: Turrick often arranges picnics in his garden. Boil eggs several times.

1791.NAME: Waterlilies
1791.DESCRIPTION: Turrick wants to decorate his garden with something royal. Build 3 royal waterlilies.

1792.NAME: Jellyfish
1792.DESCRIPTION: Turrick wants to show something spectacular to his children. Use 10 jellyfish from your bag.

1793.NAME: Jade for payment
1793.DESCRIPTION: Of course, you have to pay for the work - shells or doubloons will not do. Submit jade.

1794.NAME: Machetes for carving
1794.DESCRIPTION: Carving demands sharp tools. Craft machetes several times.

1795.NAME: Sponges for polishing
1795.DESCRIPTION: To make the surface really smooth, you will need to polish it properly. Submit 20 sponges.

1796.NAME: Paint for lacquer
1796.DESCRIPTION: The body needs to be lacquered. Submit 24 units of paint.

1797.NAME: Cactus flowers
1797.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to try growing cactuses on his island. Submit cactus flowers.

1798.NAME: Steamed sea-cabbage
1798.DESCRIPTION: Paprick has caught several sea cabbages, but he doesn't know what to do with them. Prepare sea cabbages 25 times.

1799.NAME: Goat farm
1799.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to popularize goat-keeping in Oceania. Feed small or grown-up goats on any island.

18.NAME: Gather 10 food
18.DESCRIPTION: Gather 10 units of food and give it to the natives as a token of friendship.

180.NAME: Food for birds
180.DESCRIPTION: Grow and give the bird lover 20 units of wheat

1800.NAME: Silk thread
1800.DESCRIPTION: The master wraps the strings with slik thread. Submit silk thread.

1801.NAME: Wires
1801.DESCRIPTION: The master makes strings out of metal wire. Submit wires.

1802.NAME: Contract
1802.DESCRIPTION: Finally, you have to make a contract about crafting the strings. Submit 3 parchments.

1803.NAME: Vases for water
1803.DESCRIPTION: An enraged cow has smashed all Squid's vases. Submit vases (you'll obtain them by building sheds).

1804.NAME: Masses for a colossus
1804.DESCRIPTION: Squid plans to renovate his clay colossus. Submit clay masses.

1805.NAME: Strawberry field
1805.DESCRIPTION: Squid loves the aroma of strawberries. Harvest strawberries.

1806.NAME: Silk for a cloak
1806.DESCRIPTION: Squid has heard that you can craft silk. Craft silk several times.

1807.NAME: Birds
1807.DESCRIPTION: Squid wants to lure birds to his garden. Build several bird houses.

1808.NAME: Fox friend
1808.DESCRIPTION: Squid admires foxes for their cleverness. Feed small or grown-up foxes on any island.

1809.NAME: Chisels for sculpture
1809.DESCRIPTION: Squid wants to turn the rocks in his garden into pretty sculptures. Submit lava chisels.

181.NAME: Different food for birds
181.DESCRIPTION: Grow and give the bird lover 20 units of corn

1810.NAME: Thorns
1810.DESCRIPTION: Squid believes that the most valuable things can be found in the most usual places. Remove thorns on your islands.

1811.NAME: Pizza for guests
1811.DESCRIPTION: Squid receives numerous guests every day. Craft 3 pizzas.

1812.NAME: Sea gudgeons
1812.DESCRIPTION: Squid can never catch gudgeons on the shores of his island. Catch some gudgeons.

1813.NAME: Twig furniture
1813.DESCRIPTION: Squid likes simple furniture. Build twig stools or tables.

1814.NAME: Birthday cake
1814.DESCRIPTION: Squid will celebrate his birthday soon. Help him prepare by making some honey cake.

1815.NAME: Shells for decorations
1815.DESCRIPTION: Squid uses shells only as decorative elements. Submit 800 shells.

1816.NAME: Wax sculptures
1816.DESCRIPTION: Squid enjoys making wax figures. Obtain beeswax.

1817.NAME: Rabbits
1817.DESCRIPTION: Squid doesn't believe that rabbits can be grown in 1 day. Sell grown-up rabbits.

1818.NAME: Bread
1818.DESCRIPTION: Of course, you can't go on a sea voyage without bread. Make bread several times.

1819.NAME: Freshwater
1819.DESCRIPTION: Sailors can't do without freshwater. Submit water.

182.NAME: Birdhouse supply
182.DESCRIPTION: Build and sell 10 birdhouses. The bird lover really needs them

1820.NAME: Barrels for storage
1820.DESCRIPTION: Food and water is best kept in barrels. Sell finished barrels (from Decorations).

1821.NAME: Shakers for music
1821.DESCRIPTION: In evenings, the sailors sit on the deck and play music. Submit 10 shakers.

1822.NAME: Cloth for leaks
1822.DESCRIPTION: If there's a leak in the ship, it can be stuffed with cloth. Craft 25 units of cloth.

1823.NAME: Bait for fishing
1823.DESCRIPTION: All sailors are passionate fishermen. Buy maggots for bait.

1824.NAME: Doubloons for trading
1824.DESCRIPTION: When trading abroad, one needs plenty of doubloons. Submit 20 bronze doubloons.

1825.NAME: Torches for the cabins
1825.DESCRIPTION: The cabins are pitch dark during the night. Craft torches.

1826.NAME: Chili for liveliness
1826.DESCRIPTION: If the captain gets sleepy at the wheel, a bite of chili will help. Harvest chili.

1827.NAME: New fence
1827.DESCRIPTION: Nadien wants to bound her garden with a new fence. Sell finished twig or plank fences.

1828.NAME: Sheep
1828.DESCRIPTION: Nadine has decided to grow sheep, as wool can be used to make great outfits. Feed sheep or lambs on any island.

1829.NAME: Blueberries
1829.DESCRIPTION: Nadine has never tried blueberries. Submit blueberries.

183.NAME: Craft colossus body
183.DESCRIPTION: Craft enough clay supports and masses and gather emeralds to craft the body of colossus

1830.NAME: Pearl necklace
1830.DESCRIPTION: Surprise Nadine by giving her a beautiful necklace. Sell 1 pearl necklace.

1831.NAME: Coal for cut-outs
1831.DESCRIPTION: Coal can be used to draw patterns. Submit coal.

1832.NAME: Weathercocks
1832.DESCRIPTION: Nadine always wants to know the direction of the wind. Sell 3 finished weathercocks.

1833.NAME: Fire-oil for the motor
1833.DESCRIPTION: The admiral travels by motor-boat daily. Submit fire-oil.

1834.NAME: Strawberry dessert
1834.DESCRIPTION: The admiral has eaten too much salty food - time for something sweeter! Prepare strawberry soup 20 times.

1835.NAME: Ostrich keeper
1835.DESCRIPTION: The admiral is a great lover of ostriches. Feed small or grown-up ostriches on any island.

1836.NAME: A lesson in fishing
1836.DESCRIPTION: When fishing, the admiral always catches only gudgeons. Catch royally purple fish (at shark bay).

1837.NAME: Basics of cattle-breeding
1837.DESCRIPTION: The admiral has no luck with cattle-breeding. Show him the basics - sell grown-up chicken.

1838.NAME: Cement for the yard
1838.DESCRIPTION: The admiral is tired of wading through grass - he plans to cement the entire yard. Craft cement 6 times.

1839.NAME: A new pool
1839.DESCRIPTION: The admiral still swims in a simple pond. Finish a clay pool.

184.NAME: Add the body to colossus
184.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the statue and add the body of colossus to it

1840.NAME: The taste of adventure
1840.DESCRIPTION: The admiral craves for adventure. Go to Pinaki islands and visit the secret cave 3 times.

1841.NAME: Wheat plantations
1841.DESCRIPTION: The admiral's wife bakes wonderful wheat bread. Harvest wheat on any island.

1842.NAME: Wine cellar
1842.DESCRIPTION: The admiral has recently built a new wine cellar. Sell 4 finished wine barrels.

1843.NAME: Forestry
1843.DESCRIPTION: The admiral thinks that there are not enough trees on your island. Plant palm trees.

1844.NAME: Abundance of food
1844.DESCRIPTION: The admiral believes that a governor must be generous. Spend food on your friends' islands.

1845.NAME: Pearl seeker
1845.DESCRIPTION: The admiral is certain - the more mussels, the more pearls. Submit mussels.

1846.NAME: Mice hunters
1846.DESCRIPTION: The admiral's house is full of mice. Sell grown-up cats.

1847.NAME: Furrows for the seedlings
1847.DESCRIPTION: The new plant will soon be available - dig furrows, so that you have place for them!

185.NAME: Lambs for the journey
185.DESCRIPTION: Buy and then sell 50 lambs (not grown-up sheep)

1852.NAME: 1st riddle
1852.DESCRIPTION: Sticky as glue, sweet on the tongue. Obtain this resource 40 times.

1853.NAME: 2nd riddle
1853.DESCRIPTION: The most sturdy people in Oceania are named by this resource. Craft it 4 times.

1854.NAME: 3rd riddle
1854.DESCRIPTION: It is a loyal friend with a great sense of smell - sell 50 grown-up animals of this kind.

1855.NAME: 4th riddle
1855.DESCRIPTION: It looks like the 2nd place award in a sports competition. Spend 10 in any way.

1856.NAME: 5th riddle
1856.DESCRIPTION: It contains something that rabbits like and something that makes us cry - make this dish 10 times.

1857.NAME: 6th riddle
1857.DESCRIPTION: In water you will catch it, water you'll receive from it. Use 5 from your backpack.

1858.NAME: 7th riddle
1858.DESCRIPTION: This vegetable will be ready quicker than boiled eggs. Harvest 45 fields on your island.

1859.NAME: 8th riddle
1859.DESCRIPTION: Usually they embellish the night sky, yet their look-alikes can also be found in the ocean - buy 20.

186.NAME: Ropes for the ship
186.DESCRIPTION: The wooden ship with which the natives plan to travel requires ropes. They will need 30 ropes

1860.NAME: 9th riddle
1860.DESCRIPTION: Go to the dryest place in Oceania and spend 14 energies.

1861.NAME: 10th riddle
1861.DESCRIPTION: They are brown and round. They aren't animals, yet they give milk. Spend 30 in any way.

1862.NAME: 11th riddle
1862.DESCRIPTION: Feed any white, black or black-and-white animal on any island 80 times.

1863.NAME: 12th riddle
1863.DESCRIPTION: Plant the only vegetable that has white flowers 30 times.

1864.NAME: The last riddle
1864.DESCRIPTION: In the workshop, there's only one green material. Craft it 20 times.

1868.NAME: Unfinished airplane
1868.DESCRIPTION: Obtain all the parts and craft an unfinished airplane in the workshop section UNIQUE.

1869.NAME: Finish the airplane
1869.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section UNIQUE and add a propeller and a seat to the plane.

187.NAME: Paint for the ship
