187.DESCRIPTION: The ship needs to look beautiful. Help the natives by giving them 15 paint buckets

1870.NAME: Airplane is finished!
1870.DESCRIPTION: Surprise Aldo Wingman by giving him the finished airplane!

1871.NAME: Coal for workouts
1871.DESCRIPTION: To prepare for the marathon, Gycott runs over hot coal every morning. Submit 30 units of coal.

1872.NAME: Horses for ploughing
1872.DESCRIPTION: Gycott's fields are so vast that they can't be ploughed with a shovel. Sell grown-up horses.

1873.NAME: Rolling stone
1873.DESCRIPTION: Gycott wants to make new bowling balls. Obtain stones (from stone mine or by chopping rocks).

1874.NAME: Gather 15 caraways
1874.DESCRIPTION: Find and gather 15 caraways on your island. You can spend them by making caraway cheese!

1875.NAME: Gather 30 caraways
1875.DESCRIPTION: Find and gather 30 caraways on your island. You can spend them by making caraway cheese!

1876.NAME: Gather 50 caraways
1876.DESCRIPTION: Find and gather 50 caraways on your island. You can spend them by making caraway cheese!

1877.NAME: Collecting rain water
1877.DESCRIPTION: If you collect a trough full of rain water, you'll have a dry summer. Finish and sell 1 wooden trough.

1878.NAME: Caring for sheep
1878.DESCRIPTION: If you tend to your sheep properly during summer solstice, they will give better wool. Feed small or grown-up sheep on any island.

1879.NAME: Ploughing
1879.DESCRIPTION: All fields must be ploughed before summer solstice. Dig furrows on your island.

188.NAME: Craft colossus right arm
188.DESCRIPTION: Craft enough clay supports and masses and gather emeralds to craft the right arm of colossus

1880.NAME: Flowers for wreaths
1880.DESCRIPTION: As there are no oak trees in Oceania, the locals weave their wreaths from flowers. Buy small flowers.

1881.NAME: Tomato harvest
1881.DESCRIPTION: If you don't harvest your tomatoes during summer solstice, you'll blush all summer long! Harvest 15 tomato fields on your island.

1882.NAME: Beads for the ladies
1882.DESCRIPTION: The local ladies always use an opportunity to dress up. Craft bone beads.

1883.NAME: Ropes for tents
1883.DESCRIPTION: The locals always build large tents for the celebration. Submit ropes for the tents.

1884.NAME: Delicious meal
1884.DESCRIPTION: Of course, no celebration is complete without a delicious meal. Craft bean stew several times.

1885.NAME: Bonfire
1885.DESCRIPTION: Everbody knows that you have to jump over a bonfire in summer solstice. Obtain wood.

1886.NAME: Morning messengers
1886.DESCRIPTION: In summer solstice, you can only go to sleep when the rooster has sung. Sell grown-up roosters.

1887.NAME: Visitors
1887.DESCRIPTION: When all work is done, it's time to go visiting and celebrating! Perform any actions on your friends' islands.

1888.NAME: Rubber tree for the cart
1888.DESCRIPTION: Gycott transports heavy loads. A good cart needs good timber. Chop any kind of rubber trees on your island.

1889.NAME: Lucky number
1889.DESCRIPTION: Eight is Gycott's favourite number. Submit 4 ocotopuses.

189.NAME: Add the right arm
189.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the statue and add the right arm

1890.NAME: Tasty onions
1890.DESCRIPTION: While Gycott was on a roadtrip, all his onions have rotted away. Harvest 50 onion fields on your island.

1891.NAME: Helping a friend
1891.DESCRIPTION: Toby is Gycott's best friend. Visit Toby on the desert island and do any work you can.

1892.NAME: A better house
1892.DESCRIPTION: Gycott has become a member of the local council and wants to build a more respectable house. Submit decorative blocks.

1893.NAME: Guard-foxes
1893.DESCRIPTION: Gycott believes that foxes are better guards than dogs. Feed small or grown-up foxes on any island.

1894.NAME: Maggots for birds
1894.DESCRIPTION: Mycott feeds his birds with maggots. Submit 80 maggots.

1895.NAME: Corn pies
1895.DESCRIPTION: Mycott eats at least one pie every day. Make corn pies 30 times.

1896.NAME: Hay for mattresses
1896.DESCRIPTION: Mycott stuffs his mattresses with properly dried hay. Sell finished hay stack.

1897.NAME: Pretty feathers
1897.DESCRIPTION: Mycott likes unusual bird feathers. Submit blue thrush feathers (obtained by feeding chicken or hens).

1898.NAME: Proof of diligence
1898.DESCRIPTION: Mycott likes diligent people, and nothing demands more diligence than growing meerkats. Sell grown-up meerkats.

1899.NAME: Good friends
1899.DESCRIPTION: Mycott is extremely friendly. Go and help on your friends' islands.

19.NAME: Help your friends
19.DESCRIPTION: Visit your friends and perform 7 actions of any kind.

190.NAME: Craft colossus leftarm
190.DESCRIPTION: Craft enough clay supports and masses and gather emeralds to craft the left arm of colossus

1900.NAME: Iron for rings
1900.DESCRIPTION: Mycott marks his birds with small iron rings. Obtain pieces of iron (in gem mine).

1901.NAME: Grain
1901.DESCRIPTION: Mycott uses grain to make bread and delicious drinks. Harvest wheat fields on your island.

1902.NAME: Trees for nests
1902.DESCRIPTION: Birds like to make their nests in the branches of trees. Plant trees on your island.

1903.NAME: Threads for Nadine
1903.DESCRIPTION: Seamstress Nadine is visited by tens of people every day. Submit silk thread.

1904.NAME: Food for Paprick
1904.DESCRIPTION: Paprick has a lot of acquaintances on all islands of Oceania. Add to his food stock.

1905.NAME: Screws for the captain
1905.DESCRIPTION: Captain McManus can ask everyone he meets on his voyages. Craft 20 screws for fixing ships.

1906.NAME: Fishermen's friend
1906.DESCRIPTION: Fishermen could spread the news in fishing villages. Make friends with them by fishing in gudgeon bay.

1907.NAME: Mushroomers' friend
1907.DESCRIPTION: The local mushroomers always share a lot of gossip. Make friends with them by picking mushrooms on your island.

1908.NAME: Cooks' friend
1908.DESCRIPTION: Good cooks always have a lot of visitors. Make friends with them by making blueberry drinks several times.

1909.NAME: Waiting
1909.DESCRIPTION: Now that the news are out, all you have to do is wait. Spend 30 energy points on your islands.

191.NAME: Add the left arm
191.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the statue and add the left arm

1910.NAME: Necklace for the lady
1910.DESCRIPTION: Hellen adores luxurious things. Sell 1 citrine necklace from your bag.

1911.NAME: Silk for the curtains
1911.DESCRIPTION: Hellen wants to put up silk curtains in her castle. Submit silk.

1912.NAME: Pancake recipe
1912.DESCRIPTION: Hellen doesn't believe that pancakes can be made out of potatoes. Show her the recipe by making potato pancakes 10 times.

1913.NAME: Bear friend
1913.DESCRIPTION: Hellen has heard that you can train bears. Show her how it's done by feeding small or grown-up bears on any island.

1914.NAME: Glass miracle
1914.DESCRIPTION: Hellen likes modern buildings with see-through glass panels. Finish 3 modern food sheds.

1915.NAME: Castle gardens
1915.DESCRIPTION: Hellen is interested in the newest fashion in garden keeping. Make a sample garden by buying any flower hedges.

1916.NAME: Grapes
1916.DESCRIPTION: Hellen wants to become a famous wine-maker. Harvest grape fields on any island.

1917.NAME: Paint for the floors
1917.DESCRIPTION: Hellen organises so many balls that the castle floor is completely worn out. Craft paint 6 times.

1918.NAME: Fashion news
1918.DESCRIPTION: Hellen is a fashionable lady. Change something in your look.

1919.NAME: Talk to Paprick
1919.DESCRIPTION: Go to Paprick's island and talk to him.

192.NAME: Craft colossus torch
192.DESCRIPTION: Craft enough clay supports and masses and gather emeralds to craft the torch of colossus

1920.NAME: Duck pond
1920.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to create an idyllic duck pond. He has already dug the pond. Sell grown-up ducks.

1921.NAME: Thorns for fencing
1921.DESCRIPTION: Paprick thinks that his garden is sometimes visited by unwanted guests. Collect thorny twigs on your islands.

1922.NAME: Lovely sharks
1922.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is afraid of real sharks, yet he finds mini-sharks quite cute. Sell mini-sharks from your bag.

1923.NAME: Cloth for bags
1923.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is a frequent guest at birthday parties. Submit cloth for gift bags.

1924.NAME: Carrots for rabbits
1924.DESCRIPTION: Paprick enjoys keeping rabbits. Harvest carrots on any island.

1925.NAME: Traditions
1925.DESCRIPTION: Honour the local traditions by building a totem mask.

1926.NAME: Doubloons for games
1926.DESCRIPTION: Paprick ofen organises board game tournaments. Doubloons are usually used for wagers. Submit bronze doubloons.

1927.NAME: Animal keeping
1927.DESCRIPTION: "Animal keeping is a tough job. I always help out if I can." Feed animals on your friends' islands.

1928.NAME: Building beehives
1928.DESCRIPTION: The beehives that Paprick builds are usually crooked. Build a beehive.

1929.NAME: Pigs for Paprick
1929.DESCRIPTION: Paprick has built a new pigpen - now it needs inhabitants. Sell grown-up pigs.

193.NAME: Add colossus torch
193.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the statue and add the clay torch

1930.NAME: Fish soup
1930.DESCRIPTION: Paprick always welcomes his guests with a huge kettle of soup. Make fish soup 8 times.

1931.NAME: Stools for rehearsals
1931.DESCRIPTION: Paprick plans to found a choir. Build plank or painted stools for the singers.

1932.NAME: Milk for cats
1932.DESCRIPTION: Paprick gladly treats all local cats to some milk. Submit milk.

1933.NAME: Diorite
1933.DESCRIPTION: Paprick has collected all rocks, except for diorite. Collect diorite (by digging furrows).

1934.NAME: Construction specialist
1934.DESCRIPTION: Before building the storehouse, practice by finishing any twig, plank or clay shed.

1935.NAME: Buy the storehouse
1935.DESCRIPTION: Go to the shop section BUILDINGS and buy the storehouse.

1937.NAME: Strongest horses
1937.DESCRIPTION: Prove that you're the best horse keeper by selling grown-up horses.

1938.NAME: Thickest puree
1938.DESCRIPTION: Can you prepare a properly thick puree? Make potato puree several times.

1939.NAME: Best sponges
1939.DESCRIPTION: You can clean anything with really good sponges! Submit sponges.

194.NAME: Craft colossus head
194.DESCRIPTION: Craft enough clay supports and masses and gather emeralds to craft the head of colossus

1940.NAME: Bird master
1940.DESCRIPTION: Prove that you're the most skilled bird keeper. Sell grown-up ducks, chicken, ostriches or roosters.

1941.NAME: Wonderful friend
1941.DESCRIPTION: Are you a truly helpful friend? Get good reviews by helping on friends' islands.

1942.NAME: Mine specialist
1942.DESCRIPTION: A true survivor must know how to get resources. Use clay, stone, metal or gem mines on your island.

1943.NAME: Plant samples
1943.DESCRIPTION: Prove that you can grow the highest quality plants. Harvest chili, melon or grape fields on your island.

1944.NAME: Colossal material
1944.DESCRIPTION: A true local can craft a perfect clay mass for a colossus. Submit clay masses.

1945.NAME: Master of horned animals
1945.DESCRIPTION: Horned animals are most difficult to handle. Prove your skills by feeding any goats, cows and antilopes on your island.

1946.NAME: Fire butterflies
1946.DESCRIPTION: The bright fire butterflies are attracted by melon aroma. Collect and submit fire butterflies.

1947.NAME: Arched shells
1947.DESCRIPTION: Arched shells can sometimes be found when drawing water from the well. Collect and submit arched shells.

1948.NAME: Sphalerite
1948.DESCRIPTION: When digging furrows, you can come across various rocks, including the black sphalerite. Collect and submit sphalerite.

1949.NAME: Stick insects
1949.DESCRIPTION: Stick insects hide in the leaves of tall palms. Collect and submit stick insects.

195.NAME: Add colossus head
195.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the statue and add the colossus head

1950.NAME: Raven feathers
1950.DESCRIPTION: The feathers of a raven are black as coal. Collect (by feeding ostriches) and submit raven feathers.

1951.NAME: Pansies
1951.DESCRIPTION: Pansies can be seen only in the prettiest gardens. Collect (by buying white flowers) and submit pansies.

1952.NAME: A kettle of soup
1952.DESCRIPTION: As there will be many guests, it would be best to prepare a huge kettle of soup. Prepare spicy soup several times.

1953.NAME: Lighting
1953.DESCRIPTION: The guest will definitely stay until morning. Submit torches.

1954.NAME: Lodging
1954.DESCRIPTION: It's possible that the younger guests will get sleepy. Build a guest house.

1955.NAME: Seats
1955.DESCRIPTION: There won't be enough chairs for everyone. Submit cloth for blankets to sit on.

1956.NAME: Pretzels
1956.DESCRIPTION: As a dessert, you could offer big pretzels. Make pretzels 3 times.

1957.NAME: Animals
1957.DESCRIPTION: Before the ball begins, you must take care of your animals. Feed small or grown-up animals on your island.

1958.NAME: Drinks
1958.DESCRIPTION: You definitely need some refreshing drinks. Make cactus lemonader or blueberry drink several times.

1959.NAME: Invitations
1959.DESCRIPTION: Of course, you need to send out invitations. Submit parchment.

196.NAME: Shards for carving
196.DESCRIPTION: Pupils will carve statues at  school, so they need a lot of shards. 40 should be enough

1960.NAME: Gifts
1960.DESCRIPTION: You should also prepare small gifts for the guests. Submit bull-horn shells (you can find them at gudgeon bay).

1961.NAME: Upgrade modern house
1961.DESCRIPTION: Click on the house and press "Upgrade" to start building the new villa.

1963.NAME: Tiles for a shed
1963.DESCRIPTION: Turrick needs a proper shed to keep his planks safe from the rain. Submit roof tiles.

1964.NAME: Diligence
1964.DESCRIPTION: Turrick likes diligent people. Spend energy on any island.

1965.NAME: Iron benches
1965.DESCRIPTION: Iron benches are very pretty and comfortable. Finish 4 iron benches.

1966.NAME: Iron table
1966.DESCRIPTION: Some say that everything tastes better if you eat at a nice table. Finish 2 iron tables.

1967.NAME: Modern pool
1967.DESCRIPTION: A modern pool is rather small, yet very pleasant-looking. Finish 1 modern pool.

1968.NAME: Gift for a lady
1968.DESCRIPTION: Turrick wants to surprise the lady of his heart with a beautiful gift. Submit obsidian necklaces.

1969.NAME: Nourishing food
1969.DESCRIPTION: Turrick' job demands a lot of strength, therefore, his lunch has to be very nourishing. Make potato puree several times.

197.NAME: Something to carve
197.DESCRIPTION: Of course, they will need something to carve. 40 pumpkins would be perfect

1970.NAME: Melon yoghurt
1970.DESCRIPTION: Turrick wants to have home-made melon yoghurt for breakfast. Submit melons.

1971.NAME: Exotic flowers
1971.DESCRIPTION: The princess likes exotic flowers. Submit gerberas (you'll get them by using beehives).

1972.NAME: Roasts for the ball
1972.DESCRIPTION: Tara always offers shark roast to her guests. Make shark roast several times.

1973.NAME: Doubloon collection
1973.DESCRIPTION: The princess collects doubloons from various islands. Submit silver doubloons.

1974.NAME: Jumping ropes
1974.DESCRIPTION: During breaks, the students play with jumping ropes. Submit ropes.

1975.NAME: Lunch
1975.DESCRIPTION: You have to eat properly during the lunch break. Prepare tomato soup several times.

1976.NAME: Leaves for writing
1976.DESCRIPTION: The locals write on palm leaves. Plant trees on your island.

1977.NAME: Carrots for snacks
1977.DESCRIPTION: If you feel like having a snack during the lessons, you need to have some carrots with you. Harvest carrot fields on your island.

1978.NAME: Sand for the yard
1978.DESCRIPTION: The school yard must have vast, sandy grounds for sports. Buy sand bags.

1979.NAME: Water
1979.DESCRIPTION: Any school needs a proper supply of drinking water, Submit water.

198.NAME: Collecting garbage
198.DESCRIPTION: There will be a lot of garbage during the carving. Buy and sell 90 piglets (not grown-up pigs), so they can eat the garbage

1980.NAME: Rocks for geology
1980.DESCRIPTION: In geology lessons, the students have to examine various rocks. Submit diorite (it can be found when digging furrows).

1981.NAME: Paint for drawing
1981.DESCRIPTION: Oceania is so sunny that the students always run out of yellow paint in their art lessons. Submit corn.

1982.NAME: Wooden blocks
1982.DESCRIPTION: The younger students learn letters and numbers with the help of blocks. Submit wood.

1983.NAME: Nails for crafting
1983.DESCRIPTION: Many things are put together during crafting lessons. Craft nails several times.

1984.NAME: Beans for shakers
1984.DESCRIPTION: Shakers are often used in music lessons. They can be filled with dried beans. Submit beans.

1985.NAME: Plants for biology
1985.DESCRIPTION: Samples of various plants are needed in biology lessons. Harvest plants on your friends' islands.

1986.NAME: Flowers for teachers
1986.DESCRIPTION: On the first day of school, you have to give flowers to your teachers. Buy small flowers.

1987.NAME: Candy for friends
1987.DESCRIPTION: It's nice to surprise your friends with some candy. Submit candy (it can be bought in the shop).

1988.NAME: A new outfit
1988.DESCRIPTION: It is necessary to wear something new for the first day of school! Change something in your appearance.

1989.NAME: Nimble gardener
1989.DESCRIPTION: Are you nimble enough to harvest radish? Harvest 30 radish fields on your island.

199.NAME: School table
199.DESCRIPTION: Construct 10 painted tables and sell them for the classrooms

1990.NAME: Chick friend
1990.DESCRIPTION: Be friendly to chicks. Feed chicken on your and your friends' islands.

1991.NAME: Hay harvest
1991.DESCRIPTION: You need to prepare hay for winter. Finish haystacks (in DECORATIONS in shop).

1992.NAME: Patient gardener
1992.DESCRIPTION: Are you patient enough to grow wheat? Harvest wheat fields on your island.

1993.NAME: Friendly harvest I
1993.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends. Harvest carrots, beans and onions on your friends' islands.

1994.NAME: Autumn goods
1994.DESCRIPTION: You cannot miss mushroom and berry gathering fun in autumn. Gather them on your island!

1995.NAME: Healthy gardener
1995.DESCRIPTION: The natives believe that onions are the best protection against illnesses. Harvest onions on your island.

1996.NAME: Friendly harvest II
1996.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends. Harvest pumpkins, corn and tomatoes on your friends' islands.

1997.NAME: New barrels
1997.DESCRIPTION: You will need barrels to store autumn goods. Finish 4 barrels (shop DECORATION section).

1998.NAME: Diligent cattleman
1998.DESCRIPTION: You need to take care of animals. Feed any animals on your and your friends' islands.

1999.NAME: Other resources
1999.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends to gather other resources. Use beehives, wells and claypits on your friends' islands.

2.NAME: Search the bushes
2.DESCRIPTION: You can search them by clicking on them.

200.NAME: School stools
200.DESCRIPTION: Construct 20 not painted plank stools and sell them for the classrooms

2000.NAME: Profit
2000.DESCRIPTION: You should stock some shells as well. Sell anything from your inventory to earn some.

2001.NAME: Small fluffy animals
2001.DESCRIPTION: Princess Tara adores small, fluffy animals. Feed rabbits, cats or meerkats on any island.

2002.NAME: Rare rocks
2002.DESCRIPTION: Princess Tara has never been near a volcano. Give her some volcanic rocks.

2003.NAME: Impressive fountain
2003.DESCRIPTION: Princess Tara claims that every modern garden should have at least one fountain. Build fish fountains.

2004.NAME: Fixing the raft
2004.DESCRIPTION: Udo travels so much that his raft often needs fixing. Submit wood.

2005.NAME: Flax for selling
2005.DESCRIPTION: Merchant Udo says that flax is very popular among his clients. Submit flax.

2006.NAME: Pig tamer
2006.DESCRIPTION: Udo is determined to prove that pigs can learn more tricks than any other animal. Sell grown up pigs.

2007.NAME: Picky fisherman
2007.DESCRIPTION: Udo goes fishing only at shark bay. Submit bugs.

2008.NAME: Goods for blacksmiths
2008.DESCRIPTION: Blacksmiths buy tons of iron and copper from Udo. Obtain copper or iron pieces (from the gem mine).

2009.NAME: Milk for bakers
2009.DESCRIPTION: Bakers need many litres of fresh milk every day. Submit milk.

201.NAME: Chalk for the blackboards?
201.DESCRIPTION: A small native child came and said that the school will require 200 sugar lumps so you can write on the blackboard

2010.NAME: Question Paprick
2010.DESCRIPTION: If there's someone who knows where the scary noises come from, it's Paprick. Visit him!

2011.NAME: Paprick
2011.DESCRIPTION: To talk Paprick into helping you, send him some food. Submit food.

2012.NAME: Mycott
2012.DESCRIPTION: Mycott will definitely help you in exchange for new flower seeds. Plant small flowers on your island.

2013.NAME: Gycott
2013.DESCRIPTION: Gycott will come to help if you pay him a small sum. Submit shells.

2014.NAME: Tycott
2014.DESCRIPTION: Tycott is adventurous and enjoys climbing rocks. Submit ropes.

2015.NAME: Friends
2015.DESCRIPTION: Maybe there are other friends that are ready to help you. Visit your friends and help on their islands!

2016.NAME: Going underground
2016.DESCRIPTION: Finish the tunnel by placing the entrance on your island (from your bag). The click on it, to begin the journey!

2017.NAME: Sands of time
2017.DESCRIPTION: The ghost enjoys observing how the time passes. Buy sacks of sand.

2018.NAME: Slow animals
2018.DESCRIPTION: The ghost likes gentle, slow animals. Feed cows or calves on any island.

2019.NAME: Soothing sound
2019.DESCRIPTION: The ghost likes soothing, monotonous sounds. Submit water.

202.NAME: Wall renewal
202.DESCRIPTION: To renew the castle walls, the natives will need 30 clay bricks

2020.NAME: Pretty things
2020.DESCRIPTION: The lady likes to accessorize. Craft bone beads.

2021.NAME: Wonderful pearls
2021.DESCRIPTION: The lady enjoys hunting pearls. Submit mussels.

2022.NAME: Fancy food
2022.DESCRIPTION: The most delicious thing that the lady has tried is carrot stew. Make it several times.

2023.NAME: Bright bugs
2023.DESCRIPTION: The gloomy spider is afraid of bright, cheerful bugs. Collect ladybugs (by harvesting beans).

2024.NAME: Happy thoughts
2024.DESCRIPTION: The spider is repulsed by happy thoughts and good deeds. Help your friends on their islands!

2025.NAME: Sweet joy
2025.DESCRIPTION: The spider likes only sour or bitter things. Spend sugar in any way (on your island).

2026.NAME: Firewood
2026.DESCRIPTION: The fire spirit likes everything that burns! Submit wood.

2027.NAME: Greed
2027.DESCRIPTION: The fire spirit is greedy. Obtain shells on your main island.

2028.NAME: Quick creatures
2028.DESCRIPTION: The fire spirit likes creatures that are small and quick. Sell grown-up rabbits.

2029.NAME: Catch ghostlights
2029.DESCRIPTION: Wait for the ghostlights to appear on your island and catch them (not more than 2 ghostlights can appear at once).

203.NAME: Roof renewal
203.DESCRIPTION: To renew the roof of the crashed castle, they will need 20 straw bundles

2030.NAME: Bewitch the ghost
2030.DESCRIPTION: You need to bewitch the ghost. Click on the clock.

2031.NAME: Bewitch the ghost lady
2031.DESCRIPTION: You need to bewitch the ghost lady. Click on the mirror.

2032.NAME: Bewitch the spider
2032.DESCRIPTION: You need to bewitch the ghost. Click on the rose bush.

2033.NAME: Bewitch the fire spirit
2033.DESCRIPTION: To bewitch the fire spirit, click on the griffin statue.

2034.NAME: Good deeds
2034.DESCRIPTION: Turrick believes that one should never forsake one's friends. Help your friends on their islands.

2035.NAME: Hedgehog farm
2035.DESCRIPTION: Turrick wants to keep hedgehogs because they can find mushrooms and berries in the forest. Sell grown-up hedgehogs.

2036.NAME: Paint for work
2036.DESCRIPTION: Of course, Turrick often needs to use paint in his work. Craft paint.

2037.NAME: Water for bubble bath
2037.DESCRIPTION: The princess spends a lot of water in her daily bubble baths.

2038.NAME: Wheat flakes
2038.DESCRIPTION: The princess keeps herself in shape by having wheat flakes for breakfast. Harvest wheat on any island.

2039.NAME: Gems
2039.DESCRIPTION: Gems are a girl's best friends. Sell jasper, citrine, jade or diamond from your bag.

204.NAME: Calm down the king
204.DESCRIPTION: The king loves carrots very much. Give him a gift of 40 carrots to calm him down a bit

2040.NAME: Spiders for collectors
2040.DESCRIPTION: Very many locals collect spiders. Submit spiders (you can get them by cutting broad palms).

2041.NAME: Hay for handcrafting
2041.DESCRIPTION: Hay is always in demand, as you can make hats, rugs and other useful things out of it. Craft hay bundles.

2042.NAME: Payment
2042.DESCRIPTION: A merchant is a merchant - you must pay him. Submit shells.

2043.NAME: Guard dogs
2043.DESCRIPTION: Turrick keeps a lot of valuable materials in his workshop and needs someone to guard them. Sell grown-up dogs.

2045.NAME: Fox master
2045.DESCRIPTION: Foxes are cunning and quick - they can be kept only by true masters of animal tending. Sell grown-up foxes.

2046.NAME: Useful plants
2046.DESCRIPTION: The locals consider flax to be one of the most useful plants. That's why anyone should know how to grow them. Submit flax.

2047.NAME: Popular accessories
2047.DESCRIPTION: Obsidian necklaces are especially popular among the local ladies. Craft obsidian necklaces.

2048.NAME: Go to Aldo
2048.DESCRIPTION: Find out where Aldo is and go to him (by pressing on the raft)!

2049.NAME: Spoons for sailors
2049.DESCRIPTION: The ship's cook often makes soup for dinner. Submit spoons (you'll get them by building tables).

205.NAME: Ritual for the goddess of plenty
205.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the goddess, feed any pigs (or piglets) 60 times

2050.NAME: Strawberries for jam
2050.DESCRIPTION: Instead of fresh fruit and berries, sailors take jam with them. Harvest strawberry fields on your island.

2051.NAME: Companions
2051.DESCRIPTION: The sailors are happy to take with them small pets. Sell grown-up meerkats.

2052.NAME: Fishing boat
2052.DESCRIPTION: One of captain's friends is a passionate fisherman. The captain will build him a new fishing boat. Sell wood.

2053.NAME: Cakes for arrivals
2053.DESCRIPTION: The sailors' wives bake cakes when their husbands return. Make honey cake several times.

2054.NAME: Friends' cats
2054.DESCRIPTION: Sailors sometimes say: "If you want to be friends with someone, befriend his cat first!" Feed cats on any island.

2055.NAME: Iron for anchor
2055.DESCRIPTION: MacManus needs a new, well-made anchor for his ship. Submit iron.

2056.NAME: Beans
2056.DESCRIPTION: Captain MacManus eats beans with the whole legume. Submit beans.

2057.NAME: Hospitality
2057.DESCRIPTION: Sailors always appreciate a nice welcome. Finish a guest house.

2058.NAME: Healthy drink
2058.DESCRIPTION: Cactus juice not only quenches thirst, but also invigorates and gives strength. Craft cactus lemonade several times.

2059.NAME: Toast
2059.DESCRIPTION: Experienced travellers take with them white-bread toast, as it doesn't go bad that quickly. Make bread several times.

206.NAME: Ritual for goddess of goodness
206.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the goddess, visit your friends and help them 30 times

2060.NAME: Light fabric
2060.DESCRIPTION: When travelling, it's best to have light clothing and blankets. Submit silk.

2061.NAME: Machetes
2061.DESCRIPTION: You can never know what obstacles might be ahead. Submit machetes.

2062.NAME: Inform your friends
2062.DESCRIPTION: Before going to a far away place, it's best to inform your friends. Go and help on your friends' islands!

2063.NAME: Directions
2063.DESCRIPTION: You must write down the directions that the captain gave. Submit parchment.

2064.NAME: Put up ladder
2064.DESCRIPTION: Help Aldo get down the tree by putting up a ladder (press Upgrade)!

2065.NAME: Wing
2065.DESCRIPTION: One of the wings has come off. Find it!

2066.NAME: Propeller
2066.DESCRIPTION: The propeller has fallen off as well! You must retrieve it!

2067.NAME: Wheels
2067.DESCRIPTION: And where have the wheels gone?

2069.NAME: Abandoned nest
2069.DESCRIPTION: It looks like there has been a nest on that tree. You must find it!

207.NAME: Ritual for the god of earth
207.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the god, dig 100 fields (you can dig one, remove it and dig again in the same place)

2070.NAME: Mysterious bird
2070.DESCRIPTION: Put the nest back in the tree (press Upgrade) - maybe its inhabitants will return!

2071.NAME: Market crowds
2071.DESCRIPTION: You can find out many thinks at the marketplace. To go to the market, submit mini sharks!

2072.NAME: Gossip at the ball
2072.DESCRIPTION: The local balls can be a good source of information. To go to the ball, submit wild berries to give to the ladies.

2073.NAME: Craftsmen guild
2073.DESCRIPTION: It's very likely that a craftsman might own a high ladder. To enter the craftsmen guild, pay a small fee.

2074.NAME: Tiles for the roofer
2074.DESCRIPTION: Of course, a roofer always needs good tiles. Submit roof tiles.

2075.NAME: Rooster's song
2075.DESCRIPTION: Vigo gets up when the rooster sings. Sell grown-up roosters on your island.

2076.NAME: Corn for preserves
2076.DESCRIPTION: Vigo always keeps tinned corn in his basement. Submit corn.

2077.NAME: Purple miracles
2077.DESCRIPTION: Vigo has never seen a purple fish! Submit royally purple fish (from Shark coast).

2078.NAME: Bone tools
2078.DESCRIPTION: Vigo uses only bone tools. Submit bones.

2079.NAME: Cow keeper
2079.DESCRIPTION: There are always cows grazing in Vigo's yard. Feed cows or calves on any island.

208.NAME: Ritual for the god of destruction
208.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the god, chop trees 100 times (make 100 chops, you don't have to chop the tree down)

2080.NAME: Cloth covers
2080.DESCRIPTION: Akan's yard is full of planes that need to be covered when it rains. Submit cloth.

2081.NAME: Carrot stew
2081.DESCRIPTION: Akan's favourite food is carrot stew. Make it 30 times.

2082.NAME: Wood interior
2082.DESCRIPTION: Akan uses only highest quality wood for a plane's interior. Chop trees on any island.

2083.NAME: Chili spice
2083.DESCRIPTION: Akan always adds chili spice to his food. Harvest chili on any island.

2084.NAME: Black gem
2084.DESCRIPTION: Akan collects dark gems. Submit sphalerite (you can get it by digging furrows).

2085.NAME: Water creatures
2085.DESCRIPTION: Although Akan spends a lot of time in the air, he also likes water creatures. Finish round aquariums.

2086.NAME: Burnoil
2086.DESCRIPTION: When fixing planes, burnoil can be useful. Submit burnoil.

2087.NAME: Metal bars
2087.DESCRIPTION: Akan often uses armatures to fasten something. Submit metal bars.

2088.NAME: Boots
2088.DESCRIPTION: Akan enjoys rock-climbing in his free time. His boots get worn out very quickly. Use boots from your backpack.

209.NAME: Ritual for the water goddess
209.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the goddess, craft 20 troughs

2091.NAME: Trees for birds
2091.DESCRIPTION: Plant trees on your island, so that birds would have somewhere to live!

2092.NAME: Help friends
2092.DESCRIPTION: Be so kind and help your friends on their islands!

2093.NAME: Maintaining order
2093.DESCRIPTION: Maintain your surroundings in order by removing bushes, thorns or grass on your islands.

2094.NAME: Animal care
2094.DESCRIPTION: You have to take care of your animals regularly. Feed any animals on your island.

2096.NAME: Visit Ayo
2096.DESCRIPTION: Get on the raft and go to Ayo's island to find out what has happened!

2097.NAME: Sugar-water
2097.DESCRIPTION: Ayo is very nervous. He should drink some sugar-water. Submit sugar.

2098.NAME: Latest news
2098.DESCRIPTION: Ayo wants to know if snow has taken over the rest of Oceania. Go and help on your friends' islands.

2099.NAME: Horses
2099.DESCRIPTION: Ayo was so shocked about the snow that he forgot to feed the horses. Feed the horses on Ayo's island.

21.NAME: Heal a hen
21.DESCRIPTION: Heal the sick hen with your medipack, which the natives gave you.

210.NAME: Ritual for the time god
210.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the god, grow an animal one stage older 100 times (you can do it by feeding any non-grown up animal)

2100.NAME: Place for a snowman
2100.DESCRIPTION: Remove the huge snow heap to start building the snowman.

2101.NAME: Finish the snowman
2101.DESCRIPTION: Finish the snowman by upgrading it (you can obtain snow balls by searching other heaps of snow)!

2102.NAME: Palms
2102.DESCRIPTION: Obtain Christmas decorations and decorate 3 palms on Ayo's island (press Upgrade)!

2103.NAME: House
2103.DESCRIPTION: Obtain Christmas decorations and decorate Ayo's house (press Upgrade)!

2104.NAME: Christmas tree
2104.DESCRIPTION: Obtain a Christmas tree and place it on the appropriate heap (press Upgrade)!

2105.NAME: The bonfire
2105.DESCRIPTION: The bonfire has burned out. Make it burn again, so that Ayo would be warm (press Upgrade)!

2106.NAME: Empty shed
2106.DESCRIPTION: Ayo hadn't put his vegetables in the shed, and now they're buried under the snow. Fill his food shed (press Upgrade).

2107.NAME: Salt for paths
2107.DESCRIPTION: To avoid slipping on the frozen ground, you must scatter salt on the paths. Submit salt.

2108.NAME: Gingerbread
2108.DESCRIPTION: Show Ayo how to bake gingerbread. Craft gingerbread 5 times (workshop section Food).

2109.NAME: Festive outfit
2109.DESCRIPTION: Ayo should dress up for celebration. Give him the outfit (by pressing Upgrade).

211.NAME: Ritual for the goddess of sorrow
211.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the goddess, grow and give the shaman 60 black onions so he can cry a lot

2111.NAME: Remove the heap
2111.DESCRIPTION: Remove the heap to obtain a snow ball.

2112.NAME: Remove the heap
2112.DESCRIPTION: Remove the heap to obtain a snow ball.

2113.NAME: Wool for socks
2113.DESCRIPTION: Every Christmas, Paprick hangs socks next to his house so that Santa Claus would know where to put his gifts. Submit wool.

2114.NAME: Gudgeons for the cat
2114.DESCRIPTION: Paprick feeds his ginger cat only with fresh fish. Submit gudgeons.

2115.NAME: Important tasks
2115.DESCRIPTION: Paprick believes that the most important tasks have to be done before Christmas. Dig furrows on your island.

2116.NAME: Ropes for decorations
2116.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to attach fancy decorations to the ceiling. Craft 5 ropes.

2117.NAME: Rabbits
2117.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to give a rabbit to every child in the village. Sell grown-up rabbits.

2118.NAME: Fog shells
2118.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to receive pretty shells for Christmas. Submit fog shells (you can get them from the well).

2119.NAME: Berries for pudding
2119.DESCRIPTION: Hugo's favourite treat is berry pudding. Submit forest berries.

212.NAME: Ritual for the goddess of beauty
212.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the goddess, buy 20 red starflowers (the ones you already have don't count). You can sell them afterwards

2120.NAME: Thorny twigs
2120.DESCRIPTION: Hugo wants to build a new table for the big feast. Submit thorny twigs for nails.

2121.NAME: Christmas fair
2121.DESCRIPTION: Hugo invites you to take part in the annual fair. Sell anything from your bag.

2122.NAME: Goodness of heart
2122.DESCRIPTION: Show that you're good-hearted. Help on your friends' islands.

2123.NAME: Generosity
2123.DESCRIPTION: Be generous - spend shells in any way.

2124.NAME: Solemnity
2124.DESCRIPTION: In the honor of the upcoming celebration, you have to look your best. Change something in your appearance!

2125.NAME: Wealth
2125.DESCRIPTION: One is truly wealthy if one shares his fortune with others. Submit shells.

2126.NAME: Quick farmer
2126.DESCRIPTION: Nothing grows as quickly as radish! Submit radish.

2127.NAME: Slow animal-tender
2127.DESCRIPTION: The locals appreciate slow and patient animals. Feed small or grown-up bears or sloths on any island.

2128.NAME: Pumpkins
2128.DESCRIPTION: A real farmer always has some pumpkins stored up. Submit pumpkins.

2129.NAME: Plants in pots
2129.DESCRIPTION: In a modern farm, plants are grown not only in furrows, but also in pots. Submit clay pots.

213.NAME: Ritual for the god of fertility
213.DESCRIPTION: To appeal to the god, gather any crops 100 times

2130.NAME: Bear-keeping
2130.DESCRIPTION: A modern farmer grows unusual animals. Sell grown-up bears.

2131.NAME: Minerals
2131.DESCRIPTION: If a farmer has dug many furrows, he must have some diorite stored up. Submit diorite.

2132.NAME: Harvesting grain
2132.DESCRIPTION: A real farmer grows vegetables as well as grain. Harvest wheat on your island.

2133.NAME: Useful product
2133.DESCRIPTION: Eggs are extremely useful, as they can be used to prepare various meals. Submit eggs.

2134.NAME: Fish merchant
2134.DESCRIPTION: Owners of big farms not only grow vegetables and keep animals, but also go fishing. Sell guppies from your bag.

2135.NAME: Porridge
2135.DESCRIPTION: A good farmer doesn't have to be a great cook, but he should at least know how to make some porridge. Make coconut porridge several times.

2136.NAME: Cat friend
2136.DESCRIPTION: Cats live only in warm and clean farms. Sell grown-up cats.

2137.NAME: Great neighbour
2137.DESCRIPTION: Even though you're very busy in your farm, you mustn't forget your neighbours. Feed animals on your neighbours' islands.

2138.NAME: Grape vines
2138.DESCRIPTION: Grapes grow only in sunny and well-kept gardens. Harvest grapes on your island.

2139.NAME: Luck
2139.DESCRIPTION: When working in a big farm, one must rely on luck from time to time. Obtain 3 pearls by opening mussels.

2140.NAME: Gasoline
2140.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Other" and craft gasoline for the tractor.

2141.NAME: Harvesting
2141.DESCRIPTION: Click on the tractor and use it 3 times (you can harvest 4 fields at a go).

2142.NAME: Visit Cupid
2142.DESCRIPTION: To find out what has happened, visit Cupid (click on the raft).

2143.NAME: Rose scent
2143.DESCRIPTION: "The scent of roses makes me sleepy, so sleephy..." Remove roses from Cupid's island!

2144.NAME: Sweets for energy
2144.DESCRIPTION: To make Cupid more lively, he needs a dose of energy! Get him a bunch of high quality chocolate treats (to give, click on Cupid)!

2145.NAME: Love arrows
2145.DESCRIPTION: Cupid can't fulfill his duties without love arrows! Craft quiver (workshop section Unique) and give it to Cupid (click on him)!

2146.NAME: Shards for shakers
2146.DESCRIPTION: Squid makes various drums and shakers in his free time. Submit shards.

2147.NAME: Chicken
2147.DESCRIPTION: Squid grows many chickens because their eggs can be used to make his favourite meal - omelet. Sell grown-up chicken.

2148.NAME: Canned salmon
2148.DESCRIPTION: Squid makes special cat food from salmon. Sell salmon from your backpack.

2149.NAME: Healthy soup
2149.DESCRIPTION: Squid always preaches about the  medical uses of tomatoes. Make tomato soup several times.

215.NAME: Salt supplies
215.DESCRIPTION: The stranger would like to get 30 lumps of salt for cooking his salty dishes

2150.NAME: Water for animals
2150.DESCRIPTION: Squid always makes sure that his animals have access to fresh water. Submit water.

2151.NAME: Big garden
2151.DESCRIPTION: Squid encourages you to plant a big vegetable garden. Plant any  crops on your island.

2152.NAME: Thorn nails
2152.DESCRIPTION: Squid's children have made pretty collages. They should be hanged on the wall. Submit nails.

2153.NAME: Obtaining honey
2153.DESCRIPTION: Squid believes that there is no skill more valuable than that of obtaining honey. Get 25 units of honey.

2154.NAME: Simple bowls
2154.DESCRIPTION: Squid could use a few simple bowls. They can be made out of coconut shells. Submit coconuts.

2155.NAME: Sweet tooth
2155.DESCRIPTION: Akma wants to know if you are a true lover of sweets. Spend sugar on any island.

2156.NAME: Firewood
2156.DESCRIPTION: Akma bakes tasty chocolate cakes in her stove. Submit wood.

2157.NAME: White bread
2157.DESCRIPTION: Akma makes chocolate butter that can be put on bread. Make bread several times.

2158.NAME: Lily
2158.DESCRIPTION: Akma enjoys making marzipan flowers. She would like to see a realy lily for inspiration. Submit a lily (you can get it by buying blue flowers).

2159.NAME: Ropes
2159.DESCRIPTION: Akma needs ropes for securing cake boxes. Submit ropes.

216.NAME: Shards to grind the salt
216.DESCRIPTION: The stranger needs 4 shards to grind salt

2160.NAME: Birthday candles
2160.DESCRIPTION: Akma decorates birthday cakes with hand-made candles. Sell beeswax from your backpack.

2162.NAME: Corn
2162.DESCRIPTION: The ladies love sweet corn, but Paprick has none! Submit corn.

2163.NAME: Smoked salmon
2163.DESCRIPTION: One has to serve a nice meal on the day of celebration. Make smoked salmon 4 times.

2164.NAME: Sugar for cream
2164.DESCRIPTION: Paprick will serve whipped cream for dessert. Submit sugar.

2165.NAME: Flowers
2165.DESCRIPTION: Women's day is unimaginable without flowers. Buy small flowers.

2166.NAME: Housework
2166.DESCRIPTION: All housework has to be done duly, so that the ladies can rest. Harvest crops on your or friends' islands.

2167.NAME: Beads
2167.DESCRIPTION: It would be nice to give something to the ladies. Sell bone beads from your backpack.

2168.NAME: Water for lemonade
2168.DESCRIPTION: Paprick plans to serve refreshing lemonade. Submit water.

2169.NAME: Performance
2169.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to dedicate a song to the ladies. Some say that drinking raw eggs helps the voice. Submit eggs.

217.NAME: Roasted meat event
217.DESCRIPTION: Grow and sell 20 pigs for stranger's roast-meat party

2170.NAME: Gift
2170.DESCRIPTION: You should also send something special to Paprick's ladies. Submit 2 purple-wing nightflies (can be found by harvesting corn on your island).

2171.NAME: Lianas
2171.DESCRIPTION: The merchant delivers lianas to the local basket weavers. Submit lianas.

2172.NAME: Rabbits
2172.DESCRIPTION: The locals often want to give their children some rabbits. Sell grown-up rabbits.

2173.NAME: Fish
2173.DESCRIPTION: Prove that you are a passionate fisherman. Sell salmon from your backpack.

2174.NAME: Try fishing net
2174.DESCRIPTION: Find the net in your backpack and press Use. Then, click on any fishing spot.

2175.NAME: Lovely carrots
2175.DESCRIPTION: Mycott finds carrots lovely because the can be used to make stews as well as sweet pancakes. Submit carrots.

2176.NAME: Salted mushrooms
2176.DESCRIPTION: Mycott craves some salted mushrooms. Submit forest mushrooms.

2177.NAME: Benefactor
2177.DESCRIPTION: Mycott is a true benefactor and tries to look after his neighbours' animals. Feed animals on your friends' islands.

2178.NAME: Try out saw
2178.DESCRIPTION: Find the saw in your backpack, press Use and click on a tree that you want to remove.

2179.NAME: Grape juice
2179.DESCRIPTION: The stranger wants some freshly squeezed grape juice. Submit grapes.

218.NAME: Wood for fires
218.DESCRIPTION: Gather 100 units of wood for the stranger's party

2180.NAME: Planks for the pier
2180.DESCRIPTION: "A big pier is being built in my hometown - we could use some planks!" Submit planks.

2181.NAME: Sea cabbages
2181.DESCRIPTION: "There are cabbages on your shores? I must see them!" Sell sea cabbages from your backpack.

2182.NAME: Ostrich friend
2182.DESCRIPTION: The stranger thinks that ostriches are especially great birds that deserve extra care. Feed ostriches on any island.

2183.NAME: Nourishing pies
2183.DESCRIPTION: Your guest must be tired after his long journey. Make pumpkin pie several times.

2184.NAME: An ambitious idea
2184.DESCRIPTION: The stranger plans to decorate his house with obsidian tiles. Submit obsidian.

2185.NAME: Clay buildings
2185.DESCRIPTION: The stranger believes that it's best to keep materials and food in clay buildings. Build any clay shed.

2186.NAME: Mussels
2186.DESCRIPTION: The stranger didn't know that mussels can contain pearls and threw them back in the ocean. Submit mussels.

2187.NAME: Pigs
2187.DESCRIPTION: The stranger will not trust his miraculous animals to a beginner. Prove that you're a proper farmer - sell grown-up pigs.

2188.NAME: Tomatoes
2188.DESCRIPTION: Before resuming his journey, the stranger wants to fill his bag with dried tomatoes. Harvest tomato fields on any island.

2189.NAME: Other currency
2189.DESCRIPTION: The strager will visit a place where you can only buy things for fog shells. Submit fog shells.

219.NAME: Wood for the raft
219.DESCRIPTION: Help the man by providing wood, so he can repair his raft. 60 units should be enough

2190.NAME: Parting gifts
2190.DESCRIPTION: The stranger will leave soon. Give him some parting gifts. Sell anything from your backpack.

2192.NAME: Light animals
2192.DESCRIPTION: Light animals are difficult to grow. Grow and sell cats, rabbits or meerkats.

2193.NAME: Light material
2193.DESCRIPTION: Light material, but obtaining it is heavy work. Submit bones.

2194.NAME: Light crops
2194.DESCRIPTION: Light crops are not so easy to harvest. Harvest strawberry, bean or chili fields on your island.

2195.NAME: Heavy animals
2195.DESCRIPTION: Grow and sell the heaviest animals - elephants, bears or horses.

2197.NAME: Heavy crops
2197.DESCRIPTION: Grow the heaviest crops - harvest coconuts, pumpkin or melon fields on your island.

2198.NAME: Submit 30 eggs
2198.DESCRIPTION: Find 30 Easter Eggs on your Island and submit them.

2199.NAME: Submit 60 eggs
2199.DESCRIPTION: Find 60 Easter Eggs on your Island and submit them.

22.NAME: Sell a hen
22.DESCRIPTION: Sell the hen. This way you can earn extra shells.

220.NAME: Rope for the raft
220.DESCRIPTION: He will need 3 ropes for the raft

2200.NAME: Submit 90 eggs
2200.DESCRIPTION: Find 90 Easter Eggs on your Island and submit them.

2201.NAME: Shelter
2201.DESCRIPTION: One can never know when the rain will come. For starters one needs to construct shelter. Submit bundles of straw for the shelter.

2202.NAME: Market booths
2202.DESCRIPTION: Market also needs booths for merchants, where they can display their goods. Prepare wood planks.

2203.NAME: Path
2203.DESCRIPTION: Market definitely needs new path, so that market visitors do not need to stride through grass. Place sand path's on your island.

2204.NAME: Water
2204.DESCRIPTION: Water will be needed both for refreshing beverages, as well as for Easter egg boiling. Submit water.

2205.NAME: Grill
2205.DESCRIPTION: Local cooks will prepare delicious food. Use the fireplace on your or your friends' islands.

2206.NAME: Ropes for swings
2206.DESCRIPTION: To construct swing in tree branches, one needs strong ropes. Submit ropes.

2207.DESCRIPTION: Surly Easter Market has to have Egg boiling and rolling contests. Submit eggs.

2208.NAME: Onion Peels
2208.DESCRIPTION: The Eggs will be colored in onion peel concoction. Submit onions.

2209.NAME: Flower patterns
2209.DESCRIPTION: To make the Easter eggs even more beautiful they need to be imprinted with flower patterns. Buy little flowers or star flowers.

221.NAME: Coconut palms
221.DESCRIPTION: Now you can buy coconut palms in the shop. Dig fields and plant 5 palms

2210.NAME: Honey
2210.DESCRIPTION: Sissy wants to sell honey. Submit honey.

2211.NAME: Wild berry jam
2211.DESCRIPTION: Sissy wants to sell wild berry jam. Prepare wild berry jam multiple times.

2212.NAME: Fruits and vegitables
2212.DESCRIPTION: Both merchants and cooks need fresh fruits and vegetables. Collect harvest on your or your friends' islands.

2213.NAME: Fill the basket
2213.DESCRIPTION: Go the the Paprick's Island and help to fill the grand Easter Egg Basket.

2216.NAME: Bird feeding
2216.DESCRIPTION: Feed small or grown-up birds on any island.

2217.NAME: Animal feeding
2217.DESCRIPTION: Feed baby animals on any island.

222.NAME: Coconut harvest
222.DESCRIPTION: Gather 10 coconuts for the survivor, and he will teach you two coconut recipes

2220.NAME: Collect carnivorous plants
2220.DESCRIPTION: Remove carnivorous plants from airplane island!

2222.NAME: Try out the storehouse
2222.DESCRIPTION: Put a sand path in the storehouse (click on it with the right mouse button and select "Store").

2223.NAME: Glass of milk
2223.DESCRIPTION: Eddy and his friends would love to have a glass of cold milk. Submit milk.

2224.NAME: Sugar for tea
2224.DESCRIPTION: Eddy wants to have some tea, too. However, he thinks that the sugar from the shop is no good. Craft sugar out of melons several times (in the workshop).

2225.NAME: Pizza
2225.DESCRIPTION: Turns out that Eddy loves italian food. Make pizza 3 times.

2226.NAME: Beds
2226.DESCRIPTION: "My friends and I are not proud - we can sleep outside!" Finish 5 hammocks.

2227.NAME: Duck post
2227.DESCRIPTION: Eddy sends his letters with the help of ducks. Sell grown-up ducks.

2228.NAME: Ceramics
2228.DESCRIPTION: Eddy wants to make clay vases and pots for selling on the local market. Submit clay.

2229.NAME: Mind games
2229.DESCRIPTION: Eddy plans to sell handmade chess sets at the market. Submit bones.

223.NAME: Dice from bone
223.DESCRIPTION: The gambler wants to create himself nice dice from bone. Provide him some beautiful bones

2230.NAME: Torches for light
2230.DESCRIPTION: Eddy plans to participate in the market even after dark. Submit torches.

2231.NAME: Change
2231.DESCRIPTION: Eddy does not have coins for change. Submit shells.

2232.NAME: Strawberry order
2232.DESCRIPTION: Eddy has promised to deliver strawberries to customer, but he forgot to pack them. Harvest strawberry fields on any island.

2233.NAME: Cloth for blankets
2233.DESCRIPTION: Eddy gets cold easily. Submit cloth for blankets.

2234.NAME: Local contacts
2234.DESCRIPTION: Eddy wants to get acquainted with as many Oceanians as possible. Help on your friends' islands.

2235.NAME: One for the road
2235.DESCRIPTION: Before saying goodbye, Eddy wants to clink a glass of wine. Submit a bottle of wine.

2236.NAME: Food for the road
2236.DESCRIPTION: Eddy and his friends will soon be on their way. Submit food for the road.

2237.NAME: Lucky doubloon
2237.DESCRIPTION: Eddy believes that a doubloon in one's pocket brings one luck. Submit a silver doubloon.

2238.NAME: Stuffed eggplants
2238.DESCRIPTION: Make the delicious stuffed eggplants several times!

2239.NAME: Response
2239.DESCRIPTION: Send confirmation to Curiosity to find out more about the project.

224.NAME: 5 obsidian shards
224.DESCRIPTION: The gambler is ready to part with meerkats only if you trade them for 5 obsidian shards

2240.NAME: Place ancient chest
2240.DESCRIPTION: To take a closer look at the chest, place it on your island.

2241.NAME: Unlock ancient chest
2241.DESCRIPTION: Obtain a copy of the key and click on the chest to see what it contains.

2242.NAME: Informing friends
2242.DESCRIPTION: Announce the search for a locksmith by helping on your friends' islands.

2243.NAME: Air mail
2243.DESCRIPTION: One can send messages to far-away places with the help of birds. Sell grown-up birds.

2244.NAME: Water mail
2244.DESCRIPTION: It's worth sending out some messages in bottles - maybe you get lucky. Submit wine bottles.

2245.NAME: Admiral Edmund
2245.DESCRIPTION: You should attach some doubloons to One-eyed Edmund's letter. Submit bronze doubloons.

2246.NAME: Squid
2246.DESCRIPTION: Your gift to Priest Squid could be something for his supplies of medicinal plants. Submit rowan-tree berries.

2247.NAME: Sissy
2247.DESCRIPTION: You should add something sweet to Sissy's letter. Submit strawberries.

2248.NAME: Princess Tara
2248.DESCRIPTION: Princess Tara could use some food for her rabbits. Submit carrots.

2249.NAME: Musician Sango
2249.DESCRIPTION: You could send Sango some parchment for writing down new songs. Submit parchment.

225.NAME: Some tasty berries
225.DESCRIPTION: He wants just a couple blueberries before he leaves

2250.NAME: Dressmaker Nadine
2250.DESCRIPTION: Nadine definitely needs something for crafting fabric. Submit flax.

2251.NAME: Eggplant shakers
2251.DESCRIPTION: Sango has heard that you grow eggplants - they can be used to make great shakers. Submit eggplants.

2252.NAME: Accessories for celebrity
2252.DESCRIPTION: Now that Sango has concerts all over Oceania, he needs celebrity-worthy accessories. Submit citrine necklaces.

2253.NAME: Water on stage
2253.DESCRIPTION: Make sure that Sango and his band have water to drink during the performance. Submit water.

2254.NAME: Stage outfits
2254.DESCRIPTION: Sango and his band need new T-shirts. Submit cloth.

2255.NAME: Potato stamps
2255.DESCRIPTION: Sango wants to carve symbols in potatoes and print them on shirts. Harvest potato fields on any island.

2256.NAME: Horsehair for strings
2256.DESCRIPTION: Horsehair can be used to craft strings for instruments. Sell grown-up horses.

2257.NAME: Confetti
2257.DESCRIPTION: Sango wants to end his performance with confetti rain. Submit lianas.

2258.NAME: Stage talisman
2258.DESCRIPTION: Sango is superstitious and wants to get a good luck talisman. Submit lion teeth (you can find them by emptying friends' clay pits).

2259.NAME: Silk curtain
2259.DESCRIPTION: The beginning of a concert is more impressive if there is a curtain in front of the stage. Submit silk.

226.NAME: A little something to drink
226.DESCRIPTION: The last thing he requires is some milk, and then he will leave and give you the meerkats

2260.NAME: Coal for eye-liner
2260.DESCRIPTION: Sango wants to change his image. Submit coal for eye-liner.

2261.NAME: Traveling concert tour
2261.DESCRIPTION: To travel across the big islands, Sango and his band could use a carriage. Submit wheels (you can get them by building chairs).

2262.NAME: Guarding instruments
2262.DESCRIPTION: Music instruments are very valuable, so they need to be looked after. Sell grown-up dogs.

2263.NAME: Copper locks
2263.DESCRIPTION: Ludo wants to try making locks and padlocks out of copper. Submit copper pieces.

2264.NAME: Elephants
2264.DESCRIPTION: Nobody grows elephants on Ludo's home island. Feed small or grown-up elephants on any island.

2265.NAME: Blocks for workshop
2265.DESCRIPTION: Ludo wants to build a new, more modern locksmith's workshop. Submit decorative blocks.

2266.NAME: Gasoline for car
2266.DESCRIPTION: Ludo has decided to resume driving his car. Submit gasoline.

2267.NAME: Tomatoes for son
2267.DESCRIPTION: Ludo's son wants to sell homemade ketchup, yet he's too lazy to grow tomatoes. Submit tomatoes.

2268.NAME: Waxing the car
2268.DESCRIPTION: Ludo's car needs washing and waxing. Submit wax.

2269.NAME: Iron keys
2269.DESCRIPTION: A locksmith always needs more iron. Submit iron.

2270.NAME: Rabbits for daughter
2270.DESCRIPTION: Ludo's daughter wants to learn a magic trick - pulling a rabbit out of the hat. Sell grown-up rabbits.

2271.NAME: Gem tree
2271.DESCRIPTION: Instead of payment, Ludo would be happy to receive a valuable decoration. Finish building a gem tree.

2272.NAME: Submit gypsum powder
2272.DESCRIPTION: Obtain gypsum powder and submit it to Ludo.

2273.NAME: Water for mixing
2273.DESCRIPTION: The gypsum powder has to be mixed with water. Empty wells on any island.

2274.NAME: Make a key
2274.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Unique" and make a key for the ancient chest.

2275.NAME: 1st riddle
2275.DESCRIPTION: They can be pulled out of the depths of the ocean, but they actually belong on shop shelves. Use 40 from your bag.

2276.NAME: 2nd riddle
2276.DESCRIPTION: It is the only plant that makes you cry. Make any food in which it is used. Do it 50 times.

2277.NAME: 3rd riddle
2277.DESCRIPTION: One of them can have even a hundred legs! Obtain any of them 40 times.

2278.NAME: 4th riddle
2278.DESCRIPTION: It has four legs, but it can stand like a human. Feed them on any island 80 times.

2279.NAME: 5th riddle
2279.DESCRIPTION: The smallest inhabitants of the ocean like them. Buy 200.

228.NAME: Grow 50 meerkats
228.DESCRIPTION: Gain reputation and experience by growing and selling 5 times more meerkats

2280.NAME: 6th riddle
2280.DESCRIPTION: You can use it to clean even the dirtiest dishes. Craft it 30 times.

2281.NAME: Wheat
2281.DESCRIPTION: Wheat is always very demanded at the market. Harvest wheat fields on your island.

2282.NAME: Jellyfish
2282.DESCRIPTION: One of the merchants plans to build a huge aquarium. He could use some colourful jellyfish. Use jellyfish from your bag.

2283.NAME: Machetes
2283.DESCRIPTION: The local researchers buy a lot of machetes, as they often have to walk through the jungle. Submit machetes.

2284.NAME: Cats
2284.DESCRIPTION: Merchants love cats because they don't let mice get to the bags of goods. Sell grown-up cats.

2285.NAME: Good roads
2285.DESCRIPTION: Merchants always complain if they have to transport goods on bad roads. Build clay or stone paths.

2286.NAME: Fancy jewelry
2286.DESCRIPTION: High-born ladies are always ready to buy some jewelry. Sell pearl necklaces from your bag.

2287.NAME: Truffles
2287.DESCRIPTION: The merchants want to sell exclusive delicacies. Submit truffles.

2288.NAME: Cactus flowers
2288.DESCRIPTION: Cactus flowers are demanded because they can be used for making drinks as well as for decorative purposes. Submit cactus flowers.

2289.NAME: Corals
2289.DESCRIPTION: Corals can be used to make pretty decorations. Submit corals (you can get them by emptying friends' bonfires).

229.NAME: Grow 150 meerkats
229.DESCRIPTION: If you can grow 3 times more meerkats, then you really have become rich and will gain a lot of reputation and experience

2290.NAME: Growing lemons
2290.DESCRIPTION: It's time to grow lemons! Harvest lemons on your island.

2291.NAME: Lemon juice
2291.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Food" and make lemon juice several times.

2292.NAME: Processing parchment
2292.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Unique" to process the parchment.

2293.NAME: Secret message
2293.DESCRIPTION: Give the processed parchment to Curiosity Sparks. Submit ancient parchment.

2294.NAME: Off you go!
2294.DESCRIPTION: Now that you have prepared for the expedition.

2295.NAME: Warmth
2295.DESCRIPTION: It might be colder on Haraiki island. Submit wool.

2296.NAME: Ropes
2296.DESCRIPTION: Ropes can be used for fastening, climbing and other things. Submit ropes.

2297.NAME: Paper
2297.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity will definitely want to write down her findings. Submit parchment.

2298.NAME: Canned fish
2298.DESCRIPTION: You could prepare some canned fish to take with you. Catch gudgeons, salmon or sharks.

2299.NAME: Canned corn
2299.DESCRIPTION: You could also can some corn. Harvest corn fields on any island.

23.NAME: Buy rabbits
23.DESCRIPTION: Gather money for 5 rabbits and buy them.

230.NAME: Grow and gather 10 strawberry fields
230.DESCRIPTION: Now you have a new plant - strawberries. You can craft very rich and tasty berry soup out of them

2300.NAME: Jam
2300.DESCRIPTION: You should also pack something sweet. Make berry jam several times.

2301.NAME: Bread
2301.DESCRIPTION: You could make some sandwiches for the road. Make bread several times.

2302.NAME: Boiled eggs
2302.DESCRIPTION: Boiled eggs will not go bad for several days. Make boiled eggs several times.

2303.NAME: Drinks
2303.DESCRIPTION: Of course, you'll need a lot of drinks. Craft blueberry drink, cactus lemonade, tangerine cocktail or lemon juice.

2304.NAME: Screws for repairs
2304.DESCRIPTION: The raft may need some repairs on the way. Submit screws.

2305.NAME: Visiting
2305.DESCRIPTION: You must tell your friends about the great adventure! Help on friends' islands.

2306.NAME: Small things
2306.DESCRIPTION: You should also pack various small things that might come in handy. Sell anything from your bag.

2307.NAME: Ancient chests
2307.DESCRIPTION: On the island, there are several chests that are similar to the one found by Curiosity. Find and search the chests!

2308.NAME: Manuscripts
2308.DESCRIPTION: Give the ancient manuscripts to Curiosity. Submit the manuscripts.

2309.NAME: Painting the cottage
2309.DESCRIPTION: Jarno plans to repaint the floors in his summer cottage. Submit paint.

231.NAME: Grow and gather 10 grape fields
231.DESCRIPTION: Now you can grow grapes. Soon you will learn to brew wine

2310.NAME: Garden furniture
2310.DESCRIPTION: Jarno needs new furniture for his garden. Build iron or volcanic furniture.

2311.NAME: Firewood
2311.DESCRIPTION: Jarno often uses the fireplace at his cottage. Submit wood.

2312.NAME: Goat farm
2312.DESCRIPTION: Jarno has made a vast pasture-ground for goats. Sell grown-up goats.

2313.NAME: Clay supports
2313.DESCRIPTION: Jarno wants to build a large balcony with clay supports. Submit clay supports.

2314.NAME: Pumpkins
2314.DESCRIPTION: Jarno had planted many pumpkins, but they were destroyed by pests. Harvest pumpkin fields anywhere.

2315.NAME: Rolling cabbages
2315.DESCRIPTION: Jarno is organising a party. One of the activities will be cabbage rolling. Submit sea cabbages.

2316.NAME: Cake
2316.DESCRIPTION: Jarno will treat his guests with various sweets. Make honey cake several times.

2317.NAME: Fruit
2317.DESCRIPTION: Jarno usually serves exotic fruit. Harvest bananas, coconuts, pandanus or pitaya fruit on any island.

2318.NAME: Beans
2318.DESCRIPTION: Jarno plans to boil bean soup. Submit beans.

2319.NAME: Hedgehogs
2319.DESCRIPTION: Jarno didn't know that one can grown hedgehogs in Oceania. Sell grown-up hedgehogs.

232.NAME: Grow and gather 50 grape fields
232.DESCRIPTION: Gain reputation by planting and harvesting 50 grape fields

2320.NAME: Milk
2320.DESCRIPTION: Jarno's backyard is sometimes visited by his neighbours' cats. Collect milk on your island.

2321.NAME: Craft better machetes
2321.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Other" and craft better machetes several times.

2322.NAME: Try out machetes
2322.DESCRIPTION: Try out the new machetes by chopping plants on Haraiki island.

2324.NAME: Salty food
2324.DESCRIPTION: Maybe the monster is hungry. It's safer to start with something simple - make raddish salad several times!

2325.NAME: Sweet food
2325.DESCRIPTION: You can also try giving the monster something sweet. Submit melons.

2326.NAME: Drink
2326.DESCRIPTION: They monster might be thirsty. Submit water.

2327.NAME: Games
2327.DESCRIPTION: What if the monster wants to play? Submit puppets (you can get them by building stools).

2328.NAME: Treasure
2328.DESCRIPTION: It's possible that the monster is interested in treasure. Sell any necklaces (except bone beads) from your bag.

2329.NAME: Conversation
2329.DESCRIPTION: The monster lives here all alone. Maybe he wants to chat? Get the latest gossip by helping on friends' islands.

233.NAME: Grow and gather 50 strawberry fields
233.DESCRIPTION: Gain reputation by planting and harvesting 50 strawberry fields

2330.NAME: Feathers for a dress
2330.DESCRIPTION: For the next ball, the princess wants to wear a dress with a feather collar. Submit hoopoe feathers (you can get them by feeding roosters).

2331.NAME: Copper buckles
2331.DESCRIPTION: Princess wants to have copper buckles for all her shoes and belts. Submit copper ore.

2332.NAME: Fish for aquarium
2332.DESCRIPTION: The princess wants to add exotic fish to her aquarium. Sell royally purple fish, angelfish or golden fish.

2333.NAME: Teddybears
2333.DESCRIPTION: The princess has liked bears since her childhood. Sell grown-up bears.

2334.NAME: Dumbbells
2334.DESCRIPTION: The princess wants to exercise, but iron dumbbells are too heavy for her. Submit clay.

2335.NAME: Modern life
2335.DESCRIPTION: The princess always follows the latest tendencies. Sell modern sheds.

2336.NAME: Wool coat
2336.DESCRIPTION: When visiting colder lands, Tara needs a very warm coat. Submit llama wool (you can get it by feeding friends' goats and sheep).

2337.NAME: Ants
2337.DESCRIPTION: The princess recently bought several anteaters. Submit ants.

2338.NAME: Keeping reputation
2338.DESCRIPTION: The princess believes that one should always work on one's reputation. Gain reputation.

2339.NAME: Give the crown
2339.DESCRIPTION: Give the crown to the monster (click on him)!

234.NAME: Brew 3 wine bottles
234.DESCRIPTION: Brew 3 bottles of wine in the workshop

2346.NAME: Hammerhead in lemon sauce
2346.DESCRIPTION: Make hammerhead shark in lemon sauce several times.

235.NAME: Buy wine barrel in the shop
235.DESCRIPTION: Buy, construct and complete the wine barrel by adding 3 bottles of wine to it

2350.NAME: Removing the dam
2350.DESCRIPTION: Remove the dam, so that there would be water in the fountain!

2352.NAME: Plant flowers
2352.DESCRIPTION: Finish the flowerbeds with flower bulbs!

2353.NAME: Antelopes
2353.DESCRIPTION: Paprick doesn't grow antelopes, yet he admires them. Sell grown-up antelopes.

2354.NAME: Hay bundles
2354.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to lay hay bundles in his pasture-ground, so that the animals would be more comfortable. Submit bundles.

2355.NAME: Shells
2355.DESCRIPTION: Paprick needs to return a "small" debt. Submit shells.

2356.NAME: Friends
2356.DESCRIPTION: As always, Paprick urges you to help others. Help on your friends' islands.

2357.NAME: Bones for dogs
2357.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is happy to feed the local dogs. Submit bones.

2358.NAME: Ocean gifts
2358.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to serve seafood to his family. Make any food out of fish several times.

2359.NAME: Granite for tiles
2359.DESCRIPTION: The council plans to cover the hall floor with granite tiles. Submit granite (you can get it by feeding chicken and hens).

236.NAME: Sell wine barrel and earn money
236.DESCRIPTION: Sell the wine barrel and you will gain a lot of shells. You can continue earning money this way

2360.NAME: Jasper decorations
2360.DESCRIPTION: The columns will be encrusted with red gems. Submit jasper.

2361.NAME: Obsidian chandelier
2361.DESCRIPTION: An impressive obsidian chandelier will be hung from the ceiling. Submit obsidian.

2362.NAME: Clay pots
2362.DESCRIPTION: Before leaving, Adoni has to fulfill orders from clients. Submit clay pots.

2363.NAME: Burned pots
2363.DESCRIPTION: The new pots need to be processed with fire to make them darker. Use bonfires on any island.

2364.NAME: Colourful ornaments
2364.DESCRIPTION: Adoni also paints his pots. Submit paint.

2365.NAME: Potato pancakes
2365.DESCRIPTION: While traveling, Adoni would like to eat pancakes. Make potato pancakes several times.

2366.NAME: Candy
2366.DESCRIPTION: Adoni thinks that during the journey one can eat peppermint candy instead of brushing one's teeth. Submit candy.

2367.NAME: Money for merchants
2367.DESCRIPTION: When starting to live on Haraiki island, Adoni will have to contact the local merchants. Submit silver doubloons.

2368.NAME: Attracting birds
2368.DESCRIPTION: To research birds, Balun has to attract them with corn. Submit wheat.

2369.NAME: Attracting fish
2369.DESCRIPTION: To attract fish, one needs bait. Submit bugs.

237.NAME: Chop wood on friends' islands
237.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends with wood materials, by chopping 15 trees on your friends' islands

2370.NAME: Attracting insects
2370.DESCRIPTION: Many insects are attracted by pollen. Buy white, blue, red or orange flowers.

2371.NAME: Spice
2371.DESCRIPTION: Balun likes spicy food. Make spicy cocos soup several times.

2372.NAME: Magnifying glasses
2372.DESCRIPTION: To explore the flora and fauna of Haraiki, Balun will need new magnifying glasses. Submit glass.

2373.NAME: Full collection
2373.DESCRIPTION: Balun happily collects shells. Exchange a full shell collection for a reward.

2374.NAME: Love poems
2374.DESCRIPTION: Gelar's love poems are often inspired by the sweet scent of flowers. Submit gerberas (you can get them from beehives).

2375.NAME: Nature poems
2375.DESCRIPTION: Nature poems are usually written when listening to wind rustling in the trees. Plant trees (not fruit trees) on your island.

2376.NAME: Funny poems
2376.DESCRIPTION: Gelar finds sloths to be extremely funny. Feed small or grown-up

2377.NAME: Parchment
2377.DESCRIPTION: Gelar always has parchment with him to jot down impulsively created stanzas. Submit parchment.

2378.NAME: Inspiring creatures
2378.DESCRIPTION: Prove that there are beautiful and colourful creatures on Haraiki island. Submit lion fish.

2379.NAME: New friends
2379.DESCRIPTION: Gelar wants to meet new and interesting friends. Toby could be a great fit! Harvest cactuses, aloes or camelthorns on Ahe island.

238.NAME: Feed friends' hens
238.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends with hens by feeding them on your friends' islands

2383.NAME: Freshwater
2383.DESCRIPTION: Adoni always needs water for making ceramics. Obtain water on Haraiki island.

2384.NAME: Directions
2384.DESCRIPTION: Balun is not very good at reading maps. Show him the way by visiting Haraiki island!

2385.NAME: Start the fountain
2385.DESCRIPTION: To start the fountain, click on it and choose "Upgrade".

2386.NAME: Cleaning the throne
2386.DESCRIPTION: Before the king arrives, you should clean his throne! Click on the throne and choose "Upgrade".

2387.NAME: Generosity
2387.DESCRIPTION: It is a greater gift to give than to receive. Give some shells.

239.NAME: Gather friends' crops
239.DESCRIPTION: Help your friends by gathering beans, tomatoes, corn or wheat 15 times on friends' islands

24.NAME: Feed rabbits
24.DESCRIPTION: Grow and cook enough food and feed 5 rabbits in time, once each.

240.NAME: Convince the first council elder
240.DESCRIPTION: The old man's children like coconuts. Give him a 20 coconut present to convince him

2400.NAME: Melon drink
2400.DESCRIPTION: In hot weather, Tycott often prepares a refreshing melon drink. Submit melons.

2401.NAME: Nails
2401.DESCRIPTION: Tycott needs to drive some nails into his corridor wall for hanging jackets. Craft thorn nails.

2402.NAME: Sharks
2402.DESCRIPTION: After the last storm, there are no sharks in Tycott's fishing spot. Sell mini sharks from your bag.

2403.NAME: Lazy chef
2403.DESCRIPTION: Tycott would gladly receive many guests, but he doesn't like to cook. Obtain food on your islands.

2404.NAME: Rides
2404.DESCRIPTION: Tycott wants to start a new business and offer horse rides to local children. Sell grown-up horses.

2405.NAME: Eggs
2405.DESCRIPTION: Tycott promised his wife to bring eggs from the shop, but he tripped and all eggs broke. Submit eggs.

2406.NAME: Wires
2406.DESCRIPTION: Tycott wants to make large cages for transporting animals. Submit wires.

2407.NAME: Roosters
2407.DESCRIPTION: Tycott grows roosters for their pretty feathers. Sell grown-up roosters.

2408.NAME: Fog
2408.DESCRIPTION: Tycott's favourite nature phenomenon is fog. Submit fog shells (found in the well).

2409.NAME: Flax
2409.DESCRIPTION: Tycott's favourite song is called "Blue flax". Harvest flax fields on any island.

241.NAME: Convince the second council elder
241.DESCRIPTION: This old man loves strawberries a lot. Give him a 40 strawberry gift

2410.NAME: Savings
2410.DESCRIPTION: Tycott can never save up any money. Show him a good example by collecting shells on any island.

2411.NAME: Helmets
2411.DESCRIPTION: Tycott and friends will found a club for safe biking. Submit coconuts for making helmets.

2412.NAME: Usual pigs
2412.DESCRIPTION: Tycott wants to make sure that you know how to grow pigs. Sell grown-up pigs.

2413.NAME: Grow truffle pigs
2413.DESCRIPTION: Feed truffle pigs and piglets on any island!

2417.NAME: Water for freshness
2417.DESCRIPTION: You need to feel fresh and alert to learn, so wash your face with cold water. Give water.

2418.NAME: Radish for health
2418.DESCRIPTION: You need a healthy body to have a healthy mind. So eat a lot of radish. Give radish.

2419.NAME: Feathers for quills
2419.DESCRIPTION: You need to make careful notes to learn new things. Give starling feathers (found, feeding hen and chicken)

242.NAME: Convince the third council elder
242.DESCRIPTION: The old woman's children love small animals. Buy and sell 10 non grown-up meerkats

2420.NAME: Discoveries
2420.DESCRIPTION: To learn new things, you need to dig deeper. Dig fields.

2421.NAME: Salmon and books
2421.DESCRIPTION: Before reading smart books, try to catch some salmon. Get salmon.

2422.NAME: Foundations matter
2422.DESCRIPTION: Knowledge requires foundations just like a building. Finish any plank storage.

2423.NAME: Most important thing
2423.DESCRIPTION: A true wise-man never forgets the most important - friends. Help your friends on their islands.

2424.NAME: Vitamins
2424.DESCRIPTION: Vitamin B improves brain activity. Harvest bean fields on your own island.

2425.NAME: Bee wisdom
2425.DESCRIPTION: Did you know that bees are very intelligent? Harvest bee hives on any island.

2426.NAME: Stretching
2426.DESCRIPTION: Before studies, it's always good to have a good stretch. Give lianas.

2427.NAME: Food
2427.DESCRIPTION: It is difficult to study on empty stomach. Give food.

2428.NAME: Color of knowledge
2428.DESCRIPTION: The natives believe that the blue color symbolizes strength and knowledge. Place blue flower beds on your island.

2429.NAME: Good angler
2429.DESCRIPTION: Since Mr. Quickster is a keen fisherman. He will definitely appreciate your skills. Spend tinsels on the main island.

243.NAME: Convince the fourth council elder
243.DESCRIPTION: This old man loves tasty wine. Give him a present of 5 wine bottles

2430.NAME: Punctuality
2430.DESCRIPTION: Punctuality is very important for Mr. Quickster. Prove that you can do things in time. Feed meerkats on your island.

2431.NAME: Natural light
2431.DESCRIPTION: Arthur Quickster doesn't like electric light sources. Craft torches.

2432.NAME: The neat goats
2432.DESCRIPTION: Arthur thinks that calling stuborn people goats is an insult to goats. Sell grown goats.

2433.NAME: Color festival
2433.DESCRIPTION: Arthur wants to organize a festival where everyone throws colorful powders at each other. Submit paint.

2434.NAME: Water for ice
2434.DESCRIPTION: Against all odds in a tropical climate Arthur has decided to learn ice skating. Give away water to make ice.

2435.NAME: Sweet strawberries
2435.DESCRIPTION: Strawberries growing in Arthur's gardens this season for some reason are sour. Hand in strawberries.

2436.NAME: Landscaped forest
2436.DESCRIPTION: Arthur always reminds everyone that planted forests need to be cleaned as well. Take in his advice and cut trees on any island.

2437.NAME: Oil
2437.DESCRIPTION: One of Arthur's motor wheels needs oil. Empty fire-oil pumps on any island.

2438.NAME: Truffle julienne
2438.DESCRIPTION: Arthur dreams about truffle julienne. Make it several times.

2439.NAME: Exclusive auto
2439.DESCRIPTION: One of Arthur's customers wants his auto to be decorated with diamonds. Sell diamonds from your backpack.

244.NAME: Convince the fifth council elder
244.DESCRIPTION: The old woman's daughter loves beads. Give her a present of 5 bone beads

2440.NAME: Royal welcome
2440.DESCRIPTION: The party thrown in honor of Arthur needs a red carpet. Hand in cloth.

2441.NAME: Other fruit
2441.DESCRIPTION: Abel loves all kinds of fruit and berries. Harvest fruit trees or bushes on any island.

2442.NAME: Forest treats
2442.DESCRIPTION: Abel enjoys the tasty autumn mushrooms and berries. Collect forest mushrooms and berries on your island.

2443.NAME: Protecting the harvest
2443.DESCRIPTION: Sometimes one has to cover the fruit trees with a net to protect them from birds. Submit ropes.

2444.NAME: Pests
2444.DESCRIPTION: Abel hates maggots. Spend maggots on your island.

2445.NAME: Landscapes
2445.DESCRIPTION: In his free time, Abel paints forest landscapes. Plant choppable trees.

2446.NAME: Sugar
2446.DESCRIPTION: To make tasty juice and jam, one needs a lot of sugar. Submit sugar.

2447.NAME: Cider barrels
2447.DESCRIPTION: Abel often makes refreshing apple cider. Sell finished barrels (from the decoration section).

2448.NAME: Apple pie
2448.DESCRIPTION: Abel also owns a bakery that produces delicious apple pies. Submit wheat.

2449.NAME: Pig food
2449.DESCRIPTION: Abel usually feed the rotten apples to pigs. Feed pigs or piglets on any island.

245.NAME: Convince the sixth council elder
245.DESCRIPTION: The old man's shack fell apart. Give him a gift of 30 planks, so he can repair it

2450.NAME: Beans
2450.DESCRIPTION: One of the most common ingredients for local dishes is beans. Harvest beans on your island.

2451.NAME: Bright feathers
2451.DESCRIPTION: The locals believe that one should wear brightly coloured headdresses in autumn. Sell grown-up roosters.

2452.NAME: Autumn soup
2452.DESCRIPTION: For the great harvest feast, one must prepare a large kettle of soup for your neighbours. Submit water.

2453.NAME: Autumn weather
2453.DESCRIPTION: In autumn, everyone must light their ovens or fireplaces. Submit wood.

2454.NAME: Little helpers
2454.DESCRIPTION: Hedgehogs happily take part in collecting autumn goods. Sell grown-up hedgehogs.

2455.NAME: Autumn meal
2455.DESCRIPTION: One must definitely serve a juicy pumpkin pie during harvest feast. Make pumpkin pie several times.

2456.NAME: Wall decorations
2456.DESCRIPTION: One must put up autumn decorations during harvest. Craft thorn nails.

2457.NAME: Canned carrots
2457.DESCRIPTION: The locals always prepare canned carrots in autumn. Submit carrots.

2458.NAME: Honey
2458.DESCRIPTION: If you eat a lot of honey during harvest feast, your harvest will be good and delicious. Submit honey.

2459.NAME: Other harvest
2459.DESCRIPTION: If you're done with your own harvest, go and help others! Harvest plants on your friends' islands.

246.NAME: Convince the last council elder
246.DESCRIPTION: The old woman just wants to know that you are a good friend. Help your friends on their islands 20 times

2460.NAME: Evaluate the damage
2460.DESCRIPTION: Go to the Halloween island to see what can be done!

2461.NAME: Light the lanterns
2461.DESCRIPTION: Obtain candles and finish the pumpkin lanterns (click on the Halloween decoration)!

2462.NAME: Fix the furniture
2462.DESCRIPTION: The wind has broken the furniture that had been set up at the party place - fix it!

2463.NAME: Fill the candy basket
2463.DESCRIPTION: Collect a sufficient amount of candy (on your main island) and fill the basket!

2464.NAME: Bird feathers
2464.DESCRIPTION: Luna makes very pretty dream catchers out of twigs and bird feathers. Sell grown-up birds.

2465.NAME: Grain filling
2465.DESCRIPTION: Luna sometimes sews grain-filled pillows. Submit wheat.

2466.NAME: Treats
2466.DESCRIPTION: Luna makes various salty and sweet treats. Spend salt or sugar.

2467.NAME: Ropes for nets
2467.DESCRIPTION: Luna sells handmade nets to the local fishermen. Submit ropes.

2468.NAME: Popcorn
2468.DESCRIPTION: Luna prepares and delivers popcorn to nearby cinemas. Harvest corn on any island.

2469.NAME: Milk for cats
2469.DESCRIPTION: Luna's backyard is visited by many cats. Submit milk.

247.NAME: Prepare food supplies
247.DESCRIPTION: Tarick needs 250 units of before going on the expedition

2470.NAME: Fashion trends
2470.DESCRIPTION: Before sewing new clothes, Luna wants to know what's trending. Go and help on your friends' islands.

2471.NAME: New sewing machine
2471.DESCRIPTION: Luna wants to buy a new sewing machine. Submit shells.

2472.NAME: Wool for costume
2472.DESCRIPTION: Luna wants to dress up as a sheep for Halloween. Submit wool.

2473.NAME: Collect candy
2473.DESCRIPTION: Collect candy that will periodically appear on your island!

2474.NAME: Pick up pumpkins
2474.DESCRIPTION: Collect the pumkins on Halloween island (then place them at the decoration spot)!

2475.NAME: Carve pumpkins
2475.DESCRIPTION: The pumpkins should also be carved (when the pumpkins are in the right place, click on the decoration)!

2476.NAME: Light the bonfire
2476.DESCRIPTION: Light the bonfire on Halloween island!

248.NAME: Prepare water supplies
