248.DESCRIPTION: The expedition will demand lots of water. Gather and provide 50 units of water

2483.NAME: Carrot noses
2483.DESCRIPTION: Paprick plans to build many snowmen this year. Submit carrots.

2485.NAME: Visit the gnomes
2485.DESCRIPTION: Visit Santa's helpers - go to the Gnome island (click on the raft)!

2486.NAME: Gnome's slumber
2486.DESCRIPTION: Gnome Dragonwing oversees all pre-Christmas work, but he has fallen asleep! Obtain strong coffee and give it to him!

2487.NAME: Snowflake's gifts
2487.DESCRIPTION: Gnome Snowflake has to wrap gifts, but the nasty elves have stolen the wrapping paper! Collect them and return them to Snowflake!

2488.NAME: Nosy's train
2488.DESCRIPTION: Gnome Nosy is a toy master, but he cannot manage to put together this train. Obtain the missing parts and give them to Nosy!

2489.NAME: Gudgeons
2489.DESCRIPTION: Paprick is afraid that the bay will freeze over, and he won't be able to fish. Submit gudgeons.

249.NAME: Prepare coconuts for the expedition
249.DESCRIPTION: Coconuts don't spoil so they are good as food supply for a lengthy travel. Submit 10 coconuts

2490.NAME: Chicken
2490.DESCRIPTION: One should count chickens in autumn, but Paprick prefers to do it in winter. Feed chickens on your island.

2491.NAME: Planks
2491.DESCRIPTION: Paprick's yard and house needs some mending. Craft planks on your island.

2492.NAME: Cats
2492.DESCRIPTION: Paprick will be visited by his aunt who adores cats. Sell grown-up cats.

2493.NAME: Agriculture news
2493.DESCRIPTION: Paprick wants to know what plants are being grown in other people's gardens. Harvest plants on friends' islands.

2494.NAME: Obsidian
2494.DESCRIPTION: Paprick will make his snoman's eyes and mouth out of obsidian, not coal. Submit obsidian.

2495.NAME: Food
2495.DESCRIPTION: Paprick always organises a great dinner at Christmas. Submit food.

2496.NAME: Forest berries
2496.DESCRIPTION: Paprick's wife plans to bake berry muffins. Submit forest berries.

2497.NAME: Nails
2497.DESCRIPTION: As Turrick is always mending or crafting something, he's always short on nails. Submit thorn nails.

2498.NAME: Water
2498.DESCRIPTION: Turrick has built a decorative pool next to his house. Now it needs to be filled. Submit water.

2499.NAME: Corn
2499.DESCRIPTION: Turrick gives his chicken some corn from time to time. Submit corn.

25.NAME: Sell grown-up rabbits
25.DESCRIPTION: Sell 5 rabbits when they have grown up.

250.NAME: Obstacles during expedition I
250.DESCRIPTION: Tarick has sent a message that he has encountered a broken bridge and requires 20 planks to repair it

2500.NAME: Sheep
2500.DESCRIPTION: Roro sells various woolen products. Feed sheep or lambs on any island.

2501.NAME: Other furry friends
2501.DESCRIPTION: Roro likes fluffy insects. Submit bumblebees (you'll find them by harvesting tomatoes on your island).

2502.NAME: Money for the purchase
2502.DESCRIPTION: You have to give Roro some money for buying the locomotive. Submit shells.

2504.NAME: Visit Paprick
2504.DESCRIPTION: Go to Paprick's island and ask him about the complaint (click on him).

2505.NAME: On the road
2505.DESCRIPTION: Visit Berko and Ayana on Lovebirds island.

2506.NAME: Reminder
2506.DESCRIPTION: It's important to remind Berko and Ayana that they're a great couple! Give them a nice photo of themselves!

2507.NAME: Valentine's gift
2507.DESCRIPTION: Ayana will surely be happy to recieve a nice Valentine's gift - obtain a gift and give it to the couple!

2508.NAME: Romantic environment
2508.DESCRIPTION: To ensure a romantic mood on Lovebirds island, you need to make a few improvements (finish the quest Romance)!

2509.NAME: Removing thorns
2509.DESCRIPTION: Remove thorns to make room for lovely flowers!

251.NAME: Obstacles during expedition II
251.DESCRIPTION: Tarick has to overcome a huge cliff. Send him 3 ropes

2510.NAME: Cosy gazebo
2510.DESCRIPTION: Fix the gazebo, so that the couple can sit there and enjoy the sunset.

2511.NAME: Removing bushes
2511.DESCRIPTION: Remove bushes to make place for more romantic plants!

2512.NAME: Nails for tripod
2512.DESCRIPTION: Fox wants to make a better tripod for his camera, but he's out of nails. Craft nails.

2513.NAME: Flower compositions
2513.DESCRIPTION: Fox enjoys photographing still life, for example, flower bouqets. Place flowers on your island.

2514.NAME: Fire for lighting
2514.DESCRIPTION: Sometimes the best photos can be taken in the evening. Submit coal.

2515.NAME: Pets
2515.DESCRIPTION: Fox photographs not only humans, but also pets. Feed cats or dogs on any island.

2516.NAME: Rain water
2516.DESCRIPTION: It seldom rains on Fox's island, so he can run out of drinking water. Submit water.

2517.NAME: Payment
2517.DESCRIPTION: Finally, pay Fox for printing and framing the photo. Submit shells.

2518.NAME: Tomatoes for sauce
2518.DESCRIPTION: Sissy plans to make lazanja for Valentine's dinner, but she's out of tomatoes. Submit tomatoes.

2519.NAME: Flowers for hair
2519.DESCRIPTION: Sissy likes to put flowers in her hair. Submit gerberas (you can get them from beehives).

252.NAME: Obstacles during expedition III
252.DESCRIPTION: Tarick wants to scare away a bunch of crocodiles. Send him 24 black onions

2520.NAME: Beads
2520.DESCRIPTION: Sissy likes to accessorize. Submit bone beads.

2521.NAME: Honey
2521.DESCRIPTION: To make the treats really sweet, submit honey.

2522.NAME: Corn
2522.DESCRIPTION: To make the treats crispy, submit corn.

2523.NAME: Yeast
2523.DESCRIPTION: To make a good dough, submit yeast.

2524.NAME: Money for shopping
2524.DESCRIPTION: Sissy wants to buy some colourful wrapping paper. Submit bronze doubloons.

2525.NAME: Wooden box
2525.DESCRIPTION: To keep the sweets safe, it's best to put them in a box. Submit wood.

2526.NAME: Ropes
2526.DESCRIPTION: You need to tie something around the gift box. Submit ropes.

2528.NAME: Excellency
2528.DESCRIPTION: Only excellent inhabitants of Oceania can raise gentleman animals. Sell 3 gentlemen.

2529.NAME: Prosperity
2529.DESCRIPTION: A real governor is very prosperous. Give 300 000 shells.

253.NAME: Payment for the expedition
253.DESCRIPTION: Tarick would like to have 6 paint buckets as payment

2530.NAME: Skill
2530.DESCRIPTION: A governor has to be skillful. Sell complete vax decorations on your island.

2531.NAME: Big animals
2531.DESCRIPTION: Only a real strongman can command the biggest animals. Feed grown-up elephants and horses.

2532.NAME: Iron man
2532.DESCRIPTION: In Oceania the symbol of strength is iron. Give iron plates.

2533.NAME: Stone roller
2533.DESCRIPTION: Prove that you are a mighty stone roller. Give stones.

2534.NAME: Patient mushroom gatherer
2534.DESCRIPTION: You need to be very patient and perceptive to gather mushrooms. Craft canned mushrooms.

2535.NAME: Patient winemaker
2535.DESCRIPTION: Making wine is a long and complex process. Give wine.

2536.NAME: A patient friend of sloths
2536.DESCRIPTION: You have to feed sloths so rarely that many grow impatient. Sell grown-up sloths.

2537.NAME: 1. Riddle
2537.DESCRIPTION: It is black as a coal, but after some work every lady will gladly wear it around her neck. Sell 100.

2538.NAME: 2. Riddle
2538.DESCRIPTION: Round as a sun, it comes from sunny Italy. Make this dish 80 times

2539.NAME: 3. Riddle
2539.DESCRIPTION: Grow the only vegetable that costs 35 shells in the shop and harvest 500 fields of it.

254.NAME: Reputation for the workshop I
254.DESCRIPTION: Gather 1300 reputation and you will receive some thorns and shells

2540.NAME: Coal for notes
2540.DESCRIPTION: Toby tends to forget where he is. Submit coal, so that he can write things down.

2541.NAME: Pearl games
2541.DESCRIPTION: Toby entertains himself by rolling round objects. Submit pearls.

2542.NAME: Bananas
2542.DESCRIPTION: There are no banana palms on Toby's island. Submit bananas.

2544.NAME: Coconuts
2544.DESCRIPTION: Coconuts can provide a light snack and a refreshing drink. Submit coconuts.

2545.NAME: Sponges for cleanliness
2545.DESCRIPTION: While traveling, you must maintain order on the raft. Submit sponges.

2546.NAME: Water
2546.DESCRIPTION: You can't travel without fresh water supplies. Submit water.

2547.NAME: Jewels
2547.DESCRIPTION: If you meet a traveling merchant, it's best to have something valuable to offer. Submit citrines.

2548.NAME: Potatoes
2548.DESCRIPTION: Potatoes can be used to prepare various meals. Submit potatoes.

2549.NAME: Bait
2549.DESCRIPTION: If you come across a fishing spot, you should definitely use it. Submit tinsels.

255.NAME: Reputation for the workshop II
255.DESCRIPTION: Gather 1400 reputation and you will receive some thorns and lianas

2550.NAME: Ducks
2550.DESCRIPTION: You might encounter various water birds. Sell grown-up ducks.

2551.NAME: Good dressing
2551.DESCRIPTION: Lemon juice will be great addition to food and drinks. Submit lemons.

2552.NAME: Nuts
2552.DESCRIPTION: Nuts would be light and healthy snack. Submit hazel nuts (can be found in friends' beehives).

2553.NAME: Boiled eggs
2553.DESCRIPTION: Boiled eggs are tasty and don't go bad too quickly. Craft boiled eggs several times.

2554.NAME: Cloth
2554.DESCRIPTION: Cloth will be useful for making tents and sleeping bags. Submit cloth.

2555.NAME: Salt
2555.DESCRIPTION: Whatever you happen to eat, you can surely improve it with a bit of salt. Submit salt.

2556.NAME: Torches
2556.DESCRIPTION: What if you wander into a dark cave? Submit torches.

2557.NAME: Lighter cloth
2557.DESCRIPTION: When in hotter climate, you'll need lighter cloth. Submit silk.

2558.NAME: Axe testing
2558.DESCRIPTION: Who knows what you'll need to chop through? Test your axe by chopping trees on any island.

2559.NAME: Bread
2559.DESCRIPTION: How can you leave without packing some bread? Make bread several times.

256.NAME: Reputation for the workshop III
256.DESCRIPTION: Gather 1500 reputation and you will receive some thorns and coconuts

2560.NAME: Pots for storage
2560.DESCRIPTION: Not all things can be stored in bags. Submit clay pots.

2561.NAME: Dried berries
2561.DESCRIPTION: It would be nice to dry various fruit and berries. Submit blueberries.

2562.NAME: Greens
2562.DESCRIPTION: You should add some greens to your food supply. Make steamed sea cabbage several times.

2563.NAME: Candles
2563.DESCRIPTION: When in need of light, simple candles will suffice. Build wax candles.

2564.NAME: Boots
2564.DESCRIPTION: Who knows what terrain you'll have to cross? Use boots from your backpack.

2565.NAME: Delicacy
2565.DESCRIPTION: When on a long voyage, you should boost your spirits with something special. Make truffle julienne several times.

2566.NAME: Scouts
2566.DESCRIPTION: Sometimes it's best to explore a new territory by sending skilled scouts. Sell grown-up dogs.

2567.NAME: Other tools
2567.DESCRIPTION: What if you encounter volcanic terrain? Submit lava chisel.

2568.NAME: Loyal friends
2568.DESCRIPTION: You might be away for quite a while - better visit your friends beforehand. Help on your friends' island.

2569.NAME: Sweet dreams
2569.DESCRIPTION: One doesn't always get to sleep well while traveling, so you better do it now. Build hammocks.

257.NAME: Gather water from the well
257.DESCRIPTION: Gather 5 units of water from the water source, by clicking on it

2570.NAME: Lucky traveler
2570.DESCRIPTION: Narrow-wing blue butterfly symbolises happiness and hope. Submit narrow-wing blues (found harvesting pumpkins).

2571.NAME: Visiting Gonzo
2571.DESCRIPTION: Get on your raft and go to Marakei island.

2572.NAME: Rabbits
2572.DESCRIPTION: Is there anything sweeter and more fluffy than a rabbit? Sell grown-up rabbits.

258.NAME: Provide water to Paprick
258.DESCRIPTION: Help Paprick and provide him with 20 units of water

2581.NAME: Grumpy zebra
2581.DESCRIPTION: Obtain a treat that zebras like (consult the zebra specialist) and give it to the grumpy zebra.

2582.NAME: Angry crocodile
2582.DESCRIPTION: Obtain a treat that crocodiles like (consult Chiko) and give it to the angry crocodile.

2583.NAME: Suitable home
2583.DESCRIPTION: Find out how to craft building materials that are suitable for savannah climate and finish the wigwam on Marakei.

2584.NAME: Similar animals
2584.DESCRIPTION: Sam wants to make sure that you know how to handle animals similar to zebra. Sell grown-up horses.

2585.NAME: Stripy things
2585.DESCRIPTION: Sam wants to know if you like stripes. Submit bumblebees (found by harvesting tomatoes).

2586.NAME: Suitable place
2586.DESCRIPTION: Sam wants to see if you can create a suitable area for keeping animals. Sell finished fences.

2587.NAME: Bird food
2587.DESCRIPTION: Sam grows not only zebras, but also flamingos. Submit gudgeons for feeding flamingos.

2588.NAME: Tasty melons
2588.DESCRIPTION: Sam loves exotic fruit. Harvest melon fields on any island.

2589.NAME: Colours
2589.DESCRIPTION: Sam wants to paint jungle motifs on his walls. Submit paint.

259.NAME: Gather clay from the claypit
259.DESCRIPTION: Gather 10 units of clay from the claypit

2590.NAME: Wealth
2590.DESCRIPTION: Keeping zebras is not cheap business. Prove that you can afford it - submit gold doubloons.

2591.NAME: Strawberry jam
2591.DESCRIPTION: Sam really likes strawberry jam, but he's not good at growing strawberries. Submit strawberries.

2592.NAME: Special sharks
2592.DESCRIPTION: Sam has seen the most common sharks, but has never caught a hammerhead shark. Sell hammerhead sharks.

2593.NAME: Fuel
2593.DESCRIPTION: To reach the far corners of savannah, Sam uses his jeep. Craft fuel several times.

2594.NAME: Ostrich eggs
2594.DESCRIPTION: Sam likes ostriches because he can make really large omlets out of their eggs. Sell grown-up ostriches.

2595.NAME: Pool for ducks
2595.DESCRIPTION: Sam would like to keep ducks, but his yard doesn't have a place for swimming. Finish a modern pool.

2596.NAME: Copper for craftsman
2596.DESCRIPTION: Sam's eldest son is great at crafting metal jewelry. Submit copper.

2597.NAME: Flowers for window-sill
2597.DESCRIPTION: Sam likes to keep flowers on window-sills. Sell finished flower boxes.

2598.NAME: Keys
2598.DESCRIPTION: Sam wants to visit the mysterious cave on Pinaki island. Submit ancient keys.

2599.NAME: Dried savannah grass
2599.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Materials" and craft dried savannah grass.

26.NAME: Buy twig shelter
26.DESCRIPTION: Earn enough money to buy twig shelter in the shop, and place it on your island

2600.NAME: Big and dangerous
2600.DESCRIPTION: Chiko likes big and dangerous animals. Sell grown-up bears.

2601.NAME: Scary spiders
2601.DESCRIPTION: Many fear spiders, but not daredevil Chiko! Submit spiders (found by chopping broad palms).

2602.NAME: Hights
2602.DESCRIPTION: Chiko gladly climbs trees - the higher, the better! Chop fully grown rubber trees on your island.

2603.NAME: Good machetes
2603.DESCRIPTION: Chiko often goes on dangerous expeditions in the jungle. Craft better machetes several times.

2604.NAME: Spice
2604.DESCRIPTION: Chiko likes spicy adventures and spicy food. Submit chili.

2605.NAME: Wind direction
2605.DESCRIPTION: Before going out in the sea, it's good to know wind direction. Finish weathercocks on your island.

2606.NAME: Geologist
2606.DESCRIPTION: Chiko holds a bachelor's degree in geology. Submit rock collection (it can be done in the collection window).

2607.NAME: Pretzels
2607.DESCRIPTION: Chiko has so many friends that he often has to attend celebrations. Make pretzels several times.

2608.NAME: Foxes
2608.DESCRIPTION: Chiko really likes wolves, so he thinks that he might be good with foxes, too. Sell grown-up foxes.

2609.NAME: Lucky man
2609.DESCRIPTION: If you can catch the rare golden fish, luck is definitely on your side. Catch golden fish.

261.NAME: Start upgrading the workshop
261.DESCRIPTION: Start upgrading the workshop to its 4th stage (click on it and choose Upgrade)

2610.NAME: Hero
2610.DESCRIPTION: Chiko believes that a true hero will always come to the aid of his friends. Help on your friends' islands.

2611.NAME: Quick as a flash
2611.DESCRIPTION: If you can manage to feed meerkats on time, you are truly quick. Feed small or grown-up meerkats.

2612.NAME: Reptile food
2612.DESCRIPTION: Go to workshop section "Other" and craft reptile food.

2613.NAME: Grass
2613.DESCRIPTION: Remove several clumps of savannah grass.

2616.NAME: Nourishing lunch
2616.DESCRIPTION: Turrick starts working early, so he's very hungry at lunchtime. Make stuffed eggplants several times.

2617.NAME: Wax for floors
2617.DESCRIPTION: Turrick has been hired to wax the floors in a manor. Submit wax.

2618.NAME: Decorative blocks
2618.DESCRIPTION: Wealthy clients demand building materials of the highest quality. Submit decorative blocks.

2619.NAME: Cow caller
2619.DESCRIPTION: Turrick makes whistles for herding cows in his spare time. Sell grown-up cows.

262.NAME: Complete the new workshop
262.DESCRIPTION: Complete the new workshop, by adding an anvil and a hammer

2620.NAME: Onion rings
2620.DESCRIPTION: Turrick's favourite snack is onion rings. Submit onions.

2621.NAME: Spoon deficit
2621.DESCRIPTION: Spoons keep disappearing at Turrick's house. Submit spoons (found by building tables).

2622.NAME: Research sample
2622.DESCRIPTION: Submit a few sandstones for research.

2626.NAME: Flower garlands
2626.DESCRIPTION: Sell flower garlands (crafted in workshop section Other) from your backpack.

2627.NAME: Solid wigwam
2627.DESCRIPTION: Build a solid wigwam on your island.

2628.NAME: Obstacles
2628.DESCRIPTION: Paprick plans to have various pits and tunnels throughout the track. Dig furrows.

2629.NAME: Ropes
2629.DESCRIPTION: You'll need to separate the track from the viewers' seats. Submit ropes.

263.NAME: Reputation for iron ore I
263.DESCRIPTION: Gather 1550 reputation to get 1 iron ore

2630.NAME: Resting places
2630.DESCRIPTION: You should place some benches, so that the tired runners could rest. Sell finished benches.

2631.NAME: Drinks for thirst
2631.DESCRIPTION: It is important to drink a lot of liquid during the marathon. Submit forest berries for lemonade.

2632.NAME: Food for power
2632.DESCRIPTION: All runners must have a proper meal. Submit food.

2633.NAME: Water for showers
2633.DESCRIPTION: All runners must have access to showers after the finish. Submit water.

2634.NAME: Medals
2634.DESCRIPTION: The best runners will receive medals. Submit bronze doubloons.

2635.NAME: Consolation prizes
2635.DESCRIPTION: Other participants should at least get some flowers. Submit callas (you can get them, buying orange flowers).

2636.NAME: Pedestal
2636.DESCRIPTION: You need a pedestal for the closing ceremony. Submit planks.

2637.NAME: Advertisement
2637.DESCRIPTION: Help advertise the Great Easter Marathon. Visit friends and help on their islands.

2638.NAME: Funds
2638.DESCRIPTION: You will need some additional funds for emergencies. Submit shells.

2639.NAME: Somewhere to sleep
2639.DESCRIPTION: Some of the runners might need to spend the night. Craft hay bundles.

264.NAME: Reputation for iron ore II
264.DESCRIPTION: Gather 1600 reputation to get 1 iron ore

2643.NAME: Figurines
2643.DESCRIPTION: Build decorative figurines on your island.

2644.NAME: First blocks
2644.DESCRIPTION: Before building a wigwam on Marakei island, try crafting a sandstone block!

265.NAME: Reputation for iron ore III
265.DESCRIPTION: Gather 1700 reputation, to get 2 units of iron ore

2657.NAME: Improve workshop
2657.DESCRIPTION: Collect the wise-man coin by doing the corresponding challenge on Competition isle and improve your workshop.

2658.NAME: Improve fireplace
2658.DESCRIPTION: Collect the celebrity coin by doing the corresponding challenge on Competition isle and improve your fireplace.

2659.NAME: Improve well
2659.DESCRIPTION: Collect the wealthy man's coin by doing the corresponding challenge on Competition isle and improve your well.

266.NAME: Souvenir for the 1st tourist
266.DESCRIPTION: This tourist loves the big Oceanian pumpkins. Give him 10

267.NAME: Souvenir for the 2nd tourist
267.DESCRIPTION: This tourist adores the local cloth. Give her 3 rolls

2672.NAME: Talk to Paprick
2672.DESCRIPTION: Go to Paprik and find out what's the matter (click on Paprick)!

2673.NAME: Free the entrance
2673.DESCRIPTION: Obtain a powerful explosive and use it to blow the entrance to the cave open.

2674.NAME: Miners
2674.DESCRIPTION: Maybe miners have collaborated with a specialist of explosives? Submit copper pieces.

2675.NAME: Builders
2675.DESCRIPTION: Builders are definitely worth talking to. Submit stone blocks.

2676.NAME: Pyro-technicians
2676.DESCRIPTION: Pyro-technicians are familiare with blowing things up. Submit ropes for rocket burners.

2677.NAME: Party girls
2677.DESCRIPTION: Maby the ladies have met a specialist at a ball? Sell bone beads.

2678.NAME: Travellers
2678.DESCRIPTION: Travellers meet a great variety of people. Submit maps (found on desert island).

2679.NAME: Innkeepers
2679.DESCRIPTION: Innkeepers serve representatives of various professions. Sell finished wine barrels (from Buildings).

268.NAME: Souvenir for the 3rd tourist
268.DESCRIPTION: This tourist is astonished by the local pottery. Give her 3 clay pots

2680.NAME: Mailmen
2680.DESCRIPTION: Mailmen can send messages to all islands in Oceania. Submit parchment.

2681.NAME: Priests
2681.DESCRIPTION: Priests sometimes see and hear more than others. Submit hoopoe feathers (found when feeding roosters) for rituals.

2682.NAME: Acquaintances
2682.DESCRIPTION: Maybe your acquaintances have heard something about an explosive specialist? Help on your friends' islands.

2683.NAME: Attention to detail
2683.DESCRIPTION: To remain observant, Bruno collects stick-insects that are very difficult to see. Submit stick-insects.

2684.NAME: Patience
2684.DESCRIPTION: Bruno works on his patience when fishing. Submits octopuses.

2685.NAME: Precision
2685.DESCRIPTION: Growing strawberries improves precision, as they have to be timely when harvesting. Harvest strawberries on any island.

2686.NAME: Cement for foundations
2686.DESCRIPTION: Bruno plans to build a solid place for explosive experiments. Submit cement.

2687.NAME: Explosion of taste
2687.DESCRIPTION: Bruno likes spicy adventures, even when eating. Submit chili.

2688.NAME: Beautiful horns
2688.DESCRIPTION: Bruno respects antelopes for their beautiful, long horns. Sell grown-up antelopes.

2689.NAME: Shard paths
2689.DESCRIPTION: Bruno wants to fix his bumpy roads with some shards. Submit shards.

269.NAME: Souvenir for the 4th tourist
269.DESCRIPTION: This tourist is interested in local construction methods. Give him 12 bricks

2690.NAME: Volcano adventure
2690.DESCRIPTION: Bruno doesn't believe that you've met the legendary volcano god. Get some lava chisels from the volcano god.

2691.NAME: Winter garden
2691.DESCRIPTION: Bruno's wife plans to create a sun-parlour. Submit glass.

2692.NAME: Independent friends
2692.DESCRIPTION: A cat goes where it pleases, same as Bruno. Sell grown-up cats.

2693.NAME: Gold rings
2693.DESCRIPTION: To celebrate their anniversary, Bruno wants to make gold rings for him and his wife. Submit golden doubloons.

2694.NAME: Solid support
2694.DESCRIPTION: Because of Bruno's dangerous work, all buildings must have solid supports. Submit clay supports.

2695.NAME: Cakes
2695.DESCRIPTION: Bruno likes sweets, but he doesn't mess around with cookies. Make honey cake several times.

2696.NAME: Coal for sketching
2696.DESCRIPTION: Prior to making the explosive, you need a detailed sketch and description. Submit coal.

2697.NAME: Friends' gardens
2697.DESCRIPTION: Bruno's friends often forget to harvest their fruit. Harvest coconuts, bananas, mango,  pitaya and pandanus fruit on your friends' islands.

2698.NAME: Other pigs
2698.DESCRIPTION: Spotted pigs? Bruno wants to see it! Feed truffle pigs and piglets on any island.

2699.NAME: Culture lover
2699.DESCRIPTION: Bruno takes great interest in everyday objects of various cultures. Submit the Everyday object collection (section Collections).

27.NAME: Build twig shelter
27.DESCRIPTION: Build and complete your twig shelter. The shelter will increase your maximum energy

270.NAME: Souvenir for the 5th tourist
270.DESCRIPTION: This tourist loves the local milk. Give him 5 bottles of milk

2700.NAME: Colourful dreams
2700.DESCRIPTION: Bruno's daughter wants to paint the walls of her bedroom. Submit paint.

2701.NAME: Yellow stone
2701.DESCRIPTION: Bruno really likes amber, but it can't be found on the shores of Oceania. Submit citrines.

2702.NAME: Good cloth
2702.DESCRIPTION: Bruno's clothes often get destroyed in experiments. Submit cloth.

2703.NAME: Purple
2703.DESCRIPTION: Bruno's wife is called Violet and her favourite color is purple. Submit royally purple fish!

2704.NAME: Great joy
2704.DESCRIPTION: Large animals give great joy to Bruno. Submit grown-up elephants.

2705.NAME: Pumpkin lamps
2705.DESCRIPTION: Bruno carves pumpkin lamps all year long. Harvest pumpkins on any island.

2706.NAME: Spendings
2706.DESCRIPTION: Bruno is against saving money. Spend shells.

271.NAME: Souvenir for the 6th tourist
271.DESCRIPTION: This tourist adores the taste of blueberries. Give her 10 blueberries

2713.NAME: Superstition
2713.DESCRIPTION: Minna believes that ladybugs bring luck. Submit ladybugs (found harvesting beans).

2714.NAME: Bone settings
2714.DESCRIPTION: Minna makes decorative watches in pretty bone settings. Submit bones.

2715.NAME: Eggplants
2715.DESCRIPTION: Minna is good friends with Eddy Eggplant. Submit eggplants.

2716.NAME: Prudence
2716.DESCRIPTION: Minna learns prudence and patience, growing sloths. Feed sloths on any island.

2717.NAME: Show-windows
2717.DESCRIPTION: Minna cleans the show-windows of her shop every morning. Submit sponges.

2718.NAME: Fields of flax
2718.DESCRIPTION: Minna prefers the blue flowers of flax over garden flowers. Submit flax.

2719.NAME: Watch chains
2719.DESCRIPTION: Minna hangs pocket watches in golden chains. Submit golden chains.

272.NAME: Souvenir for the leader of the group
272.DESCRIPTION: The group leader wants 3 bone beads for his wife. In exchange he will give you ironwood shaft

2720.NAME: Bear experts
2720.DESCRIPTION: Minna's family are well-known bear experts. Sell grown-up bears.

2721.NAME: A cart of radish
2721.DESCRIPTION: Minna can eat several kilos of radish every week. Submit radish.

2722.NAME: Make an explosive
2722.DESCRIPTION: Bruno Blaster has given you all the information. Go to the workshop section Unique and make an explosive.

2723.NAME: Explore the cave
2723.DESCRIPTION: The cave is finally accessible. Take a torch and go inside (click on the entrance).

2724.NAME: Lottery
2724.DESCRIPTION: Life is a lottery. Use mussels from your backpack.

2725.NAME: Cleanliness
2725.DESCRIPTION: Water can wash away dust as well as your worries. Submit water.

2726.NAME: Hidden beauty
2726.DESCRIPTION: Do not fear upon seeing thorns - a pretty flower may be hidden there. Submit cactus flowers.

2727.NAME: Flight of thought
2727.DESCRIPTION: Your thoughts can fly as birds, reaching new heights. Feed birds on any island.

2728.NAME: Basic needs
2728.DESCRIPTION: Before working with your mind, make sure that your stomach isn't growling. Make potato pancakes several times.

2729.NAME: Light dreams
2729.DESCRIPTION: If you want to see enlightened dreams, drink milk before sleep. Submit milk.

273.NAME: First pirate leader's task
273.DESCRIPTION: Provide 200 units of wood so he can repair his ship

2730.NAME: Breaking pots
2730.DESCRIPTION: You can't always be calm and collected. Sometimes you need to smash something. Submit clay pots.

2731.NAME: Roof
2731.DESCRIPTION: No task is worth going through the roof for. Submit roof tiles.

2732.NAME: Not getting mossy
2732.DESCRIPTION: You mustn't let your world views get so old that they become covered in moss. Submit moss (found harvesting friends' wheat and onions).

2733.NAME: Torch light
2733.DESCRIPTION: Show Volt how you got light in dark places up to now. Submit torches.

2734.NAME: Energetic fluffs
2734.DESCRIPTION: Volt loves active and energetic animals. Sell grown-up rabbits.

2735.NAME: Almost eels
2735.DESCRIPTION: Volt adores electric eels. Maybe you have something similar? Submit guppies.

2736.NAME: Stretching
2736.DESCRIPTION: Before climbing a utility pole, Volt does some stretching. Submit stretchy lianas.

2737.NAME: Value
2737.DESCRIPTION: Volt believes that valuable things must be spent wisely. Spend truffles.

2738.NAME: Fancy electricity
2738.DESCRIPTION: When going to fix electricity for fancy ladies, Volt usually brings them gifts. Sell jade necklaces.

2739.NAME: Rest
2739.DESCRIPTION: For relaxation, Volt observes the inhabitants of his aquarium. Submit corals (found in friends' fireplaces).

274.NAME: Second pirate leader's task
274.DESCRIPTION: Provide 5 rolls of cloth so he can mend his sails

2740.NAME: Order of the universe
2740.DESCRIPTION: Volt believes - as long as chicken lay eggs, all is right in this world. Submit eggs.

2741.NAME: Spending money
2741.DESCRIPTION: Volt is certain - money is made for spening! Sell finished shell sheds.

2742.NAME: Other lights
2742.DESCRIPTION: Show Volt another source of light. Build lava lamps.

2743.NAME: Good system
2743.DESCRIPTION: To understand the basis of a good system, Volt observes ant hills. Submit ants.

2744.NAME: Burnoil
2744.DESCRIPTION: Volt has a lot of use for burnoil. Spend burnoil.

2745.NAME: Fear of horns
2745.DESCRIPTION: Volt wants to overcome his fear of animals with horns. Feed cows or goats on any island.

2746.NAME: Locked chest
2746.DESCRIPTION: Volt has lost the key to his toolbox. Maybe one of yours will fit? Submit ancient keys.

2747.NAME: Beautiful dishes
2747.DESCRIPTION: Volt dreams of having dishes that are decorated with dark gems. Submit obsidian.

2748.NAME: Start building watermill
2748.DESCRIPTION: Start building the watermill (click on the Proud cliff and Upgrade).

2749.NAME: Finish the 1st stage of the watermill
2749.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 1st stage of the watermill.

275.NAME: Third pirate leader's task
275.DESCRIPTION: Provide 10 units of coal or the pirates so they can paint their moustaches menacingly black

2750.NAME: Upgrade the watermill
2750.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the watermill to the next stage (click and choose Upgrade).

2751.NAME: Finish the 2nd stage of the watermill
2751.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 2nd stage of the watermill.

2753.NAME: Go to Nihiru Island
2753.DESCRIPTION: Go to Nihiru Island to visit the healer.

2755.NAME: Go underground
2755.DESCRIPTION: Go and explore the underground (click on the entrance at the Proud Cliff).

2758.NAME: Building underground
2758.DESCRIPTION: Finish any decoration or building that can be built underground.

276.NAME: First pirate wife's task
276.DESCRIPTION: The pirate's wife loves yellow prideflowers. Buy and sell 10

2760.NAME: Make mushroom omelette
2760.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop and make oyster mushroom omelette several times.

2761.NAME: Bat farm
2761.DESCRIPTION: Grow and sell bats (it can only be done underground).

2762.NAME: Upgrade the watermill
2762.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the watermill to the next stage (click and choose Upgrade).

2763.NAME: Finish the 3rd stage of the watermill
2763.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 3rd stage of the watermill.

2764.NAME: Upgrade the watermill
2764.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the watermill to the next stage (click and choose Upgrade).

2765.NAME: Finish the 4th stage of the watermill
2765.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 4th stage of the watermill.

2766.NAME: Upgrade the watermill
2766.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the watermill to the next stage (click and choose Upgrade).

2767.NAME: Finish the 5th stage of the watermill
2767.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 5th stage of the watermill.

2768.NAME: Upgrade the watermill
2768.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the watermill to the next stage (click and choose Upgrade).

2769.NAME: Finish the 6th stage of the watermill
2769.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 6th stage of the watermill.

277.NAME: Second pirate wife's task
277.DESCRIPTION: Teach the pirate's wife to craft milk from coconuts. Craft 5 bottles of milk from coconuts to demonstrate

2770.NAME: Upgrade the watermill
2770.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the watermill to the next stage (click and choose Upgrade).

2771.NAME: Finish the 7th stage of the watermill
2771.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 7th stage of the watermill.

2772.NAME: Upgrade the watermill
2772.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the watermill to the next stage (click and choose Upgrade).

2773.NAME: Finish the 8th stage of the watermill
2773.DESCRIPTION: Finish building the 8th stage of the watermill.

2774.NAME: Road signs
2774.DESCRIPTION: Signs with directions to the banquet will be hung in trees. Submit ropes.

2775.NAME: Good road
2775.DESCRIPTION: Guests will arrive on foot as well as other means of transportation. Build plank or clay paths.

2776.NAME: Snacks
2776.DESCRIPTION: Guests who'll arrive early will want some snacks. Submit corn.

2777.NAME: Water for lemonade
2777.DESCRIPTION: To make lemonade, you'll need a lot of water. Submit water.

2778.NAME: Berries for lemonade
2778.DESCRIPTION: Lemonade is often made out of berry jam. Craft forest berry jam.

2779.NAME: Barrels
2779.DESCRIPTION: Beer will be served in barrels. Submit finished barrels (from Decorations).

278.NAME: Third pirate wife's task
278.DESCRIPTION: Her husband always gets dirty with coal. She needs 25 water units to wash it off

2780.NAME: Salad
2780.DESCRIPTION: The 1st dish for the banquest could be fresh salad. Make radish salad several times.

2781.NAME: Soup
2781.DESCRIPTION: The guests will definitely enjoy some hot soup. Make tomato soup several times.

2782.NAME: Sweets
2782.DESCRIPTION: You should also offer some sweet, yet healthy treats! Submit honey.

2783.NAME: Racing
2783.DESCRIPTION: The children will probably go racing in the grass with their pets. Sell grown-up rabbits.

2784.NAME: Treasure hunt
2784.DESCRIPTION: One of the traditional games is treasure hunt at the place of celebration. Submit diorites (found digging furrows).

2785.NAME: Games
2785.DESCRIPTION: The locals like to gamble. Submit shells.

2786.NAME: Visiting
2786.DESCRIPTION: In the evening, one can go celebrate with all friends and neighbours. Help on friends' islands.

279.NAME: The last pirate couple's task
279.DESCRIPTION: Both love foxes. Grow and sell them 15 foxes

2790.NAME: Upgrade the watermill
2790.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the watermill to the next stage (click and choose Upgrade).

2792.NAME: Let there be light!
2792.DESCRIPTION: Install a lightbulb at the entrance to the cave (press Upgrade)!

2793.NAME: Fresh juice
2793.DESCRIPTION: Pip has come a long way. Offer him some refreshments. Make lemon juice several times.

2794.NAME: Lunch
2794.DESCRIPTION: Pip and his friends deserve a nice meal. Make pizza several times.

2795.NAME: Dessert
2795.DESCRIPTION: Why not offer your guests some juicy fruit? Submit melons.

2796.NAME: Fish
2796.DESCRIPTION: Pip needs to be sure that you know the local fauna very well. Submit lion fish.

2797.NAME: Birds
2797.DESCRIPTION: Prove that you have experience with local birds. Sell grown up ducks.

2798.NAME: Mammals
2798.DESCRIPTION: Finally, demonstrate your knowledge of mammals. Feed cats, goats and bears on any island.

2799.NAME: Cages
2799.DESCRIPTION: When visiting a new place, Pip always tries to catch a new animal. Submit wires for cages.

28.NAME: Buy one sand path
28.DESCRIPTION: Buy one sand path in the shop and place it on the island

280.NAME: Craft iron from iron ore
280.DESCRIPTION: You can craft iron from iron ore combining it with water and coal

2800.NAME: Sunstroke
2800.DESCRIPTION: Help Pip and his friends to protect themselves from the sun. Submit hats (from curcuma, savannah grass, aloe).

2801.NAME: Place for rest
2801.DESCRIPTION: Show Pip how to make a nice bed in the middle of the jungle. Sell finished hammocks.

2802.NAME: Pig potatoes
2802.DESCRIPTION: Pip's family is into traditional farming. Submit potatoes for pig feed.

2803.NAME: Snake basket
2803.DESCRIPTION: Snakes are usually transported in baskets. Submit lianas.

2804.NAME: Making way
2804.DESCRIPTION: When looking for new snakes, Pit has to get through jungle and brushwood. Submit better machetes.

2805.NAME: Tree branches
2805.DESCRIPTION: Some snakes happily wrap themselves around branches. Chop fully grown rubber trees.

2806.NAME: Wine expert
2806.DESCRIPTION: Pip has tried a great variety of wines in his travels. Let him try yours - submit wine.

2807.NAME: Unfounded fear
2807.DESCRIPTION: Pip thinks that people have unfounded fears of snakes and bats. Sell grown-up bats.

2808.NAME: Tomatoes for everybody
2808.DESCRIPTION: At Pip's home, tomatoes are loved  by people as well as animals. Submit tomatoes.

2809.NAME: A lot of tree bark
2809.DESCRIPTION: Pip lays tree bark on the floors of his sheds. Submit tree bark (obtained from friends' chicken, ostriches, peacocks).

281.NAME: Craft pickaxe blade
281.DESCRIPTION: Craft pickaxe blade from iron, mould and coal

2810.NAME: Safe swim
2810.DESCRIPTION: Pip's childern love to swim, but they can't be left on their own at the ocean. Build a clay pool.

2811.NAME: Appropriate food
2811.DESCRIPTION: Prepare to receive the first snakes on your island. Make reptile food several times.

2812.NAME: Payment
2812.DESCRIPTION: Reward Pip for his help. Submit jasper.

2813.NAME: Bread for the road
2813.DESCRIPTION: Pip will be on his way soon. Make bread several times.

2815.NAME: Valuable poison
2815.DESCRIPTION: Pip has revealed that snake poison can be used to brew valuable medicine. Make medicine in section Other.

282.NAME: Craft pickaxe
282.DESCRIPTION: Craft pickaxe from ironwood shaft and pickaxe blade

283.NAME: Craft cement
283.DESCRIPTION: Craft 3 cement units in the workshop

284.NAME: Upgrade fireplace
284.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the fireplace to its next stage so you can burn coal faster

2846.NAME: Radish
2846.DESCRIPTION: Harvest radish fields on your island.

2847.NAME: Carrots
2847.DESCRIPTION: Harvest carrot fields on your island.

2848.NAME: Tomatoes
2848.DESCRIPTION: Harvest tomato fields on your island.

2849.NAME: Friends' harvest I
2849.DESCRIPTION: Collect any kind of harvest on your friends' islands.

285.NAME: Upgrade fireplace
285.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the fireplace to its next stage so you can burn coal faster

2850.NAME: Wheat
2850.DESCRIPTION: Harvest wheat fields on your island.

2851.NAME: Beans
2851.DESCRIPTION: Harvest bean fields on your island.

2852.NAME: Pumpkins
2852.DESCRIPTION: Harvest pumpkin fields on your island.

2853.NAME: Friends' harvest II
2853.DESCRIPTION: Collect any kind of harvest on your friends' islands.

2854.NAME: Onions
2854.DESCRIPTION: Harvest onion fields on your island.

2855.NAME: Corn
2855.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn fields on your island.

2856.NAME: Fruit
2856.DESCRIPTION: Harvest bananas, coconuts, pitaya or pandanus fruit on your island.

2857.NAME: Friends' harvest III
2857.DESCRIPTION: Collect any kind of harvest on your friends' islands.

2858.NAME: Off to Nihiru
2858.DESCRIPTION: Get on the raft and travel to the distant Nihiru.

2859.NAME: Lemon water
2859.DESCRIPTION: Lemon water is refreshing and healthy. Make lemon juice several times.

286.NAME: Upgrade oven
286.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the clay oven to a stone oven. It will increase your maximum energy

2860.NAME: Cloth
2860.DESCRIPTION: Cloth can be used to cover the most important things during rain. Submit cloth.

2861.NAME: Dried bread
2861.DESCRIPTION: You can't go anywhere without some bread. Make bread several times.

2862.NAME: Bait for fishing
2862.DESCRIPTION: You can never know when you'll get a chance to fish. Submit bugs.

2863.NAME: Onions
2863.DESCRIPTION: You can make various sauces and stews out of onions. Submit onions.

2864.NAME: Sweetener
2864.DESCRIPTION: Honey is a natural and healthy sweetener. Submit honey.

2865.NAME: Sturdy vegetables
2865.DESCRIPTION: You should take vegetables that don't go bad quickly. Harvest potato, eggplant or pumpkin fields on any island.

2866.NAME: Sleeping bags
2866.DESCRIPTION: The weather can be very unpredictable during night-time. Submit sleeping bags (from carnivorous plants and collector's packs).

2867.NAME: A lot of money
2867.DESCRIPTION: Always take some money with you. Submit shells.

2868.NAME: Ropes
2868.DESCRIPTION: Ropes can be used for fixing the raft or other things. Submit ropes.

2869.NAME: Screws
2869.DESCRIPTION: If you need to fasten something properly, you must use screws. Submit screws.

287.NAME: Upgrade well
287.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the clay well to a stone well. It will be deeper, and water will fill in quicker, and it will increase your maximum energy

2870.NAME: Sponges
2870.DESCRIPTION: You must maintain order during the trip. Submit sponges.

2871.NAME: Machetes
2871.DESCRIPTION: You can't go anywhere without some proper cutting tools. Craft better machetes several times.

2872.NAME: Post birds
2872.DESCRIPTION: To send messages home, you can use trained birds. Sell grown-up ducks.

2873.NAME: Torches
2873.DESCRIPTION: Wherever you end up, you'll need a source of light. Submit torches.

2874.NAME: Parchment
2874.DESCRIPTION: You may need to make some notes. Submit parchment.

2875.NAME: Coconuts
2875.DESCRIPTION: Coconut milk is delicious and the shells can be really useful. Submit coconuts.

2876.NAME: Shakers
2876.DESCRIPTION: What if you feel like dancing or singing? Submit shakers (from volcanic and beach chairs).

2877.NAME: Interesting accessories
2877.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity wants to know what you've learned in savannah. Sell flower garlands.

2878.NAME: Sandstone
2878.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity wants to know what you've learned in savannah. Spend sandstones.

2879.NAME: Local dolls
2879.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity is doing research on traditional games in Oceania. Submit dolls (from stools).

288.NAME: Upgrade house
288.DESCRIPTION: Upgrade the clay house to a stone house. It will increase your maximum energy

2880.NAME: Fast horses
2880.DESCRIPTION: Instead of driving a car, Curiosity prefers horse-riding. Sell grown-up horses.

2881.NAME: Tasty salmon
2881.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity loves salmon. Make smoked salmon several times.

2882.NAME: Restoring luxury items
2882.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity wants to restore several luxury items she found in excavations. Submit obsidian.

2883.NAME: Old recipe
2883.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity has found her grandmother's recipe for stuffed chili. Submit chili.

2884.NAME: Perfect material
2884.DESCRIPTION: Limestone has been used in architecture for centuries. Build limestone sculptures.

2885.NAME: Moss
2885.DESCRIPTION: Important things can be hidden under a layer of moss. Submit moss (from friends' onions, wheat).

2886.NAME: Sheep wool
2886.DESCRIPTION: When going on long expeditions, Curiosity always needs some woolen socks and blankets. Feed sheep or lambs.

2887.NAME: Beading
2887.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity's best friend is great at beading. Submit pearls.

2888.NAME: Special drink
2888.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity would gladly try some cactus lemonade. Make cactus lemonade several times.

2889.NAME: Silver doubloons
2889.DESCRIPTION: Several doubloons are missing from Curiosity's coin collection. Submit silver doubloons.

289.NAME: Build stone paths
289.DESCRIPTION: Build a new network of stone paths

2890.NAME: Meat salad
2890.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity could make some meat salad, but she's out of eggs. Submit eggs.

2891.NAME: Personal raft
2891.DESCRIPTION: Curiosity would like to build her own raft. Submit wood.

2892.NAME: What's happened?
2892.DESCRIPTION: Find out what you can do for the librarian (click on her)!

2893.NAME: Lost scrolls
2893.DESCRIPTION: Find all scrolls and return them to the librarian (click on her).

2894.NAME: What's happened?
2894.DESCRIPTION: Find out what the healer needs (click on him)!

2895.NAME: Medicine
2895.DESCRIPTION: Make some medicine and give it to the healer (click on him).

2896.NAME: What's happened?
2896.DESCRIPTION: Talk to the steward (click on him)!

29.NAME: Place more 9 paths
29.DESCRIPTION: Collect shells and place 9 more sand paths

290.NAME: Build stone fences
290.DESCRIPTION: Decorate your island with 10 stone fences

2900.NAME: Fixing the paths
2900.DESCRIPTION: Fix all paths on Nihiru island.

2901.NAME: Renovate the carpenter's house.
2901.DESCRIPTION: The carpenter's house is in an awful condition. Fix it!

2902.NAME: Craft gold bars
2902.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Materials" and craft your first gold bar.

2903.NAME: Craft paint
2903.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Materials" and craft your first high-quality paint.

2904.NAME: Paint planks
2904.DESCRIPTION: Go to the workshop section "Materials" and craft your first painted plank.

2905.NAME: Catching thieves
2905.DESCRIPTION: Anka is certain that somebody is stealing from her garden. Sell grown-up dogs.

2906.NAME: Pond inhabitants
2906.DESCRIPTION: Anka has created a decorative pond, but it's completely empty. Sell goldfish.

2907.NAME: Nourishing puree
2907.DESCRIPTION: Anka makes lunch for her husband every day, but she's running out of ideas. Make potato puree several times.

2908.NAME: Decorative gems
2908.DESCRIPTION: Anka would gladly use more gems in her artwork. Build gem trees.

2909.NAME: Brother's zoo
2909.DESCRIPTION: Anka's brother has opened a zoo, but he doesn't own any reptiles. Sell grown-up crocodiles.

291.NAME: Build new stone sheds
291.DESCRIPTION: Build any 3 stone sheds on your island

2910.NAME: Flower magic
2910.DESCRIPTION: Anka grows a great variety of garden flowers. Submit flower collection.

2911.NAME: Clay supports
2911.DESCRIPTION: Anka plans to build a very sturdy shed for storing her best work. Submit clay supports.

2912.NAME: Water from the well
2912.DESCRIPTION: Anka can't use her well because it's being renovated. Submit water.

2913.NAME: Crafting silk
2913.DESCRIPTION: Anka's ancestors were in the silk business. Submit silk.

2914.NAME: Mushroom delicacy
2914.DESCRIPTION: There are no forests for mushroom-picking where Anka lives. Make pickled mushrooms several times.

2915.NAME: Melons for elephants
2915.DESCRIPTION: Anka and Akio are determined to keep elephants. Submit melons for elephant food.

2916.NAME: Small expedition
2916.DESCRIPTION: Anka's son plans to visit Pinaki island. Submit ancient keys.

2917.NAME: Broad palms
2917.DESCRIPTION: Anka prefers wood from broad palms. Chop broad palms on any island.

2918.NAME: Small nails
2918.DESCRIPTION: Anka's delicate work requires really small nails. Submit thorn nails.

2919.NAME: Special chisels
2919.DESCRIPTION: Anka has never tried to make something out of volcanic rocks. Submit lava chisels.

292.NAME: Gather some stones
292.DESCRIPTION: Gather 5 stones, by splitting large rocks

2920.NAME: Empty ant-hill
2920.DESCRIPTION: The ant-hill in Anka's yard is completely uninhabited. Submit ants.

2921.NAME: Idea for vases
2921.DESCRIPTION: Anka plans to make some vases with glued-on shells. Submit arched shells.

2922.NAME: Distant relations
2922.DESCRIPTION: Anka is sure that she is a distant relative of the Okoro family. Go fishing or visit the inhabitants of Haraiki island.

2923.NAME: Wind direction
2923.DESCRIPTION: The wind direction must be determined. Sell finished weathercocks.

2924.NAME: Water temperature
2924.DESCRIPTION: It's important to know the water temperature. Go fishing on any island.

2925.NAME: Sand structure
2925.DESCRIPTION: Marco believes that sand can say a lot about weather. Harvest plants on Ahe island.

2926.NAME: Cat behaviour
2926.DESCRIPTION: Marco has observed that cats react distinctly to weather. Feed cats on your island.

2927.NAME: Sound
2927.DESCRIPTION: You can tell a lot about weather from how sound travels in the air. Submit horns (from friends' sheep, goats).

2928.NAME: Power of the sun
2928.DESCRIPTION: The power of the sun can be determined by observing tomatoes dry up. Submit tomatoes.

2929.NAME: Witnesses
2929.DESCRIPTION: It's good to collect information from other observers. Help on your friends' islands.

293.NAME: Craft first stone blocks
293.DESCRIPTION: Craft stone blocks from the stones in your workshop

2930.NAME: Wild plants

2934.DESCRIPTION: Wind strength and direction can also be determined by watching fire. Submit lighters (from pointy-leafs, club-moss).

2936.NAME: Help the steward
2936.DESCRIPTION: Do some renovations on Nihiru, according to the steward's advice.

2937.NAME: Help the healer

2939.NAME: Payment for the courier
2939.DESCRIPTION: Pay the courier for delivering the letter. Submit shells.

294.DESCRIPTION: He's offering to sell you an ancient looking key

2941.NAME: Onions
2941.DESCRIPTION: You can scare away vampires with garlic. This time, onions will have to do. Submit onions.

2942.NAME: Light
2942.DESCRIPTION: Many evil creatures avoid light. Submit torches.

2943.NAME: Good luck charm
2943.DESCRIPTION: A good luck charm could be of use. Submit arched shells.

2944.NAME: Water
2944.DESCRIPTION: Water has cleansing powers. Submit water.

2945.NAME: Salt
2945.DESCRIPTION: In the old times, salt was used to repel evil spirits. Spend salt.

2946.NAME: Pig's luck

2947.DESCRIPTION: Go to Paprick's acquaintance Amara to find out more about the haunted house.

2951.DESCRIPTION: Repair Amara's house, so that she could start living there!

2952.NAME: Talk to Amara
2952.DESCRIPTION: Tell Amara that she can safely inhabit her new house (click on Amara)!

2954.NAME: Light Amara's house
2954.DESCRIPTION: Acquire candles and light Amara's house (finish the building).

2956.NAME: Start a conversation
2956.DESCRIPTION: Talk to healer Haru (click on him)!

2957.DESCRIPTION: You need to find a good spot for the restaurant. Survey your friends by helping on their islands.

2958.DESCRIPTION: Cho has decided to call the restaurant "Pheasant's tail". Submit pheasant feathers (from feeding roosters).

2959.NAME: Transportation
2959.DESCRIPTION: Cho plans to travel to the restaurant by motorboat. Submit fuel.

296.NAME: Wood merchant
296.DESCRIPTION: A wood merchant is willing to trade some wood for two ancient keys.

2960.NAME: Stone walls
2960.DESCRIPTION: The restaurant will be built out of stone. Submit stone blocks.

2961.NAME: Nice panelling
2961.DESCRIPTION: The building will need some vibrant, good-looking panelling. Submit painted planks.

2962.NAME: Roof tiles
2962.DESCRIPTION: The restaurant must have a sturdy roof. Submit roof tiles.

2963.NAME: Floors
2963.DESCRIPTION: The floors must look really fabulous. Sell finished paths with ornaments or clay paths.

2964.NAME: Paint for the walls
2964.DESCRIPTION: You should paint all interior walls. Submit paint.

2965.NAME: Glass for the windows
2965.DESCRIPTION: Of course, you need to glass the windows. Submit glass.

2966.NAME: Tables
2966.DESCRIPTION: No restaurant can do without tables. Submit iron tables.

2967.DESCRIPTION: The clients will need a place to sit. Finish volcanic rock chairs.

2968.NAME: Pillows
2968.DESCRIPTION: The clients may want to sit on something soft. Submit wool for pillows.

2969.NAME: Lighting
2969.DESCRIPTION: Nobody will want to eat in the dark. Sell finished wax candles.

297.NAME: Supply food

2970.NAME: Aroma
2970.DESCRIPTION: Citrus fruit rind makes the air fresh and pleasant. Collect lemons or tangerines.

2971.NAME: Themed decorations
2971.DESCRIPTION: Cho likes ocean-themed things. Sell finished fish trophies or aquariums.

2972.NAME: Elephants
2972.DESCRIPTION: Nadine has no use for her large supply of melons. Sell grown-up elephants.

2973.NAME: Boiled eggs
2973.DESCRIPTION: Nadine never boils eggs properly. Boil eggs several times.

2974.NAME: Colourful fish
2974.DESCRIPTION: Nadine loves small, colourful fish. Sell clownfish.

2975.NAME: A proper garden
2975.DESCRIPTION: Turrick's garden often gets taken over by weeds. Submit better machetes.

2976.NAME: More goats
2976.DESCRIPTION: Turrick enjoys growing goats. Feed goats on any island.

2977.NAME: Materials for the order
2977.DESCRIPTION: A client has ordered an obsidian-encrusted chair. Submit obsidian.

2978.NAME: Simple food
2978.DESCRIPTION: Mycott is tired of preparing fancy meals. Submit beans.

2979.NAME: Diamond ring
2979.DESCRIPTION: Mycott is planning to propose to his girlfriend. Submit diamonds.

298.NAME: Beans for the key
298.DESCRIPTION: Some weird man really needs beans for his secret recipe. In exchange he offers an ancient key

2980.NAME: Orienteering
2980.DESCRIPTION: Mycott has a new hobby - orienteering. Submit compasses (from camelthorns, red-flower cactuses).

2984.NAME: Menus
2984.DESCRIPTION: Instead of printing menus, Cho will write everything on the wall. Submit coal.

2985.NAME: Change for the cashier
2985.DESCRIPTION: The cashier might not have enough change on the first day. Submit shells.

2986.DESCRIPTION: To make the restaurant look more fancy, Cho wants to put up a golden sign. Submit gold bars.

3.NAME: Craft axe
3.DESCRIPTION: There's a workshop button in the bottom right corner. Click on it, find axe and press MAKE.

30.NAME: Make radish salad
30.DESCRIPTION: Make some radish salad - you can do it in the workshop.

300.NAME: Clay for potter

301.NAME: Grow 10 hens

3011.NAME: Go to the market place

3013.NAME: Build a crafts stall

3014.NAME: Build a sweets stall
3014.DESCRIPTION: There's definitely need for some sweets and hot drinks. Build a sweets stall.

3015.NAME: Build a carousel
3015.DESCRIPTION: A carousel will surely entertain all kinds of visitors! Build a carousel.

3016.NAME: Decorate the tree
3016.DESCRIPTION: What's a Christmas market square without a Christmas tree? Decorate the tree.

3017.NAME: Money for supplies

3019.DESCRIPTION: Nadine's needles must be as sharp as hedgehog quills. Sell grown-up hedgehogs.

3021.NAME: Buttons
3021.DESCRIPTION: Nice buttons can be made out of bone. Submit bones.

3022.NAME: Wool
3022.DESCRIPTION: There's a great demand for woolen products in winter. Submit wool.

3023.DESCRIPTION: Nadine plans to sew day and night. Prepare her a delicious meal - make tomato soup several times.

3024.DESCRIPTION: A dressmaker can never have cold fingers! Submit coal for the fireplace.

3025.NAME: Wickerwork
3025.DESCRIPTION: Nadine not only sews, but also does some wickerwork. Submit lianas.

3026.NAME: Honey
3026.DESCRIPTION: The market visitors will surely want to buy some honey. Submit honey.

3027.NAME: Pies

3031.DESCRIPTION: Paprick's family consumes several litres of tea daily. Submit water.

3032.NAME: Work table

3033.NAME: Snowmen
3033.DESCRIPTION: Turrick gladly builds not only furniture, but also snowmen. Submit carrots for their noses.

3035.NAME: Bean bags
3035.DESCRIPTION: Turrick wants to make bean bags for sitting. Submit beans.

3036.NAME: A better-looking aquarium
3036.DESCRIPTION: Turrick wants to decorate his aquarium. Submit moon shells (from the well).

3037.DESCRIPTION: Turrick enjoys some morning bustle. Sell grown-up roosters.

3039.DESCRIPTION: Turrick's dad collects various keys. Submit an ancient key.

3040.NAME: A gift for oneself
3040.DESCRIPTION: Turrick thinks it's important to pamper oneself for Christmas. Use boots from your backpack.

3043.NAME: Rampaging Locusts
3043.DESCRIPTION: Hideko complains that locusts have destroyed huge harvest stocks.

3045.DESCRIPTION: Balun could try to investigate if some disease is to blame.

3046.NAME: Hire Captain McManus
3046.DESCRIPTION: The captain could tour the archipelago to find out if there's any other trouble.

3047.NAME: Hire Nihiru Librarian
3047.DESCRIPTION: The librarian could research in books to see if something like this has happened before.

3048.NAME: Preparing for Island Exploration
3048.DESCRIPTION: Before heading to such a dangerous place, you need to stock up on food supplies for the journey.

3049.NAME: Preparing for Island Exploration
3049.DESCRIPTION: What if that rot strikes again? Be ready to repair the ship and prepare nail supplies.

3050.NAME: Preparing for Island Exploration
3050.DESCRIPTION: A good supply of seashells will be useful for unexpected expenses.

3055.NAME: Lichen
3055.DESCRIPTION: One of the components is lichen. Submit them.

3057.DESCRIPTION: Collect raven feathers for the amulet.

3065.DESCRIPTION: The healer's services are not cheap in this difficult situation. Submit shells.

3068.DESCRIPTION: Make a pizza and get one moon apple.

3071.DESCRIPTION: The amulet will need a lot of rope. Obtain them.

3072.NAME: Chains for Amulet
3072.DESCRIPTION: The amulet will need a lot of chains. Obtain them.

3073.NAME: Corals for Amulet
3073.DESCRIPTION: The amulet will need a lot of corals. Obtain them.

3074.NAME: Free Shaman Manu
3074.DESCRIPTION: Use the moonlight elixir on Manu.

3075.NAME: Sponges for Teki
3075.DESCRIPTION: Submit sponges to Teki for medicine preparation.

3076.NAME: Wax for Vipiti
3076.DESCRIPTION: Submit wax to Vipiti for medicine preparation.

3077.NAME: Fog Shells for Teki
3077.DESCRIPTION: Submit fog shells to Teki for medicine preparation.

3078.NAME: Cure Manu
3078.DESCRIPTION: Cure Manu. Perform the action on him.

3079.NAME: Obtain Cursed Emerald
3079.DESCRIPTION: Find one of the three cursed emeralds on the island. It's said that one is in a chest behind a rubber tree.

3080.NAME: Make a Frame
3080.DESCRIPTION: Make the frame of the magical mirror.

3081.NAME: Farmer's Challenge for Elixir
3081.DESCRIPTION: Harvest tomato fields and get one moon apple.

3082.NAME: Obtain Cursed Emerald
3082.DESCRIPTION: Find one of the three cursed emeralds on the island. It's said that one is in a chest next to a withered tree.

3083.NAME: Obtain Cursed Emerald
3083.DESCRIPTION: Find one of the three cursed emeralds on the island. It's said that one is in a chest behind an olive tree.

3084.NAME: Make Glass
3084.DESCRIPTION: Make the glass of the magical mirror.

3085.NAME: Feeder's Challenge for Elixir
3085.DESCRIPTION: Feed a cat or kitten and get one moon apple.

3087.NAME: Farmer's Challenge for Elixir
3087.DESCRIPTION: Harvest strawberry fields and get one moon apple.

3088.NAME: Feeder's Challenge for Elixir
3088.DESCRIPTION: Feed animals with reptile food and get one moon apple.

3089.DESCRIPTION: Sell any grey or colorful stone fence and get one moon apple.

3090.NAME: Builder's Challenge for Elixir
3090.DESCRIPTION: Sell any stonegardens and get one moon apple.

3091.DESCRIPTION: Make the magical mirror in the workshop section UNIQUE.

3092.NAME: Defeat the Evil Sorcerer Ahao

3093.NAME: Free Teki
3093.DESCRIPTION: Return the voodoo doll to Teki so he can be completely free.

3094.NAME: Free Vipiti
3094.DESCRIPTION: Return the voodoo doll to Vipiti so she can be completely free.

3095.NAME: Free Manu
3095.DESCRIPTION: Return the voodoo doll to Manu so he can be completely free.

3099.NAME: Gerberas
3099.DESCRIPTION: One of the components is gerberas. Submit them.

31.NAME: Craft iron axe

3100.NAME: Fire Butterflies for Vipiti
3100.DESCRIPTION: Submit fire butterflies to Vipiti for medicine preparation.

3101.NAME: Stick-Insects for Teki
3101.DESCRIPTION: Submit stick-insects to Teki for medicine preparation.

3102.NAME: Pansies for Vipiti
3102.DESCRIPTION: Submit pansies to Vipiti for medicine preparation.

3103.NAME: Make a Handle
3103.DESCRIPTION: Make the handle of the magical mirror.

3104.NAME: Continue Freeing the Island
3104.DESCRIPTION: Clear a few more jungle sections.

3105.NAME: Fisherman's Challenge for Elixir
3105.DESCRIPTION: Fish anywhere and get one moon apple.

3106.NAME: Recycler's Challenge for Elixir
3106.DESCRIPTION: Use ropes in any way and get one moon apple.

3107.NAME: Craftsman's Challenge for Elixir
3107.DESCRIPTION: Make torches and get one moon apple.

3108.NAME: Animal Friend's Challenge for Elixir
3108.DESCRIPTION: Feed animals at friends' and get one moon apple.

3109.NAME: Cocktail Maker's Challenge for Elixir
3109.DESCRIPTION: Mix tangerine cocktails and get one moon apple.

3110.NAME: Gatherer's Elixir Challenge
3110.DESCRIPTION: Collect wild berries or forest mushrooms and get one moon apple.

3111.NAME: Builder's Challenge for Elixir
3111.DESCRIPTION: Use roof tiles and get one moon apple.

3112.NAME: Feeder's Challenge for Elixir
3112.DESCRIPTION: Feed koalas and get one moon apple.

312.NAME: Buy 5 flowers
312.DESCRIPTION: Buy 5 flowers of any kind and place them on the map (only those which you don't have to build)

3124.NAME: Take care of your friends animals
3124.DESCRIPTION: That's why always help them to feed their animals.

314.NAME: Build 5 any paths

3149.NAME: Take care of your friends plants
3149.DESCRIPTION: And whenever possible try to help them gather their plants.

315.NAME: Build 1 any shed
315.DESCRIPTION: Buy and build 1 shed of any kind

3150.NAME: Help your friend to kindle their fire

3151.NAME: Remove the thorns
3151.DESCRIPTION: The sight is disturbed by thorns, remove 5 of them. You may buy them in the shop as well.

3153.DESCRIPTION: As the snow melts the island comes to life. Gather 20 mushrooms or berries.

3155.DESCRIPTION: While cleaning oven u found some coal. Give 3 coal.

3157.NAME: Sharpen the axe
3157.DESCRIPTION: Ajo has sharpened his axe. Check is it sharp enough. Chop tree 10 times.

3158.NAME: Sell pigs
3158.DESCRIPTION: Trough the winter pigs have grovn big enough, its time to sell them. Sell 3 pigs.

3159.NAME: Dig up Ajo garden
3159.DESCRIPTION: Ajo wants to plant lots of fields to gather good harvest. Dig 10 fields.

316.NAME: Trade 50 food

3160.NAME: Lost tablecloth
3160.DESCRIPTION: Ajo have lost his tablecloth. Give one cloth.

3161.NAME: Gather clay
3161.DESCRIPTION: Seems that old clay trough are leaking. Give 3  clay.

3162.NAME: Tomato salad
3162.DESCRIPTION: Its time to eat tomato salads, but Ajo has run out of tomatoes. Give 5 tomatoes.

3163.NAME: Dry feet
3163.DESCRIPTION: Snow has melted, but land is still wet. Build 3 plank paths.

3164.NAME: Gather the water
3164.DESCRIPTION: You have cleaned the big water tank, its time to fill it up. Give 15 water units.

3165.NAME: Missing chairs
3165.DESCRIPTION: There have gathered some guests, but Ajo doesnt have enough chairs. Build 3 plank stools.

3166.NAME: Beans
3166.DESCRIPTION: Time to plant beans, but mice have eroded Ajo stock. Give 10 beans.

3167.NAME: Planks
3167.DESCRIPTION: Pond needs new footbridge. Give 5 planks.

3168.NAME: Forest mushrooms
3168.DESCRIPTION: At far enod of garden there are some forest mushroom patches. Gather 5 forest mushrooms.

3169.NAME: Dessert
3169.DESCRIPTION: Strawberries are really good for dessert. Give 5 strawberies.

317.NAME: Trade 50 wood
317.DESCRIPTION: Gather and submit 50 wood units. In exchange you will get money and experience

3175.NAME: Buy a vase
3175.DESCRIPTION: Buy one vase with tulips. You can find them at shop category decorations.

318.NAME: Get 3 coals
318.DESCRIPTION: Get 3 units of coal from the fireplace

319.NAME: Chop 5 trees
319.DESCRIPTION: Chop down 5 trees of any kind

32.NAME: Chop down a baobab
32.DESCRIPTION: Chop down at least one baobab, using the iron axe , to get more territory

320.NAME: Feed 10 animals
320.DESCRIPTION: Feed any 10 animals on your island

3206.NAME: Find out about Eostre's island
3206.DESCRIPTION: Listen what chicken farmers are talking about. Feed the chicken.

321.NAME: Feed 5 animals on friends' islands
321.DESCRIPTION: Feed any five animals on your friends' islands

3210.NAME: Visit Eostre's island
3210.DESCRIPTION: Go to Eostre's island to explore it.

3211.NAME: Find out about Eostre's island
3211.DESCRIPTION: Maybe bunny farmers have some information. Sell grownup rabbits.

3212.NAME: Find out about Eostre's island
3212.DESCRIPTION: Do more Easter activities. Collect eggs.

3213.NAME: Fish out spring eggs
3213.DESCRIPTION: Fish out spring eggs from spring bay.

3214.NAME: Open spring egg
3214.DESCRIPTION: Find in your bag spring egg and open it. You can find goods in it and sometimes Eostre's goods.

3215.NAME: Collect white snowdrops
3215.DESCRIPTION: Fish out spring eggs and try to find white snowdrops in them.

3216.NAME: Collect Eostre's catkins
3216.DESCRIPTION: Fish out spring eggs and try to find catkins in them.

3217.NAME: Collect Eostre's hares
3217.DESCRIPTION: Fish out spring eggs and try to find hares in them.

3219.NAME: Heal Eostre's bunnies.
3219.DESCRIPTION: Heal the sick bunnies on this island and you will get chocolate bugs.

322.NAME: Gather 5 crops on friends' islands
322.DESCRIPTION: Gather 5 crops on your friends' islands

3220.NAME: Restore Eostre's campfire
3220.DESCRIPTION: Restore it and she will be happy.

3225.NAME: Easy Eostre's task
3225.DESCRIPTION: Eostre loves birds. Place anywhere birds.

3226.NAME: Serious Eostre's task
3226.DESCRIPTION: Eostre loves flowers. Place different flowers.

3227.NAME: Hard Eostre's task
3227.DESCRIPTION: Eostre loves animals. Feed any animals.

323.NAME: Build a stone garden
323.DESCRIPTION: Buy and complete 6 stone garden elements of any kind

3234.NAME: Gain more Eostre's trees
3234.DESCRIPTION: You can gain more trees, by giving her more of her special goods and shells.

3235.NAME: Collect chocolate bugs
3235.DESCRIPTION: Bugs can be earned in daily tasks or doing good deeds on the island. Spend bugs fishing.

3236.NAME: Plant Eostre's tree
3236.DESCRIPTION: Eostre has gifted you a tree. Plant it and it will grow up in a week.

3240.NAME: Wandering Toby
3240.DESCRIPTION: Toby believes that if you tie together enough strings you can travel to moon. (craft ropes)

3241.NAME: Toby's favorite soup
3241.DESCRIPTION: Toby eats only one soup, that must be cooked from red beries. (tomato soup, tomato is not an vegetable)

3242.NAME: Green Toby
3242.DESCRIPTION: Toby likes to cultivate forest, its not possible to do that in desert. (plant trees)

3243.NAME: Rabbit Toby
3243.DESCRIPTION: There is a day's when Toby thinks hes an rabbit, then he eats only rabbit food. (harvest carrots)

3244.NAME: Toby's warehouse
3244.DESCRIPTION: Toby's warehouse is full with sand bags, he insists that you would show him yours. (place sand bags)

3245.NAME: Thirsty Toby
3245.DESCRIPTION: Usually toby needs to chew cactus to deal with thirst, but he wants to see how others gather water. (gather water any way)

3246.NAME: Geologist Toby
3246.DESCRIPTION: Its not a sandstone, granite, quartz, serpentine,  tuff, sphalerite or laurite what Toby is looking for. (collect diorite)

3247.NAME: Childish Toby
3247.DESCRIPTION: Toby are really happy about popcorn cooking proces. He wants to learn how to hather this plant. (gather corn)

3248.NAME: Angry Tomy
3248.DESCRIPTION: Noone knows who gave axe to Tomy, but he really, really likes to use it. (gather wood)

3249.NAME: Surprised Toby
3249.DESCRIPTION: There are lots of thorns at desert, but Toby never created nothing usable from them. (create nails)

3250.NAME: Nightly mischief
3250.DESCRIPTION: In the morning you see that Toby have planted legumes in all the fields you have. (plant beans)

3251.NAME: Other nightly mischiefs
3251.DESCRIPTION: Toby have visited your friends and also done some agriculture work.

3252.NAME: Big feet
3252.DESCRIPTION: you dont know why, but Toby trampled down all the flowers in red and yelow color.

3253.NAME: Flufy animals
3253.DESCRIPTION: Toby think that most valuable animals are the ones who give wool. He love to feed them.

3254.NAME: Superstitious Toby
3254.DESCRIPTION: Toby thinks that clothes you are wearing is cursed. He doesnt calm down, you need to change them. (change visual appearance)

3255.NAME: Empty bag
3255.DESCRIPTION: Toby had full bag with necklace's, but he have lost all of them. Help to fill up his bag. (create bone beads)

3256.NAME: More mischiefs
3256.DESCRIPTION: Toby went crazy at warehouse and destroyed all hay bundles you had. (create hay bundles)

3257.NAME: Thievish Toby
3257.DESCRIPTION: Toby filched all your friends animal food. Now you need to feed them. (feed animals at friend islands)

3258.NAME: Important sleep
3258.DESCRIPTION: Toby wants to sleep with sheep, but you dont let thim to do that. Gather wool for Tomy. (gather wool)

3259.NAME: Big rearranging
3259.DESCRIPTION: Toby insists that we should rearrange furniture. Find the new spots for decors. (move any decoration objects)

326.NAME: Cloth trader
326.DESCRIPTION: Craft and submit 5 units of cloth

3260.NAME: Love of sweets
3260.DESCRIPTION: Your first tought was that bear visited your basement, but Tobby is the one who are soiled in honey. Restore stock. (gather honey)

3261.NAME: Warm room
3261.DESCRIPTION: Toby is feeling cold, we need to fuel the furnace. (gather coal)

3948.NAME: Feed ducks
3948.DESCRIPTION: Attract duck families for life in the new pools. Feed ducks and ducklings in Atafu island 150 times.

3949.NAME: Make candles
3949.DESCRIPTION: In the evenings candles produce great atmosphere. Make 10 wax candles.

395.NAME: Corn - Level 1
395.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn on your friend's islands

3950.NAME: Craft cloth
3950.DESCRIPTION: Provide soft rugs. Collect 20 units of cloth.

3951.NAME: Rinse the dust
3951.DESCRIPTION: Cleanliness is comfort as well. When's the last time you washed floors? Collect water from wells in Atafu island 25 times.

3952.NAME: Chirping of the birds
3952.DESCRIPTION: Bird chirping is a joy to ears. Build 15 birdhouses on Atafu island.

3953.NAME: Build gazebos
3953.DESCRIPTION: Walking around the island can tire you out. The shade of gazebos helps to recover your strength. Build 2 gazebos.

3954.NAME: Build hammocks
3954.DESCRIPTION: It's wonderful to lay in the shade in fresh air. Build 3 hammocks on Atafu island.

3955.NAME: Put out cocktail tables
3955.DESCRIPTION: Some small snacks while walking will be just in time. There needs to be at least 6 cocktail tables on the Atafu island.

3956.NAME: Grow horses
3956.DESCRIPTION: You can travel far on the back of a horse. Grow and sell 12 gallant horses.

3957.NAME: Special amenities
3957.DESCRIPTION: You can need comfort in all kinds of situations. Build an outhouse.

3958.NAME: Course of the wind
3958.DESCRIPTION: It's very useful to know the direction of wind from any place in the island. Build 10 weather cocks.

3959.NAME: Energy for relaxation
3959.DESCRIPTION: Relaxation can be tiring, make sure you have enough energy. Buy superstrength potion from shop's EXCLUSIVE section.

396.NAME: Sun riddle VII
396.DESCRIPTION: Feed animals which cost 25 shells at least 30 times

3960.NAME: Drinking fountains
3960.DESCRIPTION: Drinking fountains can be very neat and useful. Finish 10 fish fountains.

3961.NAME: Catch octopuses
3961.DESCRIPTION: Octopus catching is a noble entertainment even if you don't catch anything. Fish in octopus deep 24 times.

3962.NAME: Gather milk
3962.DESCRIPTION: Music always helps with cheer. Milk bottle xylophone would be just the thing. Collect milk 24 times.

3963.NAME: Gather clay
3963.DESCRIPTION: Making figurines from clay can be lovely a group entertainment. Collect 50 units of clay.

3964.NAME: Craft paint
3964.DESCRIPTION: Can't draw a smile without paint. Craft paint 12 times.

3965.NAME: Train fish
3965.DESCRIPTION: Prepare performance with trained fish. Built 5 round or angular aquariums.

3966.NAME: Submit parchment
3966.DESCRIPTION: Game "not's and crosses" are known even in Oceania. Hand in 20 parchments.

3967.NAME: Hand in coconuts
3967.DESCRIPTION: Suggest playing coconut rolling. To prepare for the game, hand in 50 coconuts.

3968.NAME: Ropes for mountain climbing
3968.DESCRIPTION: Climbing the Proud cliff sounds exciting. Craft 25 ropes for this activity.

3969.NAME: Inspiration for treasure hunt
3969.DESCRIPTION: Organize your own treasure hunt. You can find inspiration by visiting Mysterious cave 7 times.

397.NAME: Sun riddle VIII
397.DESCRIPTION: Harvest as many fruit that are needed for an alcoholic beverage as there are unique ponds and gnomes in the shop

3970.NAME: Masks for carnival
3970.DESCRIPTION: You can't make a carnival without masks. Find 5 carnival masks by harvesting grapes.

3971.NAME: Ants for anteater
3971.DESCRIPTION: Anteater is weird. Let your guests entertain themselves by feeding it. Gather 50 ants.

3972.NAME: Elephant race
3972.DESCRIPTION: It's funny to watch elephants racing. Sell 16 grown elephants.

3973.NAME: Strong tables
3973.DESCRIPTION: You will need strong tables that won't brake under the weight of the meal. Built 3 clay tables.

3974.NAME: Silk tablecloth
3974.DESCRIPTION: Silk tablecloths will be just in time. Craft 6 silk cloths.

3975.NAME: Make stools
3975.DESCRIPTION: Chairs without backs are in fashion right now and you need to be fashionable. Make 12 painted stools.

3976.NAME: Blueberry drink
3976.DESCRIPTION: Drink after a family recipe will be just in time. Make blueberry drink 5 times.

3977.NAME: Cactus juice lemonade
3977.DESCRIPTION: An exotic cactus drink will not be spared in the feast. Make cactus lemonade 20 times.

3978.NAME: Wine for the feast
3978.DESCRIPTION: A lot of wine will be used during the feast. Sell 3 barrels of wine.

3979.NAME: Big birds make big eggs
3979.DESCRIPTION: Royal feast ask for royal size eggs. Feed grown ostriches 50 times.

398.NAME: Sun riddle IX
398.DESCRIPTION: Craft as many clay pots as there are elements in bone beads

3980.NAME: Truffle pig roast
3980.DESCRIPTION: Fatty truffle piglets grow to be productive truffle pigs. Feed truffle piglets 30 times.

3981.NAME: Fine flour
3981.DESCRIPTION: There are a lot of flour in palaces stock, but in honor of your guests, craft extra fine produce. Use mill 3 times.

3982.NAME: Shark roast
3982.DESCRIPTION: You can't find the tasty mini-sharks at the shores of Haraiki. Make shark roast 20 times.

3983.NAME: Make spicy coconut soup
3983.DESCRIPTION: The spicy coconut soup is extra zestful. Make this dish 14 times.

3984.NAME: Pancakes for the guests
3984.DESCRIPTION: Potato pancakes is superior meal to regale guests. Make this dish 20 times.

3985.NAME: Pumpkin pie
3985.DESCRIPTION: Only in your feast a 16 layer pumpkin pie can be tasted. Make pumpkin pie 20 times.

3986.NAME: Honey cake
3986.DESCRIPTION: The freshest and sweetest honey is perfect for this kind of occasion. Bake the tasty honey cake 30 times.

3987.NAME: Strawberry soup
3987.DESCRIPTION: Let's close this meal of with the sweet strawberry soup. Make this dish 25 times.

3988.NAME: Speak with Adoni
3988.DESCRIPTION: Adoni brought the monster's present. Give your thanks by giving (selling) one wax figurine.

3989.NAME: Speak with Balun
3989.DESCRIPTION: Balun brought Monster's present. Give your thanks by giving one bronze doubloon.

399.NAME: Corn - Level 2
399.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn on your friend's islands

3990.NAME: Speak with Gelar
3990.DESCRIPTION: Gelar brought Monster's present. Give your thanks by giving (selling) one royal water lily.

3991.NAME: Spider souvenir
3991.DESCRIPTION: Craft the souvenir from pearls and jasper.

3992.NAME: Starry souvenir
3992.DESCRIPTION: Craft souvenir from obsidian and diamonds.

3993.NAME: Palm souvenir
3993.DESCRIPTION: Craft souvenir from citrin and jade.

3994.NAME: New lawn
3994.DESCRIPTION: The seeds are already ready. Dig up the stomped ground so you can sow fresh lawn. Dig ground 250 times.

3995.NAME: Waxing palaces floors
3995.DESCRIPTION: Refresh palaces floors. Hand in 25 units of wax.

3996.NAME: Cloth pole
3996.DESCRIPTION: After the feast there's a lot of dirty laundry. Make 10 cloth poles.

3997.NAME: Grape field
3997.DESCRIPTION: With all the fuss about no one took care of grapes. Remove 10 rotten grape fields from Atafu island.

3998.NAME: Feed cows
3998.DESCRIPTION: Oh no, oh no! No one has feed the cows and calves. Feed cows and calves on Atafu island 100 times.

3999.NAME: Round up your birds
3999.DESCRIPTION: From the first glance it seems like there's an extra bird. Count up your birds while feeding them 250 times.

4.NAME: Gather wood
4.DESCRIPTION: Gather 20 wood - click on trees to start chopping them. Chop 10 times.

40.NAME: Tomato farmer
40.DESCRIPTION: Plant and gather 10 tomato fields. You can make tomato soup out of them

400.NAME: Corn - Level 3
400.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn on your friend's islands

4000.NAME: Memories about Balun
4000.DESCRIPTION: Balun partied hard and you can see the aftermath even now. Hand in 5 pheasant feathers.

4001.NAME: Memories about Adoni
4001.DESCRIPTION: While relaxing Adoni told you a lot new about constellations. Sell any sea stars 15 times.

4002.NAME: Memories of Gelar
4002.DESCRIPTION: Gelar hosted the celebratory "King alley" reveal. Plant 3 symbolic broad palms.

4003.NAME: Spider souvenir
4003.DESCRIPTION: Souvenir merchant would like to by 10 spider souvenirs. Make them!

4004.NAME: Starry souvenir
4004.DESCRIPTION: Souvenir merchant would gladly purchase 10 starry souvenirs. Make them!

4005.NAME: Palm souvenir
4005.DESCRIPTION: Souvenir merchant would gladly purchase 10 palm souvenirs. Make them!

4006.NAME: Working hours
4006.DESCRIPTION: Souvenir merchant has very strict working hours. Test your sense of time. Buy sandglass.

4007.NAME: Full of experience
4007.DESCRIPTION: Souvenir merchant respects people with a lot of experience. Prove yourself! Make 3 angelfish trophies.

4008.NAME: Black shoes
4008.DESCRIPTION: Souvenir merchant likes formal style. Hand in 10 coals for a black shoe smear.

4009.NAME: Little birds
4009.DESCRIPTION: Let's start with one of the smallest birds. Feed it 50 times.

401.NAME: Corn - Level 4
401.DESCRIPTION: Harvest corn on your friend's islands

4010.NAME: Flightless bird
4010.DESCRIPTION: Maybe this flightless bird has started to fly? Sell 30 grown flightless birds.

4011.NAME: Something like a bird
4011.DESCRIPTION: Looks like a green bird, but isn't one. Sell this object once.

4012.NAME: Check other island
4012.DESCRIPTION: Visit an island, that is obscured by the Proud cliff. Maybe it will have some answers.

4013.NAME: Hiding underground?
4013.DESCRIPTION: On this island you can hide underground. Check good though, at least twice.

4014.NAME: At the top of a tree?
4014.DESCRIPTION: Maybe the bird is hiding in the islands trees? Check them carefully.

4015.NAME: Tasty food
4015.DESCRIPTION: Sharpness of the black onions will unravel pilots tongue. Make this special dish 10 times.

4016.NAME: Taking care of the aircraft
4016.DESCRIPTION: Gather fire oil reserves for Aldo. Perform the action to get it 4 times.

4017.NAME: Napuk island inhabitant
4017.DESCRIPTION: Since you've visited Napuk island, greet it's other inhabitant as well. Greet it 4 times.

4018.NAME: Pirate Bein misfortunes
4018.DESCRIPTION: Once Bein locked himself in a safe. Get object that can open a safe 3 times.

4019.NAME: Paprik's wife disaster
4019.DESCRIPTION: Paprik's wife once discovered, that this is not a bath sponge. Make it 15 times.

402.NAME: Moon riddle I
402.DESCRIPTION: Gather the element which constitutes approximately 70% of human body 50 times

4020.NAME: Toby's afflictions
4020.DESCRIPTION: Toby once cooked a soup without fire. Gather combustible 6 times.

4021.NAME: Lighting bolt
4021.DESCRIPTION: Lightning kicks like a wild animal. Feed it 50 times so it stops kicking.

4022.NAME: Essence of lightning
4022.DESCRIPTION: For a moment Admiral felt the essence of lightning within himself. Spend this resource 100 times.

4023.NAME: Shock
4023.DESCRIPTION: Hands went numb and Admiral let go of the wheel. Remove 10 plants that can hurt your arms.

4024.NAME: Crash
4024.DESCRIPTION: Boat hit an abandoned clay building. Probably a storage space. Build this building 3 times.

4025.NAME: Tools for repairs
4025.DESCRIPTION: This was the only tool Admiral had. Use it correctly 90 times.

4026.NAME: Metal
